title: The absolute worst
text:
This is by far the worst place I have ever stayed, worse than any motel, hostel or hospital I've ever been in, and I can't understand how they charge people to stay here, because you couldn't pay me to do so. The only reason we didn't leave is because everywhere else was booked. 

The place is dingy, dilapidated, makes no sense, and looks like a set from a horror film. I wish I were kidding. 

Have you heard about Fyre Island? Because this is the fyre island of hotels. I've never been ripped off like this before I'm trying to make sure you don't get ripped off like we did. Avoid at all costs.

title: Great Place To Stay, With Great Staff
text: The Hotel is probably a 3 star as I have read in a few of the reviews as it is old and currently being renovated. But I gave it 5 stars purely because the staff where fantastic in every way, especially Kye who went out of his way to make our stay great. Being from Australia and first time to New York, Kye helped us naviate the subway system and gave us some great advise to find gluten free food options nearby etc. The room was a bit dated but everything worked fine and it was clean and comfortable with fantasic views of the Manhatten skyline. Yes the elevators are old but to me that just added to charm of the place. It is in a great location and was a great place to stay.

title: Stay away from this hotel
text: Hotel looks absolutely nothing like the photos. We were able to get a room change thankfully but the room we started out is was falling apart. The lobby practically doesn’t exist. The elevator looks like a murder scene and the hallways on each floor before entering your rooms are so dirty. The staff at the front desk in lobby are kind but there’s clearly a huge management issue here. Don’t stay here.

title: HOTEL RIVINGTON NYC GEM!!
text: First off I will like to thank everyone at the Riverton Hotel for making my birthday an amazing and unforgettable experience from start to finish. First off, Anna was the most down to earth event coordinator I have ever dealt with and I throw at least three parties a year. From our first conversation she made me feel so comfortable, as if I known her for years. She assisted with site visits whether she was there or not. When I arrived the day of my event, to my surprise my room was upgraded to the most amazing suite in the room. The wraparound floor to ceiling windows with the most spectacular views of NYC. The staff was so helpful from start to finish. There was absolutely nothing that I asked for that they didn’t help with. The staff is a young fun bunch that’s very educated on the area on what the area has to offer. The hotel location is ideal and near all of NYC hotspots. I will definitely be back to hotel Rivington.

title: nice tub
text:
This property as of Jan 2024 is still undergoing renovations. I knew going in that there might be some dated aspects to the place. We didn’t mind because we weren’t there for a romantic, picture-perfect getaway and stayed for the price (booked directly on their website during cyber monday week), location, and the big bathtub to take epsom salt baths (shopify product suggestion for the property :)))) ). 

The hotel has a lot of potential. The employees we interacted with were very nice, friendly, and accommodating. The bed was so comfy we almost slept the first day away. The shower water pressure was definitely the best in any hotel I’ve ever stayed at. Wine hour was actually decent wine and thankfully not Stella Rosa LOL.

I would definitely choose to stay here when I visit NYC again.

title: Great stay in LES
text: Best time, location was great and the staff is amazing, I got the room with the best views New York. Top floor was always available for complementary coffee, tea and wine hour from 5 to 6. I had an incredible stay, and will definitely recommend

title: Terrible management
text: Absolutely the worst management of any hotel I have ever experienced. Booked a room from Friday to Sunday night the week before Christmas through my credit card travel. The hotels website states, if you would like early check in we recommend booking the prior night to guarantee access to your room early. So I booked the room for Friday night knowing we were not going until Saturday morning. Saturday we arrive at 11am, go to check in ,  and we are told they re sold our room and they are now sold out. I can see this happening if we had just put a deposit, but the entire stay was prepaid, and nothing on their website said to call and let them know when we were coming, what should it matter we paid for the room for the 2 nights. The young lady working the desk tells us sorry but if you call we will refund the room. I would hope so, as the now have been paid for the same room twice . We leave and have to last minute book a room at The Domenick ( which is always outstanding service). When wr get home I notify the credit card travel company of the situation, telling them the hotel has agreed to refund the room, they reach out and amazingly thr hotel has now denied the refund. Terrible service for following the hotels own reccomendations.

title: Not worth it
text: This hotel has so much potential, but between the unhelpful staff, hidden fees, terrible breakfast (everything was stale, the coffee was essentially water, and the layout is beyond awkward), construction and overall wear and tear of the premises, it is absolutely not worth the location or the money. The street noise is very loud and kept us up all night…highly suggest any other hotel in the city.

title: Great location, wonderful staff and all "necessities" in order
text:
We had read several reviews regarding this hotel prior to making our reservation, so we had a good idea of what to expect...

Overall we were pleasantly surprised by the standard of both the hotel and rooms.
When we travel and stay at hotels, we have 4 basic requirements for our accommodation; general good cleanliness of the facilities (common areas/rooms), shower/water pressure (and hot/cold water), comfortable/clean bed and friendly staff. This hotel ticked all these boxes with ease.
The tempur-pedic beds (we booked another stay within the same week upon check-out after our first stay) in both our rooms were some of best ones we've ever experienced, it was a joy to take a hot shower (and bath) during the cold November days and the staff were always friendly, knowledgeable and greeted you with a smile every time you passed through the lobby/reception area. And as many reviewers before us, a special shout out needs to go to Seki and Gina - you won't find better people in any hotel anywhere.

The continental breakfast (served between 07:00-10:00 AM) also outdid our expectations. As we've travelled a lot in Europe, a continental breakfast usually means a few slices of white toast, jam/jelly/marmelade and maybe a cup of watered down coffee.
To find both delicious bagels with several choices of cream cheese, yoghurts, fruit and pastries with your coffee/tea - together with the beautiful skyline views over the city (breakfast is served on the 20th floor) - wasn't the worst way to start off your day, on the contrary.
And as others have mentioned, in the afternoons, before heading out to dinner, they offered wine hour everyday (free of charge) between 5:00-6:00 PM, on the same floor, this time accompanied by nighttime views of the same skyline.

Yes, the hotel in general - and the rooms - have some wear and tear to it/them which we're certain will be rectified once their renovations are completed.
We would like to point out, that the staff was more than welcoming to receive, and took notes, on any feedback you would give them during your stay in regards to the hotel and its facilities in order to take the necessary action either immediately or to be added to their "renovations list" for the future. Always with a smile and thank you.

Overall we felt that, all of the main features were in order, so we didn't care if the elevator upholstery is dated - it took us up and down all the floors safely, and fast, we might add.
Could the breakfast and wine hour area (on the 20th floor) use a minor 'makeover' with dimmed lighting, a few more plants, candles on the tables, some Ibiza chill tunes (playing during wine hour) and a generally cozier atmosphere? Definitely.
But we enjoyed our fresh breakfast every morning while watching the sunrise and in the evenings we enjoyed small talking for an hour and a few glasses of rosé wine on the house - so what's not to like - if you've seen the prices for a glass of wine in any NYC restaurant.

We have stayed at several different hotels and locations throughout the years in NYC when visiting, but this is the first time we honestly can say that we know that we will come back the next time we're in town - it was simply the perfect fit for us and our budget.

Well done Hotel on Rivington!

title: Excellent view and good bed
text:
I have never stayed in such a run down and run down hotel in NYC. The hotel was smart twenty years ago, but that is certainly not the case now.

Already in the lift you get the impression of a hotel where there is no connection between price and quality. It is worn and bears the marks of many years of use.

The room is a nice size, but the bathroom is even more run down than the hotel.

Several days there was no room service. The employees had even become aware of the necessity of daily cleaning. The last day there was no hot water either.

The hotel will probably be renovated in 2025. Until then, I would not recommend staying at this hotel. But the view is excellent and the bed good. The rest is highly critical.

title: To be avoided
text: The bathroom floor tiles stuck to my feet because they'd come off. We weren't notified there was a bar on the roof - we went in the hottest weather and could have used it! (I wasn't able to choose the right dates for this review). The shower was at the level of a parking lot across the way, the windows had no shades so anyone leaving their car could watch me shower.  When I asked for directions to MOMA the staff looked bewildered. I asked them to use the computer (in front of them) to look it up for us - they didn't.  Horrible experience. Indifferent staff, tiny room.

title: Stay away
text:
If possible do not stay in this hotel.

There is no lobby to speak of. The area where you check in is poorly lit and is basically a cart..  While the staff is super friendly they are also apologetic about the hotel. 

The elevators are beat up with old leather padding that has not been maintained..

The hallway carpeting is bright red and worn. The hallway wall decorations are sad and damaged.

Then there was our room. Beautiful view but not much else.  The lighting is terrible making it hard to see at night.  Closets are also dark. The bed was fine but the only a tiny night stand on one side. The other side of the bed had nothing.  

There was only one outlet hidden behind the nightstand making it difficult for phone charging.

The full windows make the room very noisy.

The bathroom is small but has a nice shower although when used flooded the bathroom floor.

There is one sink with minimum counter space.

Light in the bathroom was poor.

Housekeeping did not get to our room until after 3:00.

I know other hotels in the area are far nicer for the same price…stay away.

title: A great stay with friendly service
text:
While I have plenty of wonderful things to say, first and foremost I have to highlight a staff member who has been an absolute delight every time we have stayed here. Seki is outstanding. She’s so amiable, and helpful from the second you walk in through the door. People underestimate the power of solid customer service. Being greeted by a bright, enthusiastic staff member is everything. It sets the tone and helps to keep us coming back. 

Aside from that, the hotel rooms are all lovely with a view that is so incredible it can make a NYC native fall in love with her city all over again. The sunset - ridiculous. 
Every room we’ve stayed in has been very clean, with all things working as they should. Very comfortable and location is great. You’re close enough to everything but far away enough to not be in the middle of the madness.

title: My home in New York
text: I already wrote a review some time ago, I have been to this hotel many times since 2005, it was my home when I came to New York.  I have always appreciated the decor, the beautiful view from its rooms and its bathrooms overlooking the skyline, but above all the rooms are much larger than other hotels in New York.  During my recent visit to New York, I stayed at another hotel, unfortunately, because I read about the problems it had and the renovation that was underway at the Rivington.  I stopped by anyway to see how things were going and met Seki at the front desk, who explained the current situation to me.  I wanted to ask the new owners of the hotel not to change the size of the rooms, that's what makes the Rivington a unique hotel in New York.  I'm sure it will be the success it deserves again, it's a stunning hotel in a beautiful neighbourhood.

title: A wonderful small hotel with a extraordinariy responsive staff
text: What a great 5-day stay in this conveniently located hotel near the off-off Broadway shows. The staff was exceedingly helpful, responding promptly to our needs and giving pertinent advice on area restaurants & businesses.

title: Customer service spot on but room issues
text: All the staff we had the courtesy to  meet were super nice and as helpful, prompt, and professional. Sadly the room we were in had issues. The main one was the AC didn’t work and we had a gorgeous view from the south facing side of the city but had to keep the drapes closed and the bathroom door closed (even though the door wouldn’t close all the way and the door handle kept coming off) it got up to 92 degrees inside our room each day by around 3pm. It seems to be working now after the second attempt of fixing but we are leaving in the morning so really have no idea if the problem is fixed. The bathroom and tub are wonderful. The comp continental breakfast and afternoon wine is very nice

title: This is what $500 a night will get you.
text:
This used to be a pretty fancy place.  Not any more.  More of a hostel vibe.  No lobby, no bar, no restaurant.  The "front desk" is a podium on wheels.  The "lounge" on the 20th floor is literally an empty room with no food or drinks, and no hotel staff.

Staff are literally teenagers.  No lighting in the halls;  I was shown to my room by a man with a flashlight.  No kidding!

The front door is unmarked under a bunch of scaffolding.

You will NOT be able to check in before 4:00 PM, so plan accordingly...All in all, terrible.

title: Amazing staff and location!
text: The staff here is amazing! So friendly, helpful, always smiling — and the location of the hotel is great, right in the mix. Some of the hotel felt a little dated, but the room made up for it: super comfy bed, a HUGE bathtub, and wraparound windows for a corner suite.

title: You might want to call and ask about the progress of the renovation, but solid location and spot.
text: We stayed in June of 2023, during a MAJOR renovation. The hotel is dated, but what hotel got out of the pandemic, and survived, without a little deferred maintenance. I suspect the lobby area and offices were first, then they'll move onto the rooms. It's quite the lower east side view of endless rooftops, but a nice and functional room with a really nice updated bathroom, operable windows, a nice little sitting area, and comfortable bed. This isn't a place to hang out, but a weigh station between experiencing the neighborhood and going out. It served our purposes perfectly, and the staff was FANTASTIC and really helpful. A solid option for a fun part of town, but if you're into luxury or new, you might want to inquire when the renovation is supposed to be completed, and what the plan for the rooms are. Also, if you have a sweet tooth, WATCH OUT: It's across from one of the craziest candy stores I've ever seen!

title: Beware of dishonest staff
text: We had a lovely check in with Kyle but upon check in we were told they needed a card ONLY for incidentals which was 100$ which I then gave my personal card and then upon check out I once again checked if everything was alright but then I was awoken with an extra charge that was not told to me directly which was very disappointing.

title: Room with a View
text: Spectacular Room with a room. Amazingly friendly staff. Perfect location to hang out and enjoy the heart of the city. Even with to s of construction near it still was a cozy stay. Rooftop is being renovated but when you’re staying on the top floor with a balcony do you really need it? Will definitely visit again soon.

title: My go-to NYC hotel
text: Been staying here regularly for NYC getaways. Friendly staff, quiet, cool rooms, great location. Feels hip and private-club-like, but also casual, without the pretension and snobbery of some other NYC boutique hotels.

title: Sensational
text: I had a wonderful experience. Yes, i will return. 😌. The high floor views is spectacular! You see all 3 bridges: Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsburg. This experience was everything. Oh and everyday from 5-6 pm they have wine hour. This place is a hidden gem.

title: Amazing urban views, great service!
text: I really enjoyed my stay! My room had an amazing city view with floor to ceiling windows, and the set-up was bright and airy. The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive - Seki at the front desk was especially kind and helpful! I have stayed at a lot of hotels in the city and this one definitely had the best service, and the nicest rooms - 5 stars!

title: Not 4 stars
text: Not as advertised, pictures looked way better and more spacious. Only mirror in the room was in the dim bathroom with a broken toilet paper holder. Happy hour ran out of glasses and 'complementary' wine when we got there. In a room that was very oddly laid out. Maybe the main space was under construction...  Bed was clean and fresh. Shower was nice. Too expensive for what we got.

title: Great experience
text: The staff was awsome, accommodating, and very friendly. Prior to my arrival I expressed that my reservation was in celebration of my birthday. Went I got into the room I noticed a bottle of wine and a letter wishing me a happy birthday. All wants and needs were meant. Thanks guys!

title: The best hotel!
text: An amazing experience! I'm having back issues, and Seki kindly hooked me up with a beautiful room with the most beautiful bathtub. Seki and everyone at the front desk are angels who you'll remember - I will recommend this hotel widely!

title: This was the most lovely experience
text:
I am a native New Yorker, and now have the occasion to stay in hotels when visiting family, friends, etc. I am super judgemental. I will be staying at the Hotel on Rivington from now on.
1. The views. Just incredible. Surreal.
2. The service. What a lovely group of people. 
3. The location. I love the LES. Always have. Make sure to hit up the Tenement Museum around the block. So important.
4. The overall vibe of the place. Just wonderful.

The lobby is completely underwhelming though, so you arrive and experience a few moments of concern for what is to come. Don't worry. You'll be great :)

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel in Rivington. The king-size bed was extremely comfortable. The room was spacious, especially by Manhattan standards, with a tasteful modern decor. Although there was construction going on, the hotel amenities and service from the staff were excellent. I also  enjoyed the vibrant LES neighborhood.

title: My stay wasn’t that great
text: The bed was very comfortable and I love that the hotel was in walking distance of everything we wanted to do but overall my stay was not so great. The hotel looked creepy from the elevator, halls to the decor. The tile on the floor was coming up, the lighting wasn’t good in the bathroom, and I didn’t get any good sleep. Every night I kept hearing loud noises between 4am-6am and then they had construction workers every morning as well. The day of check in, they kept telling us they would call when our room was ready and never did so we walked around for hours and then decided to go back to see if it was ready. Definitely won’t be staying here again.

title: Great room, great service folks, great location, great price!
text:
OK.  Not the 5* review you may be expecting.   On our first night there we learned that the roof deck was closed for months, that one of the two elevators was down, and that the key machine wasn’t working.  But who cares?

The rooms are top notch (huge for New York), the amenities are amazing Le Labo Santal 33, every service person was amazingly polite and helpful, the continental breakfasts were great, and the location is right in the thick of a lot of fun bars and restaurants (Soho and Little Italy are blocks away for a fraction of Soho’s hotel costs).

I’d come back in a second!

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text:
Due to flight delays, my trip to NYC went from 3 nights to 6 nights, and I moved hotels from Midtown to the Lower East Side at the Hotel on Rivington. Great choice.

Everything about this hotel was exactly what I needed. The room was incredible, floor to ceiling windows overlooking a beautiful skyline. The room was cold, and perfect to come back to after walking around the Lower East Side. 

If sexy European vampires ran a hotel, this would be it. In fact, based on the amazing free breakfast, I am not certain that they were not trying to fatten up my blood with the most delicious bagels and cream cheese in NYC. Great restaurants, coffee, weed, and sex toy store nearby as well. What more could one need in NYC?

The staff were wonderful, and learned my name and situation very quickly, and were helpful when I needed to stay longer than expected. Shout out especially to Eugenia!!

I will definitely stay here again when I come back to NYC!

title: The staff was nice and did a good job explaining the renovation process. The views were also good. The wifi is strong.
text: The shower was a little too hot but it was fixed. We stayed for two weeks and had enough room for our luggage. The A/C worked great and opening the door to the balcony let plenty of fresh air in. The breakfast was good but repetitive. Book through their website for a better deal.

title: Would definitely return!
text: The amazing staff, SEKI, Gina, JULIEN, Miguel, Kyle, and Alina were paramount in making the experience so welcoming, comfortable, and a fun time. This was my first time at Hotel on Rivington and I’d most definitely return.  You all really went above and beyond, thanks for the incredible stay!

title: Great location and staff
text: The location was incredible and the staff were especially helpful and friendly. Seki was always available to ask questions and give recommendations. Thank you for making our stay memorable. You can easily walk to China Town from the hotel. We stayed for the Half Marathon and were able to see the racers from our balcony.

title: Awesome Place in an Awesome Neighborhood
text:
I absolutely love this place.  It fits right into the neighborhood around it, and there are so many little touches that make it count.

From the Japanese soaking tub, the amazing view, the comfortable bed, to the amazing neighborhood, I will definitely be staying here any time I can when I’m in town.

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: This is a great hotel and conveniently located. . Staff is amazing and all very friendly. Seki was amazing and extremely helpful. The entire staff really goes out of their way to ensure all customers are happy. Would definitely stay new here again! 9/10

title: Great Getaway for Solo Travel
text:
My stay at the Rivington was everything I could have hoped for and more! It’s a long review but I just have to sing their praises!!! I have been eyeing the atelier suite here for literal years. As soon as I saw those soaking tubs I was DETERMINED to save enough to stay. Came here for the weekend of June 17-19 for a street fair on Christopher Street after saving for a bit and getting a better new job.

First off, I wanna give my biggest shout out to the staff here. Every single person I interacted with was so sweet and accommodating and most important they were CHILL. I’m young I’m 27 years old and i always am afraid traveling solo about running into unfriendly staff who judge you on your appearance and treat you accordingly for the rest of the stay. This was the exact opposite.  When my keycard stopped working at 2am and I went outside to ask the security to call someone, not only did he wait with me but we had such a great conversation. To John in security, I truly hope that million dollars you’re manifesting comes to you one way or another. They were also very nice to my friends who came to visit during the day and check out my place. made them feel very welcome which is great considering how some hotels treat you when you dare to invite your local friends to check out your sick room. 

Obviously the room is incredible; gorgeous bathroom with soaking tub, balcony with a view of downtown and plenty of closet space. Room was clean spacious and the linens were great. Also super close to lots of places to eat. 

Overall I hope I can save up enough where this can be a regular hotel I stay at when I’m in the city. Thank you again to everyone there for giving me such an incredible stay ❤️

title: Some of the friendliest employees EVER
text: Kyle and the gang were near on faultless with their style of engagement. Friendly yet never OTT. Accommodated my every needs. Rooms good. Could do with shelves for clothes a minor thing. See u soon. T

title: Shoutout to Seki
text: I loved the front desk agent, her name was Seki. She was very welcoming and helpful when it came to checking in. She made sure we felt comfortable. Thank you for having us, definitely will come again.

title: please read this review :)
text: Seki the front desk person was incredible. It was such a pleasant experience staying at this hotel. Highly recommend. Great location and will definitely stay again next time we’re in NY. Thank you! The room was comfortable and everyone that works there is super friendly and helpful.

title: This is the spot!  100% will be staying here again!
text:
Hotel on Rivington is the spot!  First, big shout out to SEKI!!!!  SEKI legit made the trip for me, start to finish.  100% I'll be staying here again.  Floor to ceiling window, outdoor patio, huge tub for 2, nice shower, bed, staff is 10/10, etc.  This is the hotel for you if looking for a romantic, date get away type vibe, or just traveling solo and want a epic room. 
The hotel does need renovations is the only knock I got, but I believe that is scheduled to start later this year (2023).  Once these are done, omg, this place will be epic.  HR-send me a invite to come stay once done, I'm in! 

SEKI-I hope you see this review because you legit made my NYC trip awesome and I sincerely can't say Thank You enough!  You helped make my trip a 10/10!  

HR-loved the staff, the room, the vibe.  100% I'll be seeing you again!

title: this hotel is going to be a hotspot
text: I had a great time at hotel on rivington. i went to celebrate my cousins graduation, and at first i was a little sketched out by the hotel because they had a small lobby and scaffolding outside. however do not judge a book by its cover. their rooms are huge with great views and their staff is wonderful. from the front desk agents to the housemen and the housekeepers. their staff is top notch. the hotel is currently starting a renovation so that they can elevate the guest experience bc they got hit pretty hard during the covid era. with their awesome staff and their great plans for the renovations i can tell this hotel will be a big hotspot in the future. itll be on everyones list. a special shoutout to seki for her wonderful hospitality, honesty, and overall knowledge about the property and the area. it is a genuine form of kindness that helped to elevate the stay

title: Lower East Side's First Boutique Hotel
text:
The staff at this hotel are truly one-of-a-kind individuals! I booked the same day (Memorial Day weekend might I add) and it was no hassle getting right in despite them being near full occupancy. I would specifically like to highlight Julian for his incredible hospitality. He was knowledgeable, patient, and detailed.

This hotel is conveniently located in a one of a kind neighborhood with everything you need in a short walking distance. For those of you who may be unfamiliar the neighborhood can be a tad noisy as an FYI. If you're anything like me you may enjoy a little chaos (read: fun).

We stayed in superior king room on the 18th floor! This room has a separate living space area, private balcony, and complimentary WI-FI. The "cherry on top" would easily be the view of the city from the room! 

Looking forward to booking again !

title: Visiting NYC in June
text:
This is the 2nd time I have stayed at HR. This hotel has a lot of heart! The rooms with the balconies are amazing with awesome views! 

A continental breakfast is also appreciated.

Comfy beds and wonderful staff!

I look forward to the renovations which will make this Hotel even better!

title: Starting to Renovate
text: Property is starting a renovation.  I was upgraded to a high floor corner room that had amazing views.  Property is worn but staff was especially friendly. Big shout out to Seki and Gabby - both of whom couldn’t have been nicer. Should be great like their other property in Manhattan once the renovations are completed.

title: Seki at the front desk went above and beyond. Friendly, knowledgeable, and made our stay memorable. Highly recomme
text: Seki, the front desk employee at the hotel, deserves special recognition for their outstanding service. From the moment we arrived, Seki greeted us with a warm smile and a genuine desire to make our stay memorable. Their professionalism, efficiency, and attention to detail were commendable. Her extensive knowledge about the local area helped us navigate the city and discover hidden gems. Throughout our stay, they consistently went above and beyond to ensure our comfort and satisfaction. Their friendly demeanor and willingness to assist were truly exceptional. Their dedication to providing top-notch hospitality sets them apart. Thank you, Seki, for making our stay unforgettable! #HospitalityAtItsBest

title: Best customer service!!
text: My stay was elevated through the help of seki at the front desk. I let her know that I was planning a surprise trip for me and my boyfriend and she went above and beyond to make the trip special. She gave me tons of what kind of rooms would be a best fit and recommendations to restaurants and activities that were romantic and fun. I was looking at other hotels but after speaking to her on the phone it was a no brainer to stay here. Once we got there she had our room set up with complementary amenities and a handwritten card which was so thoughtful and it’s the little things that go a long way. We will definitely be back ! Thank you seki !!

title: Very nice, modern boutique hotel in lower Manhattan
text:
I had a fantastic experience from beginning to end. My hotel two blocks away suddenly closed leaving me to find a new hotel with little notice.  Thankfully, the Hotel on Rivington was available. It was a much better hotel for the price, a larger room and more modern amenities. 

From the time I checked my luggage with front desk early, I knew I was in good hands. Seki was super friendly and helpful. Two days later she remembered the purpose of my visit and asked how everything went. Julien and Kyle, who checked me in were very helpful in their explanation of the property and what it had to offer. Seki also checked me out and her professionalism and cheerfulness made me look forward to coming back to HOR on a future visit. 

I didn’t have a city view, but a nice sitting area, very comfortable bed, high quality toiletries and a huge shower. 

A continental breakfast (coffee and pastries) is offered on the second floor lobby. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Undercover Lover
text:
For me, the best parts of NYC aren't the obvious glitz and glam but rather the underground treats. Hotel on Rivington is one of these treats.

After bursting onto the Lower East Side scene almost 20 years ago, it now might appear to be neglected and washed up. With no real lobby, bar, restaurant, coffee shop, etc., built-in, it might feel more like an apartment building than a hotel. With its monochromatic art-free rooms it might feel under-designed. And yes, the building is 20 years old and shows it here and there.

THAT SAID, what you can get here are INCREDIBLE rooms (very large by NYC standards), with bonkers views through floor to ceiling glass walls, balconies, soaking tubs, sex appeal, a secret hideaway feel, and a location smack in the middle of the coolest stuff to do in Manhattan and right on the way to the coolest stuff to the do in Brooklyn. Also the world's most comfortable beds. All at a cost that would get you only a normal room at a cool-ish hotel elsewhere.

As other reviews have mentioned, the staff is also excellent. All five stars from the manager and then gentleman working when I checked in to Seki to helped us when checking out.

For me, this hotel is a no-brainer in NYC and I can't wait to go back. Strong recommend spending a little bit extra to get yourself a room with a balcony to max out your view experience from this property.

title: Big rooms but lacking the basics…
text: The staff here was very nice and my room was huge, especially for NYC, which was great—massive bathtub and very nice toiletries. In these ways it has the bones of a 4 star hotel, but it is also VERY dated, dirty and lacking the basic amenities of even a motel, which for $300-500 per night I just do not understand. They’re undergoing a renovation, which I wasn’t aware of. Not the end of the world. The dealbreaker for me was no coffee or tea at all in the rooms. And while it is available during their breakfast, it’s not available at other times. As an early riser there on business this drove be crazy. The gym has 2 treadmills, a Peloton and an elliptical. The elliptical was out of service completely and the Peloton had cycling clips so only useable if you decide to travel w spin shoes?? There weren’t any yoga mats so if you’d like to stretch bring a towel. The wine hour was nice in theory, but the wine I was served had turned. When I asked when it had been opened he said “last week”. Yikes. There’s no bar, mini-bar or in-room snacks, restaurant or room service. It’s just very bare-bones. A 3-star hotel trying to skirt by on 4-5 star pricing.  The location is great but there are many hotels in NY in this range w an excellent location and the standard amenities that fall within the 4-star category.

title: Great stay
text:
Lovely stay. One of the best hotels in NYC. Shoutout and thanks to Gabriel and Julien for an amazing stay.

Looking forward to coming back soon & strongly recommend this place to anyone who wants a beautiful spot in the middle of the Manhattan hustle.

title: Great stay
text: We were cautious after seeing negative reviews but it was exactly as shown online: a pleasant, upscale suite in the middle of a party neighborhood. Ask for a quiet room and you’ll be fine. Everyone in the lobby was so kind and friendly. We will be back.

title: Immaculate customer service
text: Was only in NYC for a night and found this cute boutique hotel on Rivington St. The hotel has a 24hr doorman which is a plus but the building overall could use a renovation or some updating. The floor to ceiling windows and views of the city are so amazing especially at night. We had a couple of issues with one of our rooms & when I tell you Maggie & Julian did everything they could to rectify the situation with such a willing spirit. They were pleasant, courteous and kind. They even gave me a late check out due to my flight being delayed. Just based upon their customer service I would definitely return!

title: Very Comfortable
text: This was our second stay and will definitely be back. Very large rooms, comfortable beds, bedding and good towels. Good shower with strong water pressure, luxury bathroom amenities, love the continental breakfast, great location, friendly staff.

title: Don't believe the pics!
text:
Attractive rooms in need of maintenance. Bed was clean and comfortable. Upper level corner room was very noisy.

Bare bones staff. Room phone had no way to call the front desk, housekeeping, etc. We had to call the hotel main # from our cell phones to get an extra blanket.

The second floor "lobby" was deserted. 

Chipped floor tiles, broken shower door, slow draining sink and toilet ran throughout my stay. Based on the limited staff i encountered, i didn't bother trying to contact "housekeeping" or maintenance because I assumed they were aware of the problems and didn't have the staff available to help me out.

No amenities to speak of. They offered a gym, coffee/pastries in the morning and wine for an hour in the afternoon. Coffee was cold, no attendant... No water offered...

The website shows an adjacent cafe which is closed.. Scaffolding at the entrance so it is barely visible unless you know exactly what you're looking for.

i had an upper floor room and felt as though i was staying on level 2 of Bourbon street in Nola. Noise all night. The people in  room above me were up late and early. Sounded like a zumba class at 6 am sunday. Moving furniture around throughout the night.

I chose it because of its proximity to the places i needed to visit on my trip.

title: Views, Breakfast, Big Rooms & Solid Location
text: The rooms were massive for NYC with a couch and a desk for work remote. Floor to ceiling windows with views of the city, the best Gotham views at night. Location in the heart of LES. Breakfast bagels coffee & croissant. Coolest & nicest staff - thanks Maggie!!

title: Best on the lower east side
text: I booked this hotel sight unseen. It’s the best one yet I’ve found in the lower east side. Felt so secure w a doorman 24-7 seeing as you could only get in if you were staying there. Seki was absolutely amazing; so kind, sweet. Just a shiny star. We also liked jerry & Danzel. We wanted to stay an extra day they were so accommodating for all of our needs. I would definitely stay there again in a heartbeat. Super clean as well.

title: Space & Comfort
text: Loved my stay here! Funky neighborhood with lots of cool shops, cafes and art. Room was the most spacious of any New York hotel I’ve ever stayed at, with a nice sitting area. Super comfy mattress. Staff was very friendly and  helpful. Really enjoyed the free continental breakfast and free wine hour. Will definitely book again.

title: cold as ever except in the room
text:
We have been to this hotel several times, but this was clearly the last time. It has lost its quality.
For our last trip in April 2023:
AC: dead ( 30° outside and 35° to 40° in the room), tv and wifi not working well. Breakfast: at 8:30 am almost nothing to eat. Room not cleaned for 2 days. 
These things can happen (even if it is a lot), bad luck too.

But no smile, no hello, not even a word of apology from the guy at the reception. Maybe it was a robot?
Also, we were with a child. 
In summary: The attitude of the staff sucks (except for the French guy who was nice), but there is no service at all.
While the view is worth it, the rest is a joke. We should have stayed 6 nights, after 2 nights we changed hotel.

title: Great little boutique hotel
text: We loved it so much here ! The staff is an friendly and helpful, the beds are simply amazing and honestly, some of the most comfortable to sleep on. There is a great breakfast and happy hour as well. And, you cannot beat the location - smack in the middle of the East Vilage. Super safe as well and not noisy.

title: Staycation
text: My room was absolutely amazing. The communication with the staff was excellent they made sure I was able to get the exact room I wanted. Great location!! Excellent amenities!!! Quick responding staff!

title: Definitely a hidden gem!
text: I was very hesitant with booking this hotel, because of the reviews online. We stayed in room 1603, which is a corner King room with bathtub and balcony. The room was clean and the view was amazing. The Hotel, can use some updating but it’s great for the price. No major issues. The location was a plus because it was around everything you can imagine with plenty of food options. Plenty of bars a lot of movement. We will definitely book and stay here again. Also, the staff was amazing, very accommodating and they made sure we had everything we needed. Even the cleaning crew did a fantastic job. Definitely a 9/10 ⭐️

title: Friendly and low-key, with wonderful service
text: Great friendly and small(ish) hotel, with excellent service from doorman to reception, to housekeeping/HVAC assistance. Quiet on back side of hotel, large rooms by NYC standards and comfortable beds/pillows. Continental breakfast was also a plus. One area for improvement is bathrooms- add towel bars, brighter lights, and dust mirrors.

title: Nice hotel, helpful staff, in a great location
text: Love the location in Lower East Side. Corner rooms have lots of light and nice views with super large shower. The staff at Check-in was super friendly and welcoming, and Seki at the desk was extremely helpful throughout the afternoon and evening with recommendations in the area whenever we were coming and going.

title: The hospitality and charm of this place caught me off guard.
text: This place is amazing, the location really great and the hospitality was super amazing.  Seki and Davis has blown me away from the moment David opened the door and Seki accommodated me in my checkin. She went above and beyond with her service and knowledge.   I would love to come back here again both Seki and Davis ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ rooms are immaculate and so cool.

title: New York Trip
text: Seki!!!!! She was the best. Awesome time here, everything was handled with class, and promptly. Would absolutely come back. This area is the only place to be. Great food and drinks, with the ability to be anywhere else in minutes

title: Seki made our trip
text: Seki is the epitome of customer service. If you want an authentic NYC experience go to her. She went out of her way to make us feel welcomed. Our friends were completely impressed as were we. We will keep this on our radar.

title: Awesome!
text: This place was amazing! Shout out to Maggie at the reception! She was super nice and helped make our stay unforgettable! The place itself was super nice and comfortable and near lots of little shops. Parking was unavailable when we were there.

title: Absolute   Great.
text: We stayed here for 4 night Maggie was a delight she was super professional and great customer service, always had a good solution for our needs.the room was great, very clean and a super view , seen in the picture

title: A really lovely and unique hotel
text: A great location on the LES. I stayed here about 15  years ago, and decided to return with my partner for a birthday weekend break. The staff were really helpful, and left a lovely handwritten birthday message and complementary bottle of Prosecco to start the stay off in good style.  I asked for a room with a good view on booking, and was amazed with their delivery. An enormous suite on the 18th floor, with jaw dropping views over 3/4 of the Manhattan skyline. Yes there is remodelling work going on in the hotel at the moment, and the bar and restaurant are currently closed, but there is an amazing variety of alternatives nearby. The staff are friendly, are there’s a unique and creative buzz about the place. We both loved our stay. Thank you very much!

title: The total package over-delivers
text: The Rivington has my favorite rooms in Manhattan, spacious and expertly laid out. They feel more like an enviable LES apartment than a typical Manhattan hotel room.  Great views as one of the taller buildings in the neighborhood, an excellent king-size memory foam mattress, a soaking tub, and Le Labo toiletries are all great flourishes within the spacious rooms. The staff is warm and friendly without being fake. They’re understanding, generous, and accommodating, especially Edlira at the front desk. The neighborhood is dense with destination dining, chic wine bars, and niche shopping. One could hardly do better than the Rivington for a sophisticated culture-rich stay in NYC.

title: Complete Dump
text: Absolute dump.  The rooms are not maintained.  My safe did not work, phone did not work, light switches were broken, tiles were missing and loose in shower - which was quite uncomfortable.  If I had googled first, the place is up for sale and they are obviously not spending money on maintenance.

title: Woah Edlira!
text:
Woah Edlira is awesome!!
 Got in early and was very tired! Room was modern and had a great view! Customer service the best even the delivery robot was friendly! Can’t beat great people! 😊 
Derric was extremely cool as well!

title: What a dump!
text:
-When I arrived there was an undisclosed $30 a day facility fee that you have to pay.

-The toilet was backing up and therefore won’t flush so there’s poo in it all the time.

- The shades  tore down when I tried to close them.

- Internet didn’t  work the entire stay

- The AC didn’t work in my first two rooms - the temp was 78. 

-The only friendly staff member is the woman  at the front desk - all the men are rude AF.

I visited 10 years ago and it was a beautiful hotel - tragic yo see that theplace clearly isn’t maintained.

title: Home away from home
text: I stayed at Hotel on Rivington for 6 weeks on and off, while waiting to move into my NYC co-op. From the beginning, they were super accommodating and treated me like family. I was put in a fantastic room on the 18th floor, which became my home away from home for the next several weeks. Being homeless due to the nightmare that is the NYC co-op approval process was challenging, but having the consistency of a warm, welcoming, and incredibly clean place to stay made it not just bearable, but I dare say enjoyable. If you want to stay at the Ritz, this may not be the place for you. This is the LES after all, but if you want a modern, clean, and cool place to take in the city, you can’t do better. Having stayed in many NYC hotels over the years, this is hands down the best hotel staff I’ve ever encountered. They actually treat you like a real person, and really strive to make you comfortable. While most NYC hotels gladly pocket your amenity fee, the Rivington actually provides things like breakfast w/ NYC bagels and pastries and a comp wine happy hour. It’s small touches like this that really make this place standout amidst the other LES hotels. Special shout-out to Lester who went above and beyond to look after me. I hope the owners recognize how special their staff is and do right by them. Thank you Hotel on Rivington!

title: Great stay at a perfect location
text:
I stayed in a beautiful double room with one of my girlfriends for the weekend. The location was perfect for food, coffee, bars, shopping, subway,
access, and close to the Williamsburg bridge for a quick ride to Brooklyn. The service was excellent and all the staff was very accommodating. The room was clean and had a fantastic view of the west side of Manhattan. I will miss the water pressure in that shower, I could’ve stood under it for hours.

title: Great experience!! Highly Recommend!!
text:
We would like to thank the Hotel on Rivington for bringing a real NYC luxury experience at a fair and affordable cost.

The views, ambiance, energy and service was personable, detailed and friendly.

We made full use of the hotel's amenities and the restaurants that the surrounding areas had to offer.

All of the staff members were very kind and went out of their way to welcome us and make us feel comfortable at all times. Two people that we would like to point out especially, are Liz and Seki; they truly made the most of it and we hope they will be rewarded for such great service.

My boyfriend came to NYC to surprise me on our 3-year anniversary and informed the hotel beforehand. Upon entrance to our room, there were rose petals on the floor and bed, chocolates, and champagne for two. It was a very romantic experience and it made us appreciate it so much.

I couldn’t be more happier, it was a beautiful weekend with so many memories that we’ll never forget and all of our needs were met.

The bath was amazing. We experienced a deep tub where we appreciated every moment of it and felt so relaxed, as we were also given complimentary wine and champagne as well.

The balcony was one of our favorite parts of our stay with beautiful views and natural lighting that was great to wake up to in the morning for both of us.

Even when we thought we had it all, they were able to give us a complimentary small breakfast as well every morning. This was a great start to our day and made a big difference. It’s really about the small things that matters most, and that’s what we realized this hotel was really good at.

We’re excited to tell our friends and family about this wonderful hotel and all it has to offer. We hope that our review will bring great service to this amazing hotel, as a token of our appreciation.

Here are some photos that we took, and we can’t wait to come back again!!

- Anthony and Emery.

title: Great location in vibrant Downtown NYC!
text:
Loved the staff and hotel location. Everyone is very friendly. I loved the opportunity to mingle with other guests during happy hour, which they offer daily complimentary! They offer a variety of wines from South Africa, and are all delicious! Breakfast is self-served, fresh every morning with delicious croissants, bagels, muffins, yogurts, etc. Not to forget the room is super spacious and mattress extra comfy, something very rare to find in NYC. -- And VERY QUIET despite the noisy neighborhood.
I would definitely stay there next time I'm in town!

title: Fun and Funky
text: Funky hotel with a friendly staff and clean and spacious room. We had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows on two full walls with the most amazing views. Fantastic bathroom with huge shower and floor to ceiling windows. Plus, complimentary glass of wine and lovely continental breakfast.

title: Comfy bed
text: So the room was nice, the bed extra comfortable and nice and big. The view was nice. Here comes the issues I had. In the bathroom, hanging on the shower rod was old dirty socks from the previous visitor. So, went to get out of the bathroom and the door knob fell off and was almost locked in the bathroom and had full blown panic so couldn’t fully close the bathroom door after. Took about 5 mins to try and get the door back open. The shower in the morning, the water would not go warm but instead to scolding hot to where you could get burned. There was no changing it. Then the water became brown and about 15 mins later the water just stopped running and working.

title: The hotel is like the LES, cleaned up but shabby around the edges
text: This is a 3-star hotel at best definitely not 4-star, especially for the rate I paid. While the hotel staff was very nice and our room was very spacious for NYC, the hotel itself is an accurate reflection of the neighborhood it is in - cleaned up but still very shabby. One of the two elevators was broken, hallways are dark, the carpet in the hallway was stained, tiles missing on the bathroom floor, door for what used to be a circuit panel couldn't be closed all the way, sloppy patching and paint on the walls. The toilet was running when we checked in to the room (which they fixed) and the heat did not work - supposedly they sent someone to fix that was well but we could not get the room warmer than 64 degrees. And without additional blankets, it was not a great night's sleep in a chilly room. Overall, not worth the price I paid.

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: Absolutely fantastic service, genuine staff and amazing rooms. 10/10 would recommend. From the minute we entered after running late, receptionist greeted us well. Had leaking food and they repacked it in a new bag.

title: Best hotel stay.. ever!
text:
I stayed in New York this past weekend & was drawn to the Hotel on Rivington because of the views of the city! I wanted to check in early but was unable to because the room wasn’t quite ready. However, the waiting period was filled with kindness, expertise of so much, and so much attentiveness from Seki, Miguel, and Lester. Literally the best staff I’ve ever had the pleasure of meeting! Everything I wanted/ needed wasn’t a problem, they handled it and made sure I was happy. I already can’t wait to come back & stay here again! Thank you three so much- I hope you get all the raises and promotions that each one of you truly deserves🤎 
Oh, and the room was perfect. No complaints!

title: A month at Rivington
text:
We recently spent a month at Hotel on Rivington.  We chose this hotel because it was close to our family at LES Manhattan, and suited us very well.  

The hotel is very clean, the beds nice and comfortable and room service was very attentive.  The views from the upper floors are spectacular.  Our stay was an Executive King, which has a separate lounge.  We were informed there is planned an upgrade of rooms and amenities, which will make this more the "Go To" Hotel in the area.

Most of all the Front Office staff were just wonderful.  They sorted out any minor issues we had, in a prompt, friendly and professional manner.  Congratulations to all of them.

We will be back to Rivington again.

PS:  If you want an alternative night or so in Mid Town, try their sister, Refinery Hotel.  Such a beautiful place, with an amazing Rooftop Bar, overlooking Empire State Building.

title: Bachelorette Stay
text: Hotel on Rivington was the PERFECT choice for a special weekend. Between the hotel staff, the amazing views, and being in the heart of the Lower East Side we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. Seki at the front desk went out of her way to make sure we had everything we needed.  I will defintely be back!!

title: Wonderful little hotel in the Lower East Side
text:
It started off rocky…I booked a double bed room because I had friends staying the weekend before a work trip began.  
Pros: The room was huge!  It didn’t have a view at all, but we were there to get out and explore so this was not a problem.  The size of the room was nice when we needed a break and to drop our stuff.  
Cons:  the water pressure was a trickle and the A/C compressor kept crapping out in the middle of the night so we woke up sweating two of the days

I talked with Seki (the most amazing front desk person ever) and she moved me to a different room.  There was a bit of an upgrade price ($30/night) but it was WORTH IT!  My new room had a separate lounging area and floor to ceiling windows in every room.  The bathroom had double shower heads (now I know all the water was being used by floor 10 and apparently couldn’t make it down to floor 3!).  

The second room was divine.  Quiet floor with only a few rooms on each level.  The bedroom’s floor to ceiling windows on two sides was amazing.  I slept with the curtains open and awoke to the most beautiful sunrises overlooking the Williamsburg bridge.

The doormen were lovely and helpful.  Seki was amazing as a front desk person offering tips and just being amazingly helpful.  

I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to NY for business or pleasure.  I hope they reopen the restaurant because I got a glimpse and it looked amazing.  The artwork is representative of the rich history of the Lower East Side.  The breakfast buffet was simple but covered all the bases.  I wish they used the rooftop terrace for entertaining guests, but maybe some day?

Overall, I would recommend this hotel.  They’re recovering after this horrible pandemic and I think they have a few staff who are fully invested in making the hotel successful.  Maybe if they created an incentive program that gave high performers a night or two in one of the executive rooms, they could replicate the amazing service Seki provided.

title: Horrible!
text:
The hotel is not worth the money they charge! Photos are completely deceptive! The building is completely deteriorating and the rooms are what they look like, small and uncomfortable. Bad service, poor cleaning and the $35 resort fee they charge for a breakfast that is joke (bad coffee and a bagel) is outrageous! 
Complete waist of money! Never coming back and do not suggest anybody to stays here either.

title: Awful stay, treated rudely by staff member
text:
My partner and I decided to stay here for our anniversary .. biggest mistake, a huge waste of money, and we are never coming back. I had seen such wonderful reviews online and was so excited to stay at this hotel, only to be completely disappointed by the room and the service I received.

Prior to checking in, we found it extremely difficult to contact the hotel. We would call the number on the website and the phone would either ring and ring endlessly or the call would just drop. I also sent an email to them asking questions about my reservation a week prior, but never received a reply.

My partner and I checked in on Sunday and were disappointed by a few details at first. Regarding the room itself, the TV remote did not work and we had to have someone come up to help us, the shower leaked through the door all over the floor and we had to use most of our towels to clean it up, and within an hour of checking in, we were told that the water would be shut off the next day for a few hours for maintenance. The room also boasted a balcony - it was a glorified fire escape that we were too afraid to step out onto.

We also booked the Romance Package, but it was not at all what we expected. When booking, I was enticed by this offer as the website boasts many things, 

- Early check-in, based on availability (unable to check in early, but understood that it was not available)
- Bottle of champagne - we did not receive champagne, but instead a bottle of red wine (which we did not enjoy nor finish)
- Rose petal turn down (we were disappointed to see that the rose petals were synthetic, and they left bits of debris and little fibers all over the floor and bed)
- Sugar Sweet Sunshine cupcakes (did not enjoy)
- Babeland Massage Oil Candle (we did not receive this)
- Guaranteed late check-out of 2 p.m (issue outlined below)

What really upset us was the experience we had regarding our late check-out. When checking in on Sunday, I made sure to double-check that we had a late checkout, which the attendee at the desk confirmed. On Monday, my partner left the hotel to retrieve breakfast (since the breakfast we were told would be available until 11 am had apparently ended at 9 am). He returned after 11 am to find that his key had been deactivated; the attendee at the desk explained that all keys were automatically deactivated at 11 am - he then reactivated his key and reminded us that our late check-out was at 2 pm.

We thought there were no issues and carried on with our morning. However, at around 12:30 pm, a woman began pounding loudly on our door saying that we needed to vacate the room since check-out was at 11 am. Obviously, we were confused by this - and frankly a bit flustered and very upset since we were trying to enjoy our anniversary and were suddenly interrupted. Through the door, I inform the woman that we had a late check-out - she is apparently unaware of this and tells us that she'll be calling the front desk to verify. I opened the door and, while still on the phone, she simply turned to give me a thumbs up - no apology, no explanation.

My partner and I were both extremely upset by this as it had ruined our entire mood, and neither of us appreciated being treated like criminals for enjoying our room for the time that we paid extra for. At that point, we decided to leave earlier than 2 pm (between 1 pm and 1:30 pm, I don't remember exactly). I told the front desk attendee why we were checking out early - including some of my other complaints listed above - and she was apologetic but didn't really say much else (which I understand that there wasn't much she could really do for me after the fact).

Overall, I am very unhappy with my stay and the service I received - particularly my experience regarding the late check-out and the rude treatment I received from that staff member left a bad taste in my mouth and is what solidified my decision to never stay at this hotel again.

So yeah, don't stay here and definitely don't book with the Romance Package - not at all worth the exponential price (we paid $450 for just one night). Save your money and go literally anywhere else.

title: Aged and not a 4star Boutique Hotel experience
text:
It is promoted as a 4Star boutique hotel. We followed the advice on a travel webpage, but were definitely disappointed.

Staying at the 11th floor gives you an ok view. Higher floors might be better. The rooms are seriously aged. Refill of shampoo and so on is only on demand. 

Staff at the reception always comes across bored and every step is to much. 

The door men are super friendly and helpful !!! Great friendly chaps !!! (ThAt secure the second star) 

Breakfast on plastic plates and plastic cutlery is after 10 - 15 guest empty. Starbucks is around the corner - yeah !!

Ah, if you dream about being on the rooftop or on the 20th floor for yoga - was only available before Corona.

Paying 500 USD for a room is definitely not worth the money.

Lower Rast side on the other hand has developed into a cool diverse place for drinks and is close to SOHO for shopping.

Pictures are showing furniture about 10 years ago.

title: Cute veneer, but doesn’t hold up to closer inspection
text: I tried to call this hotel (in advance of and during my stay) four times. Someone only picked up once. The room phone did not work either. There was stuff in the room left behind by the last guest. The carpet in the hallway was dirty, and the laminate on the floors and furniture was peeling from humidity. The sheets appeared to be clean, although when I woke up the duvet inside the sheets was visibly dirty. The bathroom was seemingly clean (but a black toilet and black tile is questionable). There was weirdly a lot of space in the room / corridor / bathroom overall, but it wasn’t utilized very well. Earplugs and a white noise machine we’re definitely needed on a party-central Friday night (I could also hear the guest above me walking around). Definitely more like a 3 star hotel than a 4. Discounted summer rate was affordable for a one-night stay.

title: Great LES hotel!
text: My mom and I stayed here before I moved into my new apartment and it was perfect! The rooms are spacious and the beds are super comfy. Not to mention the staff was so unbelievably kind and accommodating to all of our wants and needs. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city!

title: Largely unkept promises, location very good
text:
The hotel website promises a slick high end hotel in a lively location. The location is lively but the hotel is is definitely not high end, e.g. 
- reception is a tiny desk/one person operation
- there is no lobby
- air conditioning could not keep up with the heat created by the sun through the large windows surface
- my windows did not close well, which is a pity in a very noisy neighbourhood
- the Wi-Fi was very slow at best
- I found the cleaning approximate in the bathroom
- the hotel is late on maintenance work in a visible way.

I thought I had found a bargain at 180$ per night. Experience made, the price was about right.

title: Horrible! Not a 4 start hotel...DON'T book unless maybe cheap and worth it.
text: Hair in the shower, outdated, no lobby, no bar, no food, bad indifferent service (because people must complain all day and they must hate their jobs...don't know how they say it's a  4 star.  At best a 2-3 star in a cool neighborhood. DO NOT pay $700 a night like we did.  I wouldn't pay more than $200.  It's not this nice swanky place you think you're getting.

title: 4 Star Hotel?
text:
How this hotel got a 4 star rating is beyond me. It is a 2-3 star hotel. 
The only good thing about the  hotel is that for being in heart of the the lower east side night life, the rooms are relatively quiet. The beds were comfortable. 
However, the rooms are shabby and feel dirty. Some tiles were missing from the floor, the area under the sink looked like it hadn’t been wiped down in ages, the light switches had paint on the edges, the picture above our bed was tilted, the night stand looked like a cheap piece of plastic.
Plus, as I was peacefully slumbering, the alarm clock went off at 6 am!  In addition, when we returned after a full day out, the room had not been serviced. Typically in these COVID times, hotels explain their policy on how the room is to be serviced at check in. We weren’t even left clean towels. 
I blame all these problems on the upper management. The individuals working at the front desk, the bellman, and the engineering department did the best they could to honor all requests/complaints in a timely manner. 
This hotel should be advertised as a no frills boutique hotel, because that is what it is. Maybe COVID has caused it to deteriorate? 
If you are paying $500 plus for a room, I highly recommend spend the extra money on The Ludlow, just up the street. This is one hotel I will never stay at again in New York.

title: Gabriel! 10/10
text:
Thank you so much Gabriel for going above and beyond, you made our stay that much better. We loved the Rivington, it was a great place to stay in NYC! The wine hour and the shower was our favorite ;)

-Shay and Anthony

title: Great stay at Hotel On Rivington!
text: Had a great stay at this hotel in the LES. The room was huge, beds were clean and comfy, and even had a celeb sighting! The water pressure was great and the shower had a steamer too. All in all, great location and definitely recommend it if you are there for a quick weekend.

title: Great view + kind staff
text: Hotel on Rivington has a good location in the lower east side. My favorite was Economy Candy - the oldest candy store in the city - right across the street! Our room was spacious and pleasant, and the view was great. Get a higher floor if possible. All staff were very kind and accomodating. The beds were comfortable and the shower had great water pressure!

title: Not worth it
text:
Property is not what I was expecting. The
Lobby and hallways are dark and shabby. The rooms are jaded and in poor condition. Broken windows and cracked tiles. Views are pretty good and location is very good. Staff are indifferent. Very expensive for what you get and not really representative of the website photos

title: Great location and service
text: The impeccable service largely provided by Gabriel truly made my experience. He was a friendly face and always more than willing to help, go above and beyond even. The room was large and staff was friendly. The location of the hotel is prime, in the middle of lots of great food and fun.

title: Event
text: I had an event here at the penthouse and it was amazing. The views were fantastic. Nothing better than a NYC skyline with floor to ceiling windows. Anna was incredible and so helpful. She’s very detail oriented and made sure everything was perfect. I wish I could hire her as my personal event planner for all future events. The guests loved the space as did I. Book your event here, you won’t regret it. And I can’t say enough good things about Anna. She’s really awesome

title: Valentines weekend
text: My boyfriend and I decided to spend Valentines day in New York. We had an amazing time! The location was perfect, walking distance from great restaurants. The ambiance and vibe of the rooms, the bar, the roof top! Highly recommended, especially for a weekend getaway with your love.

title: Excellent Hospitality
text: Excellent hotel with excellent location located on the lower Manhattan,extremely clean & comfortable . Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by Marta (Director of operations) and the friendly reception staff ,Marta  makes our trip more interesting with her advices & tips about the city ,shops,restaurants bars are within walking distance. Would definetely recommend this hotel to everybody! It's a true sample of excellent hospitality. Thank you again Marta for going just that little step extra for the guests!!!

title: Devine
text: I had such an amazing experience. People say New Yorkers are rude but I had the opposite experience here. I appreciated the diversity and the ambiance there. I would definitely stay here again. One thing I love about this place was how fabulous the ambiance felt and the tranquility.

title: I’ll Be Back!
text: When I take the time to write a review, I truly enjoyed my stay. Room was comfortable and amazing! Our Bathroom felt like a spa 🧖 Definitely will be returning another night 👍👍  The staff was Friendly and the place was CLEAN! I’m a foodie and there was plenty around to grab a bite. Nice gym and great view if you take a trip to a higher floor.

title: Location and service is fantastic!
text: Third time staying here, rooms are spacious and beautiful. Staff and service is always great, especially Gabriel who was attentive to our needs. Great local bars and restaurants near by! You won’t be disappointed.

title: Excellent Experience All Around
text: Rooms are stylish and large by NYC standards, and are clean.  Ours had a sweeping territorial view from glass walls on two sides.  The mattress was comfortable and the room had two comfy chairs as well, with a coffee table in the middle.  There is plenty of closet space.  The neighborhood isn't as nice as some, but there are several decent eateries close by, and good access to the MTA.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I look forward to staying at this hotel again.

title: Home away from home
text: My boyfriend and I stayed there a few night late January. We were greeted by Hicham at the entry and our first experience with him was what set our stay expectations. He was personable and friendly. He offered suggestions on parking since we drove into the city. The end of our week we returned back to Hotel on Rivington specifically because of Hicham. On our last few nights we had an emergency and Hicham did everything he could to make us feel at home. Thank you so much for the hospitality!

title: Amazing Hospitality
text:
I visited the hotel recently for a "Spring Cleaning" event that was hosted by the Lovely Anna Strindberg. 
The hotel was very clean and well organized, the staff was super friendly and welcoming and the event was so much fun bringing together local artists and a lovely hospitality team.

title: One the rare hotels that’s part of tourist bus stop !
text: Our stay was very comfortable, location is perfect and views were great. What was a sweet surprise for us is that this is one of the stops for hop-on hop-off bus , with Economy candy store across street and LES full of energy and culture we couldn’t be happier !  Will stay again !

title: I enjoyed my stay here!
text:
I travelled to NYC to visit my friend. I  did a lot of research for hotels and finally chose this place because of its great location where you can easily find robust places for fun things to do and great food to eat. 
I am also very impressed by the amazing staff as well as the cozy and clean environment. Moreover, the stunning night view from my room! OMG! 
Highly recommended!

title: Cozy & Comfy As Always
text: I was remodeling my kitchen so needed somewhere to crash for a few days. Chose the Hotel on Rivington because of the convenient location and more importantly, the good experience my parents had there when they last visited. And they didn’t disappoint- nice and clean room, great view at night and super friendly staff. Rate was also good probably because of the omicron situation. But the way the rooms are cleaned and disinfected gave me the comfort- saw it once since I worked from the hotel room during the day. But they don’t do it everyday to minimize contact which is not a problem for me. Will definitely go back!

title: Much better ways to spend your money
text: Staycation for a 30th birthday. We paid extra for an executive suite room but were downgraded to a poorer room (apparently the website does not reflect the types of rooms you will get due to some ongoing changes). The hotel is hardly staffed, lacking in amenities, and is not particularly clean. Despite the poor room situation, we were unable to get the late checkout we needed. The view is in fact nice as are the windows but there is far better value for money in NYC hotels. Would advise going elsewhere unless paying <$150.

title: Dirty room / bad service / broken elevator / pathetic breakfast
text:
I normally don’t post reviews, but I feel like I need to warn future travellers/businessmen about this hotel. It was my worst stay ever. 

Don’t go to this hotel if you want to feel clean. The hotel is really dirty. They advertise the amazing views you’ll have from your room which is true but they forget to mention that you cannot enjoy them well cause the window is super dirty. On top of that the window had a couple of spots with a sticky dirty substance on it. The bathroom is horrible and very dirty. It has all kind of dirty spots on the floor, next to the toilet and in the shower. We wanted to have some wine to celebrate New Year’s Eve but the two glasses that were in the room were dirty so we could not have our wine. There is a painting on the wall which seems to have blood drops on it and it is disgusting. 

As soon as I discovered that the room was dirty I informed the receptionist and asked if housekeeping could stop by and clean the room. He responded that they were already gone for the day (it was only 5:45 PM at that time). The room could thus not be cleaned. He said that I could go to another room if I wanted and I went with a staf member to see the room. This room was dirty too so I insisted that someone could come and clean my room. The staf member consequently went down with me to see the issues so I showed him all the dirty spots I discovered until then. He did not dispute the fact that it was dirty, even took pictures and then responded that he will ask housekeeping to clean more thoroughly next time. So basically he said: “I know that the room is dirty, but although you pay almost $800 for one night you should just be happy with and we’ll try to pay attention to it in the future.”  

On top of that one of the elevators got stuck during our stay (with people in it on New Years’ Eve) and the other one was shut down by fireman which made us use the stairs to go up 18 floors. 

If you would like to have a nice breakfast in the morning, definitely don’t go to this hotel! Our stay included breakfast and the breakfast they offered was very disappointing and just a joke. It was a brown box with a muffin, an apple and a yoghurt.  This was just ridiculous. 

I travel frequently and stayed in numerous hotels, but this was my worst stay ever. Once we got home we showered for almost 30 minutes, washed all our clothes because we felt very dirty. This is supposed to be a 4  star hotel, but really is not. We paid $800 for this awful hotel and are very shocked about our stay. 

P.S: we added some photos to show you wat we mean, but some of the dirt was very difficult to capture on photo like for instance the glasses and the window.

title: A great stay
text:
We stayed as a familly with kids in a double room for 5 days. We were very kindly relocated to a upper floor with a great skyline view the day after our arrival. Rooms are pretty huge for Nyc and comfortable. Hotel team was warm and welcoming. Neighbourhood is really authentic and vibrant. 
So even with minor desagrements due to covid 19 ( basic complimentary breakfast and housekeeping on request) we strongly recommend  and hope to come back !

title: Not 4 star hotel!
text:
Staff was nice, but the hotel was no where close to a 4 star. A 2-3 stars at best. They really got some good photographs but the rooms were a big disappointment in reality and looked nothing like the pictures. 

The lobby was tiny and dated. Rooms were tired with old carpet and depressing black bathrooms. Breakfast was refrigerated packages of presealed food. Overall not what I was expecting at all. The only saving grace were the staff which is why it earned 2 stars at all.

title: Will Definitely Be Back! Friendly Staff, Spacious Rooms, Great Location & Price!
text: Everything about this hotel is first rate. We were greeted at the door by a super friendly and continually helpful staff. Cute room, industrial, fun modern details and great views of lower Manhattan. The shower was AWESOME. Nice bath products. A free wine event soon after arrival and breakfast the next morning (which we were too hungover to check out, lol,  but it was available). Felt pampered. Plus, the location was perfect for excellent restaurants and great shows in LES. Very quiet accommodations and the bed was super comfortable. Fantastic value for the price. Will definitely be back! :)

title: Hotel on Rivington, SO Special!
text:
The Hotel on Rivington is a NYC treasure. Our visit at the Rivington exceeded every expectation. We were assisted from the moment we arrived in front of the hotel. Each person we interacted with made it a special overnight stay. There’s a parking garage immediately around the corner. The neighborhood is unique and wonderful to explore. Directly across the street is “Economy Candy” (an institution since 1937).  The “Tenement Museum”, RockWood Music Hall, Russ and Daughters, Katz’s Deli, numerous unique shops are all a short walk away.

The Hotel on Rivington rooms are spacious, sparkling clean, bathrobes feel delicious. Entire staff is attentive and professional. This hotel is a 5 star at a bargain price. We booked directly with the hotel instead of an app and got a discount.

We fortunately were able to purchase tickets to see Rachael (Price) & Vilary at Rockwood Music Hall (opening act was also phenomenal; still trying to get more info about them). We made the trip into an overnight stay. So glad we did!

title: Attelier Rooms have great views but Hotel restauarant / bar not yet open
text:
The Atelier rooms have wonderful views of Southern Manhattan and good beds.  Generally well equipped!  The heat at 78F as set by the Hotel and the Chambermaid was too hot most of the time so we turned it off and opened the balcony door to get temp close to normal.  Each time we returned from an excursion the Chambermaid had reset it to 78 / heat and closed the doors.

The restaurant and bar and other facilities were still closed so we experienced the neighborhood which is great (breakfast next door at the Dominican Rep restaurant) but the hotel really should re-open to provide a full service experience.  Thus the 4 star rating.

title: Living in its glory days
text: Cool little hotel. In a lively neighborhood. It’s rated at a 4 star hotel and let me say it’s definitely not. Location could be but be aware that what was advertised is not what you’ll be getting.
