I booked an executive king room which only states on their site that you’ll have a separate living room to the bedroom and was given a way different room. I had to ask for a change. I’d recommend staying somewhere else. The hotel room was okay. During my 2 nights there I didn’t even get my room cleaned or fresh towels once. My reservation was for 5 nights. I ended up leaving early and moved to the “Standard” hotel in Lower east village. Also management at rivington loves to take your money even if you stay was not what you expected. This place is out dated and would recommend you stay elsewhere

title: Отличный отель на Манхэттене
text: Отличный отель на Манхэттене  с огромными окнами в пол. Мы его забронировали по рекомендации друзей и полностью довольны отдыхом. Из номера вид на небоскрёбы и основные достопримечательности, до которых можно быстро дойти. Рядом есть метро. Удобная кровать и достаточно просторный для Нью Йорка номер. В нашем номере был хороший вайфай. Очень красивый рассвет если встать пораньше :)

title: Amazing city escape
text: I really enjoyed staying in this hotel over the weekend. Staff have been super nice and the rooms were clean. Cityscape around the window is absolutely special. The hotel is stylish and recently reopened after renovation highlight is the breakfast  . Thank you, Hotel on Rivington !

title: Amazing stay and hospitality. Would totally recommend it!
text: Extremely comfortable and pleasant stay at the hotel! The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Great location with restaurants and bars nearby. Would totally recommend this hotel for a stay!!

title: Spacious Room with Breathtaking View!
text:
My parents were visiting from Shanghai and I’m so glad I chose the Hotel on Rivington for them! The location is super convenient with tons of good restaurants nearby. More importantly, the room is very spacious, way above the “Manhattan average”, which  was the one thing that worried me the most because I know they are spoiled by the big room size of Asian hotels. A cherry on the top is the view from the balcony especially at night. My mom literally wanted to cancel the reservation I made for dinner and just order takeouts and eat there lol. 

The only shame is the rooftop is not open to the public yet (they do private events only at the moment) but the staff was so nice and gave us a tour- man that was a view to die for!!! He told me they might open the rooftop in a few weeks and I will definitely come back just for that!!!

title: Right in the middle of bustling nigh life !
text: Since the city opened up again Lower east side night life is by far the best  I have experienced in nyc.  I have stayed in midtown and downtown recently but the crowd and nightlife in LES is happening. Hotel is located perfectly with access to all nearby bars and  restaurants and there are plenty of options for food , drinks in this particular neighborhood.  The hotel stay was comfortable and price was average for a night in city , not cheap but reasonable given the ease and connectivity. They had some renovation happening but they were very mindful of convenience of guests. Rooms were spacious. We would happily stay again.

title: This place is the worst!! Total misrepresentation
text: Dont stay here!!!! I can not this stress enough! We booked this hotel because on their website they advertised that they had a restaurant and a rooftop bar with mini bar amenities. They had NONE of these things they advertised. No rooftop bar, the staff said it was a space for private functions only, no restaurant, no mini bar. the lobby had a horrible over perfumed smell. something they were clearly trying to cover up. Mini bar? no drinks at all in the fridge. The actual room itself  smelt stale with furniture out of walmart. i cant believe that they have the audacity to charge $400 per night for this. We checked out straight away and they said that my money would be returned. They took $1088 from my bank account for 2 nights. Haven't seen the money yet. It completely ruined out weekend in NYC. This hotel is dodgy AF. This Hotel should not be open whilst they are transitioning from an apartment block to hotel. Total money grab. Do not believe the robot reviews on this hotel. its all lies!!!

title: Excellent hotel and hospitality!
text: We have been staying here for 3 days and it was such an amazing experience! Very romantic! Thank you for great welcome, friendly and hospitable staff! Location is the best and room is very spacious with comfortable bed and unique bathtub. Many good restaurants nearby and we enjoyed the view from the balcony. I wish to come back.

title: Stylish and comfortable
text: If you like your neighborhood cool , local shopping and food options in nyc and you like comfortable beds and thread counts high this is the place to go ! It’s sleek and stylish yet comfortable. Located in best block of lower east side. Hotel staff was great friendly and helpful. It was definitely worth staying here. Views from the room were awesome ! We even had a terrace attached to the room which was a nice surprise would highly recommend.

title: Our new favorite , pleasant stay!
text: Very comfortable and clean hotel, with nice modern touches. Can’t beat the connectivity subway , cabs , buses all available from the corner. The staff was wonderful and welcoming and the location is one of our favorites in the city for great local food and shopping. Downtown was a 10 min walk , Williamsburg bridge is walkable and newly opened Essex market complex is in same block. Great nightlife around. Will no doubt be staying here again!

title: New gem in Lower East Side !
text: A gem in lower east side !! ‪Hotel was steps away from the Delancey Street subway station. Our room was a corner room with amazing view of Freedom Tower and very spacious for NYC hotels. They just reopened and I was amongst the very first few customers.  Rivington street is one of the best locations of lower east side , multiple restaurants and bars nearby and Essex market is a block. It was a very pleasant stay , staff was warm and super helpful. I highly recommend  and would definitely stay again.‬

title: Class and style on LES
text: Hotel met all my expectations. Lack of cofee maker offset by free coffee in the morning at cafe'. Only issue is lack of privacy in bathroom. Room spacious and excellent house keeping. Some receptionists outstanding, some not so

title: Amazing View
text: Our room had a view of the One World Tower and midtown that includes Empire State. It was a corner room and the sunrise and sunset during our stay and seeing the city lights up during night time is amazing!

title: Super nice stay at Lower East side.
text: The corner room at 14th level was excellent. The view was magnificent, looking out of Manhattan, from the windows from the roof to the floor. The bed was big and super cosy. Breakfast was not included in the price but could be eaten in a restaurant at the street level. It was good but very expensive.

title: Great place to stay in the Lower East Side
text: We found this gem of a place in the Lower East Side just steps away from the Delancey Street subway station. Our room was on a lower floor, and fairly spacious for NYC. The Cafe Medi restaurant was very charming and reasonably priced for breakfast. The minibar was fully stocked in the room but there was no kettle to make tea or coffee. Besides that, we found the Hotel on Rivington a very nice place and would stay here again.

title: Beautifil Rooms Great Location
text: Walking in I was unsure, but then the employees were amazing, and the rooms were beautiful! We lucked out and got a corner room. Towards the end of our stay, we had an issue with the balcony door not closing. So they changed our room to a "Deluxe King" (..but worse view). The heater is very strong and I didn't sleep well, but I can't really complain since my partner wanted the heater blasting. Rooms were clean, and large compared to other New York hotels. The gym was horribly small, but there is a nice local gym around the corner that doesn't charge a crazy amount to go. The complimentary breakfast is actually huge portions and a great spot next door.   I would definitely go back!

title: Spacious Rooms in a great location
text: Love this hotel on the Lower East Side.  Corner studio rooms are very spacious with great views from the bedroom and even from the glass shower stall to the city.  The location to bars and restaurants is perfect and easy to get around to anywhere else in the city

title: Great location needs updating
text:
We stayed one night (date night). We like the room ("Unique" with expansive shower). Unfortunately, the featured part, the shower, was not usable. 1 control was only hot water. The other 2 did not even rotate properly. There was also a slight smell of cigarette smoke that permeated, furniture wear and tear, chipping paint, etc.

Going to try the Ludlow next time we decide to stay in LES.

title: Perfect for a Country Mouse
text: We rarely stay in the big city, but decided to break out of our comfort zone and hang with the hipsters.  The aesthetic was a complete 180 from ours, with black hallways, toilets, and a very 'Cousin It' Pouf lurking in the corner of the room, but we embraced everything (except the poof---we steered clear of that)!  It was a very cool experience for these lowlanders.  We would definitely return.

title: Vols et mensonges à 4 étoilés.
text:
Emplacement correct, quartier discutable, chambre propre mais hotel loin d'un vrai standard 4*. Pas de vue, pas d'accès aux étages, photos mensongères sur le site (deception), personnel plus ou moins distant, service au restaurant ne correspondant pas à un 4*. 
Dernier jour, nous avons été volé de 2 paires de baskets neuves de mes filles dans la chambre, qui ont été par hasard retrouvées qq jours plus tard (une fois avoir quitté l'hotel) et qu'il a fallu renvoyer et payer à l'hôtel par FEDEX pour les recevoir en France sans compter payer les frais de douanes.

title: Not what I expected!
text:
I love hotels and will always stay in 4/5 star when I travel, so this experience is not one I ever expected.
The heating was very loud and woke me up often throughout the night.
The top window for in the shower under the shower head wasn't frosted so it wasn't private as the neighbours could see in, I did say this to reception, he didn't seem to care.
The lighting in the room is terrible and it was difficult to see anything properly when it was dark especially when I needed to get dressed up to go out - So I had to do make up at the venue;
I dropped a lid and went to get it and under the vanity and bed as it was all dusty and gross.
The finishes around the hotel are all careless and done without care, even the light fixtures were terrible.
It kind of felt like it was a hotel by the hour.
There is no physical information about what the hotel facilities have, I found out about the gym because of the lift button not because someone shared the information.
When I had my laundry done reception said they had their own, information which was not shared upon arrival.
They really didn't care that I was leaving or how my stay was when I checked out.
I was ready to change hotels as soon as I got there as it smells like a toilet in the lobby and street floors also and was generally not friendly when I checked in. 
Although I don't like leaving such bad reviews, I feel like this review would be helpful.
I probably won't stay again or recommend it.

title: Meh.
text: Stayed here Feb 2020. High floor King room w/ tub. Room is so outdated... I’m honestly not sure why they charge so much for what it is. The room itself felt like a mediocre hotel, I couldn’t even get the balcony door open. Tub was the only nice part. Tv was hard to figure out. This is 2020 let’s get it together here hahah.

title: False Advertising
text:
Without a doubt the worst hotel experience I've had.
Had booked a stay at the beginning of 2020 with my girlfriend. Was very excited because the pictures and reviews made this place look great and it seemed like a really solid deal for the price.
Pulled up out front to unload our luggage and were greeted by the bellhop. Gave my card on file and my drivers license to my girl so she could check in while I parked the car. When I returned, I found her looking frustrated on a bench in the lobby. Even with my cards and license they wouldn't let her check in and were quite rude to her about it. We brushed it off and went up to our room.
I had upgraded our room to a corner suite and was very excited because the pictures looked amazing. We were immediately disappointed. Very awkward decor... strange giant pictures and cheap uncomfortable furniture in a frustratingly dim room. Looked closer and found incredibly shoddy contractor work (paint mishaps, bad caulk jobs, loose screws, outlets that come out of the wall when you remove whatever you plugged in to it).
The cherry on top was when we opened the closet and found a variety of sex toys and a menu for any additional toys or lubes we may want. Not knocking that stuff in general... but man is it bold to just leave that stuff in a closet without having the guest maybe elect to have it when booking the room.
Also found an open bottle of lotion tucked in to our bed... so.... guessing they didn't change the sheets after someone enjoyed that lotion... in bed....
I went to the desk, complained of our issues with the room and explained how nothing in the hotel (down to the lack of an advertised game room on the website) was as it was portrayed on the website. The gentleman at the desk informed me that the hotel "changed owners a couple years ago so a lot of those pictures are out of date/inaccurate". He said they won't give me a refund, but offered to let me change rooms. They called someone to show me another room, but it was just a smaller version of what we had for the same price so we stuck it out.

title: Will Def stop by again
text: Amazing friendly staff. EVERYTHING is walking distance and I mean everything! when in town visit Beauty and Essex restaurant a must try! Definitely will be returning. I am so sad we didn't get the name of the friendly gentleman at the door but he deserves lots of credit for making our trip great!

title: Rooms and service
text:
I asked during my whole stay 7 nights to change my room to a higher level and my request was not taken serious.
During 5 nights out of 7 nights the hotel was not full at all! so changing the room should have been no problem.
The staff promised to make an effort, call, leave a message, send a mail but non of all that was delivered. I couldn't leave since we paid the whole bill and no cancellation was possible.
The rooms are not at all like in the pictures shown at the booking site

title: Excellent service!
text: Absolute remarkable service and team! Especially Christian is a great guy, he helped me with some questions. The other great thing is the cookies they leave in your room at night such an attention to detail.

title: The view is breathtaking!
text:
We stayed on the 19th floor and we just could not get enough of that view! The location was ideal! Everything we had planned was less the 10 mins away! 

If you valet however, make sure it is VERY what the rate is because we were quoted 2 different rates and billed a completely different one. BUT they did correct it, just glad we checked our account prior to leaving.

title: Good place,people,and location.
text: Great friendly service at front desk , entire staff were excellent in accommodating my requests for ice and toothpaste, also the restaurant is pretty good with healthy dining options. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend for the easy access to public transportation.

title: New Year's Eve
text:
A group of friends and I went to the New Year's Eve party hosted at the penthouse of the Hotel on Rivington.  Let's just say that the experience was the worst we had ever had in the city.  They were entirely unprepared for people to come; we had purchased a table and upon arrival (at 11pm) were told that they were at capacity and that we would need to wait for people to exit before we could go in. After much arguing with the doormen and a manager (we had paid well over $3k already) they let us up, but it took three elevator trips to get up because their capacity is so low.  It was clear that our table was not ready, so they threw together two tables and told us to wait there.  It took 30 minutes for any alcohol to get to the table, which was accompanied by a dirty plastic bowl of ice, plastic cups, and a bottle of cranberry juice (in the plastic bottle).  We had better luck getting drinks from the bar than with our table service (which had no waitress or attendant).  The table was located right next to the only bathroom in the entire place.  This event had hundreds of people, and one single occupancy bathroom.  What a terrible job of planning.  No event like this should ever have occurred in such a location.  
Management is clearly inept and you should not expect to receive any help in the event of such a disastrous night if you were staying at this hotel.

title: AMAZING HOTEL
text: We stayed here for the second half of our stay in New York, over new years. I had thought our first hotel was great but once we checked in and walked in the hotel room my jaw dropped. We were on the 14th floor and our room was really big esp for a hotel room in New York, not to mention the stunning view! Although what really put the icing on the cake was the bathtub, we could literally lay side by side! We really enjoyed the room and were happy to chill out and relax there after a full on week walking around NYC. The location was also perfect!

title: Excellent value hotel in lively location
text: We loved this hotel which was in a lively location with lots of cool bars, restaurants and cafes close by. The room was really big and impeccably clean and the staff were all lovely and very helpful. There is a restaurant on the ground floor with free tea and coffee for guests in the morning. The subway is also very near by.

title: No hot water
text: No hot water the first day . I told the front desk. Had to run the shower for 10 minutes the second day before I had water warm enough to shower in. Not good. I had stayed here before and had high hopes. The location is great and the room is hip, but this was a deal breaker. Also, we were on 6th floor and the street noise made a good nights sleep hard. Stay on a high floor if you come - maybe that’s where the hot water is.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Our room was large and bright with a nice view (also applies to the bathroom) and the mattress was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and  breakfast was very good in terms of choice and quality. it is definitely highly recommended. def

title: Great stay in a great hotel
text: Friendly, helpful staff. Great location. Rooms a little dark but everything else was great. Room service quick and easy to order and food was lovely. Cookie delivery each evening about 8pm which was the nicest touch!

title: Disappointing
text:
Overall:
A bit dated but corner room was an ok size with decent views.

Specifics:
Most room service orders were incorrect. On checkout day one of only two lifts wasn't working (with no sign). It took us 15 mins to get to the street and 15 mins to get back to the room. This essentially meant we had to apply for and pay 75 for a late checkout. When we mentioned the lift issue on checkout it was met with indifference.
When we did checkout they said they couldn't itemize our bill (every charge showed zero) as we booked through a third party, which I've never experienced before. Apparently we would receive a properly itemized bill shortly after by email, which never happened.

When we contacted them about this, we received another copy of a bill with zero against everything.

After multiple emails we finally got a breakdown of the bill but nothing acknowledging any of our feedback.

title: Excellent
text:
Grande  chambre avec double douche et simple vasque. Toulette non separees.
 lit très agréable. Belle vue. Manque peut-être une bouilloire pour se faire un café soi-même en profitant du décalage horaire.....

title: good location,good price,good room.
text: lower east side - very good location for feeling the real newyork city.close to all the special places in the city. price is fair and rooms are with great view . best room that you can get at mid range prices.

title: Well located hotel outside of the melee with outstanding staff, great views and lovely rooms
text: Hotle on Rivington on the lower East side is in a bustling but quiet area. It has great links for the subway and taxis are easy to flag down. Walking time to lower Manhattan is about 20 minutes. The rooms are clean with great views and everyone at the hotel is friendly and efficient.

title: downtown art
text: no security layr at night, front doors should require a key, the hallways had cleaaning fluid odor the beds and views from the south rooms are wonderful, easy to park down by the 7th precinct 4 blocks away  great stores nearby.  no Marque in front only has name on front entry carpet

title: Alright, but nothing to return to
text:
Room type: High-floor King with Soaking Tub and Balcony
Length of stay: 5 nights

What we liked:
- Great room size, large windows, bright (south/east-facing), all lights dimable.
- Bright Wooden/faux-wooden floors instead of carpeting.
- Soaking tub was awesome. Nice touch with candles.
- Shower was great. Lots of space and high water pressure.
- Great quality (but a bit small) towels. Lots of towels provided. Great bathrobes. Also high-quality linen.
- Good selection of TV channels (when the TV worked - see below)
- Nice to have a balcony (albeit not a very cozy one)
- Huge selection in the mini bar (also a downside - see below)
- Good Wifi
- Parcel delivery was smooth and without issues
- Location is brilliant, on LES right between Delancey and E. Houston

What we didn't like:
- For a "High floor" room, we ended up on lowest possible floor (9 / 20) - no view really. Reception staff were not able to accommodate a move, despite asking three times over two days.
- Reception staff ranged from completely disinterested and borderline rude to decent/alright, no one would go out of their way for anything. Most seemed to consider their an income and nothing more, with zero passion for hospitality. Several times, the same person asked me "checking in?" in the same day.
- There were sex accessories, lots of 375 ml booze bottles in the minibar, a stainless steel coffee table and a fur throw in the room. Tacky and a bit of a ... dated approach. Place for hookers and parties?
- Quite a lot of noise from water pipes, wind gusting and the climate control. I'm not a light sleeper by any means, but woke up several times. Had to use earplugs some nights, which I've done a total of two times in my life until then.
- There's a weird feel to the hotel. Walking in, you take 10 steps and go straight into the starting-to-fall-apart-red-leather-covered elevators. As the reception desk is one floor up, there' no real lobby on ground level to hang out in. Most public areas had a smell of cheap/heavy perfume. There's no ambiance. Doormen had "uniforms" making them look like they were guarding a drug nest. (But they were all very friendly, so nothing bad on them)
- TV didn't work for 2 days, turned out to be a major issue for at least the whole floor.
- Bathroom door handle fell off
- No slippers in the room (but provided when inquired about)
- Slow or no replies to e-mails prior to arrival
 - A shopping bag in our room was likely thrown away by housekeeping. Only had postcards in it (but for a $30 value) Reception staff said they would look into it. Never heard a word again. Never offered anything to compensate for it (two cocktails on the house would have been enough)
- There's no service elevator, so when there's an event on the second floor, you can expect loads of tables and chairs in the elevator.
- Flushing the toilet was pretty weird, required you to bend down and hold the handle for like 5-7 seconds. Paper would frequently not flush the first time. Sometimes water wouldn't refill.

All in all: Not too bad, but certainly nothing we will recommend to friends and family, nor will we return. A shame, as the property could really be turned into something very cool and nice. Would rate 3,5 but as I can't do that, it's more of a 3 than a 4.

title: Room falling apart
text:
We were assigned to be on the 6th floor. We didn't have to wait for the 1600 check in time and was immediately given a room. $100 deposit/night was also charged.
The room we were in had seen better days. Street noise can be heard all hours of the night.The electrical panel door had a 4 inch gap and the door was askew. The curtain had not been washed since? It's dusty. The closet light was busted as well. Water pressure is on the low side, amenities are basic. On the positive note:
Bed was at least comfy
WIFI signal was strong
Spacious room for NYC standard

For the price they charge per night I would expect better quality .Didn't like the all black bathroom  theme, gave the feeling of it being not clean. There was also control timer for a what used to be sauna but is no longer functional.
Would not stay again.

title: holidays
text:
I spent wonderful days with my family. very spacious double room. comfortable beds. 
quiet room without carpet perfect for my allergic child . breakfast not included, expensive a la carte it is better to define a fixed price. underground  very close.

title: Trendy modern hotel with a super vibe and great staff!
text:
The hotel is really modern and has a great vibe.
You feel like your staying in a super Airbnb and not a hotel. 
The reception staff are amazing.
A big shout out to Danielle and Serenity who were fantastic and Christian who was also a great help.
I also liked the location which was quieter than expected and the hotel is surrounded by great cheap eat locations!
Really great stay.
Thank you.

title: Great room size in NYC for group
text: Our view was fantastic and the employees were very friendly and helpful.  My friends and i loved the room and found it very spacious and comfortable for a group. All of the closets allowed us to put our belongings out of the way.  Having the seating area was great.  The lighting in the bathroom was terrible and there was no ventilation by fan or window.  That would be something I would warn any friends I tell about the hotel. It was difficult to see putting on makeup or contact lenses. The black bathroom, while it may have been trendy at one time, appears dated and off putting.  The interior of the hotel is decorated in a dark, mostly black style so some might not like that. There were no vending machines in the hotel which might have been nice and no access to ice without calling for service.

title: Great stay and location.
text: Arriving at night, the hotel entrance is a little hard to spot.  But, once we got out of the car the doorman was easy to spot as he welcomed us in.  The hotel floors are small, with only 4 rooms on our floor, meaning it was very quiet and calm.  Everything was clean.  The cookies provided by room service was a nice touch, but I ate way too many.

title: Excellent Part of NY to Stay
text: Our room was a good size for NY, it was very clean and the nighttime turn down was also a good touch. The room had a view over the city, the gym was good. Had breakfast at the cafe downstairs and it was really nice. Can’t wait to come back and stay again.

title: Yolanda
text: This hotel was amazing i am definitely going to return . Everything was clean and the staff were very nice. The only thing i didnt like was the elevator that got stuck here and there. Other than that i will recommend  this place to everyone.

title: fantastic view, wonderful staff, excellent location
text: I stayed here for just a few days in November 2019 and thoroughly enjoyed my stay, the room was lovely, the view was fantastic, all staff that I'd interacted with were friendly and helpful, the location is excellent PLUS they bring you cookies in the evening...what's not to love!  Thank you so much!

title: Excellent customer service and awesome location
text: Check in and out was smooth.  Danielle at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant. We loved our suite, the view was excellent and the room was clean.  Breakfast was delicious at the cafe. Very happy and will be coming back soon.

title: Hidden Gem
text: Was suggested through a colleague to try Hotel Rivington and it did not disappoint. Simple and scaled back room décor with big windows for tons of natural light. Convenient location. Great minibar!! Pleasant staff. Always someone at the door to open and assist.

title: Extraordinary View
text: We were awestruck at the view from our room on the 19th floor. Our corner room featured windows on two entire walls as well as a small balcony. The service was excellent -- front-desk staff, housekeeping and concierge were all friendly and accommodating. The hotel considerately provides a list of nearby restaurants. We enjoyed our visit very much an likely will stay here when we return to NYC.

title: Never again
text: I stayed here for business and didn't select the hotel myself. I didn't have hot water for a shower the entire stay--first I was told by the staff there was no problem, then the problem was acknowledged, engineers were summoned but it was never resolved. The water just got colder and colder. Hair dryers didn't work. Outlets were few and often didn't work. Design and ambiance is great though.

title: Bday
text: Cute boutique hotel. The room was spacious (double double) and clean. Great location to everything (restaurants, bars, shops, and subway. Would stay again. Door men were all great. Wished there was storage for my clothes

title: Je recommande cet hôtel
text:
Nous rentrons de New York pour un séjour de quatre jours en famille
L’hôtel est bien située et à proximité d’une bouche de métro
Les chambres sont joliment décoré confortable, la literie est extraordinaire et la vue au 10e étage est superbe!
L’accueil du personnel est top et on n’y mange très bien au café medi 
Nous reviendrons

title: my very bad recent stay at hotel on rivington
text:
I had issues right after my arrival, I spoke to the reception, and they asked me to send an email to the manager, I sent it 3 times, no reply! 
Here's the text of the email sent to the manager, that explains everything.

My name is Patrizio Baldereschi, and I booked the hotel on Rivington for 12 nights.
I arrived last night as planned ( oct 26th ), I was tired, it was late, I had dinner and I went straight to bed.
Unfortunately ( for me) I woke up many times during the night, because of the noises, all night long.
At 5 am, I got up and it was raining inside the room, through the windows!!!!!!!! It kept for hours.
I went down to the lobby to tell them, and they offered me the room I’m in right now, 193. 
The problem is, the wardrobe is half of the previews room, and since I have to stay here for another 11 nights, I can’t handle that.
I really hope you get me a better solution out of this.
Tomorrow morning I’ll have to leave for work at 9am, I really hope once I get back, there´s a better option.

title: Bummer
text: Front desk staff had no idea.  I was told I would have a high floor room, the showers have floor to ceiling windows and are easily seen from outside.  This turned out to be false. Booked with a free daily cocktail deal, front desk said that was not possible.  Waited 1.5 hours, had to call twice, for a working hair dryer.  Finally had to take a $20- cab to a blow out bar and pay $100- to have my hair dried.  Missed a meeting as a result.

title: Some good some not so good.
text:
This hotel is pretty good overall. Nice room - corner view. Street noise is a little invasive. Floor to Ceiling windows are nice. Décor is ridiculously dark like the designer was teenage goth. Bed very comfortable.
I enjoyed my stay. 
My only serious complaint is the Gym, it's very small, the equipment (machines) very old and not in good working order, the layout is terrible as if there is more that 1 person in the gym you are tripping over each other and there is no where to use a mat.

title: A Great Place to Stay
text: The hotel staff were very friendly and seemed to do whatever they could to make our stay enjoyable.  The location of the hotel for visiting the downtown sites, 9/11 memorial, Staten island, Ellis island,. etc. is very convenient.

title: Nice view!!
text:
ニューヨーク一人旅。マンハッタンにあるホテルの中では、かなり広い部屋だと思います！おかげで快適に過ごせました！
眺めもよく、部屋もきれいで安心して過ごせました。ただ、シャワールーム丸見えではなく、曇りガラスにしていただきたいなぁと思います。
次に利用するとしたら、お洒落なロビーやカフェも、利用してみたいですね。
近くにデュアンリードや、ホールフーズもあり、お洒落なお店も多くて飽きません。立地もgood です！
帰りのタクシーをコンシェルジュで予約できたら尚よし。

title: Major Decline
text:
I've stayed at the Rivington at least 50 nights over the past 10 years. It started out as a place that was a bit of a scene but the size of the rooms and decent service made up for it. 

The last time I was there was 4 years ago. I decided to drop in (I started staying in midtown) and give it a go and...what a disappointment. The condition of the hotel is deteriorating. They've got the same artwork/carpets from a decade ago. Looks and feels really dated. Flakes of paint and leather in the elevator peeling off. 

But the rooms are still a nice size so I figured I'd stick it out. In my 10 night stay here's what occurred in the first three days...Bathroom door handle falls off. Ok. No biggie. Closet door nearly comes off. Two of the four hinges are busted. Ok. Then the electrical outlet by the bed (next to their pad of paper) blows up and sparks fly out of the outlet and over the nightstand. No joke. I call down to get all these things fixed. Someone comes up and 'takes care of it.' Next day the closet door is off again and the outlet blows up. Again. But this time when it happened my iPhone was plugged in and charging. Charger stops working. iPhone is acting funky since. 

I relay all this to the front desk and am told that it will definitely be rectified and that the manager will be contacting me directly to take care of things. One day passes. Two days. I check in with the front desk and I'm told, "Oh, strange, he's aware of it I'm surprised he hasn't contacted you. I'll def let him know." Five days go by and I finally check out and nothing. 

This place is ramshackle. From the service (Aside from the bellmen. Nice guys) to the upkeep. BUT...if you're looking for a good sized room by nyc standards and you don't care about a possible fire hazard or handles and doors falling off...this is the place.

title: Overpriced for just a View
text: Cracked window glass in multiple spots of room, moldy silicone in shower, damaged closet doors, faulty shower mixing valve, Water damage, false advertising or rooftop bar/nightlife. Found out from staff that it was shutdown by staff same day it opened. Overpriced stay for just a skyline view of the surrounding area

title: awesome
text: This is a great hotel, rooms were so nice, beautiful views.  clean and staff was great.  The restaurant was a little pricey but very good.  Bar closed early though so do not count on a late nightcap there.

title: Great staff comfy room
text:
I ended up getting an accessible room as an “upgrade”. I really liked the accessible roll in shower and the extra space. The shower didn’t look like it was accessible. It had beautiful black tile and look chic. The only telltale sign the room was accessible was the taller toilet and the bars. 
Our view was of a roof. If I had paid for a fancier room, I would’ve gotten a better view but what I enjoyed was I didn’t hear noise from the street! Our bed was so comfortable as were the pillows. Lighting wasn’t the best but sufficient for our needs. I enjoyed the turndown service and the cookies that were left.
I found the service to be friendly and helpful. When I needed a kettle one was sent up right away and the doormen were all so cheerful!

title: Tolles Hotel
text: kleines aber feines Hotel mitten in NYC. Unser Zimmer war für New York schon fast riesig und uns hat vor allem die Aussicht aus der Dusche sehr gut gefallen. Das gesamte Personal ist äusserst freundlich und zuvorkommend

title: Great stay in great location
text: Spacious room and great area to stay in. Lovely bedlinen and great bathroom! We wanted to stay in an area of NYC that was close to great shops / restaurants and close to the subway. The Hotel on Rivington met all our requirements.

title: Below Par - Customer Service
text: I recently made a reservation for a unique suite I called to get information as it is a special weekend, the associate I spoke with was condescending & smug. I also sent an email as a follow-up and no response. Customer Service has declined over the years (I’ve been here previously). Will be canceling upcoming reservation!! This review is for customer service... did not even get a chance to arrive and already the service was below par.

title: Great bed
text: The beds were great! They were the most comfortable we slept in while in NYC, and we slept in 5 different beds. The shower pressure was amazing! The lights in the bathroom were horrible, very dark. The location was really good. It was noisy if the windows were open but when closed it was very quite. The room was a good size and very comfortable.

title: Really friendly hotel with one of the best view in Manhattan
text: The strength of the hotel is absolutely the view you can have from the room. The location is "strategic"; very close to SoHo, you can reach easily any area of Manhattan. Personnel are really kind and do the best to make you feel confort.

title: Terrible service - total disgrace.
text:
Just stayed here last week. 
Staff were terrible, rude and unhelpful. 
A respectable elderly man had a bad fall on the sidewalk outside hotel doorstep as I was arriving and no one helped. I had to beg for ice for the man’s head injury’s and bar staff were useless. Doorman (Edwin) stood and watched and did nothing. I asked him for help and he simply ignored me. Did not even help me with my luggage as I struggled to pick the man up. Appalling. 
When I asked why he did not help he said, “This is New York” 

Went to front desk for help. Useless. 

Room smelled of food from kitchen
No full length mirror 
Terrible lighting in room, especially bathroom. 
No shaving/make up mirror
Very loud : it’s a nightclub with rooms. 
Continental breakfast is a total joke. 
Waited 15 minutes for a soggy croissant in a paper bag. 

Shocking.   I checked out because of how appalled I was from the incident. This may be New York but show some compassion and treat everyone as equal. 

Never again!!!!! And your hotel room and service was second rate at best.

title: thank you On Rivington
text:
thank you for this amazing room, the vibe of the hotel was great. 

Location is just perfect, a few minutes away from the melting pot of nyc, great restaurants around.

comfortable beds, nice and friendly staff.

title: A little pricey but beautiful view on 15th floor
text: After a little trouble at check in (booked the wrong dates) I was presently surprised by the size and light in the room! The hotel could defiantly be cleaner for the price. But overall it was a nice stay and we will be back as we love the views! Would also like to say thanks to cody at the front desk for upgrading us and thanks to the woman at reservations for fixing our reservation for us!

title: Beautiful property!
text: Beautiful hotel, all of the rooms were bright and airy! Views were spectacular! The staff are accommodating and professional at all times! The little “extras” are what will keep me coming back! Fresh cookies left in your room during turn down service, amenities available, and cafe medi has the best food!  The on property bar has fun drinks, the bartender was amazing! The rose margarita was exquisite!

title: Put my mom up here
text: Put my mom up here For two nights on a stop in nyc. She loved the room, it’s design, the bed and bedding. Nightly turn back service and cookies were a treat, as was the proximity to great restaurants and my own apartment.i was surprised that the hotel seems Less upscale in the entrance (dark, a bit tired), but the room itself was perfect. The restaurant was minimally open (not open the nights we were there). This meant we had to go out which was a good thing since there are so many excellent places in the area, like good thanks for breakfast and coffee, dudleys and Rosie’s for dinner, Davelle for coffee, and the Essex market.

title: A little pricey for the quality
text: It's a great hotel with friendly staff, but certain details and amenities left me feeling like I'd like to pay less for the quality. The street facing room was very loud, water temperature inconsistent, and service/fixes didn't come through.

title: Hidden Jewel
text:
Hidden in Plain site- A jewel of a place. There is no sign on the place that is is a hotel. And other than 
Doorman, you would not know walking in, you would think it was a second entrance to Cafe next door (attached). Entry (street) level very unimpressive. However, move upstairs and everything within the rooms, lobby (2nd floor), Conference rooms were very modern, clean, elegant even. Nice oversized bath shower! Can hear some noise from street, but I've found that common everywhere we have stayed in Manhattan.  Stay 10th floor and above to quite street noise.

title: Hotel on rivington ,a unique experience that captivates a view and your heart just like the city itself! Loved it!!
text: It was a get away couple trip for us!  I loved the floor to ceiling windows, the sunrises and sunsets were amazing from that view!  I found some binoculars in the in room bar!  The bed was amazing! The toliet needed a couple extra flushes each time it was used, maybe cause we were so high up, I dont know it still worked and did its job! From the hotel we easily walked to China Town, Little Italy and Soho. The subway was right around the corner!  The doorman and all the staff was so friendly, helpful and just made you feel at home   We stayed 6 nights!  The balcony was a little.different and high up so I didnt go.on it except to take pictures but you can see everything from inside the room to!   The room is a  great setup for taking pictures.  When your from a tiny town in the wide open desert, NY was a whole new world , but it was wonderful and highly recommended.  Where the hotel was it wasn't but a 20 or so min travel time to just about anywhere in the city!  Great location, beautiful place, wonderful people, gorgeous views , highly recommend!

title: Nice view and nice staff
text: The hotel on rivington was a great choice for my wife and I, the rooms were beautiful and the staff was helpful! From our room we could see the freedom tower and downtown manhattan. Bathroom could use some work but other then that we had a great stay! special shout out to Cody and Danielle at the front desk!

title: 4 days on the Lower East Side
text: The Hotel on Rivington has great staff, that are both friendly and most helpful. Location is great with many bars, restaurants, smaller shops and the metro around the corner. The Deluxe King room was nice, however with a few flaws.

title: I loved it all!
text: I found the hotel on Rivington excelente. I loved the room size and the bathroom, the great location and the very friendly service. I also loved the restaurant Café Medi for the delicious dishes and special service.

title: Great boutique hotel, very vell located in Essex.
text: Great little hotel in the Essex area. This was my first trip to NY and I'm sorry I didn't allow more time to explore the neighborhood. It's a gritty little place full of young people. The hotel corridors and elevators were a little dark but the modern floor to ceiling windows with wrap around curtains made the room bright and exciting. Be sure to book above 7-8 floor so you get a view. One block from the subway. Centrally located from downtown, uptown and Brooklyn. Great staff, clean rooms, cheerful and helpful doormen. Cookies every night with the turndown!

title: Chambres spacieuses, Hotel très bien situé
text: Notre choix s'était porté sur cet Hôtel du fait de sa localisation (Lower east side) aux abords de Chinatown, Soho et Nolita. Un très bon rapport qualité prix, des chambres spacieuses, une literie très confortable (important après de longues journées de marche). Nous avions tout le confort souhaité. accès au métro (Delancey street) trés proche.

title: Honeymoon visit
text: Could be perfect with a little TLC. We had a room on floor 14 which offered a great view. The room was very big considering it was New York.  Unloved the uniqueness of the bathroom had 2 showers one with an open view of Manhattan and 1 with frosted glass. Didn't have much dealing with the staff but when we did they were perfectly pleasant. Loved the area, easy tonget everywhere and loads of bars in the immediate area with much lower prices than other parts of Manhattan.  The minor details stop it being 5/5 , lots of marks on walls etc. We had what looked looked dried blood on the dressing gowns. I paid £120 per night which I thought was great value. I'd definately stay again

title: A great stay, real New York experience
text: Hotel on a Rivington is perfectly located in the Lower East Side giving you great access to New York City either on foot or via the subway. The LES is a real neighbourhood with a relaxed cool vibe and plenty of places to eat drink and shop. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful and our room was cleaned everyday to a high standard. It was great to come back on an evening to a turned down bed and cookies! We will definitely be returning next time we visit NYC.

title: Lovely hotel in LES
text:
Thanks for a great stay, we had a room over looking Brooklyn Bridge and Midtown Manhattan.

The room was very spacious and a good size.

The cleaners do a very good job of keeping the room clean and tidy.

The location of the hotel is fantastic, based in the heart of the lower east side.

I will definitely return again!

title: Dissapointing hotel
text: The pictures of the rooms and the hotel are deceptive on the website.  In fact the property is dated and in need of renovation.  The rooms are falling apart (tiles coming off walls in the bathroom, loose door handles etc) and miss basic facilities such as iron/ironing board and a kettle (although has a well stocked mini bar)  the staff (other than the door men) are not friendly or particularly helpful.  the constant groaning and creaking of the air-conditioning makes sleeping difficult and the 7am start of the cleaner (whose cupboard was opposite by bedroom door) adds to the difficult).  I would not recommend a stay here.

title: Room 62, 9/15-9/20
text:
Excellent room service! Loved the location. Door men were helpful. Loved afternoon turndown of beds. Loved cookies. Shower water not hot enough. 
I don't like this 200 word minimum. This is in itself is a big negative. Change this requirement!

title: Lovely stay at Hotel on Rivington
text: Rooms had all the amenities that are typical of a high end hotel. Friendly staff and service was excellent. I would definitely stay here again! The surrounding areas had a lot of good restaurants and an easy walk to most sites on Lower East side.

title: wedding in new york
text: I did not like this hotel at all  the lighting was poor  bathroom to small no counter space and the shower exposed you to the public with a clear glass wall in it. No luggage rack no iron . Not enough services very expensive even with the group rate for the wedding.

title: review
text: The service was friendly and fun. The location was great.  Views were amazing and fun.  The hotel was funky with black walls and a red rug.   Sleep was great, bed comfy. The curtains and other furniture in the room could use updating.

title: Great place in NYC
text: Great rooms and super view facing North (they also have facing south rooms). The beds are very comfortable and the staff is very kind and always helpfull. My room was upgraded to a unique suite on 18th floor. Overall, it's a great hotel, nicely located.

title: Don’t Use the valet and stay away
text:
Spent two nights in this place and used the valet parking service.
Big mistake. They charged 150. Per night!
The room was just ok and had several maintenance issues,namely, the bathroom door dragged on the floor making a loud noise when opening. Also the bathroom door knob fell off and the toilet ran. I should have inquired about the parking but I’ve been in the city many times and never had that issue. Definitely a money grab. No coffee maker in the room. Stay away.

title: Great Room at 17 floor!
text: Highly recommended for the suite at 17 fl.  Amazing view and very spacious room.  Room service quick and with good choice and quality. Very good option for ny. Guys at the lobby very kind and nice. We will come back for sure.

title: 2 Night stopover
text: Great couple of days in NYC. Perfect location with plenty of bars, restaurants and speakeasy around the corner. I recommend the room with balcony overlooking Manhattan. The room was spacious (rare in NYC) and in perfect condition. We will definitely come back for our next visit in April.

title: Great hotel, beautiful rooms, awesome location
text: We’re from New York & live on the Upper West Side, but decided to stay at this hotel because of a family wedding in DUMBO.  The staff is so kind & hospitable, the rooms are beautiful, clean, & spacious with incredible views of the city (we were on the 18th floor in a corner room), & the hotel is in a fun, classic New York neighborhood with a ton of character - right in the midst of cool bars, good restaurants, boutique shops, & street art.  It also doesn’t hurt that it’s two doors down from a cheap and delicious Dominican restaurant that’s been a decades-long neighborhood staple (the batida milkshakes are the best and they serve American breakfast there, too!), and across the street from the iconic Economy Candy from 1937 that sells retro candies, $5 records, antiques, & vintage toys & trading cards (so much nostalgia)!  Highly recommend staying here if you want a beautiful hotel & an authentic New York experience!

title: Inte värt pengarna
text: Oförskämd och inte till mötesgående personal. Sunkigt och slitet inredning. Väldigt mycket ljud från gatan nedanför. Det enda som var någorlunda bra var sängarna. Kunde jag gett 0 av 10 hade jag gjort det.  Jag rekommenderar ingen till att bo här när ni skall till NY.

title: Fantastiskt läge
text: Jättefint och trevligt hotell i underbara Lower Eastside. Bodde i en hörnlägenhet på 14:e våningen med fönster från golv till tak med en fantastisk utsikt över staden. Väldigt skön säng och rymligt fräscht rum. Balkong. Fantastiskt välfylld minibar med utrymme för egna inköp. Älskade närområdet med sina låga hus. Många matställen runt hörnet och nära till mysiga Williamsburg och allt downtown. Rekommenderas.

title: Great friendly hotel
text: We have stayed in a few hotels in NYC and the size of our room was fabulous. We had no view to speak about but can not fault this friendly hotel. Free coffee and tea in the lobby in the mornings a bonus.

title: Nice hotel if you want to stay in LES
text: This was not my first stay at Hotel on Rivington, but I had about the same experience as I usually do. Traveling for work, the things that matter to me the most are a good gym, comfortable bed, and working mechanics. I was pleasantly surprised by the nice 180 degree view of the city and a spacious room. I soon found out my shower was broken, so I had to deal with that hassle late at night and the following morning. The bed was comfortable, and I'll always welcome free evening cookies. The gym was pretty abysmal -- probably the smallest, smelliest, and most outdated gym of all NYC hotels I've stayed in. I feel like every time I stay here, I criticize the gym and when I return, nothing has changed. It's a shame because if they just made that update, I would stay here much more than 1-2x a year!

title: Perfektes Hotel in NY
text: Wir hatten die King Studio Suite im 11. Stockwerk, für New Yorker Verhältnisse ein riiiiiesen Zimmer! Perfekte Aussicht über die Stadt - so wacht man wirklich gerne auf! Die Jungs am Eingang waren mega nett und haben unserem Sohn sogar extra Geschenke zum Abschied gekauft als wir abgereist sind - unglaublich! Bei der nächsten Reise nach NY auf jeden Fall wieder Hotel on Rivington!!!!

title: Ok
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel con la mia famiglia e ci siamo trovati benissimo. Stanza al decimo piano molto spaziosa con letti comodissimi ( materassi tempur e lenzuola frette!), unica nota dolente il bagno nero poco illuminato.
Al nostro rientro ci facevano trovare dei biscotti sul comodino, pensiero molto apprezzato!
Metro vicinissima!
Ci ritornerei!

title: I do not recommend
text:
many problems in our stay with Bathroom , light room and air conditions.
At the end, they charged me extra fee without my consent.  
the reception staff was not friendly and responsible in solving the problems.

title: Great views great party nite life great staff
text: We had a amazing room with a balcony that looked at Williamsburg bridge that was beautiful. The oversized tub was very nice addition except we couldn’t use at first due to only hot water coming out.  The staff tried to fix but engineer wasn’t on site at the time. They ended up giving us 2 huge buckets of ice which was just what I needed to cool down the large bathtub with worked great. The staff also gave us a 2nd room to shower in which was very nice dual head shower

title: Tolles Hotel für NYC
text:
Das beste Hotel, das ich bislang in NY hatte.
Aus dem 10. Stock hatten wir einen tollen Blick auf den One World Tower.
Einziger Kritikpunkt ist das schwarze Bad, das alles Licht verschluckt. Die Matzatzen waren uns etwas zu weich, aber noch o.k.

title: Special Hotel, Well priced rooms. Great location, Helpful, Friendly Staff
text: Very tall modern building with fantastic views.  The rooms are spacious, clean and will=maintained.  There is a restaurant attached but I never ate there because of previous appointments.  The Staff was super friendly and informative.  Great area for walking, so many things to see right near the Hotel.

title: Bellissimo Hotel nel Lower East Side
text: Bellissimo hotel con camere con vista dello skyline newyorkese. A due passi dalla metro Delancey st. Zona ben fornita da locali. A 5 min a piedi è possibile raggiungere sia little italy che chinatown. Unica pecca il bagno essendo tutto nero e con poche luce non era molto pratico.

title: Still Delivers Location, Value and Friendliness
text: Hotels come and go in NYC but the Rivington remains committed to the LES. Staff is great and the rooms are clean and well appointed. Maintenance may have slipped a little a few years ago, but they’re back on it and the place is not showing its age. Bedding is lux and the turndown cookies are a treat!

title: Brutto e vecchiotto Hotel
text:
Abbiamo prenotato tramite Hotels.com, dalle foto ci sembrava un bell'Hotel, ma abbiamo trovato un hotel vecchio, trasandato, nel bagno della camera mancano delle mattonelline del mosaico a terra, tutti i rivestimenti di colore nero, anche la vasca, ed è poco illuminato sembra il bagno di un film del terrore.
si sono staccate delle mattonelle dal pavimento lungo l'armadio e non sono state rimesse. 
Il vetro della finestra è rotto, incredibile.
nell'ascensore più della metà del pavimento è spaccato.
La camera è piccolina, avevamo anche chiesto un piano alto e non ci hanno accontentato. 
LASCIATE PERDERE QUESTO HOTEL!!

title: Best Hotel in the Lower East Side
text: Hotel on Rivington has become my wife and my NYC retreat. Fantastic staff, and amazing rooms. The steam showers and soaking tubs in the higher end rooms are highly recommended. Also is in a great location.

title: Great Lower Manhattan Hotel
text: This hotel is located two blocks from where I had daily meetings, so it was an ideal location for me.  The onsite dining was convenient and lucky me, there is a sushi restaurant right next door!  My room was quite spacious and very quiet, making for a comfortable stay.

title: Hotel sopravvalutato di una stella
text: Ho scelto l’hotel per il quartiere ( amo il lower east side) ma onestamente date le recensioni lette e le 4 stelle mi aspettavo qualcosa di meglio. Il fatto che non abbia una reception all’ingresso ma al secondo piano per chi come me la utilizza solo al check in o al check out non è stato un problema ma può risultare scomodo. Il letto era l’unica cosa davvero comoda sia per dimensione che per materasso e cuscini. La stanza era poco illuminata ( pochi faretti ed in bagno la luce era quasi assente e soffusa) Il wc non scaricava bene e la pressione della doccia era pochissima.. dopo una giornata a scarpinare questa era davvero la cosa peggiore! Inoltre mancava un comodino di fianco al letto.. ce n’era uno dall’altra parte ma dal mio lato no e la sera dovevo caricare il telefono poggiandolo a terra. Personale cordiale ma non il servizio di un 4 stelle.. su un 3 stelle avrei dato altra valutazione!

title: Average
text: This property is decent. The doormen aren't too swell. But overall its ok, the front desk is excellent and the food is good. Id say its just ok. Its over priced as far as im concerned.  We paid like 3 something a night.. room wasnt worth more than 250 tops.. and if you wanted to park its 150 a night.. kinda offensive pricing.. lol! Anyways the beds are comfy, staffs nice.. Just way over priced. Id probably have stayed somewhere else, but short notice and wanted a balcony so this worked out. I didnt hate it.. I just didnt love it. AVERAGE..

title: Beautiful rooms
text: A little expensive but very nice. I stayed in a corner suite with soaking bathtub. It’s the nicest hotel In my opinion in the area. Also, we had a balcony. Saw a couple of celebrities in the elevator attending a party

title: Hotel mit toller Aussicht
text:
Es gibt hier genug positive Bewertungen, zu Recht. Ich schließe mich da an, insbesondere wegen des Top-Services, der Freundlichkeit des Personals, der Sauberkeit und der tollen Aussicht Dank der hohen Fenster, selbst in der Dusche. Ich hatte zu keiner Zeit Angst vor Zuschauern, denn dazu ist man im 15. Stock (wo wir schliefen) viel zu weit oben, außerdem sind die Scheiben von außen eh verspiegelt. Ja, die Minibar ist überladen und teuer, muss man aber nicht nutzen. Das Raumlicht ist bei Dunkelheit tatsächlich ein Problem, wir stellten die Stehlampe ans Bett. Das Zimmer war schön groß.
Im direkten Umfeld des Hotels selbst ist es nicht so schön, wie ich persönlich finde. Da gibt es schönere Ecken in Manhattan. Aber dafür kann das Hotel ja nichts. Subway-Station ist direkt um die Ecke, ebenso eine moderne Markthalle mit tollem Essen. Die Lage des Hotels bewerte ich nicht, hier kommt es nämlich darauf an, was man in Manhattan anstellen will. Vom Central Park ist es sicher weit weg, dafür liegt es dicht am WTC oder Battery Park. Alles in Allem ein schöner Aufenthalt.

title: Gem in the Lower East Side
text: Clean hotel with cool art vibe and great restaurant (Cafe Medi) in Lower East Side. They elevator only requires scanning a room key AFTER 11pm - so anyone can walk in off street and gain access to any floor, bypassing the front desk as they're tucked away on the 2nd floor. I point this out as I had a complete stranger mistakenly banging on my door at one point. Hallways are dark and moody and the doors to rooms don't have any peep holes, preventing you from seeing who is actually knocking on your door! Otherwise, my stay was sufficient.

title: Frequent visitor to New York
text:
Cool and modern hotel. Great location for bars and eateries. Super comfy beds and powerful showers. 
Well located for subway for trains uptown. Breakfast at the cafe downstairs was excellent. Staff were friendly and helpful

title: Exceptional hotel
text: Spacious rooms with comfortable beds. Stylish hotel in a great location on the lower East Side. Across the street from the famous Economy Candy Store. Walking distance to Bowery, Chinatown, Soho and Little Italy. Lower East side is a trendy area with lots of restaurants, bars and cafes. Just round the corner is Katz Delicatessen.

title: A GREAT HOTEL FOR A GREAT PLACE
text: Excellent Hôtel. Très bien placé à 200 m du metro. Très propre. Superbe chambre et literie parfaite. Vue magnifique depuis le 10ème étage. Avons été *upgradé* à notre arrivée. Restaurant Le Medi avec très bonne carte et très bonne cuisine.

title: Ottimo
text: Albergo carino e onesto assolutamente economico rispetto allo standard newyorkese, ho alloggiato in questo albergo con la famiglia in una stanza per 4 persone decisamente grande ..unica pecca il bagno ..tutto nero 😂😂

title: Good
text: at the hotel we immediately found ourselves well;  welcoming and helpful staff.  the room was clean and comfortable.  excellent proximity to the subway and with a great market.  the only problem was not being able to use the balcony as it was damaged.

title: Two night stay at Hotel on Rivington from Sydney
text: Beautiful hotel, staff at front desk could be a bit more attentive on check-in considering they didn't even ask where I had come from.  Location great for subway, great restaurants close by and extremely good coffee at Ludlow Coffee around the corner - which is a huge plus for an Aussie

title: Average hotel
text: Will not return even though the area is nice. The restaurant need to hire people with better service skills. Hotel is fine but dont show pictures of rooftop if guests cannot use it. Rooms are fine but we will not return

title: Summer holiday in New York for Iron Maiden, Freedom Tower and Liberty Island.
text: I had my room at 8th floor. Very nice views from my window including Freedom Tower. Room was spacious, flat screen tv, air conditioning, mini bar and cleaning every day. Bed was very comfy. There was sofa also in the room which was nice.Bathroom was clean and filled my needs. There was also gym which I used couple times. Basic one but good for me. Door men and the people in reception were polite and helpful. The hotel had a restaurant but I did not use their services.I can easily recommend this hotel to everyone and if I someday travel to New York again this is the first hotel for me to look for a room. Area was good with lots of restaurants and bars near by and Delancey st metro around the corner. Also Essex Market near by where I visited many times to enjoy Davidovich bakery to have a cup of coffee and their delicious cinnamon bagel. I visited New York to see Iron Maiden at the Barclays Center, Freedom Tower and Liberty Island.

title: Great view and location.
text: We stayed in a Corner King Suite. The room was large with a balcony and the view was breathtaking! Located in the heart of the Lower East Side, Hotel on Rivington provides easy access to the hippest neighbourhoods in Manhattan.

title: Excellent Hotel in Lower East side of Manhattan
text:
Excellent hotel. Awesome rooms and views above the 8th floor.  Beds and soaking tubs were incredible.  Staff was very friendly.!  Cafe Medi is a great restaurant and lounge. We loved our bartender Dorian! World class customer service!
Close to Williamsburg Bridge ..we had an event  on the waterfront in Brooklyn  so this was only 2 miles away. Highly recommend!

title: Nice hotel for a trip to New York.
text: Hotel is close to Chinatown, Soho and Little Italy. A metro station is around the corner. Downtown Manhattan is at walking distance. The people from the hotel are very friendly. We had a room with a bad view on the third floor. Higher in the building the view will be better, I guess.

title: I’ll definitely come back!
text: The rooms are great, the Café down the street is really sweet and beautiful.Definitely come back next time.The location was perfect. Especially for people that like to go out and have a drink at a bar. The service was awesome. They let us stay even though I wasn’t 21 which made my time in NYC only better.

title: Excellent !!
text: Can’t go wrong. Location and rooms are perfect. Would recommend staying here to avoid the tourist hub bustle of midtown. Easy to access Brooklyn via subway or walk across the bridge. Staff are super helpful. We were in a deluxe king room and it was amazing, especially the steam shower room with the deep soaking tub.

title: Okay ok place
text: The beds are very comfortable. Poor lighting needs updating. Employees were the best!! Very helpful and will assist with your needs. Turned down cookie is nice too. The Cafe is convenient and has good food!

title: View to remember! Service top notch!
text: Stayed in the king corner suite and it had the best views of the Lower East side and the Downtown. Staff upgraded us after we had a tiny problem with our room (maintenance), balcony was awesome and good for relaxing and having a smoke.

title: Perfectly met our needs
text: Nice room with modern decor nice seating area. COMFORTABLE bed was perfect after our long exhausting days. , Good location, traveled with my daughter and always felt safe. There was close by eateries and it was close to subway. Bonus was a nice steam shower in our room.

title: A marmite hotel you love it or hate it
text: On arrival, hard to spot hotel,the cafe medi is the tell tale sign.Once inside the lobby is on the second floor, it's very black and red with some interesting art work, which makes the hotel very dark & gloomy.Our room was on the 16th floor and we had amazing views of the New York skyline.The beds were very comfy and the room was clean, bathroom once again very dark, lighting not good for us girls when putting on the face! We had air -con which was very welcome and cookies were in the room daily.No tea/coffee ,used to pop to the shop on the corner for coffee.The rooms could do with a freshen up,as looking a bit tired.The staff were lovely and friendly and helpful, couldn't fault them. On a personal note and also being first time in New York it was a little far out for our liking, area is very much like the East End of London and about the same distance to travel into.There is a subway which is a 5 minute walk from hotel and you can be in the centre in around 20 minutes.All in all not a bad place at all.If you want the views book a room higher than the eight floor.

title: Beautiful, spacious room!
text: We loved our modern, spacious room and its beautiful view.  The hotel creatively reflects the spirit of the neighborhood.  The wall of windows provides a fantastic view and lots of light.  We'll definitely be back!

title: Great value and location
text: Great little spot LES.  In the heart of the village.  Near metro and action. Rooms big for NYC standards.  Clean and welcoming.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was good value and easy to enjoy in the pretty cafe.

title: Best Stay!
text: Well decor in room, sinking tub was beautiful, skyline view was a sight to see!  Staff very nice, room service impeccable.  Liked idea of balcony, stayed on one of the higher floors, nice to sit outside.

title: AMAZING!
text:
Really Everyone.  Me & my wife celebrated our anniversary and her bday!  Starting with Ashley(AMAZING), everything and everyone was so amazing....Christian, Danielle, Cody, Lester....if I forgot anyone, them as well.  Everything was [perfect for us and we will be coming back again.   Thanks to All!

A special thank you to our Beautiful Lovely Svetlana @ Cafe Medi.....Muahhh!

title: Arghhhhhh
text:
I've been coming to this hotel for 11 years with my partner we thought we would try somewhere else for the majority of the stay in nyc and thought we’d come back for our last two nights ! After checking in there was no welcome back nothing we kinda thought that was a bit off ! No welcome in the room ( we have usually had a note some fruit or some wine) the rooms are great big spacious and clean the bathrooms are great ( I’ve never had an issue with the rooms) they have always been amazing ( but they need an update) been saying that for the last five years ! First night we were left some cookies with the turn down service (second night nothing) so no consistency 
Basically overall it’s a nice hotel great location the guys in the door are always lovely and welcome you home but it’s just a bit tired they have told us numerous times it’s being done up and nothing ever happens !

title: Perfect Night
text: We were looking for a place to view the fireworks without having to walk amongst the millions... the view was amazing, balcony was a great addition, and the staff was so helpful making our night amazing.

title: Wendy in New York
text: Don't miss "The Grey Dog" on Mulberry, amazing food and service, breakfast, lunch or dinner! The Little Cupcake Shop on Prince Street, amazing strawberry muffins. Serafina Italian, just on the corner outside the hotel is fabulous. Remember the F subway goes all of the way uptown no need to change onto the 6 and buy a week metrocard, they are very good value for money and you can hop on and off as often as you like.  Gym in hotel a bit small, but does the job if there are only a few of you. Most disappointed about the room. Rooms are not sound proofed and streets outside can get very noisy. Location was good.

title: Very Nice But Underwhelming
text: I had stayed here several times previously and always enjoyed the facilities and the location.  This trip was for a birthday weekend and I booked an Deluxe room expecting a room with a soaking tub.  While the room was still very nice, I was informed by reception that not all Deluxe rooms have such a tub.  If I had known, I would have just booked the regular room, which is still very nice.  I  probably should have pushed to switch but I typically don't like to make an issue out of such things, especially since I don't go to NYC to spend too much time in the room.  That being said I chose to let it go.  I would still go back and highly recommend this hotel but this trip was definitely underwhelming and would give this particular stay 3.5 stars instead of the usual 4.5.

title: Excellent hotel. Higly recommended.
text: The King corner room with balcony was amazing. Love the neighborhood. I just wish hotel guests have access to the rooftop. Cafe Medi was closed on 7/6 so we didn't get to try it. We did attend the 4th of July event at the penthouse and we had a blast!

title: nice boutique hotel on lower east side
text:
I stayed at the hotel on Rivington during quick stop in NYC for one night - check in was smooth - Christian at the front desk was great - (and a Sox fan, but I won't tell anyone!)
Room was clean, spacious enough and bed was super comfy.  Close walking distance to the event I attended at the Metrograph theater.  Ample parking at a city garage right around the corner for $57/night which I thought was very reasonable.  Overall, a great stay.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: This hotel exceeded our expectations in all ways. We would highly recommend the hotel and the area it is located in. The room had spectacular views and as we booked through Expedia it was fantastic value for money.

title: Quick trip
text: Had randomly found this hotel on a previous trip to NYC six months prior. Loved it and knew I wanted to stay on my return trips. It did not disappoint! I look forward to my next trip to I can stay here again!

title: Breathtaking!
text: I don’t really have anything negative to say about this hotel! I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels in NYC and this one by far has been the best one! Parking was also very close by (almost on site) and was reasonably priced! The views are breathtaking and I would definitely stay here again.

title: false advertisement
text: if your going to post photos make sure they are of current rooms not just your suite. Your property definitely needs major updates. I will never stay at your property again or recommend it. The Ludlow and Sixty LES are 100 times better!!!!!!!!

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text:
Excellent location, really amazing views, friendly staff.
Beautifully designed rooms, especially the corner ones on the higher floors.
My favorite hotel when I'm in NYC, so definitely staying there again.

title: Clean, comfy, good location
text: Great place to stay. For some reason the bar wasn’t open on the day I stayed which was a bit of a bummer. Only complaint about the rooms which isn’t a huge one is that the bathroom was dark and the shower pressure was so high, the curtain kept blowing in on me

title: Nice room Great Service
text: This was a business trip that was booked by the company.  I was provided with great service, and nicely decorated clean room. Walking distance to Beauty and Essex, Mr. Purple and other great venues.  I recommend!

title: A very nice room in a busy neighbourhood
text:
The entrance and the desk are dark and disappointing, but a pleasant person will open you the door on ground floor and guide you to another  pleasant one at the desk on second floor. The dining room under the skylight is very attractive, but do not take your breakfast there. It is terrible.
The rooms are very clear and clean, and the large bathroom, with a large tube and shower is perfect.

title: Nice place
text: We stayed here for 6 nights.  The room itself was a decent size (double room).  We were in room 36 which is on Rivington Street but because it was a lower floor, we found the street noise quite loud.  It would have been nice to have tea making facilities in the room to have with the cookies that were waiting for us in the room every evening after a hard days touristing!  It also would have been nice to have a hotel brochure/information in the room itself.  The only thing in it was a menu for Cafe Medi and a menu for room service.  The hotel is literally just around the corner from a subway stop which was great.  If I was going again I would probably pay the bit extra for a higher floor as the view was disappointing.  The bed was very comfortable.  The shower pressure was ok but it never got very hot.  The wifi signal was at its best just inside the bathroom door!

title: This one’s a keeper!
text:
If you find yourself traveling to NY a lot and need a place you want to keeping coming back to... this is it. The friendly staff will take care of you like you’re good friends. And the rooms are great too. 
We had the room with a balcony and king bed. Great views, comfortable bed.
Great location also!

title: Top Floor Rooms Are Amazing; Location Accessible Everywhere
text: Booked a room at the Rivington as I was to attend a wedding for my friend there. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and accommodating, even though they couldn't allow me early check-in. The rooms at the top floors are amazing with great views of the city. Try to get a corner room if you can as the corners offers amazing views on two sides. The bathroom has an extremely deep soaking tub. The event floors upstairs offer amazing views. Overall a comfortable amazing stay, well worth the money spent.

title: Ok
text:
We were part of a group who chose to stay here. The hotel from the street has no markings so we literally drove right past it. It has a very small and dark entrance with the lobby on the 2nd floor. It advertises that rooms have a great view of the city. Unless you stay on one of the higher floors the views are of rundown rooftops or alleys. We were on the 8th and had no view. The room itself was roomy and nice. The bathroom had a window but was still quite dark with no counter space. 
There are other hotels in the area that have a more welcoming lobby and are more appealing. Overall this hotel has a very dark decor. We had brunch which was good.

title: Privacy issues in the clear glass shower and bathroom area
text: Shower water never got hot. Bathroom faucet water pressure was very high resulting in water splashing out of the sink and everywhere the first time we turned it on. Drapes would not completely round (close) the corner so in the morning the rising sun hit the bed and woke us up. Ridiculous “frosted” glass in the shower and toilet allow neighboring onlookers to see right into the shower and toilet area. This was a huge privacy issue for my wife. Other guests also complained about it. I’ve never seen anything like it.  Roof dwellers on an adjacent building rooftop we’re drinking and observing me shower before I noticed them. I ended up showering in the dark to give onlookers less of an opportunity to see anything. My wife refused to shower during the day without me holding up a towel to provide privacy. I just don’t get it. Extremely poor design and poor customer service not advising us of the lack of privacy in a shower and toilet. Crazy.

title: Great stay
text: Upper floor rooms are inviting, sunny and beautiful with great views of the neighborhood and city. Lower floor rooms not so much—dark and a bit depressing—but fine if all you’ll be doing is sleeping and spending no time in the room.

title: fitness room :(
text:
everything was fine except fitness room which was small and machines were old.
there was no spa/pool/wellness.
bathroom was in black color. the lightening of the bathroom was not good enough.
each room has umbrella in the cupboard which saved me during rainy days in NY.

title: Good hotel, great location
text:
Good hotel, great location
choose carefully your room because some are better than others, on the street lower floor are noisy. the rooms are nicely designed in a modern style. but some better than others.
I like the area very much. and the subway station is near

title: Great experience - will definitely return
text: Great room for a special occasion. The design aspects, particularly in the bathrooms, were really impressive. I'd come back just to get a chance to use the bathtub - looked more like a small lap pool!

title: WARM, COMFORTABLE, AWESOME STAY!
text: I've lugged my suitcase here before so let me start by saying *this was a repeat visit*. Why repeat? This hotel is my NYC FAV for so many reasons. Imma keep it brief. The staff. The included beautiful breakfast. The warm bedtime cookies. The doorman. The view from the floor to ceiling glass walls. The location for Lower East Side (and SOHO and east village and subway and public market) excursions.

title: Net neutral
text:
Pros: night view from corner 14th floor room beautiful, nice large shower, comfy bed, good room size
Cons: upgraded for a balcony that was a fire escape with no stairs (see photo). You could not safely get to the chair on the other side of the table. Insufficient and inconveniently located outlets - none by desk! Each of the four days of our stay our air conditioning shut down and we returned to an 80plus degree room. Engineer quick to respond but problem persisted. The fourth day we restarted it ourselves . I know the staff has received raves but honestly we found them able to respond to a question or request but if we did not ask about something (like location of free coffee in morning) we were not offered any information.

title: Awesome place to stay in NY
text: Exceptionally comfortable beds, with a spacious and usable layout. Very friendly staff. Sensational location. Tremendously convenient, with a great New York vibe. Positioned just around the corner from the subway, with Bluebottle Coffee Shop and Morgentern's finest Ice Cream all minutes away. What more could you ask for!

title: Great views, strange decor
