text: This hotel is in a great location. The staff is friendly and accommodating.  Very cool views too!  However, if you are shy, you may want to ask for a room that has a shower without windows.  (Not sure if they exist here.)  One must embrace the exhibitionist in oneself to take a shower as the window is not frosted or covered in any way!

title: Luxurious boutique hotel with a stunning view!
text: Lovely boutique hotel located in vibrant East Village - lots of shops, bars and restaurants around. If your budget allows for it you got to book a room on level 11+ ... the view over Manhattan is amazing. Really love this Hotel!!!

title: An hotel to recommend
text: Strategic location, Subway near, Citibike near, Personnel very very nice and ready to resolve every kind of problems. Even ice for the leg of my partner, even indication of a iphone doctor near and very efficient. All working very very well... Internet quick and always well working. Only a little of noise in early sunday morning in the street (drunk people). Next time we'll ask for higher floor... All very good, WHAT ELSE?

title: Tipico Hotel Moderno con Vistas
text:
Actualmente hay una corriente que cuando un hotel es moderno todo vale y yo creo no es así.
Muy bien situado y con un personal agradable, aunque las habitaciones un poco anticuadas.
Nosotros dispusimos una con vistas, aunque la puerta a la mini terraza no funcionaba y quedaba abierta.
El precio no esta mal, quizás un poco caro para la calidad que ofrecen,

title: Hate the Black Bathroom
text: Our room had  black walls, fixtures, floor, counter and one light over the sink.  It was impossible to put on makeup and if an item was dropped on the floor, it was impossible to find.  Some of the bathrooms do have windows which would improve the lighting, but, unfortunately, ours did not.  Otherwise we were very pleased.  The beds were so comfortable and the staff very accommodating.

title: Our Stay at Hotel on Rivington
text: My husband and I visited New York for a family wedding and my sister suggested staying at Hotel on Rivington, as a few other guests would be staying there too. We were pleased with the accommodations and would definitely recommend staying there!

title: Home away from home.
text: I always smile when I get to the hotel because it's like seeing old friends again and for some of the staff it is.  The location is perfect for me.  Not crazy with tourists and an eclectic mix of New York City.  Always unique food and stores.  My only issue is that ownership needs to put money in the the infrastructure of the property.  Electrical and pluming are wearing out and so is some of the decor.  But 2 of the people that keep me coming back are Lester at the front door.  He is quick to take care of things, sincere in his concerns, and a pleasure to talk with.  I don't even mind that he is so much more brilliant than I am.  I feel smarter after I talk to him!  Lisalda is great when I need a reservation and I feel like a movie star when I get to my room.  The best part of the hotel is the staff..

title: Wrong Suite Room Reservation
text: I reserved a "unique room" and paid an additional charge for a  suite which was not as pictured and I was given a basic style room. I am unhappy with this since I paid a lot of money and the additional fee to get something and didn't receive it.

title: Best wedding night hotel!!!
text: We arrived late after our wedding to the hotel and were helped with valet quickly and checked in. Our room was beyond amazing. From the balcony with the view to the Japanese soaking tub, this was the most magnificent hotel and it was perfect for us!!!

title: Ok to good
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights recently. The hotel is ”ok to good”, sort of ”funky style)Nothing is really bad - nice clean room - good cleaning every day. If you stay here, try to get a room higher up than what we got, 6 th floor and a iView straight in to an awful backyard/building -not so funny- there was a balcony, but they had sealed it, so couldnt get out there ( even if it was nothing to see). They have a very nice restaurang in the bottom, we had breakfast there every day - really good. The staff is overall helpful and nice. We thought we could have access to the toproof and maybe we could at times, but it felt like it always was some private partys there and not allowed for hotelguests? That was a minus. 
Fantastic beds by the way, we slept really well. As a tourist from scandinavia i can recomend this hotel. Some minus, but nothing big - so go for it if you are thinking about it.

title: Emplacement idéal
text:
Chambre propre et très agréable, literie confortable, jolie vue. Nous étions au 15eme étage et absolument pas bruyant.
Café de l’hôtel agréable.
Petit dej pris à la carte varié et bon.
Nombreux restaurants et bars à proximité, quartier très sympa!!
Prix chers ms comme partout à N.Y

title: Excellent
text: Spacious room with nice new york views, exellent matress, very good location in lower east side with modern bath with a vew, relaxing atmospheare nice cafe medi with young vibe, aware of relative poor sound proof between rooms

title: The BEST!
text: I’ve been coming to the Hotel on Rivington for years now, it feels like my New York “home away from home” I LOVE EVERYTHING & EVERYONE at this hotel - so professional, friendly, considerate and happy to please ALWAYS A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE! Plus huge rooms by most standards, especially NY and some Deluxe King rooms have a steam shower...a rare, heavenly treat!

title: Beautiful hotel in fun LES location
text: Had a great stay for two nights, was given a corner room with wrap around windows and the room was quite large for NYC.  Picked the location as easy to pop over to Brooklyn and around Manhattan on the F train. The neighborhood has more character and personality than staying in Times Sq or Midtown, much better for getting to LWS, Village, Soho, etc.  Good bars and coffee shops all around. The reason the overall rating is a 4 rather than a 5 was a few problems with temp control and with the shower temp (could both be operator error)

title: Creative Business Travel
text: Great place for creatives to stay if they're in town for business. Our team stayed here for a week and it became a place to meet up, talk shop, and plan before we went to our set for the day. Lot's of great restaurants and bars in the area. Solid pizza shop around the corner. Super clean rooms and friendly staff.

title: Front desk unaccomodating to complaints
text: I booked a two-double bed room and we were given a room on the 3rd floor (Room 33) where the gym is located. The first night, we woke up at 6am to loud banging noises and realized that the gym butts up to our room's wall and the sound was the dropping of the weights on the floor. This persisted all morning. We talked to the front desk and they were not sympathetic at all and explained they don't have a room to switch us to. There was not an ounce of concern or willingness to offer us something in concession (e.g. a noise machine, free breakfast, a bar voucher, SOMETHING). I explained this again when we checked out and the front desk attendant asked us how our stay was and she was actually apologetic and was surprised to hear that we spoke to someone about this issue. The room was also showing some wear and tear with cracked tile on the floor, scuffed/banged up cabinets, and uneven floor tile in the bathroom. Our bathroom door also did not shut. The positives: the turn down service is nice, very nice cookies was a suprise. Also, the two double bed room was very large for NYC standards.

title: Sleek and sexy in the Lower East Side
text: I'm an artist and I love being in the city - this hotel just checks off so many things - from the cleanliness to the amazing tub options they offer. The service is always impeccable and if there are any issues they are so fast and thoughtful to remedy them. The beds are absolutely comfortable!

title: Fabulous stay
text: Amazing fun weekend. Nice area. Lots to do. Hotel was immaculate. Staff was friendly and accommodating. We had two beautiful rooms stocked with everything we needed.  Cafe Medi brunch was fabulous!  Can’t wait to to stay again soon! Loved our stay!

title: Confort / style / situation
text:
Superbe situation au cœur du Lower East Side à Manhattan. Les rues sont vivantes, les bars et restau variés. la station de métro est proche. East Village, Little Italy, Chinatown et Soho sont accessibles à pieds. 
L’hôtel est très confortable, très propres et le Café Medi en bas super pratique. 
Les chambres sont assez grandes et les plus haut étages disposent d’une vue incroyable.

title: nice place-nice neighborhood
text: Nice hotel.  A bit overpriced.  Fun neighborhood.  Skip the hotel bar...nothing special.  Lots of food and drink options nearby.  Beautiful event space.  Bigger rooms for an NYC hotel.  Needs more outlets in rooms.  Would stay here again.

title: awesome
text: enjoyed my stay cant wait to book again the room was amazing the view excellent food delicious cant wait to stay there again i enjoyed the stay so much it exceeded my expectations 10000% percent loved it

title: Cool & Energetic Hotel
text: Went here for one day and i wished i had stayed longer, really nice and polite staff, it was a very fun place to be, hotel restaurant is top notch service is great friendly and good food, the decor was most impressive at restaurant

title: Gem of a hotel in LES
text: This is LES best kept secret. Excellent and friendly service, smooth check in, stunning floor to ceiling views of the river and sparkling clean rooms. Just round the corner from a great juice bar. I stayed here when I visited my sister who lives in Queens in the fall. It was a smooth trip there and back.

title: Just perfect
text:
Best location in town, amazing view!
Lower east side is the best area to discover NYC and the hotel is just perfectly located.
Room are nice and large  with a lovely balcony.
Close to Brooklyn and the village.

title: We liked it : )
text: The room was great, big and a beatufiul and comfy king size bed : ) But the breakfast in Café Medi was not good, the food was alright but the service was bad. I really like the location in lower east side.

title: Good hotel
text: We were satisfied whith the room but avoid Café Medi for the dishonesty. Prices changed every day. We gave tips every day but during the check out the hotel had taken 12, 40 $ for tips. Why ? We paid also 20 $ more. Why ?

title: Best kept secret
text: This hotel does not get enough credit. Beautiful rooms, beautiful views, and staff who will stop at nothing to make guests happy. Not to mention the value is amazing considering everything you get. I spend my birthday here every year and I love it.

title: Great location. Large room.
text: Had a comfortable 6 night stay in a Deluxe King room. The location in the Lower East Side is excellent. Close to subway. Surrounded by great restaurants. Staff is friendly and considerate. Room was a bit odd in that there was not great hanging space for our clothes for a long stay. We actually went out and bought a rolling rack and the staff provided extra hangers. We got a kick out of the fact that it feels bit like a love hotel in Japan. Dark padded hallways. Large bathroom with shower room for two. Huge mini bar and accessories. Overall it was very comfortable and the room size was great for a long stay.

title: Wonderful place to stay in NYC! We will return to the Hotel on Rivington!
text: Wonderful 5 night stay! The views from our room were amazing. Great location and service. Comfy bed. Cookies at night. 24 hour doorman, free coffee service, plenty of outlets for technology. Fun neighborhood close to metro line.

title: Awesome + + +
text:
Hotel on Rivington in LES was a BLESSING. After a long morning of issues with SIXTY LES hotel- I cancelled at SIXTY and walked 2 blocks to Hotel On Rivington. They had an early check in available  and was BLOWN AWAY by the awesome property, the super sweet staff and the simplicity of the booking / check in process. 

PLUS the room is huge, floor to ceiling windows and a STEAM SHOWER + Tub. 

PLUS PLUS I left for a concert and came back to a completely recleaned room, they remade the bed and refilled the towels plus they left cookies. 

You would be making a mistake by booking anywhere else. This spot rules. Thanks everyone for making it a perfect NYC stay.

title: Hit or Miss
text: Great location, had some issues, but it was an ok stay all in all. Cafe medi food was awesome. Only thing was that the hours were so weird for the cafe, maybe I came at the wrong time of the year. Oh well

title: Comfy bed, really good bathroom and good staff
text:
We especially enjoyed the extremely comfortable bed, the super nice shower and the over al cleanliness of the room. Staff was also really helpful. On the minus side; room needs a bit of maintenance. A window that is possible to open (at least a bit) would also be nice. Lighting in the bathroom is a bit dark, difficult when you do your make up.

Overall a good impression.

title: Déception
text:
Après une troisième fois au Rivington en famille et pour nos 20 ans de mariage. Nous avons demandé une chambre au 20'. Nous nous sommes trouvé au 14'. Sans aucun accueil, dans une chambre mal vieilli, etc etc. Par contre le restaurant rien à dire!
Nous n'y retournerons plus malheureusement.

title: A solid LES hotel (updated review)
text:
I stayed here with my wife last month when she was in town for the half marathon. It was St Patrick's weekend so the neighborhood was very noisy due to all the bars around this hotel, which wasn't great for sleeping early before a big race...but there you go.

I dig the hotel, our room was good size for the 2 of us, with space around our king bed to walk (not "euro style" like some others) and the blackout curtains did an adequate job of keeping out the bright sun. My only negative is that there were hardly any power outlets in the room, save for one corner by a bedside table...and also that there were ZERO towel hooks in the bathroom to hang wet towels. We ended up using the doors to hang them instead.

title: Amazing view
text: One thing for sure will visit again, the room was amazing. Love the detail / quality of the room! Two thumbs up for me . Bathroom breath taking. High floor corner king with balcony. See you guys again for sure.

title: Great property, reasonably priced
text: I loved the Hotel on Riverton. It is a great boutique hotel in a popular location, walking distance from where I wanted to go, and subway and many great restaurants nearby. The room was the largest I've stayed in in NYC for the price and it was very well appointed. The bed was super comfortable which is unusual.

title: excellent in many ways
text: The Hotel on Rivington offered a clean, comfortable, contemporary, and attractive hotel room with the added convenience of a fine restaurant located just floors away within the same building.  A bit pricey, but well worth it.

title: OUTSTANDING hospitality
text:
Outstanding customer service and hospitality!  The hotel is located on the Lower East Side, walking distance to Chinatown and Little Italy.  Bonus- there is parking lot right behind the hotel; you can either park yourself $50 all day or $70 to valet--- this is super convenient.  We parked all day in the garage and use Uber to commute.   Lots of restaurants, bars, bakeries on the block.  The front desk staff and their attention to details is what sets this hotel apart.  

Location- excellent
Cleanliness- excellent
Value- excellent for Manhattan
Beds- excellent
Customer Service- Superb

title: Hotel Rivington
text: Great hotel in a good location. Most of the rooms have a fantastic view, but last time I stayed on one of the lower floors where the view was a street view but the room was larger to compensate. the cafe downstairs has a good breakfast and there are good places to eat nearby. The other stand-out feature is the mattress its so comfortable.

title: I love NY
text: Friendly staff, great bartender, soft pillows! They don’t tell you but there is coffee in the morning on the street level and then after 12pm by the lobby. Had a few issues with our room so would ask to not be in that one again. This is my second stay and I will be there again soon.

title: Good Location
text: Really great location and staff.  Rooms need general updating.  Several maintenance issues which were fairly minor but annoying. The worst being no hot water in the mornings.  We had a 19th floor King with balcony.

title: Rivington review
text: Great location and friendly staff but we did not receive value for money. Room was overpriced for what it was. No tub, no view, no extras like complimentary bottle water or espresso machine, poor lighting and layout for over $400 per night. Unfortunately, we will not return.

title: Fantastic!!
text: I was there two nights and was super impressed with everything.  The friendly, staff were very helpful.  My room was clean and wonderful!  I would recommend this place if your staying in Manhattan!  I’ll be back to stay again!

title: Awful service and see through showers
text: I'm warning all the tourists from making a reservation at this hotell. The service was awful. At the reception desk they didn't welcome us to the hotel and didn't make eye contact at all, like we were some junkies coming in from the street. We took our luggage by our selves to the room. To our huge surprise we see that there is a big window into our bathroom. The apartments in the back could easily see us shower. When calling the front desk and asking to switch rooms they answer that they can put a 'sheet-like'. over on the window. So for all the tourist out there looking for an expensive stay with loousy service and home made window cover your welcome.. For the rest of you, stay away.

title: A room with a view
text: A super hotel. Within walk in distance to nice restaurants the hotel is in the middle of Lower East Side. History, tenenments, nice bars and restaurants in the neighbourhood and you don’t even have to walk far. The straff in the reception was so nice and arranged the best stay ever in NYC! Thanks!

title: Not worth it.
text:
This hotel has seen better days and looks like management have really fallen in the last few months. Room wasnt serviced till we called them at 6pm. When I ordered room service for just a pot of hot water, it wasnt delivered after multiple calls and 2 hour wait. In addition, they dont have a service elevator so everything is done on the customers elevator, making morning ride down to lobby/street level a pain stopping at every level. 

Only positive note- the bell men were great.

title: Interesting neighborhood hotel
text:
We read a lot of reviews regarding this hotel before booking it. It isn’t cheap and we thought, it would be a cool design, boutique hotel. 

Pros-
Location 
Amazing location. Lots of good food around. Must try Katz. 
Free WiFi
Near the subway 
Clean rooms 
Shower was nice

Cons-
Flush system doesn’t work well 
Pillows are the worst
Service is sad for the price- we asked for some assistance and advice as our flight was 9pm (informed them we were flying 24 hr and asked if we could use shower facility)- granted its not their problem- BUT they couldn’t reply nicely, rushed us to check out by 1pm- and kept pushing us to extend for a night. Water is not free. Only for the first day. Lobby service is the worse. Don’t bother wasting your time asking for help. Think about it more like- a sleeping place. 

I really didn’t mind paying- but not like this. 

A hotel of such quality- should really pay more attention to service. Warm and friendly service especially to first time visitors from aboard - instead of shocking us with the New York treatment.

title: My NYC Trip
text:
Overall an excellent stay. Great staff and attention to detail. Maid service was some of the best I've experienced. Luggage storage prior to departure was great.
Would stay again and recommend to friends.

title: Good service and everything!
text:
We like so much, but wi-fi didnot work as it should.
Les is best Place to be in Manhattan
Les ha sbest restaurants and bars in Small area.
Metro goes everywhere you want to go.
YOU CAN FEEL NYC BEAT IN LES!

title: Hotel on Rivington did not disappoint!
text: Hotel on Rivington did not disappoint! We have been coming to Hotel on Rivington since 2007. We used to stay two or three times a year but we took a five year break before taking this resent trip. All of our visits to Hotel on Rivington have been enjoyable in the past and we decided to keep the tradition on this long overdue visit back to NYC. We love staying in the Lower East Side and we like all that this area has to offer in dinning and the nightlife. We have always appreciated the modern feel of the hotel with its floor to ceiling windows and well though out floor plans with plenty of out of the way storage. We also love the comfortable beds with super fresh bedding. What really stood out on this trip though was the welcoming and friendly staff. Everybody we made contact with was very helpful and nice. Thank you Hotel on Rivington for another fully enjoyed week long stay in NYC.

title: Beautiful room but service could be better
text: The hotel is beautiful but beware of the finicky room service hours and policy. I tried to order breakfast to my room at 10:50 am and they told me the kitchen was closed and I would have to go down to the restaurant to get food. I wouldn't have minded if I was at a budget hotel but I expected them to be more accommodating at this price point.

title: A great hotel for business trips
text: I stay at Hotel on Rivington as often as possible. The beds are amazing and ensure I get a good night's sleep. The restaurant has great breakfast. The neighbourhood is interesting and has many good food options that aren't touristy. There's a subway stop really close by.

title: Cool Hotel, can't wait to come back
text:
This was my first stay at Hotel on Rivington and I had anticipated the standards tiny rooms that I have come to expect when staying in Manhattan, however this place was perfect. 
My room was comfortable and spacious with a great view of the neighborhood.  The staff were all super friendly and welcoming and the the location was absolutely perfect. So much to do right in the immediate neighborhood.
I sincerely can't wait to come back and stay here again.

title: LES Class
text: Hotel on Rivington does it right especially with staff that care and rooms with, well room. Fun and upbeat area with other great NYC neighborhoods within walking distance. Plenty of choices for subways within walking distance to get to other areas of Manhattan and the boroughs.

title: I love this neighbourhood
text: Very nice location to explore. Subway is ariund the corner, a lot of shops, restaurants , coffe bars and bars just a fes steps away. The hotel offers good rooms and we were lucky to have a view of the NY skyline.

title: Excellent stay
text: I was wary about this hotel - I booked it and then read TripAdvisor reviews and was alarmed by the many negative comments. However, I was nothing but pleased with my stay. The bellboys were helpful and courteous, check in was easy, and the housekeeping staff were helpful. Our room was on the 11th floor; it was beautiful and overlooked the Freedom Tower, and was fitted with blackout curtains, which had been something I was worried about. The bathroom was tiled, floored and ceilinged with black tiles which made it a little dark, and the lighting was difficult to do your makeup, and additionally it took us a short while to work out how to open the wardrobes (we arrived after 15 hours of travelling though!). The free cookies every evening were a lovely touch, and the beds were comfy. One thing to note is that the air conditioning/heating is VERY loud (woke myself and my roommate up multiple times per night) and can be adjusted but not switched off - it seemed to switch on randomly and was loud enough to stop me getting back to sleep. Otherwise, a faultless stay!

title: Never going back
text: Services were good but not the room. The room was way too small for the price that we paid. Bathroom smell like urine and everything, especially the closets doors were broken. The carpets were so dirty with lots of stains. Not worth it at all!

title: Super
text: This place is best! Amazing staff and hotel. Room is awesome and comfy. Beautiful. Location is wow!  Totally love it there.  Hotel itself has so much characters & makes it so unique.  Oh abd bef is super comfy too!

title: Great Room!
text: Wonderful room. Bigger than I was expecting and had a balcony and HUGE tub. Perfect location for Lower East Side and downtown fun! The hotel really feels like the LES, not a big box midtown hotel, which is exactly what I was looking for.

title: Unwilling to help
text:
I was put on the 4th floor facing busy road/cross roads; My request to upgrade (and pay extra) and move to different room - other side and higher up was refused.
I did get a feeling that I was not important as room was paid in full prior to my arrival.

title: Great fun!
text: Trendy neighborhood fun for hanging out. Large rooms make it easier to sleep. Staff super helpful. Great location and places to hang out nearby.  Gym! Especially good to transport subway lines. Lots nearby.

title: Okay Visit
text: Good room, but bad view. Balcony door wouldn’t lock, but after it was fixed by hotel the door wouldn’t open and wasn’t able to use balcony. Room wasn’t made up one day, but it wasn’t a huge deal. Woman at the bar in the cafe was amazing!

title: Great place
text: This place was amazing the staff was very helpful with places to eat and visit. The room was clean and had an amazing view. The mini bar had everything you could want or need. The atmosphere and the whole experience was amazing

title: Prima hotel in leuke wijk
text: Om de hoek van het hotel ligt de metro. De wijk is prima, leuke restaurants op loopafstand. Prima kamer met uitzicht op Brooklyn bridge. De medewerkers van het hotel waren vriendelijk en behulpzaam. In het weekend was het rumoeriger op straat. Wij hadden daar geen last van.

title: Great hotel on lower eastside
text: We have been to this hotel for the last 2 years. It is our go to hotel for NYC. Wonderful place to stay. Clean & excellent accommodations. Helpful & friendly staff. Great views from room (16th floor). Being from Minnesota, this part of town feels very safe to us. It is  walking distance to many small restaurants, bars. etc.

title: The good and bad of it
text:
I stayed here in the fall with a friend. We had a suite on an upper floor. Here is the good and bad of it
The Good: the views from the upper floors are amazing. Had a view of the Freedom tower and most of Manhattan...really spectacular. The door men are really helpful . The cleaning staff did a great job and the room was always clean with cookies at bedside when we returned at the end of the day. The manager was great and sent a bottle of champagne to the room. The decor is trendy with hardwood floors throughout the room. The bed was the most comfortable I had ever slept in. The location in LES is great and just an Uber or cab ride from everything.
The Bad: Even on the upper floor the street noise at night during the weekend is unbearable and made it difficult to sleep. The room was very cold even with the heat on so I can't imagine what it is like in the winter. The lighting in the bathroom is seriously the worst i have ever seen, it is impossible to put your makeup on and sometimes I had to wait until the sun came up and streamed into the bathroom to do so. Wifi was very patchy. The place needs an update. Cracked windows, reading lights that kept going on and off, damaged furniture all needs to be fixed. The restaurant downstairs was never open, couldn't figure that out. The front desk staff were rude at times. The bathrooms with their exposed ceiling to floor windows to the outside is a bit unnerving. While it is cool to have a great view of the city while showering if I can see them, they can see me. Luckily we weren't too close to anything.
All in all the hotel was just okay. If you're looking for a trendy place in a hip area of New York it might be okay if you don't mind the cons, get a high floor.

title: Fine
text: Check-in & talking to the front desk was a weird experience; both instances were pretty rude. Room was fine, the shower was disappointing (wouldn't get very warm, little water pressure) I likely won't stay here again.

title: Manhattan March 2019
text: Great hotel in Lower Manhattan, hotel is very well connected great area for shops and bars. The room was very spacious and clean, 152 had a balcony and great view of the 3 bridges. The Japanese tub was very nice to soak after a day out in the snow and cold weather. Staff are friendly

title: Not like the photo's
text:
The stay overall was ok. Good location for exploring downtown and Soho. Great speakeasys within a few minutes walk. 
The hotel is pretty dated and definitely not like the pictures. All need a refurb. We had to change to rooms due to the noise from the street, its very loud. We moved to the15th floor however you could still hear it. Yes, I know it's New York however this is the 4th hotel I've stayed at, in NY and I didnt have this issue before. 
The TV remote didnt work, we had mark's on the sheets when they were changed and loose titles in the shower. The staff were great and the complimentary cookies each evening were a nice touch. However I wouldn't stay again and for the price there are many other hotels to choose from.

title: New York vacation
text: Overall a good stay. Room had an incredible view and had a nice modern feel. Other than our issue at check in. Being given the key to another guest room and having to deal with that awkward situation I would say it was an overall good stay.

title: Great Stay!!
text:
In the past, we have stayed closer to the Financial District, but always dined on the LES.  So this time a friend recommended the Hotel on Rivington, and we were not disappointed.

We were in room 152 and the room size was very generous, especially by Manhattan standards.  Furnishings were modern minimalist, but comfortable (especially the bed!).  The glass walled shower looked out over the city with beautiful views at night.

Staff were incredibly friendly and professional (Elvis, Chasity, Luis).  We will definitely stay here again on our next visit!

title: Stay away! Worst NYC hotel (among close to 50 we have stayed at)
text:
Unbelievingly negative experience. Do not take our word for it, check our profile to see our reviews of close to 50 different NYC hotels we have stayed at in the last 5 years. Absolutely and certifying the worst. 
1. Prior to our arrival, we have tried to contact the hotel via their website's "Contact Us" option. No reply whatsoever for 3 days. After my comments on the hotel's Instagram page, we were given the email address of the reservation and were promised that our rather insignificant request of checking in 2 hours earlier, at 2 PM instead of 4 PM would be taken into consideration. Not only that didn't happen, but after being told that our room wasn't ready, we were prompted to schlep our suitcases to the ground floor. How about the hotel's staff taking care of it? 
2. The bellboy, upon seeing our suitcase, told me to get it to the storage room, without moving himself. No assistance whatsoever. 
3. We were asked to provide our cell phone number and were told that we will get a phone call when our room is ready. To no avail. Shortly after 4 PM, when we inquired about the update, we were given the nonsensical explanation that after 4 PM, there was no need for a phone call, due to the customary check-in time. So, when exactly our room was ready? 3:59 PM? Or 3:55? If it was 3:55 why no promised phone call followed? 
4. The upkeep is below average, with scuffs on the walls and doors. 
5. No reading light by the night tables, only the overhead light fixtures. 
6. The so-called fitness center, a tiny room with cramped in two treadmills, one elliptical and one bicycle (and a few resistance training machines and free weights) was nothing but a joke, with only one treadmill working. When asked the employee about the issue, the gentleman kept plugging and unplugging the machines with zero end result.   
7. Upon checking out of this nightmare of a hotel, we were told repeatedly that the receipt would be sent to Expedia. What Expedia? We booked our room via Amex Platinum Traveling.  
Our King Corner with Balcony featured a nice view to the Lower Manhattan, but unlike Midtown hotels, so does every other hotel in the area, be it Sago, Public, NobleDen or 50 Bowery, all due to the different urban architecture in the area, and the absence of the mass of skyscrapers. 
Also, our rate was $428.08 per night, and that is during off season. For that amount of money, you will be so much better off at any of the decent neighborhood hotels. 
The final proof to all of the above is the total lack of management response to the reviews on TripAdvisor, both negative and positive. It is considered a good practice on the part of hotel's management to respond to their guests reviews. Nonexistent in the case of Hotel on Rivington. 
Our experience with hotel's Cafe Midi, even though only visited briefly, while waiting for our room, proved as negative and sub-quality as of the hotel itself.
We found a good and affordable parking right around the corner, but won't mention it here, for we absolutely suggest you pick a different hotel for your stay in the LES.

title: Has had its heyday...
text: Hotel on Rivington has an ideal location. But, so does the Ludlow, Citizen-M Bowery... I really want to love this hotel but it's just a bit to dated and faded. It's convenient and rooms are good size. The views are nice from 10th floor and up. But, furnishings are worn and all in all I feel this hotel was top notch 10 years ago. I'd be happy to stay again but not given the price. Service is ok. The Lobby is on the 2nd floor and is very unipersonal and I really lacked a nice common area for guests.

title: perfect
text:
Everything was perfect. The view was stunning, the room was amazing. A best location in New York. Just a word : PERFECT ! 
I will come back for sure to this hotel as soon as possible. New York New York :)

title: Never disappoints
text: This was my third time staying at the Rivington and they are truly the best,easy check in easy check out, friendly staff and that’s why I will continue to come back and recommend to all my friends and family

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Great place, great decore, great service! “I’d go back just for the views” is what my wife keeps saying. Rooms had great amenities and it was the first time in a long time hotel has pleasantly surprised me!

title: Valentine's Day at The Hotel Rivington.
text: We had an amazing Valentine's Day at The Hotel Rivington. The room was perfect. The bathrub was absolutely mindblowing. The views were incresible. The room service foos (both dinner & breakfast) were delicious and delivery was ridiculously fast!

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel was great and the staff was very professional. Check in only took a couple of minutes and the view from my room was just spectacular. If you live in Nyc or are visiting and need a clean room with a view of the city skyline this is the place to be.

title: HIGHLY  Recommend staying here
text:
Came with my mom to visit my daughter who lives in NYC. I chose this hotel just off of availability for double beds and the pics looked like it was a nice place. It is the BEST! The rooms are spacious and very clean. It has an artistic hip vibe. It smells good. Everyone working is extremely helpful. I celebrated my birthday while staying there and they gave me a complimentary bottle of champagne which was sent with some beautiful berries too. Such an amazing touch and it really made my day. I can't say enough good!!!!! I'll always stay here while visiting the city. My favorite hotel to date! 
Only drawback.... not good lighting in bathroom so hard to put on make up. Lol

title: Rude front desk agent! Beware of Alex!!
text: I normal don’t write reviews but after dealing with Alex at the front desk at the hotel Rivington I am beyond upset and will never stay at this hotel again. Alex treated me and my family with so much disrepesct! Stay at the indigo hotel!!! It’s worth the money!!

title: Incredibly Accommodating
text:
My husband and I stayed at the hotel this past weekend. We had to have a last minute business meeting on Saturday.  We went to the front desk and spoke to Melissa about our situation.  Melissa was incredibly accommodating and found us a quiet space and even provided water for us and all of our guests.  She definitely goes above and beyond!

On another note, we were checking in very late on Friday night, when I called the hotel to let them know we would be late and ask if they could recommend a place to eat, they of course gave me restaurant options.  When we arrived in our room, they had a fruit platter and two waters waiting for us.  What a thoughtful gesture!

This is the hotel to stay at in the Lower East Side!

title: Nice Rooms
text: The rooms are pretty. The hotel takes good care to provide a comfortable stay. The front desk staff are polite and professional. The Cafe downstairs is nice, prices are in line with typical NYC prices, maybe even better. Staff there is super nice as well. However, buyer beware when booking through a service. The no refunds and no changes policy is strictly enforced. It was my fault, but I won't be staying with this hotel again in the future. If a guest makes a mistake and if the hotel could accommodate, it doesn't make sense that they refuse. Their loss.

title: Never again
text: Basé staff. Hotel charges credit card enormous sums for deposits - over 5000 USD for a stay of one week - and reception doesn’t know they charched at all nor has any information how and when and we will get it back. Dirty Bathrobes, no light at the bedside for reading. Housekeeping never replaced glases.

title: Great room, service and location.  Staff was great and immediately helpful.  Will stay again on my next trip.  Great val
text: Stayed in a unique room for a business trip in February.  Hotel was in a great location.  Room had incredible city views, staff was super accommodating and even helped me get food at 1:00 AM after my flight got in late.  I will stay there again.

title: OMG! A must stay...
text: The staff were so friendly. The room was clean and comfy, especially the sauna shower/tub. Perfect location for my BUTI certification training. Hotel Rivington is a must stay spot! It is beautiful, comfortable and relaxing.

title: a pleasure and a great find
text: everything worked.. the staff were super helpful and yet always discrete., the space in the room and the view made us feel like we were travelling first class and the bed and bedding was superb.. everything was nearby in the neighbourhood and the streets are filled with kind and interesting people.. a gem for visitors: the slipper room burlesque is up the road and has some genuine excellence..

title: WOW!! Fantastic location, hotel & staff
text: My daughters wedding party stayed at Hotel on Rivington and the experience from start to finish was incredible.  Everything is happening on the lower east side & this is the center of it.  The hotel isn't affiliated with any chain, so no robots working the front desk. Just real, friendly people.  It starts from the top down.  Daniel (the manager) was everywhere, all the time - making sure everything was going smoothly & if we needed anything.  Such a great hotel & amazing experience.  I can't get say enough good things about our 4 days at Hotel on Rivington!

title: Ideal hotel on the Lower East Side
text: After reviewing various hotels in the vicinity of Delancy Street and Rivington we settled with the Hotel on Rivington and we were very glad we did.  Hotel was easy to find and drive up to for unloading street wise.  Valet parking staff were prompt and ready to please.  Check-in was efficient and considerate especially when we were offered a 14th floor upgrade.  Room was larger than expected with an adequate sitting area, bathroom with really nice toiletries, a very comfortable king size bed and a great view towards Lower Manhattan.  One thing of note is this hotel has a lively bar and dining area at street level which was a fun place for after dinner drinks with family from the area.  A la carte breakfast was delicious and I highly recommend their Nova Eggs Benedict which they made specially, even though this wasn’t on the breakfast menu.  All in all a great stay made even better by the accommodating staff who seem to always want to go above and beyond, and all at a great price.

title: EXCELLENT
text: The best stay I have had in the city in a long time!  I had three rooms over the weekend - my family and I had a wonderful time!  Staff was great and the room was clean, bed was super comfortable, and the view of lower Manhattan was spectacular

title: Great location, clean and cozy
text: Five nights here was long enough to be able to tell how good Hotel on Rivington really is. My room was beautifully cleaned every day, room service breakfast was tasty, 10th floor room was light with great views. A Lower East Side gem. Liked it more than another hotel not far away where I stayed last year.

title: Beautiful, posh space.  Friendly Staff!
text: We had a beautiful time, I really appreciate all the special care that every staff member took to ensure we had a beautiful and restful time.  We have a toddler so hardly get to have time away and this much needed night allowed us to reconnect.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!

title: Perfect for my solo getaway
text: The best location, stunning views and super attentive and friendly staff. I didn’t want to leave!  The soaking tub in my room was to die for and the toiletries were delightful. Only minor complaint was the cleanliness of the bathroom floor when I got in (sounds nit-picky, but...). Definitely planning on coming back in the summertime when my partner is able to fly in from London.  Cannot wait to stay again!

title: Great property, great location
text: This was our second stay here and the hotel did not disappoint.  The room was ready upon arrival and the desk staff was friendly and welcoming.  The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean.  The location is great as it is an quick walk to the west side and getting into midtown was also easy being so close to FDR drive.  I have already reserved the hotel for another weekend trip.

title: Great stay, great vibes
text: If you are visiting the delicious restaurants in L.E.S like Beauty and Essex, or want to experience night life down here, then stay at Hotel on Rivington for the night or two or more. The decor and service is beautiful. The food at cafe medí is so good too! Try the salmon!

title: I've been here before and expected better
text: First of all the service was incredible, I would give 10 stars if I could. However I gave a poor rating because I specifically requested a high floor corner king and was paying more in the price to be on a "high floor" and then placed on floor 11, Only 1 floor higher than the "lower floors" but I was paying so much more. Like $100 more to be "in the sky" "high floor suite" It was my boyfriends birthday and I wanted everything to be so special for him, it was just a huge let down I don't think we will be staying again. We book hotels a lot and I specifically wanted your hotel for his birthday and we were placed in a bad room in my opinion. -didn't have the high view, as promised-clearly could see people on the street and they could see us-the room was freezing, never was above 68-the floor was so cold and no slippers

title: Great location. Great service.
text: Well-designed and very comfortable rooms,  large windows from floor to ceiling higher floors are  Absolutely incredible.Free, fast Wi-Fi. Staff and Manager are fantastics.Great location. Near soho, East village, great Art Gallery.

title: Great LES View
text: Nice hotel, nice people, good sized room, great location. The lobby is a bit dark so seems like it could be a bit party party party, but once inside the room, it was light and lovely. I was on the 11th floor so had a good view.

title: Christmas Weekend was extra special
text: I was beyond impress with the interior and service Hotel on Irvington provided.  The staff knew how to make us feel extra special and took care of us. I wasn't expecting too much regardless of the great reviews, but was so grateful and pleased from my experience that I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a beautiful, comfortable NYC hotel. When checking in, we asked what floor we were on which was the 10th.  They asked if we wanted a higher floor. YES, PLEASE! The corner, 18th floor was stunning. Thank you SO much for a beautiful experience on Christmas weekend.

title: Rivington
text: Very nice hotel. Relaxing environment. Great for couples or just by yourself. Awesome view on high floors. I havent slept so good in a while, the beds are very very comfy. I also love the light colored wooden floors

title: Great Location
text: Great location with incredible city sky line view. Check in was easy, room was sparkling clean, gym was great, goo location with a lot of option for dinner and lunch, very friendly stuff. Rate was also good for lower east side, I will try cafe at first floor on my next visit. Thanks for great Service

title: The perfect stay in New York at Hotel on Rivington
text: I went to New York for my 21st birthday. I was a far way from home and traveling solo. Hotel on Rivington was the ideal and perfect place to stay. It’s located in a safe and fun neighborhood. Exciting and very much alive during night, but still quiet when arriving in the hotel to get a good night’s rest from day and night activities. The service is welcoming, helpful and very nice. The rooms are beautiful, modest and very clean. I can actually say with confidence I have fallen in love with the hotel and would return any time back in New York.

title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Super Clean
text: I travel to N.Y.C., to visit my son, who lives in The Lower East Side. This Hotel was the perfect location, excellent restaurant, & was very clean, with a lot of space in the room & bathroom, compared to others, where I stayed before. I would definitely stay at The Hotel Rivington again.

title: Não recomendo
text: Ficamos no hotel em janeiro 2019 um casal com 2 crianças. O quarto é pequeno, bem apertado, super diferente da foto do site. Ele tem carpete preto o que faz parecer menor e da impressão de sujeira. As camas eram apertadas, o banheiro era preto e com um odor muito ruim que me fez sentir dores de cabeça. Parecia que não estava limpo da maneira adequada ou que haviam arrumado o quarto rapidamente. Não gostamos da nossa estadia e só não mudamos de hotel naquele momento pois estávamos com alguns amigos na região e optamos por ficar perto deles. O lobby é escuto também e com o teto muito baixo que faz com que vc se sinta um tanto claustrofóbico. Os corredores são estreitos com carpetes vermelhos o que passa uma má impressão também. As pessoas que abriam a porta da frente eram corteses, não temos queixas deles. Os elevadores eram velhos. O hotel precisa ser revitalizado e/ou reformado pois parece que foi muito usado. Não ficaria novamente de forma nenhuma. O Café MIDI por outro lado era lindo, iluminado e fomes muito bem servidos. A comida era boa e o ambiente limpo e arrumado. Nem parecia fazer parte do hotel.

title: High end LES hotel
text: Very comfortable hotel in the heart of the LES. The neighbourhood is great with lots of independent restaurants and shops. The hotel, alike the district, has its own identity, somewhat unconventional. Nice and friendly personnel. We stayed in a family bedroom with our two teenagers. The view from the 16th floor was spectacular.

title: Family Vacation
text: Overall decent place to stay but missing key hotel amenities, ie; microwave in room/lobby, ice machines on floor/lobby. Nearest restroom on 2nd floor. Not a place for young kids, feels more like a place for young, hip singles or couples.

title: New Years Eve
text: Visited the hotel for a penthouse New Year’s Eve party. It was a horrible experience and my worst New Year’s Eve ever. The doors were meant to be open at 9pm, we were made stand in the lashing rain until 10:40pm until we finally got into the venue. When we got in the experience didn’t get any better. There was one bathroom available in which I had to wait 40 minutes in line. The free bar was no better with a poor selection of drinks. There was no countdown at midnight. We left straight after midnight. Worst experience and ruined our New Years stay in New York.

title: NYE
text: Came here for NYE and it was such a horrible stay. For the price of the room it would have been better to stay somewhere else and actually have a warm shower and access to available amenities. We paid to have breakfast included but then had to pay a service charge after obtaining said “free breakfast”. The NYE party at the penthouse was horrible. Horrible drinks. Horrible organization. No NYE countdown. All in all, it was a terrible experience and I would not come here again. I would avoid this place if you’re hoping to have a nice weekend in NYC...!!!

title: Disappointed
text: I really felt that your staff need to communicate who is checked out there is no need for matenience to knock on my doir to paint the ceiling come after 12 after check out time disgusting I called the front desk very nonchalant asked to have manger call I got no call insand

title: Good stay but not 4-star feel
text: So the views from the corner studio room were amazing! The location is a bit far out from all the touristy things so keep that in mind but you will definitely get great skyline views from the entire city. Rooms are clean but maintenance could be greatly improved: some light switches dont work properly, the wall paint is terrible, floor looks very cheap and poorly done. If all these minor cosmetic things are fixed, this hotel would be amazing! Other thing to note is that they claim to be a 4-star hotel but it sure doesnt feel like it at all. Too small of a lobby, the cafe isnt that great and the overall cosmetics of the property seems a little tacky. But for my stay, I only used to hotel to sleep at night with nice views and wake up with even better views.

title: Best hotel in LES
text: great service, big, super clean rooms.  Front door guys Lester and Alex are super accommodating.  Stayed for a weekend and felt like i was at home.  Daniel the manager runs a tight ship, hotel is legit.   Katz deli is right around the corner

title: spectaculaire en étages hauts, un peu cher néanmoins
text: hôtel conseillé par VDM, néanmoins situé dans un quartier "entre 2", l'hôtel n'est pas renseigné au rdch - réception au 2°, la chambre est très belle - 18° étage, clim chauffante très bruyante, point de vue exceptionnel, personnel ok, no wow, un peu cher pour ce que c'est...

title: Friendly staff, great location!
text: I have both stayed and shot at the Hotel on Rivington for my job, and the staff goes above expectations to make you feel welcome no matter what your stay is for.  Love the location, too - walkable to so many great restaurants and nightlife!!

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: Its was my second stay here and from check in to check out totally seamless.. Kenny at the front desk is an amazing, dedicated and Rock star employee. His pride show through and through.. The rooms area large super comfy and tempurpedic bed is a huge plus! Location is great and walk-able.Highly recommend for business or pleasure!

title: Great potential, total disappointment.
text: Cute hotel. Awful staff service. Awful housekeeping. Awful beds. During my 4 night stay, I probably slept a total of 8 hours. Housekeeping left my cookies for turndown service in my bathroom next to the toilet while they forgot to finish cleaning my room. Will not revisit.

title: Scalding hot brown water, fire hazard hair dryer, and flooded room
text: This hotel is super sexy but... The soaking tub filled up with brow water that got lighter the next time we tried but was still brown, not that it mattered because the mechanism to adjust the temperature was not working so the water was scalding hot and there was o way to turn it down.  The hair dryer made a really loud pop while I was using it and then something was rattling around in it.  They did send a new one but the delay cause me to be a few mins late for a meeting.  The shower drain couldn't handle the volume of the water flow and so it flooded the bathroom twice and out in to the main room both times.  Finally had to start showering in short spurts so as to let the water drain before it got so high it leaked out the door.

title: Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!
text: My overall stay at this hotel was nothing but amazing from the first time I walked in until the very next day I walked out. I already recommended at least 7-10 people of this hotel and the experience from staff to the room I stayed in.

title: Great Location
text: Room was comfy, great walking distance to almost everywhere in the Lower east side.Great continental breakfast at the Cafe downstairsPersonnel was very friendly and helpful when requiredI will recommend

title: All around great!!
text: The friendliest staff creat a relaxed ultra comfortable vibe.  Astounding views (1/2 the reason you're here!) and modern hip interior yet relaxed and not at all pretentious.  We loved the place, the lower east side is great and this hotel is as well!!

title: Awesome hotel on the Lower East Side
text:
This boutique hotel on the lower east side of New York is a great place to stay.  The rooms are very large and comfortable by New York standards.  Here is a list of why I loved this hotel:
Great beds (the mattress is very firm so if you don't care for a firm bed, don't sleep here).
Room has a nice seating are.
Floor to ceiling windows.
Great walk-in shower with a fantastic shower head that has plenty of power.
Nice towels.
Great lighting in both bath and bedroom. (lighting over beds which is great for reading)
The only things that the room did not have that I missed having:
No luggage rack in room and no dresser.  No shower caps or q-tips were available but the toiletries  provided were nice.
There is a lot of street noise - honking and sirens.   Try to get a room on a high floor.

The hotel manager, Daniel, was very helpul.
  
Note:    We stayed in Room 71 which is a corner room had a metal piece of something outside our room.  It rained one of the nights that we were there and the rain noise hitting against this metal piece kept us up the entire night.    IF you see rain in the forecast, avoid staying in Room 71.     My kids had other rooms in the hotel and they did not have this issue in their rooms.

title: Absolutely Love Hotel on Rivington
text: This is my 4th stay at Hotel on Rivington and absolutely love it! The cookies as a turn down amenity is a very nice touch. The bathrooms are amazing and I love the Davines products, original and great quality.

title: Very Swanky
text: Great room, lovely location. Very spacious by NYC standards! We asked for ice and they brought 2 buckets within only a few minutes. Loved the fluffy white robes and the bathroom with a full window was especially nice!

title: Nice hotel
text: The hotel is in an excellent location - perfect for a weekend getaway.  Room was clean, bed was comfy, staff was pleasant and helpful.  It's directly across from Economy Candy - important to know because the signage is bad.

title: Florida Senior
text: Terrible location,  and room. Heard street noises all night long. Sleep quality was poor.The bathroom was too dark. No dresser in room for storage. The closet space did not allow you to hang long clothes. The food and service in the cafe was good.

title: A huge success, great location
text: Our stay at the Hotel on Rivington was a huge success.We loved our room, the smell in the lobby when you come in, the neighborhood, The staff, everything. Even when I had a small problem, the staff was very friendly and caring and solved it in no time.I would definitey come back.

title: Hotel on rivington is incredible
text: Kenny at the front desk went above and beyond to make our stay incredible. He gave us great dinning and nightlife recommendations, brought us up a bottle of champagne for a birthday and was very helpful throughout our 4 night stay. We will definitely be back and recommending others to stay here

title: Amazing Stay
text: Room was even better than expected.  Staff is wonderful, views are memorable, and the room itself was great.  I had never been in a shower that looked out to the city before!  Will definitely be booking again.

title: Agree with the other comments, not a 4 star hotel
text:
Pros - Comfortable bed, value for money for its great location

Cons - 
1. Potential safety issues - balcony door cannot be locked and room was facing and close to other apartment buildings. Upon asking the reception to switch rooms, it was said that ALL balcony doors cannot be locked "for teh customers wellbeing so that customers cannot be locked out". This is poor logic - hotel can install balcony doors that are does not AUTO-LOCK. i have stayed in many residences with balcony with doors that dont lock you outside.

2. Privacy issues in toilet -  We stayed on the 6th floor.The Full length glass Panels in the shower area faced a car park and also other apartment buildings. What is shocking is that these glass panels are a mixture of transparent (top panel) and semi-translucent. This mean, people viewing from the top of the car park and higher floors apartment building are able to completely see us showering; and tThe outlines of your body are potentially visible. Upon expressing this concern, the hotel seems to be aware of this issue and sent us "privacy screens". To our dismay, the screens are 2 pieces of small cloths that cover only the top half of the glass walls. Upon further bringing up this issue, the receptionist said " its not visible when its fogged up (during hot shower bath). It can be so during the winter - but I am skeptical during summer. To be honest, it does not take too much effort not money to simply change the coating on the glass panes to make it opaque, or simply install some blinds.

3. Decor issues - our room had a terrifying HUGE picture of a woman with heavy eyeliner. Not very pleasing to see to say the least. Does not make you feel very comfortable with someone "staring at you" all the time.

4. Lack of amenities - There was not many amenities in the room like cups, plates. Whats a lot is alcohol and even a fleshlight for male pleasure. We were sincerely considering if the hotel is actually intended for a one night stay / love hotel.

title: Modern and comfortable
text: Very happy with our choice -- great location around the corner from a subway stop and very near some of the attractions and eateries we wanted to visit, reasonable price, wonderful bed, and a show-stopper modern bathroom with large tiled shower. We appreciated the attractive hard-surface floors in our room (I'm so over other hotels with worn carpets) as well as the comfy sitting area, and enjoyed the complimentary cookies delivered nightly. Our room could have done with a little more lighting, and, as with any city hotel, if some street noise bothers you, ask for a higher floor.

title: Still love this place
text:
Stayed for the second time with my boyfriend, only one night this time, 18th floor, amazing view, bright and airy rooms with a balcony.

Spacious, modern and great bathroom with a massive tub! 

It’s non invasive, tucked away and just a gem of a place, if you like LES this is the place to stay without bursting the budget.

Defo will be back!

title: Fantastic view!
text: Favorite hotel I have ever stayed at! Went with my loved one and it was so romantic. Floor to ceiling windows of the city, tempur-pedic mattress and great location! Look no further for a unique stay in the Big Apple.

title: Great Hotel
text: We chose this hotel because of proximity to music venue we were going to, but would definitely go back again whenever we are in NYC! Very cool hotel, awesome views, comfy bed and great location!So glad we found it!

title: Modern and comfortable room
text: I was in NY for business travel and our company site recommended this. I'd never heard of it, but it was modern and comfortable. Used the gym once, it is small has a couple of treadmills, an elliptical and weights. Bed seemed like one of the online foam mattress company setups, was comfortable enough. No lobby on the main floor, go up a level to have something small. For a value hotel, I thought it fit the bill nicely.

title: Great hotel
text: Amazing hotel! Deff reccomend the owners suite if you are having any special occasion. The staff was very polite and willing to help with everything. Daniel the bellboy was especially outstanding!!!!!!

title: Nice hotel in good area
text: We really liked this hotel.  Loved the location for great restaurants, bars and shopping.  Rooms were spacious, loved the fact that the floors are solid surface and not carpet.  Staff was friendly.  Lobby was spacious and was great for meeting up with group.

title: Great stay, great view
text: Stayed in a room on 19th floor with king bed & balcony.  This is one of the new kind of boutique hotels, similar to the MADE hotel (also in NYC) in some design choices (wall art, dark hallways, “edgy” finishes, etc). Very enjoyable experience, clean room, very friendly staff & service, amazing views of manhattan skyline (from 19th floor). Neighborhood is typical LES - gritty, but now pretty safe, lots of great bars & dining spots. In short - highly recommended!Oh and the hotel cookies are fantastic!!!

title: Beautiful Room and Extra Special Service
text: My partner and I stayed in a high floor corner king with a balcony for our anniversary. At first I booked a regular king, but after reading reviews about the higher floors being much better, I called the hotel and upgraded. So glad I did! The views of the city were incredible, especially during sunrise and sunset. The city noise was minimal, but we live in NYC, so we're sort of immune at this point anyway. The shower water pressure was divine. Super comfy bed. I made a note in my reservation that we we here for an anniversary, and we got several freebies throughout the night! First, cookies came to our door, then a bottle of Veuve and chocolate covered strawberries! I booked the "Breakfast at Rivington" deal ,which included a "free" breakfast at Cafe Medi (there's an included $8 service charge that will show up on your bill). I definitely recommend SKIPPING Cafe Medi. The service was absolutely glacial. Just go grab a bagel nearby and bring it back to your room.The hotel let us extend our check-out time by an extra hour, which was glorious.

title: Great stay.
text: Stayed for 6 days in a south facing room with balcony. 15th floor, stunning views total quiet. Liked everything. Only minor quibble: a reading lamp by the bed would be good. Staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. My rate included Breakfast in Cafe Medi and it was delicious. Coming back!

title: Pretty tacky, cheap and cold place. Great location though
text: It's a good location, bed was comfy and the room was big but the shower wasn't hot enough. Room was freezing and the whole feel of place felt empty and cheap. I was given coffee tokens for the restaurant downstairs which wasn't even open before check out so a bit pointless.

title: Amazing hotel in LES
text: I had never stayed in the Lower East Side of Manhattan despite having visited NYC many times and I loved it! The location is amazing with a great neighborhood-y feel, lots of restaurants to choose from, but most of all, the Hotel on Rivington is awesome. The service was top-notch and the rooms were comfortable, particularly the bed.The vibe of the hotel is cool and untraditional. Can't wait to stay again for next visit to NYC!

title: The most incredible customer service
text:
Hotel is great location and perfect for NYC visit. But the really amazing part has been the staff - incredibly helpful, they went way beyond the call of duty - absolutely amazing, we cannot thank them enough for helping us - when we left some items behind they bent over backwards to get them back to us when we were thousands of miles away.
Thank you to the team - we are so touched by the level of service!

title: Perfect Stay
text: The staff helped me plan a proposal, which took place on the balcony of one of their beautiful rooms. Roses, champagne, and the view of the city in the Corner King Balcony suite on a high floor. Couldn't have been more beautiful, and friendly.

title: Rude service from security
text: The views are great and it's pretty cool with floor to ceiling windows. It's in a great location accessible to the train station . The rooms are clean , and quaint . There's is a hotel bar or something attached to it. As much as I wanted to love it. My anniversary was ruined because security would not let my fiancé in so he had to sleep on the streets.  I could say much more but I won't . Good luck

title: Special weekend in the City
text: My sisters and our husbands stayed at the Hotel on Rivington for my sisters Anniversary.The hotel was convenvient to our plans for dinner and a nice fall weekend.The rooms were nice and the bathroom had a very nice walk-in shower with a large window to the outside shaft that let in a lot of light.The bed was very low to the floor if that is a concern for some.My one sister got a coupon for a free glass of wine. and they both got cookies at bedtime. We got neither.

title: 4 star - not a chance
text: Booked with Expedia 2 adults and child paid up-front in Oct including taxes. Upon arrival the reception area was on the 2nd floor. Checking in was fine however when we entered the room we were extremely disappointed. The room was small, full height window view was of a neighbouring room with an air con system. The windows were mouldy and the shower tray had not been cleaned at all. There was no kettle or cups in the room and no bedside tables at all. To make matters worse there was not even a sofa bed for our child despite booking and paying for 2 adults and a child in advance. We complained at reception area and they indicated that the room we were in was unsuitable for 3 persons and as such they would have to charge for a double bedroom room instead at extortionate rates. Having showed them the booking confirmation they said there was nothing they could do however they would consider providing a foldaway bed, once again at an additional charge. By this time we had had enough and the argument created scene at the reception area. The manager had heard the commotion and informed the staff member in a derogatory manner "just give them the foldaway bed" and then walked away again. That evening the roll away bed had indeed been delivered to the room however with the two sofas left in place there was no room to walk round the bed at all nor get into it either. The mattress was that bad that our son was essentially sleeping on the springs. He had to endure this for the 6 nights of our stay. During the booking process there was no mention of any surcharges by the hotel for service charges at all however on departure a service charge for each day was added onto our bill. By that stage I did not even have the energy to contest it and just wanted to leave. I asked reception if they could organise a taxi to the airport 60 miles north of New York. They confirmed the price in advance of the booking which was £210 which was acceptable by us and the booking was made by the hotel. Upon departure the porter was kind enough to put the cases into the boot of the taxi closed the door and when inside asked if we had received the updated price which was £280. We said we had not and had agreed the price prior to making the booking through the hotel. The porter confirmed this was the cost and having no time to re-organise this due to our flight departure time we simply had to accept the amended fare. The taxi firm the hotel booked was shambolic to say the least. The journey is usually 1.5 hrs to the airport. Our trip took 3.5 hrs and as such we almost missed our flights. Three times the driver missed turn-offs despite the sat nav clearly indicating the correct route which resulted in a 15 mile detour in each direction three times!!. We thought the Hotel would have booked through a reliable firm and that was simply the icing on the cake for us and we do stay in many hotels and make fair reviews however this was our worst experience by far. To call it 4 star is a complete nonsense 2 star at the most!!

title: Great rooms, but not the total package
text: Rooms are great, comfortable beds and large area with seating . Bathrooms good size all working well. The hotel bar is shut. The cafe Medi is independently run I experienced a number of times it shut early, stopped room service sporadically. It does shut certain days which is fine as you can make other plans. Lots of good bars and restaurants in the area. I stayed on 3rd floor and it was noisy as expected but good earplugs and it wasn’t a problem. If you have small children make sure you pay for a higher floor. Staff could be a little more caring.. ‘how was your stay’ etc would’ve been nice as I was there a week.. didn’t seem to be much care from front desk staff. Hotel is well located, and I will def stay again.

title: NOT a 4 Star
text: Hard to find hotel and almost impossible to park vehicle to unload.  Beds very comfortable and sheets great- the day after arrival we were out and about all day, came back to clean up and go to dinner, room had not been serviced- knock on door at 5 PM to service room! We just took some clean towels and declined. Day we left I checked out around 9:45, told them we were still in room and finishing packing- knock on the door at 10 AM to service room!  Hotel is in a good location, but over-rated.  Valet and luggage attendants great- desk staff nice, but were to call when room was ready and I finally went to desk after 4 PM, the room was ready and no call.

title: Cool lace in Lower East Side
text: Our journey was made wonderful also by our hotel. The location is very beautiful, in the heart of Lower east side, common spaces are stylish, rooms comfortable and with great windows on Manhattan. It has two subway stations very close. cafe Medi is a beautiful place, relaxing in the morning and lively in the night. Moreover, food is really good!

title: Amazing views
text: Views from the room were amazing. Full glass wall windows made the room feel open and not tiny like most NYC hotel rooms are. There were a few parts of the room that were broken-one of the light switch dimmers and the fridge was frozen up. Also there were parties going on during the weekend all night long on the 20th floor. We were on the 18th floor and it was fairly loud all night, still slept great though because of the super comfortable Tempurpedic beds. Neighborhood vibes were chill. Location was great and super close to the subway. Would stay here again for sure.

title: Professional Staff
text: I left my wallet in the safe at Hotel on Rivington.  Melissa at the front desk called me to let me know.  She kept it safe until my son was able to pick it up.  The hotel staff was very professional, and I am very grateful.

title: Immer wieder gerne
text:
Ich komme nun zum dritten Mal ins On Rivington und fühle mich nach wie vor sehr gut aufgehoben. Dieses Mal bin ich mit meiner 15 Jährigen Tochter hier. Daniel Tennant, der General Manager, mit dem ich vor unserer Reise Kontakt hatte, hat mich hinsichtlich der Zimmerauswahl beraten und alles für unsere Bedürfnisse vorbereiten lassen. So waren wir in einer Single Suite im 14. Stock mit Blick auf das One World Trade Centre/Financial District/Downtown auf der einen Seite und auf der anderen Seite haben wir Richtung Uptown geschaut mit dem Crysler Building im Blick. Meine Tochter hatte ihren separaten Bereich mit Zusatzbett.
Das gesamte Personal war, wie gewohnt, sehr freundlich. Besonders zuvorkommend und extrem kundenorientiert war Jelani Gordon, der Director of Guest Services, den ich aufgrund seltsamer Geräusche kontaktiert hatte. Die Ursache war schnell gefunden und die Geräusche komplett weg. Zum Abschluss möchte ich noch die Sauberkeit betonen. Die Supervisorin vom Housekeeping (Angel) weiß ihren Job wirklich zufriedenstellend zu machen und checkt nach der Reinigung alles. Perfekt. Ich komme wieder😊

title: The little hotel that could be
text: I was so excited to stay here! I booked direct because the website promised a free upgrade.  I did not receive an upgrade.  When I arrived to my room my toilet was running.  It continued to do so as I unpacked , so I had maintenance come.  He replaced a part and left.  He forgot to take the old part with him and left it in the sink.  I called the desk and they moved me down to a room on floor 7 right next to my friend!  Which we wanted in the first place and they did not do! I unpacked and checked out the mini bar where I found a half empty bottle of rum and items missing.  I did tell the desk upon check out, and am hoping I will not be charged.  Don’t stay in room 72.  The view was horrible and it was noisy at night.  The only redeeming quality was the excellent mattress and deep tub!!

title: Recomendable
text: Situación muy buena ya que se encuentra en una zona con mucho sabor , el lower east side. Barrio con artistas , negocios alternativos , mucho restaurante pequeño y ambiente nocturno. El hotel tiene un buen restaurante y mucho ambiente  . Hay que pedir habitación alta para disfrutar de las vistas . Queremos destacar la atención de Elvis , gran profesional y con mucha empatía con los huéspedes . Sin su actuación nuestra estancia  no hubiera sido la misma. Gracias Elvis . Hotel recomendable 100%

title: Top Position
text: I liked the Hotel on Rivington for its perfect position, you are in the middle of Manhattan and can reach from there every point of interest. The tube is just around the corner. Staff very friendly and the hotel was perfectly clean. My room was good but it lacked in light, I guess it makes sense to take a room in the upper flores.

title: Worst experience I’ve ever had.
text: Don’t stay here.  There’s no onsite management. Had worst experience ever.  From broken shower to noise, housekeeping not showing up and no manager available for my entire 3 night stay.  There’s too many other options in the city to choose this hotel.

title: Great location and customer service!
text: The staff was very professional and friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Very stylish with comfy beds. The location is also great. There are plenty of good restaurants very close to the hotel.

title: Only good with this place is location.
text: Only good with this place is location. I chose to stay somewere else next time. Breakfast staff were ignorant to food allergies and rude. Noicy rooms. Over all staff could improve in friendliness. Except from Doormens & Housekeeping they were great!

title: Worth considering
text: Had a five-night stay as high prices in late September meant my first choice in nearby Soho was out of budget.Location is Lower East Side, a couple of streets from the Bowery, and just round the corner from Chinatown. Quite a ‘gritty’, old school feel to the area - some graffiti but I really like that as it doesn’t feel overly polished or clinical.No concerns over safety.Arrival slightly uncomfortable as street level signage seems poor and the area and hotel bar/cafe was busy with revellers on a Saturday evening. Reception is up elevator on second floor.Had a lovely eighth-floor room with floor-to-ceiling windows and no noise. The huge bed was so comfortable. Decor has a very stylish, modern feel.Lower East Side is handy for Soho and Greenwich Village and a 20-minute walk from Brooklyn Bridge. There’s a subway station round the corner from the hotel too which can take you to Coney Island, Brooklyn and uptown.Hotel’s Cafe Medi was good and reasonably well-priced for breakfast.While many holiday-makers may opt for midtown (Times Square, Fifth Avenue etc), Hotel on Rivington is well worth considering if you want to be based elsewhere or see a different side to the city. I enjoyed my stay, although depending on price would possibly still prefer Soho as my first-choice location.

title: Easy, nice and great location
text: The staff are excellent. That’s the strength of this hotel. The location is the best. Small rooms, but to be expected in NYC and there’s a great use of space. Clean, super easy check-in and check out.

title: No longer so well appointed.
text: Rooms worn out. Over priced. And not the best service. No gluten free breakfast items to speak of. Suits can be  behutfuk as I have  stayed in one but some are just plain tired and beat up. All needs a freshener.

title: I didn’t want to leave a bad review.
text: I encountered a number unpleasant experiences during my stay. The room I was given upon checking in was a corner room on the 8 floor. Immediately did not like it as it was about to stories above the roof of a lower building with a loud fan/vent atop it.I requested a room change almost immediately and told there was a wait. I decided to ask for an upgrade to the delux corner room with balcony because I did not want to wait. The upgrade was granted with an upgrade fee.When I get to my room, I find the balcony is bolted shut from the inside with two metal plates. I call about this and the response was I can go back to the first room or stay there with “complimentary breakfast”.I decided to just accept this inconvenience as I was already tired of everything. The next morning I call about the breakfast at 11:55am and was told it wasn’t in the notes and that I couldn’t get breakfast because it end at 12:00.Long story short it was upset after upset. Worst experience in a hotel. They attempted to make it up by leaving champagne in the room which was nice and I appreciated it however, I felt it was a last minute gesture.

title: Average
text: Everything other than the helpful and friendly staff at this hotel felt pretty average. I think reviews on this hotel will very much depend on exactly what you are looking for. If you are looking for a very lively and central location then this could well be the place for you but if you are looking for a more relaxing experience surrounded by creature comforts then this may not be your place. Some things in the room could do with updating and maintenance but the steam shower rooms and the regular showers themselves are really nice.

title: Too much street noise
text: Ask for a room away from the street if there is one and maybe that would help with the street noise. I cannot recommend this hotel because we spent 3 sleepless nights due to the street noise.Room service for breakfast worked out well.  Although the restaurant was very attractive, the service was nonexistent. Twice we had to get up and go look for someone to serve us more coffee.

title: Great Location
text: Stayed here for a weekend for our anniversary and was very impressed! The location is so ideal, there is so much going on.
