We stayed in the "regular king" and our room was beautiful I loved the decor it was bright and the perfect size with great views, and the staff in the hotel was so lovely! Right when we checked one of the employees gave us 2 free coffee and wine vouchers for Cafe Medi right next door, which was so kind. Throughout the evening an employee came a brought us up warm fresh sugar cookies which I thought was a very sweet touch...but then about 20 mins later another employee knocked at our door with a complimentary bottle of cabernet and a delicious fruit plate for our anniversary!! I was completely WOW'ed, I thought this was so overly generous and I've never been to a hotel that have given us a free bottle of wine for a special occasion. It really touched me and I just want to give a huge THANK YOU to everyone working at the Hotel on Rivington you all were so wonderful and hospitable. The only negative I would have to say was that our room was 80º when we first came in and I think the heat/air system may have been broken or old in our room specifically because it took me a while to get the room cooled down. And lastly we were not able to go out onto our balcony, and I know we're allowed to be out there because we heard the people above us sitting outside that night so I guess in our room the door was jammed shut, that was a little disappointing but to be honest it was all made up by the complimentary wine and fruit plate.I would definitely come back to this hotel I would just maybe upgrade from the "regular king" to a more expensive room.

title: Great value in Lower East Side
text: Second time staying at the hotel. Loved the large rooms, the cool in-room bar offerings, and the hip location close to SoHo and all the rest. Clean, friendly. Fantastic value for the large clean rooms! Will be back.

title: Good room, poor service.
text: My husband and I stayed for two nights. The room (both bedroom and bathroom) was big for a hotel in such a central location. The room was very clean and good quality. However, do not stay here if you are looking for a night of quiet sleep. The doors and windows are super thin and you can hear anyone and everyone walking past and speaking in the hall, and car noise and construction noise outside. Some of the staff was nice, but some others were quite unfriendly and inattentive: took us 2 calls and 3 hours to send up a razor. The wait time at check out was also very long as the staff were chatting. Overall I would say the property itself is 4-star and the service is 3-star.

title: Hotel On Rivington, il mio albergo a New York
text:
Iniziamo così: io, l'Hotel On Rivington l'ho amato subito! Perché è davvero bello, è nel cuore di Manhattan, ed è in uno dei quartieri più trendy di New York, Lower East Side. 
Un albergo particolarissimo, easy chic, molto Vip e a due passi da ogni cosa. 
Design contemporaneo e molto curato, camere ampie, ben arredate e con quell'attenzione al dettaglio che ho apprezzo moltissimo. 
La cosa che ho amato di più: la doccia con vetrata con vista su Downtown. 
E poi, il vino rosso della Napa Valley per accoglierci e le piccole dolcezze - cookies al cioccolato e alle nocciole - che ci lasciavano sul cuscino prima di andare a letto. Infine, sorrisi e cortesia come in pochi altri posti e il fatto di essere nel cuore dell'ombelico del mondo. 
Per momenti speciali, scendete al piano terra, su Rivington Street e fermatevi per la colazione o per il brunch al Café Medi: maioliche colorate, stile contemporaneo e cucina mediterranea. Se desiderate un vero croissant fermatevi qui. Poi, fate breakfast con uova, pane tostato, salmone e avocado, e bellissime porzioni di frutta tropicale.

title: Great place to do some work & have a meetup
text:
We organised to have an international meetup of likeminded people in the hotel and also booked overnight stays accordingly.

Due to some shift in personel the meetup seemed to be off the calendar but Kali jumper in very well and arranged everything needed to make it a nice experience.

Also the room was great, nice view, tidy and daily cookies made it a great experience overall. Thanks

title: Great Location
text: Great price, clean room, spacious, walking distance to many areas in lower Manhattan.  Staff was courteous and friendly. Down pillows and comforter. Tile floors in rooms.Nice mini bar and refrigerator.

title: Great little hotel
text: Cool vibe, clean, great bed with bedtime cookies! Not fancy but super location in LES area with adjoining Cafe Medi!  Great price for a weekend stay and play!Very friendly staff, no problems, will be back!

title: Gute Lage, zuvorkommendes, kundenorientiertes Personal.
text: Ein in die Jahre gekommenes Hotel mit teilweise sehr schöner Aussicht auf den financial district. Die Betreuung und die Erfüllung von Kundenwünschen sind sehr gut, rasch und zuvorkommend. Vom Zimmerservice über die Verlängerung des Aufenthalts, Behebung kleiner Unzulänglichkeiten  bis zum Flughafentransport ist man da in besten Händen. Eine gute Taschenlampe und einen Spiegel braucht frau jedoch mit, im Bad ist es schummrig. Die Minibar ist eher eine Maxibar, sehr toll, aber Vorsicht, kostspielig !

title: Hotel con vista
text: Albergo molto carino a sud di Manhattan. La mia camera era al 18 piano con vista the One Trade Center. Prenotato direttamente contattando la struttura. La camera pulita con armadi molto ampi. Reception posta al secondo piano con personale molto gentile e disponibile

title: Very nice hotel!
text: The hotel was very nice and clean.  The pictures on the website are accurate.  Our room, the king deluxe was very spacious and open.  Floor to ceiling windows.  The service, food, staff were all very good. We will stay again. There is a lovely candy shop (cute toys also) across the street which is nice if you have grandchildren or others you need to take a little something home to.  There is a lovely open air bar on the same side of the street as hotel, on the corner where you can relax and play Jenga.

title: My time on the lower east side
text: Hotel on Rivington was exactly what I was looking for,  great staff, room, and service. You can keep midtown and all of the touristsLoved that we we close to what I was looking for as far as local flair. Little Italy, China town,  close to transportation

title: You're paying for the view at night
text: Corner king.Pros: beautiful view, great bed, water pressureCons: cracked windows, no updated appliances and taking a closer look, part of the room was falling apart (fixtures coming out of the wall, etc)

title: 2nd visit
text: 2nd visit to Hotel on Remmington.  It did not disappoint.  Spacious rooms, temperpedic mattresses on beds, more than enough storage.  A little noise from the street in the wee hours of the morning.  I think phone calls were not made when room was ready or to have luggage brought up to room.  Other than that, it was lovely and hope to come back!!

title: Welcome to the sauna
text: Booked this hotel based on the location on the lower east side - close to good restaurants and the Williamsburg bridge.  The room itself was fine with a good view on a high floor. The first night we were unable to sleep comfortably because the air was not working properly - set at 68 but it never got below 75 all night.  I reported to the front desk and they had it checked out while we were at the tennis tournament.  when we came back the room was at 78 and they sent someone up again - he checked it and said it would begin to cool down.  It never got below 77 that night.  When I checked out I made mention of it again - she removed a breakfast charge and said the manager would be in contact.  I never heard back from anyone after that.  We had actually paid for an upgraded room as well.  Very disappointed in level of attentiveness and follow up.

title: All the Feels and Smells
text:
I'm currently staying at this hotel and it's beautiful! Every time I walk in this amazing smell immediately brings a sense of calm and comfort. I spoke to the bellman, Lester (he's great!), and he said it's a Bespoke custom scent design from the owner's wife. I wish I could bottle this up and take it home! Same with the shampoo and lotion scents. She has great taste!

The rooms are spacious and the beds is so comfortable. 

If you're staying in the lower east side, I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Beautiful view
text: The hotel is very nice and my room had a beautiful view. People at the reception was very kind and they help us to satisfy any type of our requests. I suggest this hotel if you want to stay in the South part.

title: Excellent hotel
text: The hotel room was very spacious and clean.  The hotel staff was courteous and friendly.  It was a great place to stay while in the city.  The location was perfect and the views from the room were amazing.

title: Amazing
text: Had a wonderful weekend stay. Location. Staff.  Quality of rooms.   Views.  Everything exceeded my expectations. Thank you so much for everything   I will return and hopefully enjoy the same level of awesomeness

title: false advertising and horrible service
text: horrible service, if you are looking for a water view , please do not choose this hotel.. false advertising and they will not honor your requests. The staff does not really care .. My birthday was horrible

title: Super hotel
text: Excellent hotel tres bien situéTres bonne literie. Vue sur les building depuis la chambre (10eme étage). Bonne insonorisation excellente et métro très procheChambre et salle de bain propreCookies offerts tous les jours

title: Albergo molto originale, in perfetta sintonia con la zona e con l‘arte...
text:
Bell'albergo con stanze davvero grandi. Molto ampio anche il bagno con una grande vasca e una comoda doccia.
Dalle vetrate delle stanze si gode la vista sulla strada. Mi avrebbe fatto piacere avere una vista panoramica sulla città...
Personale molto attento alle esigenze del cliente.
Molto interessante il bar alla moda nel quale è possibile prendere un caffè gentilmente offerto dall'albergo.

title: Typical NYC at it’s best
text: This 14 years all hotel is still one of the most open on the city with ground to ceiling windows. Studios have big storage place, which is not so usual in NYC hotels Lower east side is more and more the place to stay.

title: Amazing Hotel... if you have a free schedule and absolutely nothing else planned on check-in day.
text: I reserved a hotel room here over three months before my stay, as I planned to stay for my birthday. I had already planned a brunch elsewhere in the city at 4pm and really wanted to check in early to drop some things and get changed. I called at 10am, 12pm & 2pm to see if I could check in early. I arrived at 3pm with similar intentions. (check in is at 4pm) ... long story short, I could not and I was told it would be ready at 4pm, the check in time they promised.Fine.I waited in the lobby for one hour...At 4pm... (already late for my brunch) , I walked to the check in desk only to find out that my room was STILL unavailable !!!Long story short, I ended up taking whatever room they were giving me just so I can get on to my brunch and salvage my day.The room I requested had a balcony. The room I ended up taking, although arguably an upgrade, did not have one. But I was left no choice. I had things to do!!!Long story short, if you have anywhere to be... don't book here. You will most likely waste your time and money doing so

title: great stylish hotel
text: great room, great service, cute restaurant! we stayed in the corner king suit, very comfortable and stylish and clean. outside our room fantastic restaurants and bars, very close to transportation, soho, nolita, east village

title: Beautiful room, loud events
text: I booked a high floor king tub + balcony to surprise my boyfriend for his birthday. Upon arrival we were given a room on the 19th floor (the highest floor for this particular room type). The view was unobstructed and the sunlight through the frosted shower glass was beautiful.The photos of the tub on the hotel's website don't do it justice. The tub was much larger than I imagined. The two of us could comfortably relax with the water up to our necks and still have extra space. Additionally, the "mini" fridge was stacked with all kinds of alcohol, sodas, snacks, and more. We ended up not taking anything but it was nice to be given options.Being on the 19th floor was both a blessing and a curse. It was our first time staying at this hotel and we weren't aware of the rentable event space above us on the 20th floor. Whoever booked the space had a music blasting, feet stomping rager and the sound traveled straight through the walls into our room. We weren't able to sleep until the event ended past 2am.All in all we had a fun experience here. The staff is friendly, the rooms are beautiful and spacious. Just be aware of the other rental/lounge spaces inside the hotel.

title: Excellent hotel
text: What a nice surprise- we had a fantastic stay at the Hotel Rivington.  The room was spacious, and clean.  The wall to ceiling windows are fantastic and the shower is magnificently sexy.  For those worried about privacy in the shower, one side has frosted windows.  Cookies brought to our room late afternoon was a nice treat.  The staff were all very quick and attentive.  The bartenders were more then generous!  Great for a couples get away.

title: Sexiest Hotel in NYC!
text: This is the sexiest hotel in NYC! Lower east side location is perfect, close to amazing restaurants and The Slipper Room. The room is spacious and we loved the balcony and the beautiful views! The Japanese soaking tub was so luxurious,  as was the robes to use during the stay. I have stayed many times and will stay again!

title: Birthday bisit
text: Had a night here for my birthday booked by my thoughtful other half. We stayed in a corner suite, which was spacious, clean and well presented. My only wish would have been to have been further up the hotel as we were 9th floor, but we were told this wasn't possible. The large windows were fabulous and the sound from the street was blocked out very well. The large bathroom with double shower was amazing and at night, I could have looked out the window forever, even though we couldn't see any landmarks from our floor, just loved being in the middle of New York. The hotel is close to lots of restaurants and bars and we paid a trip to the creperie which was amazing. So happy with my stay and late check out was a bonus. The hotel is quite expensive but it's probably standard for NY. Would definitely come back!

title: Great hotel downtown
text: I walked past the door of the hotel once: not very visible on the street. And I wasn't sure how to find the lobby. But, other than that, I had a great experience in every way. Big room, well appointed and quiet. I thought it was a great value.

title: Es un hotel con arte algo diferente
text:
Excelente gusto lo que no me parece es la alfombra roja en los pasillos falta iluminación en el baño la tv no prendio pero la cama esta muy confortable esta limpio la habitacion el piso es de duela y te encuentras con un cuadro y su explicacion en un folleto.

hay una vinateria en la esquina y a la vuelta hay una taqueria para aquellos mexicanos que les gusten los tacos ,el metro esta a 1 cuadra y tambien hay una lavenderia a una cuadra

title: What started as a great trip, ended with poor customer service.
text: I had a wonderful stay at the hotel, beautiful room, great room. I was looking forward to returning during my future business visits, however, the hotel disappointed with poor customer service after my departure. I was charged over $90 in mini-bar charges even though we never consumed anything. I called the hotel two separate occasions and the customer service representative said they would take care of it. They never did, and never got back to me. I am extremely disappointed that not only did the hotel charge me for something I did not consume, but they don't have the decency to return a call and follow through to fix a mistake. Here's to hoping this will improve their customer service for future guests.

title: Exceptional Boutique Hotel
text: Elegant luxury in the lower east side of New York. Perfect location for an authentic New York experience. Views of the Freedom Tower and famous blue building from your balcony. Rooms and bath are totally upscale and the welcome team and service from Kenny and Pamela made the stay perfect. Wine at the adjoining Medi Cafe and cookies delivered to the room are gratis and part of the delightful welcome at this hotel. You can’t go wrong here. Fine meeting place for friends.

title: Excellent hip hotel
text: The rooms was great and spacious for a nyc hotel.  Location was convenient and a fun area for our visit. All our activities around the wedding we attended were close to this hotel. The front desk staff, specifically Kenny, was extremely courteous, friendly and helpful. We love this hotel!

title: Inconvenienced
text: Plumbing issues. Lighting issues. No vanity to apply make up..dark bathroom., toilet weak flush, clogged, running for days, even after supposedly fixed, had to sit on floor to use small table near window to apply make up

title: Great Hotel on LES!
text: The location can’t be beat honestly as the LES has tons of restaurants and local flavor. I stayed only one night as a local New Yorker for a special occasion and the service and staff didn’t disappoint. While the wine in the mini bar was seriously over priced but it’s what you expect at a hotel. So bring your own if you don’t want the price tag. But overall the room was worth the money for what I needed it for. I would definitely go back if I needed to be in that area again.

title: If you want privacy while showering, maybe look elsewhere...
text:
I recently went on a trip with my partner around the states and our last stop was New York. We chose Hotel on Rivington mainly because of the location, and to be honest the photos looked great online.

When we arrived at the lobby on the second floor we were the only two waiting. The guy at the reception was speaking on the phone for at least 3 minutes. When he finished his phone call he didn't greet us, he didn't welcome us to the hotel and he didn't apologise for leaving us standing there. We didn't mind having to wait while he was on the phone but he at least could've apologised and said 'hello', not just 'You're checking in?' - friendlier reception staff or some basic customer service should be a necessity in any hotel.

Everything looked fine when we got to our room on the 5th floor, until I saw the bathroom. I can't understand why anyone thought it was a good idea to put clear glass in a shower that looks directly into the back of people's houses? Clearly very easy for anyone in these houses to see you while showering/using the bathroom. Bizarre! When we spoke to reception, he laughed and said 'A lot of people complain about this, we'll send someone up to your room to put a privacy screen up'. Shortly after, someone from maintenance came to our room and stuck a sheet up on the window. Seems silly that they created windows like this in the first place. Very uncomfortable!

The photos of the room on the website didn't match what we got at the hotel. First of all from the photos it looks like the room has a city view, ours had a horrible view of an alley. We asked if we could change rooms to a nicer view, and were told that we weren't in the right price bracket for a room with a nicer view. The room we chose showed photos of a city view from the window, not an alley view, feels a bit deceiving? 

The rooms are missing simple things that a lot of other hotels are supplying. I don't care if someone pays for the most expensive room or the least expensive room, there are some things that should be in every room i.e. A full length mirror (Only one mirror in the bathroom, had to look at every outfit I wore in the elevator), bedside lockers (had to leave my phone on the floor charging along with my bottle of water), no ironing board or iron (travelling for 3 weeks, you need to be able to iron your clothes).

There were positives - great location, shower was powerful, bed was comfortable, housekeeping staff did a great job, air con was excellent. 

All in all, I don't think we will be rushing back to stay here any time soon.

title: Top-Ausblick über die Lower East Side!
text:
Positiv:
+ Hotelzimmer wirken recht neu, sehr geräumig und sauber, cooler Ausblick dank raumhoher Fenster (höhere Stockwerke natürlich empfehlenswerter)

+ bequemes Bett, sehr schönes Bad mit Badewanne und Dusche direkt am Fenster (King Room Kategorie)

+ Subway-Station in Gehweite, ebenso gibt es um's Eck einen 24/7 Laden. Die Umgebung des Hotels könnte aber etwas besser sein.

+ Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist für NY ok

+ sehr gut gefüllte Minibar (siehe Foto), ist aber natürlich nicht kostenlos

Kritikpunkte:
- Hoteleingang kaum zu erkennen (außer durch Namen auf Teppich am Eingang)

- hellhörige Zimmer und das Licht ist teils sehr schummrig

- wenn Frühstück inbegriffen, dann nur sehr abgespeckte Auswahl (à la carte, kein Buffet). Würde man von der großen Karte bestellen, so sind die Preise horrend

title: Clean with good views of the City
text:
Stayed here on business. The room was clean and came with a balcony - fantastic views of downtown Manhattan! The room also featured one of the biggest baths I've ever seen - it was essentially a swimming pool. It was great. 

The reception staff were fairly casual - not the most well trained but they did ok. The reception is also on the second floor which was a bit odd but given this is Manhattan - space doesn't come easily.

Breakfast is served in the restaurant downstairs. We were offered the continental breakfast - fairly basic but did the job. It seemed they were fairly short staffed as it took a while to bring it out (doesn't take much to put a croissant and meat on a plate!) and it was over priced for what you got. Never the less there aren't many places elsewhere to get breakfast so I didn't mind. 

Overall it was a good stay and would come back again. Good location to access the Financial District and East Village

title: We had a just perfect time at a beautiful, friendly place
text:
The rooms are very nice and big and specially the front desk were totally helpful and friendly! The beds are cosy, subway is just round the corner - perfect! 

We totally enjoyed our stay, thank you so much for it!

title: Great Value
text: Modern and Stylist with a great vibe.  The location and price were unbeatable.  The hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and the location was second to none. Hotel offers eatery, a bar and Lounge for those interested in the night life.  I personally thought the lounge was nice but very pricey, drinks were about $25 each....Ouch!!! After 2 drinks I left and went somewhere else.  Overall, I  Would recommend it and plan to return.

title: Great price/ great size of rooms
text: Great experience in Hotel on Rivington   , Daniel the GM of the Hotel  made sure i will have the best time in Ny  -  rooms are VERY big   , prices are lower than anywhere else i looked  , stuff very very  friendly and responsive  - Highly recommend !

title: Excellent!
text: Great Hotel! Clean, large, quiet, wonderful suite. Amazing service! It was my husbands birthday and we received a complementary bottle of red wine! The bed was very comfortable and I was able to get a good night sleep. A restaurant on the first floor of the hotel is cozy, convenient offering delicious meals for breakfast and dinner! Highly recommend both!

title: We’ll be back!
text:
The Hotel on Rivington May be one of the best kept secrets on the Lower East Side.  The staff are consistently gracious, the public spaces are inviting and the rooms are sleek without being sterile.  The hotel’s sister restaurant, Cafe Medi, reminded us of the elegant but relaxed ambience we last experienced in Havana two years ago.

We would highly recommend the Hotel on Rivington but we’re afraid that if we do, it will become too chic and we’ll never get good prices on rooms again !

title: Do not stay here
text: The location was the only positive part of this hotel. It was close to restaurants and shops. I was told the room I booked was given away upon arrival. They also placed 3 holds on my card for the duration of my trip. Which held up my vacation money the whole time! Total nightmare! A front desk person apologized when I complained and told me their post system was garbage. Unbelievable!

title: Still a Believer After Multiple Stays
text: Once again, a wonderful visit to this LES hotel. Staff were extremely friendly and professional, with a special mention to Belmary. Upgraded to a corner king with balcony. Although tiny and vertigo inducing, the balcony was a great place to look out over downtown New York. The room was sizeable and bright. Café Medi is an upgrade from the former restaurant. Had two breakfasts there that were both commendable and fairly priced.

title: Perfect views, perfect location!
text: Hotel on Rivington is located in the heart of the lower east side, walking distance from popular bars, night clubs, rooftops, and shopping districts. The rooms are incredible and the floor to cieling windows give an unbeatable view of the city. Cafe Medi is right downstairs and also a popular brunch/dinner spot. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be back

title: Not Happy with Service
text:
Originally I thought I had booked the Unique Suite for Saturday 15th, but when I called in the morning of the 15th to request a specific suite the hotel informed me that i booked the wrong night and that i would have to pay again.  They also said they could not refund my money for the incorrect date.

To make matters worse on Sunday Morning at around 4:30am water start to pour out of the ceiling.  The water soaked our luggage and a couple pieces of furniture in the room.  I was informed by the front desk that someone would be in-touch, that still has not happened.

title: Value and a fabulous neighborhood
text: Location is amazing especially if you want to explore downtown. The rooms are large and comfortable which is unusual for downtown hotels. Ask for a room on a high level to get the views. Loved our experience there.

title: Boutique Hotel on LES
text:
The hotel is located in the heart of the LES. The tenement museum is just on the next block.  The hotel lobby is on the second floor and quite dark, not very inviting.  Our room was spacious with lots of light and a king size bed. No bed stands on one side, so you have to put your glasses, cell phone etc on the floor.  The bathroom is interesting with one full wall of glass. Beware the shower  has a full glass window, half frosted facing the outside ally. Some may think its cool, and others may not be comfortable.  There is an nicely stocked bar and snacks available.  Quite frankly, I would have liked a less-stocked fridge of booze, so I could store some cold water.  Also, I would have liked more counter space and drawers in th room, instead of a big coffee table.  I guess that didn't fit into the boutique feeling.  There is  Cafe Medi on the first floor and we received complimentary wine and coffees.  This is a nice cafe where we had breakfast.
Beware, that there is a lot of private space in the hotel which is for those people who use the hotel as shared office space. One night we had to leave the lobby because there was an event- which was a happy hour for those who use the hotel for an office. As a hotel guest, I was not happy about this.
Overall, the hotel is a cool place to stay on the LES.

title: The views were amazing, the loud dog, not so much
text: I very much enjoyed my stay. The room and view was beautiful. it was clean. The staff was wonderful and professional. My only complaint was a rather loud dog across the hall who barked continuously when the owner left it in the room alone. I also would have loved to have a microwave in the room. However, I really enjoyed my stay. This was my second stay with the hotel on Rivington.

title: Warm greeting upon arrival!
text: Hotel on Rivington is in an excellent location in the LES, with close proximity to all the bars and restaurants. Friendly and welcoming staff and room cleanliness was superb! Will definitely stay here again.

title: Tired with a view
text: This Hotel was one of my favorites in New York City, but she is getting old and showing it.  This hotel use to have a swank upbeat contemporary entrance,  It was curvy and colorful; red and powerful.  But for some reason they took it all out and remolded with this older 70's retro look that makes me think I am going to visit my grandmother in Oklahoma.  Wood paneled waist coat and golden brown woven wallpaper. The furniture and paintings to mach, so you know it was deliberate. So it went from Live with a vibe to dank and restful.  Like, I said she is getting tired, but the remodel seemed to put her right in the old folks home.  The restaurant was also remodeled to look more country french and that is what the hotel began to remind me of- a hotel in Paris - tired and in desperate need of cleaning.  However,  the rooms still have great views of New York and with her floor to ceiling glass she shows it off 24/7.  I enjoyed watching fireworks from two to three location and if you can get past the down stairs the rooms look pretty much the same as they did 4 years ago.  Yeah there is some damage on the molding but the bed was very very comfy and the views are the best in all of LES.  Be sure to book a corner room if your going to stay here,  It really makes a difference.

title: 4th of july
text: ok  stay   WE went here for view of fireworks and we were told when reservation made that we would have one from our room   We did not   They did compensate though by giving us access to PH roof / party ....

title: Outstanding Time
text: I booked the unique suite for my 21st birthday and stopped by the hotel a week before my stay to check out since i've never stayed here before. Chasity greeted me and we chatted briefly, and when I came for check in the next week she was there, remembered me, and that it was my birthday! She was so kind, along with the rest of staff - they sent up a nice bottle of champagne and a plate of cookies to help me celebrate. They were also able to upgrade my room to the Terrace Suite for a small fee. Truly so worth it and the best birthday I have ever had. Will most definitely be back.

title: Stand-out service from Ken!
text: Great room with an amazing view in a super location, but it was Ken who made it a truly great stay. He was friendly, welcoming and hospitable. A real hotel person when so many people who work in hotels just aren’t.

title: Excellent stay!
text: We were extremely happy with our stay.  The rooms were spotless and the cookies left at night were a great touch!  The room was larger than what I usually see in NYC and was very comfortable.  It was so nice to spend all day and night walking around the city and then come back to our nice room to relax.  We will definitely be coming back!

title: Website depictions exceed reality
text:
The lobby is small, dim, dated decor-wise and down-at-heel - and elevators to get up to the second floor reception were busy and also small and dilapidated looking. Reception is tiny and has no decor whatsoever. Bad first impression.

I had requested a high floor, but got a low floor with no view (except of the back of other buildings). When I went to change rooms, was told that would be a different price bracket (not mentioned anywhere at booking) and that they were fully booked.

The elevators were slow, the room was dated and dim, and the "balcony" (looked like a fire escape) was sealed shut (it overlooked a garbage area behind buildings so no one would ever want to stick their nose out). 

Bizarrely, the bathroom had a window wall in the shower that was only partially frosted, leaving one side with a full view out to the buildings/balconies behind - leaving anyone going to the bathroom or showering exposed to neighbours.

There is also no place to put anything. No luggage rack, no bedside table on one side of the bed and a tiny ledge on the other side, and the smallest bathroom countertop I've ever encountered in a hotel. 

And the lovely-looking images of a rooftop patio on the hotel booking site is NOT accessible to hotel guests - it is a private event space only.

All in all, a disappointment. There are many better options in the lower east side (The Ludlow) and nearby Soho (The James or Nomo Soho).

title: Family wedding
text: We loved the hotel and the location . The only problem was the bathroom lighting is horrible for getting makeup on . The rooms have wonderful natural lighting but no mirrors in the room except the bathroom and one full length on a closet door .

title: Even with a bust Boiler hard to beat the location on LES
text: Super stylish room with absolutely stunning views (corner full glass floor to ceiling), staff were super helpful and even made the lack of hot water bearable , the bar restaurant downstairs was so lively with great music and vibe

title: The Hotel,on Rivington
text: This hotel may not be for everyone, it’s a  boutique hotel, a bit funky (in a good way). It was a perfect location for us with both bus and train service nearby to the places we like best. Good places to eat in the area, some shopping. The room was clean, plenty of hot water & a good shower head. The tub is gigantic by  any standard, probably 4ft deep! We had a tiny terrace with a table for 2. Hotel staff were helpful, friendly, always available. If you like the culture of the Lower East Side, the Village-East and West this is a great place to stay.

title: Clean, polite and an outstanding location
text:
We never expected such a familiar, friendly and polite atmosphere of the entire staff. It was absolutely great!
Wheelchairusers be advised to check the hight of the bathroom sink and keep in mind that the showerhead is fixed.
The restaurant of the hotel is highly recommended!
All in all absolutely worth being visited.

title: Good Hotel with Horrible Front Desk Service
text:
My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a business trip for 6 nights from June 9 to 16. There are many positives about the hotel but let me go directly to main negative: the front desk. 

Upon check in, we were greeted by a woman named ELMARIE who will go down in our books as one of the worst receptionists we have EVER dealt with. So this is what happened: We checked into our hotel room on the 9th floor and were surprised by how untidy the room was (hair on the couch, hair on the bed, dust on bathroom, chipping walls, candle wax in the bathroom burnt, sticky floor). We called Elmarie and told her our situation. She then started arguing with us over the phone saying the room was cleaned. BUT IT WAS NOT. I had to practically beg her to send up housekeeping to inspect it. She then told us that we can be transferred to another room if we are willing to wait outside for a couple of hours. The housekeeping came and we showed them the room. No response from Elmarie for the next 4 hours. We had to call her to ASK FOR AN UPDATE. She said that the room was inspected and it was clean and that there was nothing she can do. SERIOUSLY?! She had to wait 4 hours and us calling her to tell her this? I asked to speak to the manager and thankfully he moved us to a much better room on the 14th floor. Honestly, we've stayed in different kinds of hotels - from the Sheratons of the world to the St Regis to the Ritz - never have I encountered a receptionist as plain arrogant and unhelpful as Elmarie. 

But wait, there is more... Strike 2 is when I called the front desk the next day asking for complimentary water. It was again Elmarie. She told me that they should have refilled the fridge. I told her they haven't. Instead of just sending up two freaking bottles, she told me sorry just wait the housekeeping to refill it. It was 7pm. I was done dealing with his horrible receptionist the entire stay. 

Aside from Elmarie which is the main negative, the hotel had a lot of positives:

- great view from the room
- comfortable linens and bed
- good airconditioning
- absolutely wonderful location
- great manager who helped transfer us to a better room
- delicious breakfast every morning
- really lovely hotel housekeeping lady who cleaned our room every morning! She was the sweetest!
- rooms bigger than most in NYC

It's really sad and eye-opening that instead of the 5 star review that this hotel could have easily gotten, I have to take off 2 stars all because of Elmarie and her horrible attitude. And it seems like a lot of people have noticed. When we were at breakfast, we chatted with a couple visiting from Europe and they had the same negative feedback about the receptionist (surprise surprise: Elmarie) and her attitude. 

To the hotel management, please hire front desk people who help guests solve problems and make their stay better and not the other way around. People like Elmarie are doing a disservice to the great amenities you offer.

title: Great hotel on lower east side
text: This was a small boutique hotel.  It was very clean an modern and beautifully decorated with original artwork in each room.  The hotel is in a great location and close to the train, Essex Street Market place and many fine restaurants.  There is a municipal parking lot around the corner and great $1.00 pizza slices as well.

title: Great hotel, great location
text: This was our second stay at the Rivington. We love the Lower East Side and our son, daughter in law and grandson live in the East Village. was modern, bed was comfortable staff was great. We would recommend the hotel and will stay there again.

title: Great
text: Fun time for my sister's bachelorette party, the hotel was clean, decorated nicely, and was a great location for all the fun stuff we had planned to do.  Would come back and definitely am recommending to all of my future out-of-town guests.

title: Very disappointing
text: Location is perfect, that's about the end of the good. During our stay we started with a thermostat issue which wouldn't be a problem on it's own. A simple request for a razor was forgotten and on further inquiry, they ran out. The smoke detector started the low battery beep at 3am. That alone should have warranted some sort of refund. The poor tech who came to fix it was pretty embarrassed.  In the end, they charged me for the complementary breakfast. They fixed it, and it may have been an accident but the confluence of these issues made me think it was a little more than bad luck. I wrote to them about it all and got no response. There's hundreds of hotels in the lower east side, stay at another.

title: First time in NYC - Thanks Ken!
text:
My girlfriend and I took our first trip to New York and stayed at the Hotel on Rivington for the first couple of nights. When we arrived Wednesday night, Ken at the front desk made sure we were well taken care of. I’m serious, he went above and beyond to make sure our first stay in New York was the best it could be. When we checked in, he upgraded our room to a higher floor (19th floor) with an incredible view of the city and told us he was born and raised in the area if we needed directions, suggestions, or ideas on what to do. 

When we got to our room, there were complimentary red velvet cookies, popcorn, and bottles of water waiting for us (we thought it was a nice touch). Initially we thought the room was a little on the smaller side, but then we realized it was about average size for New York standards. We also noticed there was no iron or ironing board in the room so we called the front desk (my man Ken answered the phone); literally within 60 seconds, someone was knocking on our door. That’s what I call quick service!

On our last day, we were told check out was at 12:00PM (noon), but not for us. We told Ken we couldn’t check in to our next hotel until later that day and he arranged for our check out time to be at 2:00PM free of charge. Once 2:00PM came around we went downstairs to check out (even though we could have done it online). There was a small line for the front desk, but Ken had everything for us ready to go (paper receipt as I asked for on the first day) and even came around the desk to shake my hand and thanked us for choosing the Hotel on Rivington for our first time in the city. 

If I knew I was going to receive this level of service, I would have never booked the second hotel and just stayed here. Ken, thanks a bunch! You made this a great trip.

title: Great for Work and Pleasure
text: LES is so much more affordable than its neighboring SoHo. I got a suite with a full balcony that I laid out on one morning. The bathroom and amenities were great. It's unusual for a hotel's mattress to be anything but bad, but this was a combination of memory foam but firm. I loved the turndown service and looked forward to my cookies and popcorn each night. And I can't complain about the drink vouchers provided. Also, the artwork was provoking and cool.

title: Keith is a gem
text: My second time staying at this Beautiful hotel. Keith that works at the front desk was so kind and accommodating. He made sure we got everything we were promised in booking the hotel. Keep up the good work and great hospitality.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: This hotel is chic and comfortable and great location. Belmary at the front desk was extremely helpful as well. Staff is awesome! Mini bar is a plus. Love the design and the artwork by Domingo Zapata as well.

title: Fun rooftop
text: Went here for a unlimited wine and brunch event on the rooftop and really enjoyed it. The rooftop has great views and it’s 3 stories so more then enough room even when crowded. The food was absolutely delicious with stuffed strawberry and cream pancakes and mini burgers. I think it was just for this event but I will love to go back if they have it again.

title: Excellent place, Excellent service
text: I enjoyed staying at Hotel on Rivington. Excellent service. Spacious room. Great ushers. Great food at Cafe Medi. Loved the courtesy they extend to you when you need a Taxi. Great location. Enjoyed running through the bridge.

title: Great hotel in Lower East Side
text: Fabulous accommodations with a great view in Lower East Side. Easy access to  all attractions in area with great restaurants and nightlife. Broadway shows only a short ride away. Really enjoyed our stay.

title: Shower stall has a window
text: I was in a room on the seventh floor.  The shower stall in the bathroom has a glass exterior wall made up of three panes of glass.  Two of the panes of glass were frosted.  The third pane of glass was not frosted.  There was a building across the alley from the hotel with numerous windows that could be seen when you looked out of the unfrosted pane of glass in my shower stall.  I assume since I could see those windows form my shower stall then people could look out the windows in the building across the alley and see into my shower stall.  I brought this to the attention of the employee at the check-in desk.  He informed me that all of the rooms were like this and that when I took a shower the clear pane in my shower would steam up.  I would not book a room in this hotel if I knew I could not take a shower in private.

title: Horrible
text: They charge $150 even for service dogs saying that they need to “deep clean” the room after an animal visit when they didn’t even put me in the clean room in the first place. Horrible experience. ....

title: Fun in NY
text: The Rivington has a great location and is near several great points of interest. Small issues though made stay weird. Would have liked house cleaning to check utilities before okaying the room and would have liked front desk to call me back about lost item after they said they would.1

title: A wee bit tired, and in need of some restaurant staff attitude adjustments
text:
In the heart of the bar and restaurant zone in the northern LES, the Hotel on Rivington is well located for those who want to be in the middle of everything, particularly on the weekend.  It can be loud, with motorcycles and shouting bar goers late into the night on a Saturday, but if you choose to stay here you might in fact be one of them.  Overall the property has great views, is close to many great restaurants and a the burgeoning lower east side gallery scene.  The rooms are getting a bit tired and are in need of a bit of a makeover, but frankly are priced to reflect this.

I would likely have given the hotel a 3.5 or so, but I had such a negative experience trying to order breakfast to take back to my room from the staff at Cafe Medi (in the hotel), that I bumped it down a bit to reflect it.  It's a shame because I definitely will not be coming back based in large part on the attitude I received from the folks there...

title: Gem of a hotel in the Lower East Side
text:
Stayed here with my sister for a long weekend in NYC and couldn’t recommend it highly enough. Staff are super friendly, knowledgeable about the local area and keen to help. 
Rooms are well appointed and a decent size for New York. We had a corner suite on the 9th floor and loved it. 
Our stay had breakfast included and there was a wide variety of options available. We had cocktails in the bar too, which had a great busy vibe. 
The Lower East Side is so young and vibrant. Streets are busy and there’s lots going on. I loved the noise and the hustle and bustle, there’s tons of great bars and restaurants within a few block radius. Don’t come here looking for sedate!!
We will definitely visit again.

title: Gutes Hotel in LES
text: Herausragend ist die Lage in LES. Perfekt gelegen, um LES, East Village oder Williamsburg zu erkunden. Die Zimmer und das hotel sind alles in allem in Ordnung und gut. Es ist leider in dem Hotel und auf den Fluren teilweise laut. Es gibt einen Fitnessraum, den wir auch drei mal benutzt haben. Wir hatten aber den Eindruck, dass dieser nicht sauber gemacht worden ist. Zudem waren zwei der Cardiogeräte nicht funktionsfähig.

title: Amazing Beautiful
text: Lower East side. Perfect location. we walked to Brooklyn bridge were we rented bikes for a few hours. took us about 29 mins to get to our location (not a bad walk). 6 mins to the restaurant we had reservations for and 10 min walk to the Slipper room. Oh and the DL night club wasn't bad at all 10 min walk. Overall everything was walking distant. The staff members were soooo nice super cool. Shout out to Belmarie and Melissa who helped us out a lot. These ladies rocked!! they made our stay super comfortable, anything we needed these two were right there.

title: Great boutique hotel in a great neighborhood
text: I was here for business and was pleasantly surprised at the great location and overall experience at Hotel on Rivington.  The rooms are great affording breathtaking views, mine had a balcony, and the services was top notch.

title: Nicht mehr das was es mal war...
text:
Einrichtung und Service in die Jahre gekommen.
Klimaanlage und Armaturen funktionieren u.a. nicht mehr einwandfrei.
Hilfsbereitschaft des Personals hält sich in Grenzen.
Gute Lage, aber längst nicht mehr das, was es mal war.

title: Good
text: Rivington not-even-trained staff can't even spell "service" Nicely furnished and great views but if you expect ANY level of professionalism or service, "fah-ghet-aboutit" If you have this expectation, you won't be disappointed. Could not get appropriately hot water in the shower, which I'll call "misty...More

title: Average...at best...
text: Booked this hotel for one night (glad only one) to try something/someplace different in NYC.  Upon arriving, the staff was pleasant, and indicated that our room was not ready.  Returning to check if our room was ready(approx 3/330) we were told by the desk woman that the mgr had "upgraded" us to a balcony (very narrow terrace) room with soaking tub.  Funny, but that is what we had booked.  She also indicated that the mgr had corrected our rate as we had paid too much.  Upon checking out, there had been no adjustment.  the best part of the room was the soaking tub.  The room needed some serious TLC, broken door handle, electrical sockets that didn't work, dim light in the bathroom, etc.  Front desk is hit or miss, sometimes they answer the phone other times, not so much.  We've stayed in many hotels in NYC, doesn't hold a shadow to most.  Room service was quick, as long as you could actually contact them.  ROOMS ARE NOT SOUND PROOF, we had a want to be DJ on the balcony above us who was playing music on the "terrace" much louder than necessary and neighbors next to us who were loud talkers (with guests), HAD MUCH HIGHER HOPES FOR THIS HOTEL.  we did advise the desk of the problems at check out, she indicated that she would pass the info on to maintenance...sadly, not really sure it made a difference.

title: Hotel On Rivington
text: There are windows in the shower that are placed in such a way that observers in the apartment building next door or individuals in the nearby parking lot can easily watch you shower, without hiding the private bits.  This is highly disturbing and uncomfortable.

title: Lower East Side Gem
text: I loved the location as it is near so much great dining, two subway stations, cabs were plentiful, and the hotel can also arrange for a driver. The room I stayed in was clean and spacious. There was the extra touch of nightly turn down service complete with a plate of cookies sitting bedside. The biggest draw for me though was the gigantic steam shower!  It was definitely pampering and I was spoiled to have to leave it. The staff was always accommodating from early check in, giving directions, dining recommendations, baggage storage, car service to airport etc. I am already planning to stay here again.

title: Graduation weekend
text: Celebrated my graduation and my boyfriends bday over the weekend and it was amazing! Great view and service. Room was on the 19th floor had no problems. Worth it to spend a little extra for the higher floor rooms. Will definitely be back.

title: Great time!
text: I love this Hotel! The only thing I didn’t like is that there’s no fridge and microwave in the room. I love the view and the modern look. Oh and paying an extra 50 dollars just to get a unlocked balcony door was a bit much.

title: Not what it seems
text:
This place is most definitely a bit of lipstick on a pig. Beautiful view, cool neighbourhood, very friendly maintenance staff, yes maintenance staff. 

AC needed to be fixed, filter covered in dust so thick it was black, tiles coming up from the floor in the bathroom. If you took a quick glance at the hotel and room everything seems nice, but once you look a little closer you'd see the true picture. 

But by far the biggest disappointment with this place was the front desk staff who seemed aloof and disinterested. Many guests were having similar issues with their rooms, for example one couple when we checked in, two when we checked out and one lady who was in the hallway flagged down a worker when we were heading out for dinner. 

Again, the maintenance staff, housekeepers were fantastic, but front desk, simply the worst service I've experienced at a hotel.

title: Charm but a little gross
text: Room was misrepresented, Not a value for the money and falling apart. Staff were kind but did nothing to correct any issues and seemed unsympathetic. We offered to pay more for the amenities we wanted and were told it was not an option.

title: Mother-Daughter Escape
text:
This hotel was a great stay for our weekend. Situated in a LES neighbourhood with an amazing vibe. Multiple great eats for serious Foodies within walking distance,awa shopping etc. Staff was amazing, Alex at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. We had booked a King, and were pleasantly upgraded to a King “deluxe” corner room. Nice views from 11th floor!
The only thing I would mention for those who tend to use room service for food-beverages...this is not available Sundays after 5,nor Mondays.
Would definitely come back and not hesitate as a recommend.

title: original
text: Arrivée en peut spéciale ,la façade ne représente rien mais les chambres sont vraiment sympas .Le lit est génial et la chambre vraiment calme .Situé au Sud de Manhattan pas loin de soho et des visites touristiques .Le métro est juste à coté .Rien à redire sur cet hotel .

title: BEWARE!!!
text: BEWARE!!! My family stayed at the Hotel on Rivington when we traveled to New York for my daughter’s graduation ceremony. When we first arrived, the hotel was great aesthetically and we had all of the amenities that we needed, but things took a turn for the worse on our first full day. Hotel staff warned that the water for the entire hotel would be turned off for maintenance for a period of time, which was fine, but when it was turned back on, the water pressure in our bathroom was extremely low—so low that it was impossible to shower in the small trickle of water. When we spoke to staff about the issue, they refused to look at the plumbing because they “needed to respect the privacy” of our neighbors who had a “do not disturb” sign on their door. Since the hotel is fully booked they were unable to give us a new room and told us to simply work with what we have with no attempts to address the issues or compensate in any other way.

title: Great Stay!
text: My go to hotel whenever I’m in New York City! Location is perfect for shopping, dining and sight seeing. The staff is always accommodating, friendly and professional! I would like to recognize the Doormen for always greeting the guest with a friendly smile. Will never stay anywhere else.

title: Muss nicht sein
text: Das beste am Hotel ist die Lage in der Lower East Side, nah an SoHo, Little Italy und TriBeCa, so dass man unendlich viele etwas außergewöhnliche Möglichkeiten zum Essen und Shoppen hat. Das war es dann aber auch schon. Die Zimmer des Hotels sind ganz ok - wir hatten ein etwas größeres mit Sitzecke und Balkon in einem der „oberen“ Stockwerke gebucht (es gibt sowieso nur 20, was für Manhattan nicht so richtig viel ist) -, aber die staubigen Plüschhocker und Felle über den Sesseln schaut man besser nicht genauer an... Bett und Bad sind ganz ok. Die Dusche direkt am Fenster macht anfangs etwas stutzig, ist aber ganz witzig und funktional. Wer irgendwelche „Amenities“ erwartet, ist fehl am Platz; selbst bei den Föns hat erst der dritte richtig funktioniert, den wir bekommen haben. Schlicht nervig ist allerdings das Personal, das verzweifelt versucht, dem Hotel Coolness zu verleihen, indem es Service-Wünschen nur widerwillig nachkommt. Koffer aus- und einladen zum Beispiel scheint nicht in der Arbeitsbeschreibung zu stehen. Und das ist dann halt in dieser Preisklasse auch für New York ein Unding.

title: Great location, nice view, rooms okay but bad services
text: We loved our stay in hotel rivington mainly of the location and the view of our room. Ask for a high level room! Regarding the breakfast and the front desk it was the baddest service we had in New York. We took only one breakfast there. It took them 45 minutes to cook two plates. No one says sorry.

title: Great location, so so room
text: We stayed in a high floor corner room.  The view was fantastic and there was a long narrow terrace with a small table and 2 chairs.  There are no drawers or shelves in the room, only one shelf in the closet above the hanging area.  There is only one plug in the room next to the sofa and hard to get to.  Great shower, but the sink faucet was hard to use.  The hotel is in a great area.  We loved being in the Lower East Side.  Next time I would pick a different hotel.

title: Disappointing first time in New York
text: This hotel was selected and recommended by  the wedding party. We were excited by the web site and were disappointed upon arrival. We were put in a small lower floor on the street side. We had booked early and selected an upgrade room.  We were told the hotel was booked and no other rooms were available. We moved to another hotel after our event was over.

title: Excellent choice for work and play
text: Hotel on Rivington is a hidden gem in the heart of my favorite New York neighborhood, the Lower East Side.  With quick access to public transportation to get uptown it was ideal for my business trip, and being in the center of LES was great die exploring the great restaurants and nightlife of LES and surrounding in the evenings.  I’d highly recommend Hotel on Rivington to business and leisure travelers visiting New York.

title: Nice Hotel - be careful of weekend nights
text: This is one of the nicer hotels in LES - the rooms are great, service is very friendly. One thing to be aware of is that if you are there on a Friday or Saturday night and your room faces Rivington, expect to be kept awake by cars honking/people yelling until 4am. This wasn’t a problem on the weeknights we stayed, but was annoying on the weekend if you go to bed before the bars close.

title: Great hotel
text: The room was spotless - love the brands of shampoos/soaps.  Cute balcony - hard wood floors and one of the best mini bars ever - anything you could want is in there - and if you don't - no worries.  Very helpful friendly staff.  Comfy firm memory foam bed - slept like a baby! tv had some issues and you could hear the city noise but I found it to be pleasant.

title: Still, The Best Hotel Hands-Down In NewYork!
text: I have been staying at Hotel on Rivington for years now, both for business and pleasure. I just returned from a business trip where I spent 3 days at my favorite hotel. Picking a hotel to stay at in NYC can be overwhelming, I am so thrilled to have found the best by far and will continue to go back every time I'm there, which is often! From the moment you step out of the cab, you know that you have arrived at someplace very special. From the doorman to the smiling folks at the front desk, you are met with a smile. The rooms are beyond amazing with huge windows providing gorgeous views of the city. The beds are incredibly comfortable and when you return at the end of the day to go to sleep, you'll find freshly baked cookies on the bedside table. Some rooms have balconies that you can actually go out on and take in the view. The rooms are clean with inviting furniture and a large TV. Room service is quick and the food is some of the best I've every had. The bar is very nice with friendly service and great drinks. If you need a conference room, you got it, this is a hotel that caters to both business and leisure travelers. The feel of the hotel is modern meets comfortable with a friendly overlay. I maintain, why would you stay anywhere else in NY?!

title: Comfortable and cool
text: We picked this LES hotel for the location...so many great restaurants in walking distance...movies around the corner as well as subway station. We were given a free upgrade and had a litttle balcony and deep soaking tub which we loved after tramping around NYC all day! The room had a small sofa and coffee table which was great for wine and cheese before dinner and coffee and pastry at breakfast. The bed is a firm Temperpedic with crisp Italian Frette sheets. Super clean bed feel free to lounge without feeling creeped out. The comforter is encased in the same sheeting material.great pillows and two robes. Hairdryer is full size and the toiletries are also Italian. You don’t even need to bring your own with this quality! Lower East side is up and coming...hip restaurants but dirty streets...easy train and taxi rides to all lower Manhattan sites. Nice folks at check in and a great Croatian bartender at Cafe Medi downstairs. Oh, yeah... view of the Freedom Tower, Brooklyn and Williamsburg Bridges from room 102!

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: Extremely noisy street you can hear from room, pillows have us very sore necks, cable TV wouldn’t work, our key cards wouldn’t work, staff weren’t that helpful. Room was large which was nice however our overall experience was average.

title: Engagement weekend success!
text: Hotel on Rivington was the perfect hotel for what was intended to be my boyfriend’s 30th birthday.  Little did I know, he had planned to surprise me with a proposal.  Hotel on Rivington’s staff were incredible and catered to our every need to make the weekend ideal for a surprise party following the proposal.  We will stay here again, as the location is perfect for great dining, casual bars, upscale lounges and boutique shopping.  The neighborhood has so much character, and the hotel is both chic and edgy.  Highly recommend!  Kenny (front desk) was wonderful!

title: First time at Hotel on Rivington
text: The hotel was clean with pleasant rooms and great views. Food was great. We will stay there again. It was difficult to find your way into the hotel and to the second floor reception without asking for directions from people.

title: A week at NYC
text:
A Nice hôtel at an affordable price thanks to Booking.com rate 
Lower East Side is a perfect area to visite Big Apple. Only disapointed by not beeing a le to enjoy the Rooftop.
Breakfast a bit expensive for us on a daily basis

title: a gem of a hotel
text: My husband and I booked at the last minute for a business trip in April. Our expectations were exceeded on all counts. There were few rooms left when we booked, so we were on a lower floor (I recommend asking for a higher floor to take in the sheer beauty of the expansive views from this hotel) but even the lower floors had a nice airy feeling. The beds were comfortable with high quality linens. The gym was small, but well equipped for a quick cardio session. Most of our cardio however was expended walking the neighborhood and exploring the dozens of great eateries in the area. Never worried walking the neighborhood at night, and never felt like we were in a

title: Friendliest Service
text:
The Lower East Side of Manhattan may not be the gritty, bustling creative area it once was, but if there's something to appreciate about the "new" New York, it's the service at Hotel on Rivington.
Ken, who checked us in and checked us out was phenomenally friendly. The rest of the staff was fantastic as well.
Rooms on higher floors have great views of the city with floor to ceiling windows. Upgraded rooms have unreal shower/tub. Great spot overall.

title: Not at all what I expected!!!
text: Just returned from a business trip to NYC and felt compelled to write a review. Great location, really good standard of accommodation (much bigger than I thought I would get in NYC), friendly staff and the beds are awesome, so comfortable.  The food at the restaurant was much better than your standard expectations.  Will definitely recommend to my colleagues and looking forward to bringing the family for a holiday next visit.  Lower East Side is now my favourite area of the city.

title: Great location and Friendly Staff
text: Amazing location and very friendly staff. The only reason I have given this 3 stars it is mainly due to the fact that the hotel looks a bit tired. The hotel has a lovely design concept but in need of some investment.

title: Friendly Staff - Large Rooms - Great Location
text:
I have stayed here approximately 4-5 times. Rooms are very spacious. The design of the room is cool, sleek and sexy. Think American Psycho. Lots of closet space. Very great views. Total Cost 350 USD

Staff are very friendly, I constantly lost my keys, and they were very understanding. 

Cons: Checkin is confusing. 

I booked a room once, and my flight got canceled due to inclement weather. The manager did not offer refund/credit. I hate to eat the cost of 305 USD. This is very confusing. I stay at the hotel a lot. I guess they do not care about repeat service.

title: Two weeks stay
text: Was my first time there. The staff  is great and very polite. I had a unique room at 18th floor, i never had a better view in Manhattan ( i am flying to NYC every  5 weeks, the last 3 years), the bed was very comfortable. Also everything was clean and nice.

title: nice place
text: great people and great service.  The restaurant was nice for breakfast and good desserts.  LES is a good place to stay for good and affordable food and nightlife.  Subway around the corner, walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy and Soho.

title: Not this hotel. No.
text:
The worst hotel ever. Dusts and hair on the table and lamp. The furniture and the carpet seemed to be never cleaned since the hotel was hotel. Bathroom tiles and toilet was filthy. I could see many grey fingerprints on the toilet lid. It was obvious they never cleaned.  Creepy painting by bed side and the hall way.  Elever was dirty and wreck. The neighborhood is very wreck. 
The worst check in service.
The photo looks such decent hotel, but the inteior look totally different, not even close. It is deceiving. I come to New York for business trip often, and this is somekind of hotel never expected with this price.

title: If you value a hotel room with water, don't stay here!
text:
I stayed at the Hotel on Rivington in March 2018 which was booked as a 30th birthday treat. First of all, there are some positives to the hotel – it’s in a great location on the Lower East Side, the room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. The turndown in the evening with the cookies was also a nice touch. The corridor was a bit noisy at times and I wouldn’t bother with Café Medi – coffee was awful and the food is only ok. Lots of better places to go for food nearby instead. My partner had great trouble trying to arrange breakfast in bed for the morning of my 30th birthday as the front desk wouldn’t take his order and sent him to the café, then the staff there wouldn’t help and told him he had to fill in the room service sheet in the room. This just seemed like unnecessary hassle as when he filled out the room service sheet it wasn’t even lifted so he ended up having to take it down to the café himself anyway! Frankly, I would expect better service from a 4 star hotel.

However, the main issue that marred our stay was the lack of hot water at the hotel. Lukewarm (and at times cold) water was available in the shower on the first three days of our stay. After this some workers came in to look at the shower one morning but the water then stopped working completely so it wasn't possible to have a shower at all for the rest of the stay. Despite repeated complaints to the front desk, they were unable to tell us when the water would be working again and only offered complimentary wine to make us feel better about it! The service was really unacceptable in my view - at one point a member of staff just waved a list of rooms experiencing water issues in front of me in an exasperated fashion and it was only on my third trip to the reception desk that someone actually apologised for the inconvenience. My partner had booked a meal at a nice restaurant for the day of my 30th birthday but there was no water at all on that day so I couldn’t even have a shower beforehand. Thank goodness I had brought dry shampoo with me at least! The lack of a shower put a real dampener on the outing – I wouldn’t have minded so much if it hadn’t been my 30th! ☹  

I don’t normally leave trip advisor reviews but the poor service from the front desk and management have left me feeling very disappointed. The issue was clearly impacting on lots of rooms in the hotel but the staff were completely unhelpful – any half decent 4 star establishment would make a greater effort to placate their customers, especially when it was expensive enough to stay at the hotel. To be honest, the responses even left me wondering if this is something that has happened on other occasions and therefore the staff have just become indifferent to dealing with frustrated customers. I have since complained to the company that I made my booking through and received a partial refund for some of the days impacted by the lack of water which I appreciate. However, I remain unable to recommend the Hotel on Rivington. Basically if you value being able to shower in your hotel or having staff/management that are interested in whether their guests are enjoying their stay, give this place a miss!

title: Soggiorno
text:
Attualmente sto soggiornando in questo hotel (stanza n 43) la zona è tipica della movida newyorkese, metro vicina.
L’hotel è molto bello, stile moderno, molto curati i dettagli, scomoda la reception che si trova al secondo piano è buia e piccina, 
camere belle ma purtroppo per chi prenota con Booking (come noi) ecc le camere riservate per tipologia sono come presentate nelle foto più o meno ma sono le più penalizzate, la vista è orrenda, bagno senza finestra, piani bassi, la prima cosa che dicono quando vedono Booking è che non possono assicurare la vista quindi mettono subito le mani avanti.
Pertanto ne consegue che il rapporto qualità prezzo rispetto ad altri hotel di catene famose 4/5 stelle in pieno centro è assolutamente svantaggioso.
Leggendo i commenti sono tutti super positivi ma probabilmente tutte prenotazioni avvenute tramite agenzie e tour operator conosciuti e dirette perché leggendo meglio per chi ha prenotato con Booking il trattamento è il medesimo, ne ho letta uno di una coppia milanese che si trovava al nostro stesso piano e le caratteristiche erano le stesse. Evidentemente dal 6 piano in giù vista sul retro sono le stanze riservate a Booking e simili, capisco la scelta aziendale, a qualcuno andranno date queste camere ma almeno con intelligenza, essendo penalizzate datele ad un prezzo più vantaggioso oppure offrite ai malcapitati qualche cosa tipo colazione compresa nel prezzo per fargli digerire la pillola.
Allego foto della vista per rendere l’idea.
Ps: diciamo che al buio,con le tende chiuse e i tappi alle orecchie per il rumore dei motori dei condizionatori ecc la camera è piacevole anche se buia, basta un po’ di fantasia!!!!

title: Nice Rooms and incredibly bad service
text:
Arrived early in the morning (redeye flight) and was informed that a room is not available. Ok understandable.  They said they were fully booked the night before and would call me as soon as they have a room available. Sounded plausible. 
Then one angry guest after the other appeared behind me because apparently there hadn’t been hot water in days!! The story goes on... 

They never called me and basically let me wait until 4pm. If I had waited for their call I’d still be waiting. I had to go to front desk several times. Only to see they were giving others rooms. Then I had to recheck in again. Not sure what the others did or didn’t do before ...

Service at its worst. I canceled the extra night and moved to Nomo Soho. Almost same price but 100 x times better and great service. Beautiful. 

Would not recommend Hotel on Rivington. Although rooms are nice and modern. You can hear every word from your neighbor. The gym is super tiny. The hallways are smelly and need repair.

title: No Hot Water!!!
text: This hotel is in a great location and the beds are quite comfortable. However, our family experienced a broken pipe which knocked out the hot water, supposedly in the entire hotel for 4 of our 5 day stay (so we had 1 hot shower during our trip), and the lack of response by management is not acceptable. Every time we inquired about the situation, we were given a different story, but we were always told that it was fixed and it should be working momentarily. A manager was never available. Upon check out, we were told that the problem was supposed to be fixed that day!?? I was also assured that a manager would be contacting me after the trip. This never happened (even after I reached out on several more occasions). The most that they did was send us a sub par bottle of champagne. For any hotel this sort of issue is not acceptable. I would definitely never go back.

title: Good value for LES
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights for business in March. 

First the good!
-	The staff is very pleasant and accommodating
-	I received a complementary upgrade to a suite
-	Maintenance quickly fixed a faulty AC unit 
-	The beds have got to be the most comfortable hotel beds in the world! Others have noted this but I cannot street enough how satisfying this was.  I had to inquire about the mattress, they are actually using top of the line Tempur-Pedic mattresses (model: Contour Supreme if you’d like to get one for home, $2599 for a Queen size! I am actually seriously considering it…)
-	The rooms are very large by NY standard
-	Great view from my 15th floor corner suite
-	The little touches, like dimmers on lights, candles in the room, vouchers for 2 glasses of wine, cookies with turn-down service
-	1 block to M, F, J, M, Z trains 
-	Fast wifi

What could be better:

-	The property shows some wear and tear. Furniture and TVs look a bit dated
-	There are not enough outlets to plug in or charge devices. No USB outlets either 
-	The restaurant, Café Medi, is a major letdown. Very slow service during breakfast and mediocre omelets
-	No coffee machine in the room. No complementary coffee in lobby. Seems to be a trend in the city which is unfortunate. To add insult to injury, I received 2 vouchers for a free cup of coffee at Café Medi between 11 am and 5 pm. That’s great assuming I was planning to hang around the hotel all day long…
-	A lounge with drink service on the front desk level (street side) would liven up the mood and create an opportunity to socialize

Overall a pleasant stay and great choice for LES. I thought the price paid was a good value for the area and I especially enjoyed the helpful staff, comfortable bed, spacious room and great view.

title: GREAT POTENTIAL
text: My husband and I chose Hotel on Rivington as we wanted to experience a stay in the LES. It is truly a wonderful neighborhood with a blend of multicultural tradition and new creative energy. The Rivington is one of the nicer hotels in the neighborhood and offers some competitive packages. Kristen, the Reservation Manager was very accomodating in booking our stay. The rooms are large for NYC and beds very comfortable. Unfortunately the rooms are missing a coffee maker. Although that may sound old fashioned, it is pretty standard and guests should be able to make a cup of tea before bed and coffee in the morning. Not the case and with no coffee available in the hotel (restaurant) until 7AM, I was unable to enjoy a hot cup of coffee before leaving for an early flight. The hotel has great potential, but no one seems to be orchestrating. Unfortunately there was confusion from the moment that we booked. With different staff communicating different information, both by phone and in person, things got unnecessarily frustrating...over and over again. Suffice it to say that the left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing. Due in part to the fact that the restaurant is not owned by the hotel, there doesn't seem to be much pride in ownership or guest satisfaction. In addition to grumpy breakfast waiters (except for one lovely Bangladeshi waiter), there was a miscommunication about what package we booked and with 3 different breakfast menus, it got confusing. We were there to celebrate my birthday and birthday breakfast turned into a 2+ hour frustrating ordeal. The upside was that with every problem or confusion, there was a staff member who took the initiative to fix it. Helpful staff included Alex, Elvis, and Idalia. Unfortunately, I left in the same confusion that I arrived since the car to JFK that I ordered through the bell captain the night before was apparently never ordered. As a marketing professional and frequent business traveler, I can honestly say that although the brand has great potential, but will not get there until internal communication is improved and all brand ambassadors are singing the same tune.

title: I LOVED IT!
text: The deep soaking tub and the view on the balcony was amazing! I love the privacy of the hotel, the lobby is on the second floor, so if you're socially awkward and hate the weird eye contact dance you have to make with reception every time you enter or exit hotels this place is perfect. great for a date night in the city.

title: GREAT LOCATION
text: Excellent hotel. Rooms and hotel very clean. spacious rooms. quiet location. walking distance to many restaurants/bars/stores. we will be staying here when we come to New York in the future. staff was very accommodating and helpful.

title: good
text: i had a very nice stay, i love the location, the area and the staff and the apperance of the hotel, the style and design very much. Maybe the Bar at the Lobby-Area should be in operation, serving coffee, drinks etc - the spot is nice and would appear more inviting and tempting to rest, if it would be bizzy

title: Okay.
text: The views were lovely. The room was clean. Unfortunately, there was no hot water the first night there which made for a sad attempt at a relaxing first night. Also, the internet did not work the entire stay of 2 days.

title: Cute hotel!
text: Great location, and very nice rooms. The amenities are worth the stay, including the larger windows and balconies, and memory foam mattresses. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. My only complaint is that the front desk staff was not the most friendly, and also my bathroom faced a parking deck, and the windows are not fully frosted, so there was not a lot of privacy.

title: Design XL
text:
Quand on connaît NYC, on sait qu'un hôtel trendy et design rime souvent avec chambres minuscules et prix au top. L'hôtel On Rivington  offre des chambres d'une taille inespérée avec coin salon et vue impressionnante pour un prix raisonnable (surtout en février période basse !). Nous avons eu la chance en plus d'être upgradés dans une chambre en étage supérieur (11éme étage) en angle et totalement vitrée, y compris la douche. Certains trouveront à redire sur tout ce qui fait l'attrait d'un hôtel design, mais qui peut se plaindre de prendre sa douche avec une vue surplombante sur Manhattan et s'endormir en admirant les gratte-ciels à 180°. Propreté irréprochable, literie douillette et draps de qualité compensent une isolation phonique perfectible et un chauffage bruyant. Mais le rapport au bruit semble différent dans cette ville aux sirènes hurlant jour et nuit. Comme dans tous ces hôtels, après quelques années, les équipements sont un peu fatigués : porte d'accès au petit balcon bloquée, robinets fatigués, patères branlantes... dommage car les amateurs de design recherchent aussi la perfection. Le roof top est réservé aux événements et non à la clientèle de l'hôtel. Petit-déjeuner au Café Médi sans intérêt. La jolie décoration de l'endroit ne fait pas oublier l'indigence du menu, l'austérité des pancakes et un service... désincarné. Profitez plutôt de la richesse du Lower East Side qui regorge de lieux créatifs pour se nourrir en compagnie de gens sympathiques.
En résumé, un endroit (encore) à la mode où on peut dormir confortablement et s'en mettre plein les yeux.

title: Good Location for a NYC tour
text:
Excellent location as a base for the tourist. 5 mins from subway; 10 mins walking from Chinatown and Little Italy: Don't get a room on the lower floors, especially the 3rd floor as the gym is on that floor and corridor noise and street noise is quite bad.
It took 2 days to get the wifi sorted out, and its very slow. I had to move elsewhere to carry out a business meeting as I kept dropping out on hotel system.
