Café Medi the restaurant next door that serves breakfast should be avoided. Over priced, poor quality and dismal service. The good news is that either side there are some excellent cafeterias, and dellis and restaurants. All in all the hotel for the price and for the location, not too bad. Would I stay there again, probably yes, but on a high floor and only if the price was right

title: posizione eccellente e hotel panoramico
text:
posizione ottima, letto comodissimo e stanza bellissima con vista panoramica.
ottimo compresso prezzo qualità, sotto i bar più alla moda di ny, a piedi raggiungi le zone piu trendy , metro dietro l'angolo.
ci tornerei subito, forse colazione costosa

title: Great stay & excellent room
text: We stayed for a night out in the city.  The room was big, bed was very comfortable and nice and quiet.  We were on the 10th floor room 103.  The views were nice but it was really rainy and cloudy.  Hotel is very close to the M train which is perfect for me getting to the office.  Definitely would stay here again in the future.

title: Top Notch Hotel in Lower East Side
text:
Booked a "staycation" here for my girlfriend's birthday. The experience could not have been better. We stayed in a "high-floor king with balcony and Japanese soaking tub". 

A special shout-out to Melissa in guest services for helping make the weekend the perfect experience. She was most helpful in having balloons placed in the room prior to our arrival with less than 24 hours notice. The service went from great to outstanding when a bottle of Veuve-Clicquot appeared in our room as a complimentary gesture. 

Additional Pro's: cookies delivered to the room on 3 separate occasions during our two-night stay. Seamless check-in/check-out. 4 free drink tickets at Cafe Medi, the hotel's ground-level restaurant. We did not use it, but the mini-bar in the room was one of the most stocked ones I have seen. Rooms were, by NYC standards, very spacious. The bathroom was phenomenal - soaking tub is huge and shower has a window overlooking the downtown skyline.

The only con, and it's not one the hotel has much control over, is that there was a pretty noisy generator at a neighboring building that sounded like it was broken. This, however, did not keep either of us up at night.

I did a lot of research before booking the room, and for the quality, the hotel is by far the best bang for your buck for lower Manhattan hotels. Quality for price, in my opinion, is superior to the Standard, Public, Ludlow, Sixty LES, etc.

If you want a trendy, boutique, luxury hotel in a great neighborhood in NYC, this is your best bet.

title: Fun location, cool hotel
text:
Loved the cool vibe of this LES hotel - from the decor to the amazing soaking tub in our bathroom. Even the views out the window with a classic LES look at water towers was fun.

I wasn't a huge fan of the dark hallways, but the inside of the room itself was spacious and the restaurant downstairs was good. Great location as well.

title: Perfect for one night in LES
text:
Pros:
- Location! Stayed here for one night with my husband for a local “babymoon”.  It was the perfect location for our itinerary - all food destinations were walking distance from the hotel and having a hotel room close by offered me the comfort and convenience of coming to the room if I needed a rest (5 months pregnant).   
- boutique city vibe w the art, colors, and lobby furniture 
- service was helpful and front desk was friendly enough
- complementary water bottles at the front desk
- coffee comp for guests after 11am
- clean room
- if you’re lucky, great views! It’s floor to ceiling windows, but the lower floors will have views of neighboring buildings. 
- free cookies brought to your room at night. Flavor: not so great but the idea is nice. 

Cons:
- bathroom did not have enough lighting. Hard putting on makeup and it just had an overall dim light. Maybe having one more light option by the sink would suffice?
Our bathroom was all black (wall to ceiling black tiles, black fixtures, etc), so the dim lighting added to the “darkness” of the room.

title: Nice hotel
text: I love how modern the room looked and since I loveeee black my bathroom was black, as in black tiles, black toilet , black everything. It’s a little pricey but the view was really nice from the 8th floor. I surprised my boyfriend with the room he absolutely loved it. Staff were really friendly and helpful.

title: Great Location and stylish hotel
text: The location in the LES can't be beat!  You're within a 5 minute walk to the Subway to get to other areas of the city, or you can stay within the same neighborhood and eat and drink to your hearts desire, as well as check out some trendy stores and galleries.  The hotel sets the mood from the moment you walk in, pumping a delectable scent of cologne and leather through the vents.  There is a great bar/restaurant on the main floor, but unfortunately was closed on the Sunday evening we stayed so didn't get a chance to visit, but the menu looked great.  The rooms are well laid out and the beds are very comfortable.  Definitely try to get a room on a higher floor so you can take in the great Manhattan views.

title: Best location in Nyc and great staff
text: One of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed at! The staff were all incredibly genuine , helpful and professional at the same time. I wanted to point out , Elvis, Daniel, Ken and I know I’m forgetting more but yeh wanted to say thank you for making my stay feel like home!

title: Great customer service in a great location!
text: Comfortable beds, a bathtub, candles and a lovely location.  I’ll definitely stay here again.  Not as fancy as some of the other hotels in the neighborhood but not as expensive either.  Wonderful staff and they bring you cookies at night❤️

title: Great Location - commendable service
text:
great location. steps away from shopping and restaurants as well as the subway. room is small but sufficient, we had space for 6 large luggages. daily plate of cookies was also a nice touch. 

However, we also had quite a number of packages sent ahead of time before our trip from various online shopping sites. The hotel unfortunately managed to lose one of the boxes which was not resolved during our stay (reception was quite unhelpful). after we checked out and leave nyc, we managed to get hold of the GM to explain and he was quick to fix the issue (items we repurchased and sent to us).

title: Weekend Getaway
text: Great location in the Lower East Side. A great part of NYC to explore. So many things to see and do just minutes away in all directions. Expected to see more of a lobby, but thats a minor detail that can be overlooked.

title: Easy access to Manhattan
text: A nice sized room for the money, cleaned every day and easy to come and go. Café Medi served up good meals in the evening. Staff were all very helpful and approachable. The noise of the city was constant so if you are a light sleeper bring some ear plugs.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Excellent hotel in a great neighborhood. The lower east side is interesting to explore with the Tenement Museum, Katz's, Soho nearby. Staff were very pleasant as was the breakfast.  I very much recommend this hotel.

title: Good location
text: Bed was great but could not sleep because of MANY drunk guests literally partying in the hallway throughout the night.  Wish we had been told that many of the guests for the private party were on our floor.  We would have preferred to be on a different floor.

title: Getaway
text: The Rivington is one of my favorite stays to date. We got an upgrade to a higher floor and, with that, a great view of Lower Manhattan. Great decor, friendly staff, and in the heart of the Lower East Side.

title: Awesome boutique hotel with great views in the East Village
text: great place to stay in East Village. Modern hotel in a convenient area in East Village. I thought the price value was outstanding. Really nice bed and bathroom. Great dining at restaurant and lots of good restaurants in area.

title: Winter Staycation for my Bday very solid stay
text: Hotel is in prime location and legit close to anything. Very cool room and even though the hotel is a little older found it in pretty good condition! Only things I can think of that could have been better was the Speaker in room, which was one of those old ihome alarms from years ago (too outdated). Later at night I needed ice and since it went through kitchen it was a bit of an issue, so went to local deli and bought myself since they took so long to figure out what to do. Also there was no ironing board in room and I like to always look crisp. Besides that really good experience and can't complain. Would def recommend and go back. Again location is def the biggest Pro.

title: extraordinary views of the Manhattan skyline
text:
A hotel which will most definitely leave a lasting impression.
A great place Close to the subway some really good places near by.extraordinary views of the Manhattan skyline. we staty in the Owner suite since was like 6 of us.

title: Great location
text: The room are pretty big for NYC. Nice views of the city from the higher floors. Slow service during breakfast appr 30 min wait for an omelett. Issue with the plumbing in my room that I don’t think was handled that well when I asked front desk to fix it. Comfy bed and really nice location in LES

title: Hotel on Rivington - Party Hotel
text: This would be a really fun hotel if you're visiting for a rowdy weekend in NYC- if you're visiting for a calm trip or for work AVOID! The hotel has a fun atmosphere and very rock and roll vibes. The hotel staff is not helpful when booking or checking out so try and avoid any complicated situations. The rooms are big and the bathrooms nice. They have a custom scent that they put through their air vent system so be prepared for all of your things to take on the Hotel Rivington scent. Food from restaurant downstairs was really good!

title: Great location
text:
Enjoyed my stay at perfectly located hotel
In the heart of restaurants and clubs. 
All windows in rooms so be prepared for cold weather 
Staff was super friendly and helpful 
Check in was easy. Breakfast at Medi included

title: Not a good price for value hotel
text:
427/5000
reception staff little concerned, the shabby view of a courtyard (below level 10, no view!), the unmet request (in 8 days) to change rooms for a higher floor with a view , the freezing floor of the room (imitation wood tile) with bad insulation of the building entirely glazed, comfortable bedding but slatted bed base defective, the slats coming off and falling ...however, correct bathroom, room cleaning and refurbishment well done , the geographical location to visit the south of Manhattan with metro station very close

title: It’s ok
text:
sometime the heating wsa no function. And the housekeeping took the glass away but didnt put it  back.
In addition above, it’s good experience. The hotel staff will give you cookies everyday. It’s really delicious.

title: Superficial luxury
text: The rooms are spacious and clean. This is an affordable hotel with all the trappings of a boutique experience. But, the windows are drafty, the water pressure is not great, cold floors, and rude staff

title: Great location, wonderful hotel.
text:
We loved the room and atmosphere. Very romantic.
A great place to stay in. Close to the subway and some really good places near by.
Very clean and fun.
We recommend the room with the balcony and tub..

title: Wouldn't recommend
text:
- Not enough extra blankets for every room (winter in a mostly glass hotel, how is this possible)
- Place was trashed for days after New Years
- Staff needs a lesson in hospitality. General attitude was not at all helpful.

title: Great Location / Tired Rooms / No Heating
text:
We have stayed at the Hotel on Rivington a number of times over 5 years, as the location is great.
Close to loads of restaurants / bars and great coffee.
Unfortunately the rooms / décor is all very tired and needs some work.
There are chips in the furniture, cracks in the windows.

Though the worst part of our stay was during the cold New Years period, the heating in the room did not work.  It kept tripping even on low temperatures, so most of the time the room was 63-66F which is way too cold for comfort.

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
chambre spacieuse très agréable, salle de bain au top.
Hotel bien situé dans quartier hyper sympa près de Soho, Chinatown , pleins de petits restaurants autour top à découvrir via tripvasor . Les chambres dans les étages supérieures ont une vue exceptionnelles!! A découvrir

title: Great location
text: This location was great. Easy access to the subway. Room was larger than most and the bathroom was great, large shower and great soaking tub with a view.  Floors are small so not much noise from hallway traffic

title: Great Experience at a Great Hotel.
text:
My stay at the Hotel on Rivington was excellent. Finding the hotel was very easy. It is located a few blocks away from the bottom of the Williamsburg Bridge in Manhattan. There was ample street parking and because we stayed on a weekend, it was free. The staff also informed us that there was a municipal parking garage a few blocks away in the event we could not find parking.

Check in was a breeze. The lobby was located on the second floor. The staff was very accommodating and even upgraded our rooms. We called and requested to check in early or as soon as the room was ready and they obliged. We also requested a 1PM check out and staff did it, no problem. 

The room itself was a nice size for my girlfriend and I. The bed was a tempurpedic. I know this because I checked for a foam mattress topper, but to my surprise it was just the mattress. The bathroom was also very nice. Very large shower and plenty of mirrors for getting ready. 

There was a table and two chairs that were comfortable but also very chić looking as well. The room had a small balcony that had a great view of the city. We were upgraded to the 19th floor and the view was spectacular. 

We were only there for one night, but our stay at the Hotel on Rivington was one of our best. I would 100% recommend this hotel to family or friends. We really liked the fact that it was in the Lower East Side which gave us the opportunity to have a more authentic New York experience. 

Hotel on Rivington is 10/10 or 5 Stars. Whatever the rating scale, this is an amazing hotel.

title: Great stay but room for improvement
text: Very nice rooms and great views. Valet service could use some improvement. I'm used to at least 2 or 3 guys working valet coming up to you to help you in Boston but I didn't get that here. Found that odd. Also asked for ice 3 times but it never came.

title: Classy room with a view for NYE
text: The room was beautiful, spacious and had a wonderful view of the City. Great location. Personally, we checked out the local food and social spots rather than stay at the hotel... there are a lot to explore within an easy walk.

title: Another great stay
text: This is a wonderful hotel.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed.  The hotel is in a good location and is just steps away from a municipal parking ramp if you are driving.  Although there is a bar/club in the hotel our rooms (high floor) have always been very quiet.

title: Great stay - Horrible Receptionist
text: My room was amazing and had an amazing view however the receptionist at the front desk was extremely rude to me. Never stayed at a hotel with a receptionist with such lack of respect. The woman inconvenienced my entire morning and ignores me standing in front of her. It was very insulting to see her much kinder to other guest she was than me. Staff needs Diversity and Ethics Training. That way staff will know how to professionally treat everyone. I feel like I was mistreated due to my age and background

title: Very good hotel
text: The guest room (corner,king bed) is very nice. We could enjoy the view with the WTC. Was also clean. The reception offered us 4 glasses of wine in the bar downstairs. The bar is very nice, good atmosphere and good food. I recommend this hotel

title: Beautiful views and great staff
text: My room was so beautiful and comfortable, with views that stun. Bed was perfect and the shower was an experience with floor to ceiling windows in the bathroom. Was lovely sitting in the chairs to look out at the city too! Get a room above the 15 floor for the best views!

title: Great place to stay!
text: Great hotel-- beautiful views, spacious, clean rooms, great service and overall experience. We got a room with a soaker tub and upper floor views, and it was well worth it. Location is good, and easy access to public transit. If it's windy, the wind may whistle a bit in the room on the upper floors, but it didn't bother us. Fairly low street noise overall.

title: Great spot
text:
very nice hotel , large and modern room, close to the subway and lots of good restaurants, 10 min away from Broadway st. where you can have great shopping 
price is very reasonable especially during the week day 
Recommended !!!

title: City tour
text: We we're lucky to choose this hotel. There was a minor glitch with the heat but it worked to our advantage. Great rates! The rooms are huge with floor to ceiling windows. The shower was the best I experienced in a hotel. The staff was friendly. I will book here when I return.

title: Great place, Great Location, great value for money
text: Clean and spacious room. Great for 2 people, and great size bathroom. Staff were attentive and help out with any request straight away. Although we didn’t use the minibar, its is perhaps the most well stocked. Even provide an array of adult entertainment toys and stuff through it. Great location, close to the subway and easy to get around.

title: No working heat in the middle of winter
text: Heat stopped working on 6th night, and room wouldn't go up past 69, 70 degrees. To add insult to injury, houseman tried to portray this as "normal" and would not accept that the heating system was broken. Very poor stay overall.

title: Beautiful view, nice location
text: Recommendable place except of the cleanliness of the rooms. But they cleaned it up after we told them. Good location to explore NY and find nice restaurants and pubs in the evening without having to take the sub. Great area around.

title: Christmas vacation
text: Great hotel in a great location. Huge rooms and views (we were on the 8th floor, I imagine the upper floors view is magnificent! Staff are friendly and attentive - the housekeeping service is second to none. Will definitely stay here again, the hotel made our usual great NY Christmas even better!

title: Hotel Stay
text: Overall we enjoyed it.   Bathroom in desperate need of lighting.   Bedding was bulky and in places tattered.    Nice view  and delicious food at breakfast.   Great location for us.    Ice was brought promptly   doorman always there.

title: Why I love the Hotel on Rivington
text: You guys are the best! I shared my story about why this is my favorite hotel in the part why I chose to stay there and I'm planning to stay again. I've recommended this place to my friends and hopefully soon, we'll be able to plan a trip to NYC and stay with you guys. :-)

title: Lower East Side cool
text:
I recommend that you start your day here wirh a run to the East River, then stopping off for a juice or açaí bowl next door to the hotel. 

Dining and cocktails in the area can’t be beat. Cool rooms, attentive staff.  A terrific spot.

title: Love that view
text: I often stay at THOR on my visits to the city.  While it is not most convenient location for uptown journeys it's wonderful enough to be worth the long ride.  The rooms are wonderful.  We had a corner suite with magical views.   The only negative was breakfast.   Very expensive and not great.  Weak coffee, unforgivable in my family and marginal food.  Just eat across the street and you will have a perfect stay.

title: Not up to scratch
text: Several issues with the hot water in the rooms. Also the rooms are poorly insulated for noise. The staff here were fairly inept and unable to recommend restaurants/ bars or solve any issue that occured during the stay.

title: LES Gem
text: My boyfriend and I wanted to stay in LES because we wanted to shop in SoHo and eat and drink at the speakeasies in LES/East Village. The hotel was great about storing our bags before and after we checked in. We didn't have to wait long to check in and even checked in an hour early at 3pm. We stayed on the 6th floor and the room looked just like the pictures. Very spacious for a 4-star hotel in NYC. We each received a complimentary glass of house wine at Cafe Medi which we enjoyed before heading out to dinner. The bartender was sweet and we enjoyed talking to her. We were also surprised by the complimentary mini bottle of champagne and sweets in our room. Above and beyond - what a treat!

title: Good potential, customer service needs work
text: The room itself was very large in comparison with other hotels on the LES and the large tempurpedic bed was extremely comfortable. However the room was FREEZING and despite many efforts to adjust the temperature it was really uncomfortable. The floor was like ice. The real problem was that there was no hot water! I called down to the front desk and was told it was a building wide problem and there was no solution: all of the rooms were experiencing this problem. Being unable to take a shower in a freezing room is simply not acceptable. At checkout I reported all of these issues to the front desk staff who merely apologized and moved onto the next guest. There are other better alternatives in the immediate vicinity that provide a much better customer experience.

title: Horrible hotel !!
text: This hotel is very dark and dingy. The rooms are dirty the heat does not work. I would never ever stay at this location again. When I went down to complain about the heat not working no help is offered. I checked out a night early because of this reason.

title: Terrace suite
text: Overall quality of the hotel was not great, especially given the “4 star” rating. Shoddy, cheap-looking construction, lights burned out, delayed heck-in, lost deliveries, and broken door handles were no what I expected when staying in a $1200 suite. I would not stay again or recommend to others.

title: PERFECT BOUTIQUE HOTEL EXPERIENCE
text: My stay was extremely please with my accommodations! The restaurant food and in room service was excellent. I slept like a baby and I intend to use Hotel on Rivington as my home base while in New York!

title: Rivington was a huge Win
text: I don't know that I've ever had a better Hotel experience in my life, Hotel on Rivington was exactly what my wife and I were looking for in terms of location, value, cleanliness, and service. This staff absolutely knocked everything out of the park from the second we checked in.

title: Great December weekend in New York
text: We have stayed at the  Hotel on Rivington twice and both times we really enjoyed out stay.  We were visiting family and location is perfect.  There are lots of great restaurants close by, and there is also the Cafe Medi in the hotel that is very good.

title: Business Travel Stay
text: The hotel was unique and very trendy. The room was bigger than I was expecting and was decorated very modern (black tile, trendy furniture). The location was very accessible to get an Uber to travel around the city. We ate dinner right down the street, there are many options within walking distance.

title: I love NY
text: This hotel is awesome! Amazing views, attentive staff, great location & delicious fresh cookies. I had a wonderful stay, Ashley was very helpful and she made sure I had everything I needed to really enjoy my time in NY.

title: Pretty cool and nice Hotel
text:
Hotel on Rivington is located in the heart of Lower East Side, New York - a perfect run near cool bars, good restaurants and communications (closest subway station is just a block away). From here you can easily get around town and in just a few minutes you also reach Brooklyn.

The hotel offers good breakfast options in a pleasant environment. And a cozy bar/restaurant for after work as well.
The rooms are incredibly spatious and trendily decorated. But, unfortunately, a bit noisy. Do you have your room located against the street, the noise can disturb from outside, especially on Friday and Saturday nights.

But an overall lovely hotel experience. And - as an extra bonus - you'll get a free glass of wine in the hotel bar, every day!

title: meh
text: service needs improvement. Rooms need some maintenance. Very disappointed that the hotel bar and restaurant close early - cannot even get room service for a decent /quiet nightcap. The location is great, near subway, shopping, bars, galleries and good food.

title: Great Price; Great Location
text: The hotel rooms are spacious with large windows. We received a complimentary glass of wine at the restaurant and turn down service each night with cookies! So cute.  The location is awesome. Close to the subway and walkable to so many restaurants.

title: Excellence!!
text: Great stay!  Rooms were ready upon check in. Rooms were clean. Location is right in the heart of it all in downtown Les. My preferred hotel whenever I want to get away and rest.  I live in the area but for relaxation and to get through another month of craziness this place helps you feel like you went away from it all.

title: Phenomenal Hotel!
text: Great location, great staff, and an amazing stay!  Room was very clean and all of the staff was super friendly and attentive.  Stayed over the thanksgiving holiday.   Great restaurants and shopping in the local area and centrally located to the subway so getting around NYC is easy.  Will definitely be coming back!!

title: Great service, big rooms and good value
text: We stayed for 6 nights in Hotel on Rivington. Very good location (very close to the subway station, walking distance to SoHo, good links to JFK...). We were very happy with the staff of the hotel. They were always very nice and helpful. The rooms are very big with a nice view to Downtown (at least from our room). The bed was very very comfortable. We enjoyed every moment we had in this hotel. Thank you and cu soon again.

title: Creative.Mysterious. Amazing
text: The entrance to the hotel is very cool, because you see the S'zen and it's incredible artwork on the wall. I was actually impressed and felt like I made the right choice. Inside the hotel was low-lighting and once you got to the floor, it just lit up and you were walking on beautiful velvety red carpet..The King room was spacious with gorgeous modern furniture and accessories, but the highlight here is the VIEW, which was breathtaking! It made you feel like a superstar! The doorman was incredibly nice and the staff members were so accommodating to my needs. I decided to book, because I wanted to get a few of my friends and just hang out for the night. There are so many options to party, eat, or explore around there, and a short walk/train ride to Soho if you want to shop. I definitely have to stay again!

title: An average thanksgiving stay
text:
Stayed on the 8th floor in king room for 3 nights.  It was an okay place for the price we paid; I did not like the black toilet, black tile in the shower, and floor.  It makes one wonder what they are trying to hide... like is this toilet clean or disgusting?  

The night we arrived and the following morning the shower was lukewarm to cold.  I called the front desk and the gal told me they were working on it and asked me if there was anything they could do make it up to me....She said they would bring me red wine. Never got it.   

The blackout curtains were extremely hard to pull across and never really blocked out the light.  

It wasn’t a terrible place but.. if you say you’re going to do something like make it up to customer you should come through.

title: Bester Manhatten View mit schwächelndem Service
text:
Schönes cooles Boutique-Hotel mit super Lage und Blick auf Manhatten und das neue WTC. Hatte im 19.Stock ein Eckzimmer, vollverglast mit Traumblick über die Skyline mit Sonnenaufgang und -untergang. Auch aus der Dusche ! Dafür sind die Zimmerpreise zwischen 250 und 350 USD sehr akzeptabel. 
Das Frühstück im stylischen Caferestaurant war leider nur beschränkt, es gab einen recht wässrigen Kaffee und rein amerikanisch ein paar Eierspeisen und diverse wenige und separat zu ordernde Kleinigkeiten. Der Zimmerservice beschränkte sich auf die Öffnungszeiten des Restaurants. Auch nachmittags blieb die Essens- und Getränkeversorgung auf die allerdings ganz gut bestückte Minibar begrenzt. Insgesamt war der Hotelaufenthalt sehr nett, vor allem die Aussicht in den oberen Stockwerken, aber doch deutlich in der Qualität von einem luxuriöseren Hotel entfernt.

title: Outstanding service
text: Would I come back? Yes. Do I recommend this hotel? Yes. Loved the view from the corner unit.and watching the city life below. Helpful staff day and night. Variety of eateries nearby. Enjoyed the shower with a view; don't worry about privacy...the windows steam up quickly.

title: The absolute worst!
text: I stayed here on a honeymoon we wanted the freestanding bathtub with a view we didn't get it. I specifically asked for it. I ate a handful of nuts from the minibar and there were bugs in it I actually ate bugs! Awful!

title: Great Stay
text: Really enjoyed my stay.  Beds are amazing.   Hotel was very clean.   The location is great with many restaurants and bars to chose from in the immediate radius.  Planning on staying there again the next time my wife and I have a chance to get away.

title: great location, comfortable rooms
text:
great location if you're trying to get away from the times square midtown hustle. comfortable + clean rooms with comfy beds. 

the gym is in pretty bad shape but the amenities are otherwise lovely.

in my experience, a request for a special occasion gesture / email went completely ignored, even upon check in.

stay here for a good rate, otherwise not worth it. perhaps try The Standard in the east village for great service with the same level of cool.

title: Keith is awesome!
text: Amazing hotel in a great area. You can't beat the view for the price! Keith at the check in counter was amazing. Very lively and a good sense of humor. When we told him we were here for my sisters 21st birthday, he gave us drink tickets! Also had great recommendations on where we should go. Thanks Keith!!!

title: Great Stay
text: From the helpful staff to the spacious room to the perfect location it's hard to beat the overall value of this hotel in NYC. Amazing room layout, bathroom and amenities. But the service really makes this place.

title: Wont stay at another hotel in NYC. A+
text: My Fiancé and I stayed at the Hotel on Rivington recently and could not have had a better experience. We stayed in a corner room on the 18th floor which had it's own private balcony looking over the L.E.S. and into the Financial District. The room it's self had floor to ceiling windows across both walls. It was stunning. So stunning that I proposed to my girlfriend there on our first night. The room was large and clean. Bed was super comfortable.The entire team at the hotel made us feel at home.  We'll be coming back anytime we return to the city. This hotel has style and personality and is a true L.E.S. gem.

title: Amazing views from 14th floor
text: This hotel is gorgeous and the floor-to-ceiling windows in our corner room on the 14th floor provided truly amazing views. The sunset happened to be gorgeous and we fell asleep looking at all the lights in the city. So beautiful. Liked the free glasses of wine at check-in too. :)

title: Needs a revamp
text:
Nicely located hotel, needs an urgent revamp. Hotel room was not clean as expected. Shower tool completely useless. 
Wifi signal very good. Room service good. View decent. Balcony door as noisy as hell.

title: 20th floor king corner balcony
text: It’s not a king bed on the 20th floor corner balcony.  It’s a double Murphy bed with no headboard. We were really upset by the size of the bed and the viewing angle to the tv.  With no headboard pillows just fell into the void

title: I'll be back.
text: If you want to feel hip in NYC this is the place to stay.  The staff is very attentive and knowledgable.  Plus they know the area extremely well.  Terrific neighborhood that is hip and not a tourist trap.

title: Excellent LES hotel - location, accommodations & service
text:
I stayed here for a few nights while in NYC for work a few weeks ago. My wife and I shared a room (we were upgraded to a king corner suite) that had plenty of space for this hip, euro-styled hotel, including two chairs and a table for a sitting area. Given the Lower East Side location, most hotel rooms are very tiny, so it was a nice change.

Desk staff and door staff were always friendly and helpful, the hip art collection on all floors is really cool, and the lobby area was comfortable to pass a little time while waiting on a colleague.

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: Great location. Decent hotel although it could use some upgrades. Rooms are getting  a bit dated now. Service was pretty good overall. Attentive doormen.   Would stay there again primarily for the location.

title: Great stay at this hotel
text: Great location, the rooms are nice and quiet for such a busy neighbourhood and the view from the room was nice. I can highly recommend it. The restaurant downstairs was very cool, and a nice place to hang out with a much needed beer after a lot of walking...

title: Great Trip
text: The hotel accomodations, service and location was perfect.  We were in town for an anniversary and were very pleased with everything the Hotel had to offer.  They also help us plan the trip and handled reservations for us.

title: Great Place in the LES
text: Fantastic room, great food, and in the middle of everything. Super close to all that NY has to offer. Lively, fun neighborhood. So much shopping, people watching, and generally awesome area of NY. Check out Beaty & Essex, Stanton Social, and many many more restaurants very close by. Fantastic products are provided for your stay.

title: Less bang for your bucks
text: Food service and quality was sub par. Rooms were mediocre. There was a slight stain on my bed sheet. No hotel slippers were provided. The wall art is mediocre. Check-in is on the second floor, which is not obvious.

title: old and outdated
text: not worth the money - even for NYC.  this hotel is all about getting money fast and has no interest in improving or providing service. i was on floor 18. The room showed in every corner that the hotel is over 10 years old. no, never again.

title: Disappointing
text: Was looking forward to staying in the lower east side rather than my usual Chelsea hotel, and the neighborhood was lots of fun.  Hotel though not great.  Went for a high floor corner room with (tiny) balcony at over $600/night.  The view was great with floor to ceiling glass.  However nowhere to store clothes other than small closet, only lukewarm water in shower despite complaining, and most irritatingly no reliable internet in room, again despite complaining.   Hotel was also run-down with dirty hallway carpets and paint chipping in room.  Decent bar on ground floor - where I had to go to use wireless - gym in hotel very small but decent one around corner for a feee.

title: Amazing stay, awesome staff!
text: From beginning to end our stay on rivington was exceptional. Staff was super sweet in recognizing it was our wedding night and even sent up a bottle of champagne, fruit, and cookies. The bed was comfy, the view was amazing and the bathtub was exceptionally large in our suite. Room service ending at 11am on sunday might have been my only complaint if we weren't in a neighborhood with so many other options. Over all, it was a great stay!

title: Hotel Rivington
text: One of the best hotels we have stayed at, especially in New York, grate value for money, clean, spacious rooms, exteraordinary mini-bar, excellent bed, quiet rooms, everything very good. We highly recommend this hotel

title: I'd stay again in a flash
text: It was excellent. Staff and room were top notch and the bed was massive and super comfy. Our view on the 16th floor was epic.  LES is a great neighbourhood. Brilliant location to get to SoHo / Greenwich Village / Williamsburg too

title: Trevlig service och rymliga rum
text: Trevligt hotell med stora, rymliga rum. Något slitna möbler men ok. Väldigt sköna sängar och memory foam madrasser. Bra badrum men väldigt lyhört. Härlig utsikt över stan. Extra plus för trevlig service!

title: SimplySexy!
text: The rooms are incredibly Sexy! It’s a place you don’t want to be alone! Some of the best views of the city are from the high floors in this hotel! Besides the rooms being incredibly sexy... The lack of any street noise or any other noises! It’s rare to find such silent rooms in the city!

title: Great location and nice rooms!
text: Location, location, location - and then some nice rooms too ;-) Everything you need in a big city is within walking distance. Nice to get back to our cosy local area around Rivington in the evening after strolling the streets of NYC all day.

title: Great location....minor considerations.
text:
I'd say this is more of 3.5 out of 5. The hotel is 'good', but not 'very' good.
Firstly, the price was great for New York. Location is amazing and rooms were to a great standard. Beds were super comfortable and we had a shower that was also a steam room. 
The things to consider when staying here. 
1. Depending on where your room is situated. Expect noise outside until the early hours and lots of car horns. We had this every night.
2. It felt like the General Manager of the hotel needed to get a grip on the small detail things that make your stay a five-star experience. It felt like it lost the touch they had 10 years ago. We saw on most days dirty dishes on trays at the top of stairways for example.
3. Concierge was a complete disaster. They had very little knowledge of restaurants or provided options on where to dine. For those completely new to the city, the team demonstrated very little knowledge of options available.
I would definitely stay again, as I said, this is a great place. Just needs to uplift on the finer details.
Hope this helps! Enjoy your stay and NYC!
P.S. 
Top restaurants we tried:
Dirty French!
The Spaniard
Sunday in Brooklyn - amazing Bloody Mary's and pancakes!

title: Excelente
text: Muy buena relacion precio calidad, excelente atencion, camas super confortables, habitaciones comodas, amplias. La ubicacion fue buens para mi. Buena decoracion, y buen ambiente en general. La limpieza excelente. Voy a volver!

title: Rivington
text: corner room, good size, nicely appointed, the shower was enormous although the bathroom was poorly lit, friendly staff, good mini bar, limited menu at cafe medi for breakfast, good wifi, east village location good not great.  good hotel but price sensitive.

title: Excellent place to stay!
text:
First off, I was put up at the Rivington by my employer, and didn't make the reservation at my own choosing. Excellent place to stay, however, and enjoyed it very much!! My experience with the staff was VERY positive. Did not dine at the hotel, however, as my coworkers had eaten there the night before (and loved it) but decided to eat at one of the many places within a couple minute's walk for food and drink.

Upon checking in, I did see the room rate my employer was paying; maybe I'm not used to NYC hotel prices, but I thought to myself that I'm glad my employer was picking up the tab!

The only other "ding" in the experience -- and this is a fact of NYC life and no reflection on the hotel -- was the number of garbage trucks collecting trash in the middle of the night in the neighborhood! My room was on the 6th floor....but it almost sounded like I was on street level!

Regardless, a great stay overall!

title: Amazing Experience!
text: Absolutely wonderful; the hotel is beautiful and despite its size, it still maintains a very personal, boutique-like atmosphere. The location is perfect with easy access to any major area in the city. We absolutely loved it!

title: Pretty good location, good rooms. Great staff
text:
Good location, great stuff, modern rooms, awesome shower. The art is cool and offbeat. 
The wine happy hour is a nice touch. 
Staff was wonderful. 
Our room was not ready immediately (just took an extra 10 min), and they offered us breakfast next day at the adjacent restaurant. 
Unfortunately....
Restaurant- terrible service.

title: Unbeatable Sunrise
text: This must be the coolest boutique hotel in NYC. Un-obstructed (literary) sunrise in the room/bed/shower. Cafe de la Mar has nothing on this hotel. Depending on the room location you can have both sunrise and sunset over the small-scaly East Village skyline. The location is right in the mix, with crawling distance to great bars, galleries, restaurants, shops et tutti quanti. Great retro (60s) interiors with contemporary art works thrown in for good measure. Awesome.

title: Nice view, terrible everything else
text: i stayed on the 19th floor in a room with a gorgeous view and balcony, but that is the only good thing i can say about the hotel. i was staying there for business, and room was booked via our travel agent and prepaid on the company card. upon arrival, front desk told me that i had to put down my personal card (i travel all the time for work and have never been asked to do that before) and refused to acknowledge that the room was already paid for (which i showed them on my itinerary). after arguing for 15 mins, they finally used the card on file and let me up to my room. i hopped in the shower to notice that the courtesy conditioner they provided was USED and half empty. DISGUSTING. that made me look at the lotion that was on the counter to realizes they REFILLED a half empty bottle with more lotion. there were greasy fingerprints all over the bottle. REALYY??

title: Great place
text: Came for business. Room was massive. Shower was massive. People were fantastic. Overall: Great area, amazing service, would definitely recommend & return myself. I wandered into the restaurant on the first floor, and I'm also glad I did. Great service there and good people watching from the patio.

title: Good location, but not every room shines
text: The location is great. The room I had was ok. Nice interior, but pretty dark with a tiny window facing another building. If you're booking for the views, make sure you get a room that actually has them.

title: Our home away from home - Our home in NYC
text: Welcoming hotel - Great service, friendly staff, wonderful rooms, the best beds ever, spacious rooms, clean, fantastic views from the rooms - recommend HighFloorKingCorner, unpretentious, charming and cool neighborhood

title: Perfect business stay
text: Well run hotel with a boutique feel in Lower East Side's bar and restaurant hub. Comfy beds, great rooms. Perfect choice for fun or business. Its also great to have a hotel room with limited street noise so that you start the day rested. Tempur mattresses are a great plus - have one at home and have never experienced this in a hotel.

title: So close to 5 stars
text: I give Hotel Rivington a 4.5, only because the breakfast that I ordered arrived 45 minutes after the time I specified on the order form. Other than that, everything was perfect. They turned down my bed while I was out for the evening and left cookies which I loved! The King Suite was huge, had a great bathtub and shower. Cafe Medi was cute for getting some work done during the day. All staff members were friendly and helpful. Great location as well. Will definitely stay again.

title: Business and vacation
text: It is was just ok to not good. Loud party nothing down about it. Slamming doors cursing loud music I had two boys with me. It lasted from 2-6am. Room was not cleaned second day till 5:3 after we got back from a full day out so I passed because we wanted to rest instead. Will be canceling December reservations sorry. First tripnthere was better. Also the coffee voucher to start at 11 no one starts there Day having coffee at 11 nice to have it but use less. Sad because it's a great location and the rooms are a great size for NYC!

title: almost perfect
text: so I would have neen able to say that my stay was perfect had it not been for the last 30 mins of my stay. first, when I called down to extend i was told that the hotel was sold out only to see various time available on hotwire.com hotels.com and the hotelstonite app. secondly at check out I was charged the $25 upgrade fee i was told by the very kind check in receptionist. when I explained that to the not so friendly receptionist at check out I was cut off and dismissed.

title: Belle camere
text: Hotel abbastanza centrale che non si presenta benissimo all'ingresso ma che ha camere davvero ampie con bella vista, minibar super rifornito e ottimi prodotti da bagno. Colazione non eccezionale, molto semplice ma alla fine la scelta di due prodotti può accontentare tutti.

title: Rivington has set a new standard for us
text: We have had the privilege of our work landing us all over the world. Our experience at Hotel On Irvington was sheer heaven. The place, the people, the care, the use of space. Truly Special.New York is my second home & we all know it's a beautiful place to often feel cramped. Not on this trip!

title: Stay Here!
text: We booked the Hotel on Rivington because it is close to where our daughter lives. We were delighted how nice it is, spacious guest and bathroom, great location close to lots of restaurants, bars and attractions.

title: Modern hotel in lively neighborhood
text:
This hotel is clean, bright and modern. It was also affordable for Manhattan.

Our room was a decent size with a great view. Wifi and AC worked well. Gym is well equipped.

The neighborhood was great! Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants. Even with the nightlife the hotel room was quiet.

title: would have been 5 if not for...
text: Full/see through window in my third floor shower! Maybe some people like strangers seeing them naked but definitely not for everyone. Also, don't make guests feel like they're crazy when they ask why there is a window in the shower. Don't say "the building is designed that way" or "we'll send up a privacy screen" as if I'm being high maintence. Also when you say you're sending up a privacy screen, send more than a wide piece of duck tape.

title: October 2017
text: The view from the room was amazing and the hotel was in a good location.   I would think that the outside noise could have been less.  The room we were in had a beautiful bath but the shower wall was  windows and only very little was frosted.  I know I was on the 11th floor but did not like the idea that anyone could look up and see me in the shower.

title: Review
text: The hotel was great, the view was amazing, we enjoyed the location.  Having both a shower and a soaking tub was great.  The black toilet was weird, we could not tell if it was clean or not (it probably was).

title: Home away from home a+
text: I have stayed at Rivington about five separate occasions now. It is my favorite hotel in NYC. Customer service is wonderful and the rooms are so swanky and cool with beautiful city views. It is in an artsy area with tons of restaurants in a short walking distance.  The corner suit is amazing and if you can swing it I highly recommend it. The Japanese bath tubs are so cool I have never seen a tub so big! My husbands favorite part is their comfortable bed and linens it's like sleeping in a cloud. Thank you Rivington for your continued excellence !  - The Tunnacliffes

title: A visit to remember
text: I usually stay in SOHO or TRIBECA to enjoy the atmosphere of Manhattan below 23rd street. This time I tried something new and found a great location. I will be back again soon and I will also refer friends.

title: Great location
text: Clean, large room, great hot shower. 4th floor looking over neighborhood life - a good vibe. Great downtown location, within walking distance to subway, restaurants, shopping, and candy store. Expensive for me, though.

title: A Good Value But Rooms Can Be Tired And Need Of Refresh
text:
Staff is really nice, good amenities over all but the room we stayed in this time around was really tired and in desperate need of a refresh.
Also, can be noisy on the weekend.  Suites are nice though so those are the best rooms to stay in.

title: I won't make the same mistake twice.
text: The front desk staff was unprofessional and unhelpful.  From the moment of check in, thru the 2 nights we stayed, and then check out at departure, the front desk seemed annoyed to be working there. Trying to get room service was a disaster, and no one seemed to care.

title: Great time at the Rivington
text: My wide and I went for our birthdays! Had an amazing time. Especially impressive was our corner suite room. With one of the most amazing showers I've ever been in. Overall a very fun, cool place to stay in a great location.

title: large rooms and Davines bathroom products a plus
text: The room met my expectations and was spacious (is there such a thing in NYC?); the check in process wasn't painful but guest service agents weren't very outgoing or nice.  I would stay here again if I wanted to be in the LES.

title: Best hotel experience I have ever had!
text:
I had the best hotel experience I have ever had while staying at your hotel last Tuesday. The employees were friendly and quick to accommodate, the room was extremely clean and I loved the entire feel/look of the room. The view was AMAZING!

I did not expect to come back to see that my room had been cleaned during the short time I was out to dinner but then to have delicious cookies waiting for me when I returned took my happiness to a whole other level.

I also had a great nights sleep. I wish all my over night work trips were like this! Thank you for such a great experience and I hope to come back for work and play in the near future.

title: Top of the list
text: We stayed here once before and we loved it then.  On our second stay, their services made us more enamored with Hotel On Rivington.  There is an abundance of 5 start hotels in NYC but this 5 star hotel is the only place for my wife and me.  Pure sexiness and admirable service.

title: Simple but good
text:
Arrived to this hotel and my reservation was not found!
I had booked through Booking.com
After a cancelled flight and more than 24h travel time, I just wanted a bed!
It took them a lot of time to find the reservation and they were not very friendly about it. 
I had all documents and reservation numbers with me, so I would have thought that this would not have been such an issue.
Another couple checked into the hotel and their reservation was also not found. 
It took me an hour to get to my room, which they did upgrade after waiting. 
The room was great, but small for a suite. Bathroom was super clean. Overall great stay. The restaurant below offers amazing breakfast. I loved the area.

title: Fantastic spot
text: I can't recommend highly enough! This was my second stay in 2 years and the staff and ambiance just keep getting better. Highly recommended if you don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of mid-town. Love the LES!

title: Great rooms!
text: Bed is amazing, very comfortable. Great view from the corner rooms. Ample showers. Best shower heads ever! I got a double shower which was pretty cool. Location is good too. A few restaurant and bar options nearby. Would certainly recommend this hotel!

title: Plesantly surprised - modern but not annoyingly so.
text:
Stay there. Eat there. Location is great! 
My group was thrilled with the restaurant, and I loved my corner room (two walls of windows!) on the high floor. It's was a surprise to really like a NY hotel.

title: Die Aussicht ist grandios
text: Endlich in NY Zimmer mit einer Größe bei der man keine Probleme hat seinen Koffer unterzubringen und die Aussicht ist grandios. Leider hat man im obersten Stockwerk über sich die Rooftopbar die privat vermietet wird (nicht für Hotelgäste) und das ist in den Zimmern darunter schon störend laut. Das inkludierte Frühstück ist okay aber die Servicegebühr die dafür berechnet wird ist wirklich frech.

title: Great LES Hotel
text: Favorite spot to stay when visiting NYC. Hotel on Rivington is conveniently located, the rooms are fantastic (so are the shower products), and there are several great bars & restaurants on the same block. Close to a Metro stop as well.

title: Great location
text: This property was close to the train station and walking distance to Soho, Little Italy and China Town which was fabulous.  The quality of workmanship in the bathrooms was substandard with tiles falling off and paint splatters on the tiles.  Great to be in a room with floor to ceiling glass to enjoy the views of the East side.

title: Sketchy area! Creepy hotel
text: The place was nothing like the pictures. The whole room was outdated and falling apart. The balcony was more like an unsteady fire escape 19 stories up! So my wife and I didn't go out there. Don't go!

title: Excellent
text: Great hotel, excellent service! Would come back again next time I'm in town. The hotel really thinks about the guests needs and what they would want in there room. The bar was fully stocked. The views are amazing!

title: Excellent Location, Views, Staff, and Accomodations
text: Everything at the hotel exceeded our expectations. We really enjoyed our stay and will be visiting again. Our room was huge for a hotel in the city and we really felt like we got a great value. The staff was very accomodating and made sure our stay was enjoyable.

title: Cool and comfortable
text: Spacious room, superclean, with very very comfy beds! Excellent staff, friendly and always helpful...Well located in vibrant LES, with the amazing Trapizzino roman food just across the street! Close to metro, short walk from Soho. It's a nice place to stay. I'll be back here for sure!

title: Not gluten-friendly options
text: Excellent city views and staff; restaurant had gluten in breakfast items that are typically not a challenge. Enjoyed common areas and the desk attendants were super helpful. The area of the hotel was very diverse, with good cab/Uber options.

title: Fun hotel, great location
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel On Rivington.  It is a cute little boutique hotel. Loved the art, decor and vibe. Friendly staff.  Great location for us. The cafe at the entrance to the hotel has good food and is a super fun place to sit and watch people pass by on the streets of New york. The room was a wee bit smaller than expected but it was nicely decorated and had a great view. I loved the cookies each night with the turn down service. Would certainly stay again.

title: Amazing Birthday Party at Hotel Rivington / JIA Lounge
text: Hosted my birthday party for ~60 guests at JIA Lounge at the Hotel Rivington.  Amazing experience!  The management there, in particular Anna Vagner the Director of Events, handled every detail with care.  The food, DJ, bartenders, and even the head of hospitality were set on making sure everything ran smoothly.

title: High scale or Gothic haunted house rip off?
text: The hallways and bathrooms were SO dark, and the bathrooms to the point that it was difficult to see to put on makeup. There were chips out of the tile in the floor of my bathroom that were sharp and the repairs I could see had been done were not done well. And honestly those BLINDLY BIG face pictures as you stepped off the elevator on EVERY FLOOR were creepy AF.  I seriously thought there were camera's in behind the eyes watching us. It didn't feel like an upclass hotel but like a gothic rip off haunted house.

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed in the terrace suite. We ran into some minor problems, but the team worked hard to make sure that they were all resolved-- and they were! We had a blast! Hotel room was very comfortable too!

title: Great views from the Corner King
text:
I booked two rooms, a corner king and a standard double.  If you want to stay in the LES area, and have the budget for the corner king it's worth it, great views, spacious room and bathroom, and natural light due to being on the higher floors.  Positive points for the standard double, I had a room on the 5th floor, very spacious, contemporary and comfortable, negative points - facing onto the walls of neighbouring buildings - not unusual for NYC I know, but it meant very little natural light - wouldn't be so much a problem if the room and bathroom lighting was bright, but it's not - it's very subtle, with every light on in the bathroom it's still not possible to see enough to put make up, or see properly at all when getting ready.  The shower was lacking any power, maintenance tried to address this and made an improvement but still not good enough.

generally the staff and service is good.  Our Corner King room was not ready until after 5pm (check in is 4pm) and staff organised complimentary breakfast in the attached restaurant to compensate for the inconvenience.  Complimentary coffee and wine in the bar are offered on arrival.  my requests re. lamp and shower were addressed quickly.

rooms and beds are comfortable, with turndown service each night and cookies left by the bed which is a nice touch.

location was great for exploring chinatown, little italy, soho, all close walking distance, subway station a couple of minutes walk away.  The LES is lively at night so expect some noise if in a street facing room.  one point on the corner king, and this is not the hotel's fault obviously, but something I wish I had known - there is an enormous amount of construction going on in NYC and the view included two huge construction sites which contributed quite a bit of noise if you plan to sit out on the balcony - if I'd known we were splashing out a premium for a room with a view I really would have reconsidered it if i'd known the view to include this, or checked if the hotel had another room with an alternative outlook before booking.

Overall, it is a good hotel if looking for something cool in the area, but for me there are other good alternatives at a similar price for a standard room, but i would recommend it if you go for the higher class of room.

title: Just... bad. But nice room.
text: The room was actually nice and decent. But the outside of the hotel doesn't even have a sign with a name. I happened to see it because of the carpet on the ground outside. Service was just horrible. Expensive for my taste but that's New York prices.

title: Ruined Wedding Experiencd
text: Where to start. As charming as the  views are, the staff is TERRIBLE. No one knows how to help or take accountability for issues at the hotel. Smelled like weed in the entire building. Would NOT recommend.

title: Noisy
text: I couldn't sleep from the street noise, very unprofessional staff. I didn't know there are room categories depending on the floor, so I ended up in a lousy room on the 5th floor, it's noisy and people could see me through toilet window which had no screen. The bed is comfortable, the bath products are good, the location is good but noisy.

title: Large room & great views!
text: Cool, minimalist decor/design with unique artwork. King corner rooms have great balconies for watching sunrise & sunset or just taking in the wonderful views. Request a high level floor. Great neighborhood for restaurants and bars.

title: Rita Black
text: Stayed at the hotel with my daughter. Lovedi the location close to the East Village Soho Chinatown and of course in the lower Eastside. Saw an amazing band at Rockwood,  had dim sum in Chinatown which was in walking distance and shopped through Soho and the East Village. We frequently travel to New York City as my son lives there .I am also a native New Yorker. This hotel was my favorite of many. Will definitely be back

title: Paging: Bleach and a Scrub Brush
text:
First off, I'm a longtime guest of this hotel:  I was here on opening night and have stayed throughout the years in all types of their guestrooms (yes, including the Penthouse...  Fabulous bathroom).  

Let's also get one important thing straight:  HoR is no longer the 'It Girl' hotel.  It's long since passed the cool torch onto other, newer properties and is now an expedia.com sale staple, catering to the needs of people who want the look of Lower East Side 'cool' without the high price tag.  

And with that low cost comes the many caveats:  Rundown rooms, walls that need repair, painting, cleaning, etc.  They thankfully have replaced flooring, but even that is beginning to show age.  Elevators routinely break down.  The tech in the rooms is laughably outdated.  Mold in the showers.  Dirt in all cracks. Window cranks that fall off and are unusable.  Thank God the toilets are all black, otherwise I fear what I'd really see.

With a dozen or so new properties having gone up on the LES since The Riv opened, it's surprising to me that the owners haven't tried harder to remain competitive.  Down the street The Ludlow, while having smaller rooms, is spectacularly beautiful (and clean).  The same goes for the Indigo, Trump Soho, Crosby St and LES60.  

On a positive note, I can say that The Riv still has an incredibly comfortable bed, outfitted in Frette sheeting.  It's not worth the stay, but it's better than sleeping on a god awful bed.

Rivington, if you're reading this, consider you're in one of the most competitive hotel markets in the world and no longer the only 'upscale' option in your neighborhood.  It's time to either put up or shut up.  You can do better.

title: Super Hotel
text: Fantastic hotel - value, service, location, transport, food options in area.....East Village may not appear to be where most tourists want to stay but if you prepared to spend 5-10 mins on a subway that adds to the NYC experience then this hotel is fantastic. Family room is large and spacious, front desk is relaxed and very welcoming and helpful. Complimentary coffee and wine daily, great cafe and breakout areas....perfect for our family of 4.

title: Very noisy
text:
All I asked for is a high floor room , away from any noise. I got a corner room on the 5th floor, the area is very noisy at night even after 1pm cars beeping, people screaming we couldn't sleep. At 7pm we were woken up by noises in the hallway. Also the room overlooks a rooftop where some people were playing games and having a party early in the evening, the toilet overlooks that area and there is no screen , so they can actually see you while using the bathroom.
I called to complain and asks to be moved to a high floor, they said I must pay more for a higher category. I have stayed in many hotels in the city, this is horrible. Maybe if you stay on the top floor, but even then you can find a much better hotel at that price. The rooms are so plain and furniture is chipped. I don't recommend it to anyone

title: Mostly good.
text: Great location for restaurants and NYC history. (Visit the Tenement Museum) Not close to mid-town but a bus, cab or subway will get you there. Staff is very nice and efficient. Room was comfortable and spacious for NYC. They could use a few updates and a little more storage space. Overall a good stay and very enjoyable for my husband and me.

title: Great vibe, great rooms, great price
text: It's a really cool place in a fantastic neighborhood, and all the staff I met were friendly and helpful. I had a great weekend in LES thanks in large part to these guys. To give you a sense of how great the staff were: they were showing my room to a group of prospective guests as I walked into it for the first time. I told them that there was no problem--they have to show the place to new people sometimes, right?--but they insisted on sending up a bucket of cold Brooklyn Lagers anyway.

title: Awesome place to stay!
text: Location is the Best! Soho is walking distance if you like to shop;) Great restaurants in the area as well! Room was clean and comfortable with cool city views and staff was very professional with great customer service! Looking forward to my next stay in the fall! I love this place and the location!

Good hotel but the location is not really (I hadn't checked it in advance). Subway is close (next corner). Good value. Staff is very helpful and kind. The room is excellent and clean. The bed is comfortable.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here the night of our wedding. Our room had a beautiful view and the hotel staff were very friendly. The room had champagne and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us, too!

title: Cool Hotel on the Lower East Side
text: Hotel On Rivington is perfecty located in the Lower East Side. It's near bars, restaurants, public transportations. Rooms are much bigger than the average in New York. The views are beautiful. The service is really helpful, nice and welcoming. I would definitely recommend it!

title: Cool retreat in an awesome neighborhood.
text: We loved everything about our stay at the Hotel on Rivington and will be back. The staff is welcoming and helpful, the rooms are huge and lovely and the neighborhood is full of galleries, bars, shops and restaurants. It's a perfect place to stay in NYC.

title: Sleek, trendy hotel with great amenities.
text: It is a great location if you are doing most of your visiting on the the Lower East Side / Greenwich Village area. The hotel is wonderfully managed with stylish accommodations. The beds were great! I have never slept so well in my life. I actually asked for the model of the mattress so I could get one.

title: Great stay
text: Fabulous location in heart of East Village. Small feel hotel with a big presence. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was well appointed, and Tempur-pedicure bed was divine! Will definitely be back.

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: Service is not good, you'd think you were in the south not the lower east side of manhattan, check-in is kind of late, 4pm, and check out is at 12pm and the .  I booked two rooms, side by side, checked into one at 1pm, the cleaning person walks out of the other room at 105pm and tells me that the room is clean and ready to go.  Do you know that that room was not ready until 330....

title: The interior is totally different
text: DO NOT TRUST THEIR MARKETING! They renovated it in a totally different style one or two years ago. It's dark, black wall and bloody carpet, vintage with dim light and large creepy headshots everywhere. The bed is clean and comfortable, however I don't quite feel comfortable with the cleanness of the furnitures. They have a really nice bathroom with large space in the shower room though. The staffs are nice but it seems like they don't have enough people during daytime, you can hardly find the bellman when you wait at the entrance.

title: Great stay nice staff.
text: Fun location. Staff was very kind, helpful, and friendly. We had kids with us and they were friendly to them and helped us speedily when our younger son was sick. Everyone there seemed sincere and nice. I would go back there for sure.

title: Stunning hotel with probably the best view in the world!
text:
We didn't want to leave this incredible hotel, with the most exciting view of lower Manhattan. All staff are vibrant, laid back and friendly. Best hotel staff we've ever encountered. 
The room on the 15th floor gave us a view on two sides of NYC - from Williamsburg bridge right round to the Empire State Building. Breath taking.
The hotel is ultra clean, and every day we were treated to cookies in our room, complimentary coffee and wine.  
We'll be recommending this hotel to all and sundry. Lower East Side is the place to be.
And we'll be back.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: La ubicacion es comoda. El hotel esta bien. Las habitaciones comodas y grandes, con gran calidad en todo (si bien ya nos habiamos hospedado hace varios años y era un poco mas lijoso antes. y me refieron a tapizados, etc). Igualmente esta muy muy bien. Personal muy amable. Lo mejor son las vistas que tiene de NY desde los pisos mas altos. Vista espectacular. Muy recomendable.

title: Excellent
text: Beautiful hotel! Very friendly and helpful staff, great location, wonderful view from the room, clean rooms, cute restaurant,  all around great place!  We highly recommend it to everyone and will definitely stay here again!

title: A truly great find
text:
Good price, Interesting location (very different for us), and REALLY wonderful staff.  Everyone seemed genuinely happy and happy to be there.
The bed was actually the BEST hotel bed I've ever slept on.

title: Great Lower East Side Hotel
text: Wonderful, warm welcome from the bellhops. Smooth check-in. Slightly dark lobby. Lovely art hanging. Comfortable, secure room. Sublimely comfortable bed...best sleep ever. Good breakfast. Lots to do right on your doorstep. Easy checkout.

title: Loved our stay!
text: What a gem of a hotel!  Easy check-in / out, great room (we got a corner suite - worth the upgrade).  The bed was AMAZING. Perhaps the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever sleep in.  Super quiet, especially for NYC. Loved the LES location. Nice restaurant on-site.  There were some "interesting" guests here (bachelor parties) but they really didn't bother us, just entertaining. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

title: Stunning views & Incredible hospitality
text: Hotel on Rivington has been a favorite of mine for years. Unlike other NYC hotels, which often become run down or less attentive over time, the Rivington is better with every stay. Kristen goes above an beyond for loyal guests and has not only made my stays feel special but takes care of my clients during their trips with equally phenomenal customer service. This hotel is unrivaled when it comes to views and it continues to be my home away from home, year after year. Another shout out to this wonderful establishment, their accommodating staff and wonderful service. See you next trip to NYC!

title: What a pleasure
text: We so enjoyed the location and value of this great little hotel. We arrived really late but were welcomed with a big smile into this what feels like a family owned hotel. The ed was the best. Contemporary artworks give it a funky feel. The location is perfect for subway uses and easy to get to from JFK. Trendy bars close by.

title: Just what I needed
text: Clean, modern, comfortable (beds was comfy) and convenient hotel to where my daughter lives in the Lower East End. Not the prettiest of views, but that was expected.  I didn't get to try the restaurant or bar.

title: Comfortable stay
text: This hotel was so comfortable. It was clean with nice decoration/design and quality decor. Loved the location. Friendly staff, complementary wine upon arrival, and a bed that I could have stayed in all day.

title: Great Location and Sleek Hotel
text: The Hotel on Rivington is a sleek hotel which has a beautiful dark bathroom with Italian Davines bath amenities of more than decent size. The bed is heavenly, and with turn down service they treat you to water, popcorn and two little cookies. Very spacious room for NYC and service, restaurant was great. Would definitely recommend and return.

title: Disaster
text: If you want to stay in a brothel, this is the place for you.  Terrible access to lobby and dirty rooms.  Not a place for children in the least bit.  If you are looking to be drunk at check in and check out, then this is your hotel.

title: Davvero bello!
text: Lo consiglio assolutamente: camere ben arredate, spaziose, pulite, hotel tranquillo nonostante si trovi in una zona piena di locali che di sera si animano... la colazione offre diverse alternative; è vicino alla stazione della metro e comunque a piedi ci si può recare a Chinatown oppure raggiungere la Broadway e da lì arrivare in pieno centro di Manhattan

title: Downtown hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel with my husband to celebrate our anniversary, and were generally very pleased with the hotel. The staff was very friendly, the room was lovely, and the soaking tub was amazing! Location is great, close to good food and bars in the area.

title: Solid Manhattan hotel
text: Very decent sized rooms for Manhattan, nice decor, friendly staff. This was my first stay with the hotel and I'll definitely go back. I had a street side room and the noise was fine, didn't disturb me at all. Wasn't much a view from my room, not sure if you can get a room with a view on the top floor though, might just be high enough to peep over the buildings opposite.

title: Best hotel experience in NYC
text: Best hotel experience in NYC. Immaculately clean, large and comfortable room, amazing view, quiet, affordable, great location close to subway, friendly and professional staff. Super impressive experience.

title: Sexy place to stay
text:
Beautiful views from the balconies, amenities are unparalleled, and LES location is perfect. Highly recommend the King Corner room with balcony, it is worth every penny. 
 The room was clean and spacious, and the hotel is walking distance to many nice restaurants.

title: Great views, with modern, inviting interiors
text: Last minute booking, was able to be accommodated with a gorgeous room with an intoxicating view of the city, and a balcony. Located in the heart of it all. A stocked mini fridge. Very welcoming staff, always greeted properly.

title: Excellent hotel
text:
Great time at the Rivington with our two kids. Superb staff, excellent location and view. Restaurant was very good - complimentary wine a very nice feature. Not to mention the bottle of champagne and treats that were waiting for us when we returned to the hotel in the evening. 

The staff was especially nice to our kids - 11&13.  The kids loved the place.

title: First trip to NY!
text:
This was my family's first trip to NY and we were overall very satisfied with our stay. The staff were all nice and helpful. The women at the front desk was wonderful and accommodating, and the doormen always greeted you with a smile. The couple of things we didn't like is that you couldn't really walk to any of NY attractions and sites and there's only a mini bar filled with over priced drinks and no room to put anything in to keep cold. Only one restaurant in the hotel, but many food options around the hotel. There's no visible sign saying Rivington hotel only the sign for the restaurant(Cafe Medi) on the outside. They do have complimentary wine and coffee, but you would only know that if you were to read about the hotel online. There's nothing there that tells you that you have that available to you.
Overall I would recommend the Hotel on Rivington.

title: Great location and awesome staff
text:
When I arrived at the the Hotel Rivington I thought it was in fact the Medi Restaurant but that seems the theme in New York ... they love to hide things .. I mean top nightclubs are hidden behind derelict graffiti laden doors with no indication of what lays behind.
Anyway the Hotel Rivington was very cool with large and well appointed rooms. I was, however a tad disappointed as the pictures showed wall to floor glass rooms but I didn't have one of these :-(. Maybe its worth checking exactly which room you get. I believe the good ones are on floor 9 and above.
Anyway the highlights for me were Ashleigh in reception and Jerry on the door. Two native NewYorkers with an amazing insight . Jerry was from the neighbourhood. I loved it when he said the Lower East Side was like a c**p shute when he was a kid but now it's all trendy and gentrified with cool bars n bistros and the pavements awash with models and city slickers. 
Ashleigh likewise was an insightful character. Her vivacious personality and laugh rebounded off the walls of the reception area delightfully. What a gal .. pleasant, funny, welcoming and knew so much about NYC. Her tips of where to go were truly great, the highlights being the walk over Brooklyn Bridge and a stroll on the HighLine located in the Meat packing district.
I found New York very expensive but found a great Taqueria around the corner .. The Essex Taqueria I believe .. I love Mexico but found the chef un poco sosa (grumpy) but I said cheer up man .. your food is muy rica!!! he got to know me over the days I was there and he did brighten up for sure .. but definitely try out the tacos n quesadillas ...
The hotel is in a great position to walk to SOHO, Little Italy and Chinatown and the F line subway is just round the corner (in fact you pass the Essex Taqueria on the way!) The subway is next to McDonalds, a great option for breakfast, especially since the Rivington have stopped their complementary breakfast :-(
Two blocks away is Katz's the world famous deli .. you can grab yourself a $22 pastrami sandwich after queuing for about an hour but it sure made Sally happy dining there (Was featured in when Harry met Sally) so give it a go. The cutters are well funny and the place is a must see really.
I also got grabbed by a random guy who took me to a comedy club (well a room behind an Irish pub) really close to the hotel .. Jerry will know all about it! And it was free to go!! and they ordered free pizza for you too! The comedians were so funny, a couple in particular had cutting new york humour which definitely satisfied my english palate!
Oh .. next door to the hotel on the corner of essex/rivington is a bodega owned by a lovely indian family. They sell coffee at $1 a throw!! It should have a sign saying New York's cheapest coffee jut like in the movie ELF where a similar establishment claimed the World's best cup of Coffee!
Well New York was great and the Rivington is in a perfect location in the neighbourhood as Jerry says ... Staying in midtown, Times Square is good but you lose the quirkiness of somewhere with that local feel .. I really liked it and would like to come back even to eat the $22 sandwich!

title: Great location, great staff
text: Excellent location on the Lower East Side, walking distance from many good restaurants, the Tenement Museum and one block from the subway (F train, direct to Grand Central). The room is comfortable and large for an NYC hotel.  The staff was exceptionally friendly -- both at the desk and at the doors. Great place!

title: Great experience
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. A great property in a fun part of NYC. Great location with excellent access to restaurants and transportation. We will definitely return. The staff is very helpful with excellent recommendations.

title: The best in LES!
text: We stayed in a high floor corner king.  Well worth the extra money.  During the day, we had terrific views and sunlight.  At night, the room was quiet, and the black out curtains and cozy bed made for great sleeping.  The hotel is located in a nice area with a municipal parking ramp ($45 per day, I think).  Good eating, shopping, and people watching right in the neighborhood.  Not too many tourists.  We also walked easily to SoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown.  Took several quick cab rides to see music at MSG (less than $20 fare).  Will stay again.

title: Rockin' Boutique Hotel
text:
Amazingly beautiful rooms.  Chic, hip and VERY comfortable.   Beds and pillows etc.  Cool bathroom.  Also very quiet.
Great staff!!    Helpful, friendly and charming.
