Great location in trendy lower east side.  Still maintaining some of "Old New York" flavor.

title: great room!
text: By far the best room and room layout of any of several i have stayed at in the Tribeca/Soho/LES areas. If you can get a good price its definitely a great place to stay in a neighbor with a lot to offer. Ask for a high floor.

title: Fun spot to stay on Lower East Side
text: Hip boutique hotel well situated on lower east side. Easy access to subway (block away), wonderful views on upper floors (corner rooms are best), fun neighborhood with good restaurants within walking distance. Review your bill upon departure.

title: Amazing location and excellent service by staff!
text: The location of this hotel is amazing being that it's in the Lower East Side. There is always something to do or someplace to go. Also, the staff at the HOR is superb! Ask for Ken! He's amazing and has the best recommendations for places to frequent.

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC.
text: The Hotel is located in the heart of the Lower East Side and is a terrific, happening neighborhood.  Love the hip vibe and the staff is very personable and helpful.  I always look forward to going back.

title: Best Hotel Value in Manhattan
text: This Lower East Side gem is an amazing value and well-worth the cab or Uber if you want to go uptown.  The rooms are simply the best, with Fret sheets and Tempurpedic mattress.  Edgy decor, soaking tub for two with all the extras included.  Highly recommended.

title: East Village NYC
text: Cool place to stay: modern architecture and decor with original artwork in rooms and public spaces.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Rooms are spacious, comfortable, very clean.  iIn hotel dining in Cafe Medi.  Situated in an interesting walkable neighbourhood, close to other interesting walkable neighbourhoods.  lots of dining options nearby. A short walk to metro station, quick rides uptown.  Can't wait to stay at Hotel on Rivington again

title: Dirty...
text: As mentioned i had to go to a local duane reade to pick up cleaning supplies to clean the bathroom. As a guest who paid for a balcony room - youd expect a little better ....also i was charged twice for my room service which is an annoyance. Bathroom door was difficult to close (room 103) very awkward pull. Balcony view was horrible with all of the construction. Not what was pictured online. They do not mention the distasteful views!!!

title: Tolle Aussicht
text:
Die Zimmer sind sauber 
Minibar ist liebevoll gefühlt 
Sogar ein Charger gibt es für die EU 
empfehle Eckzimmer mit Balkon 
Von da sieht Mann die Brücken und Empire State Building 
Café medi ist ein liebes  Café 

Personal sehr nett und hübsch ;)
Vor allem Kenny

title: My LES Go-To Hotel
text: I had a great experience at the Hotel On Rivington. The room was spacious, the housekeeping top notch, the food excellent. I am a regular visitor to the lower east side, and I have to say this hotel is now my favorite.

title: Great Hotel at a Fantastic Price
text: Friendly staff, clean rooms, modern decor, and super comfy tempurpedic beds.  We booked this room for a fantastic price and they did not disappoint.  The street facing 5th floor room could get a bit noisy in the middle of the night for the city that never sleeps, but that isn't a reflection of the hotel.

title: "We love kids" - not so much
text:
We were looking forward to our spontaneous evening in the city with our two young kids. While we're not club goers anymore, we still want to be in the heart of the action. We travel all over the world with our kids and they are accustomed to new experiences.
I made a last minute booking on the hotel's website and made a follow-up call to my requests for an in room crib and bath (for our young kids) and was told - of course! "We love kids more than adults."  These reassurances were not met. We were not given a room with a bath, and no cribs were available - nor were we told there was none available (at check in we were told one would be brought up right away - nothing was there when we returned from dinner.)  A strong smell of marijuana permeated the room all evening, coming in from a bathroom air vent. Never was an I'm sorry uttered or alternatives suggested.  While the room was beautiful and the location amazing - I would take stellar service over these other amenities any day of the week.

title: Great location. Really nice room!
text: We had an awesome view! Can't say enough about the room and location. There are tons of places to eat and drink within walking distance. You can go fancy at Beauty & Essex or have a hearty lunch at the Caribbean restaurant next door.

title: Wedding Aniversary
text: This place was perfect for wedding Anniversary.  I liked the design of the room. The location was very easy to find and the service was great. My wife and I really enjoyed our time together at  Hotel on Rivington.

title: The Best choice
text: After researching the best places in New York I can across Hotel on Rivington and I'm so glad we did. We were celebrating 3 birthday's out of the 4 of us and from the moment we arrived the service was exceptional. They organised a few surprises and were always so accommodating, it really did make our trip an amazing experience. When I thought it couldn't get any better we met Jordano in Café Medi and what an amazing guy. First class customer service and always wanted to help. We felt so welcome. The food was also good and we loved the vibe of the place. The hotel was perfect for what we wanted and it happened to be a 2 minute walk from Beauty & Essex restaurant which I also recommend. Subway is also a 1 min walk away I can't forget to mention being opposite the best sweet shop. Your kids will love you. If I ever go back to New York I will stay here again.

title: Great hotel in LES
text: Incredible view and very good rooms. Highly recommended both for business trips and weekend breaks. Make sure you book a room with a view - so much worth it, especially beautiful for watching  sunrises and sunsets.

title: Wonderful
text: Loved the experience at Hotel on Rivington. Fit persona of location. Like it was away from chaos of rest of city, but still easy to travel to various locations for meetings and to dine. Rooms were larger than what I have experienced before at similar status hotels in NYC.

title: A Party Hotel
text:
A Party Hotel	

With no visible sign to let you know that you have arrived at the Hotel on Rivington other than the doormat, we were ushered into the main floor by a very friendly and accommodating doorman.  Our room was spacious, with two walls of windows and a nice view.  The decor was hip and modern, and the bed was very nice and comfortable

The problem was the noise! There was an event on the top floor and there were revelers on our floor (the hotel rents out the top floor for events)  When the noise, yelling, whooping, and the like began around 10p we called the main desk at 10:15p.  Someone came up from the front desk and the part goers settled down briefly.  We called the front desk again at 10:45p and someone came to our floor (11th) and asked them to pipe down.  All was well, we were sound asleep, when at 4am we were jolted awake by a loud brawl in the hallway: slamming, yelling, cursing, threatening noises. We both jumped to our feet.  We tried in vain to call the front desk, multiple times but there was no answer.  The partiers were were clearly out of their minds. The next day when we went to the front desk, we were told that the phones went out which is why the front desk could not answer.  Noise is one thing but lack of security, being trapped with no ability to contact the front desk is another.  I hope that our experience was an anomaly.  The front desk offered to upgrade us to another room, but we were afraid to chance another rough night.  They did refund us what we had paid.

title: Birthday Treat
text:
Arrived on the 15th July 2017, to spend a couple of days with friends to celebrate my birthday.

The initial welcome seemed genuine with the reception staff recommending some local hospitality.

I later returned to the room to find a bottle of Verve and birthday cake, a really nice touch.

The hotel was lovely with our corner room on the 19th floor had great views but I wasn't brave enough to spend too much time on the narrow balcony.

The bar was great with a well versed barman creating a range of cocktails

The well stocked mini bar in the room with some amusing additions made us chuckle whilst the well equipped room and wet room made our stay really comfortable

We explored some great local restaurants included the expensive but worth it Stanton Social.

Overall would thoroughly recommend this quirky hotel as the base for exploring the lower side of NYC

title: Lower East Side Gem
text: If you're looking for a reasonably priced (by NYC standards) hotel, in a great neighborhood (Lower East Side, LOTS of food options and shopping), with great service and a luxury feel, this is the place.

title: The best room yet!
text: Stayed here last night for a staycation. This hotel hits all the spots. The room was beautiful, staff beyond welcoming and accommodating. I can't begin to rave about the views and the art work. Really incorporate that LES feel. The hotel restaurant down stairs was also beautiful. The food great, workers chatty and warm and best Frozè in NYC.

title: Great Hotel in Wonderful Location!
text: I  was not sure what to expect from this little hotel, but was pleasantly surprised that it far exceeded my expectations. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was spacious by New York Standards and the view was spectacular. The room was well appointed and the shower divine. Free wifi and cookies delivered in the evening. The location is excellent, especially if you are not interested in Times Square. We walked for miles and thoroughly enjoyed the neighbourhood. I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Un service client au top !
text:
Nous avons passé plus d'une semaine dans cet hotel que nous avons pu nous payer grace a une promo a 50% sur le net.
Nous etions un couple et trois enfants.
La chambre etait tres agreable avec une excellente literie et une belle salle de bain.
Le quartier est formidable et nous avons meme pu aller a pied dous le pont de Williamsburg pour assister au feu d'artifice du 4 juillet. Acces metro Essex a 200 metres.
Un personnel au petit soin et tres agreable.
Pour l'anecdote nous avions branché nos Iphones sur une prise USB mural qui les a fait dijoncter. Apres un echange chez Apple pour le premier (sous garantie), l'hotel nous a remboursé le second sans discussion apres avoir verifié la prise defectueuse. Merci de votre honnêteté.
Merci pour ce sejour et a bientot j'espere.

title: Great location
text: Situated in super hip lower Manhattan. Great restaurants and bars close by. Spacious rooms with sofa and desk. Free wifi. Great views across the city. Very friendly and helpfull staff. I will be back for sure.

title: Review of Rivington Hotel
text: Review of Hotel on Rivington.   Ask for non street facing room, provide coffee, put visible signage for the hotel.  The staff was courteous as well as the doormen and the location was good for subway use and Downtown accessibility.

title: Nice and cozy!
text: We arrived. Check in was easy. The room was clean ambiance was sexy and comfy- only issue we had was parking cost $70 per day and it's not advertised as such. I upgraded my room to a corner king. Was on the 16th floor. Nice view for a nice night.

title: Fun boutique hotel
text: It is on lower east side, so it was far away from Broadway, but that was nice.  My girls and I enjoyed this area more.  The hotel is small, but the rooms were spacious.  Great customer service.  I didn't like the black bathroom and we were on the 3rd floor so no view.  Room was well appointed and comfortable.  We paid a very reasonable price.  I would stay again.

title: Awesome Place
text: A real gem in a great neighborhood!  My family and I enjoyed everything about this hotel.  It is surrounded by great bars, restaurants and activities.  No need to stay in Times Square when this place gives you the real vibe of a New York City neighborhood and its a short subway ride away for anywhere you need to go.  The staff is friendly and helpful for any questions or problems.  Thank you for your hospitality.

title: Not first choice
text:
Flew into Newark Airpot and took a cab to hotel ($76 not including tip from airport taxi line).  Arrived to hotel and in an area with a narrow street.  Hard to even find entrance to hotel.  Once inside you have to go to 2nd floor to check in.  Check-in was quick.  Two elevators but are small and take a while to come up.
Room I had was 74.  Room was decent size.  Looked out windows and basically no view with view of a wall to building next door.   
As far as room was quite disappointed throughout stay.  Stayed for three nights.  First off, the room was extremely noisy.  You could hear noise all day and all night.  Doors closing and opening, people in and out and could hear conversations.  Noise from people showering upstairs.  Luckily always travel with ear plugs and that allowed me to sleep.  
Hotel itself needs a major renovation.  Just looks like it’s in need of a major makeover.  
One of the biggest disappointments was with the bathroom.  I did not get one of those showers people can see in as I had a bathroom with an interior bathroom.  But the room is all black.  Black walls, black vanity, black tub, black shower walls, black curtain and black floor.  Room is so dark and just one light in the bathroom.  Very hard to see when you’re getting ready.  Some of the floor tiles were broken. Toilet sometimes would not flush.  Had to flush several times.  AC door opened up and filter was filthy.  Looks like it had not been cleaned in months.   Bed was comfortable and linen looked clean.  Small sitting area with small sofa and a desk/chair.  If you need an iron and ironing board you have to call front desk to get one delivered.  Quick delivery though.  Safe in room.  Has a mini bar and one of the most well stocked mini bars I’ve ever seen.
This hotel would not have been my first choice but stayed because of an event at hotel.  Would I return to hotel?  Probably not.  Just not my type of hotel.
Check out was quick.  If you want a late check out though they will charge you $25 dollars per hour past noon check out time.  
They do have drivers that will take you to airport and to Newark they had an $80 flat rate (not including tip) as long as you paid in cash.  Much nicer car than taxi you get at airport.  
Hate writing reviews that are not positive but have to be honest and give an honest opinion of this hotel.

title: New York
text: Long distance from uptown and Broadway. Beds very comfortable and staff excellent. They must have been at the top,of their class in hospitality. We would stay there again on our next visit to New York.

title: Great boutique hotel and location on LES
text: From the moment we checked in we knew we were in for a great stay. We were a family of four traveling with two sons aged 17 & 20. The front desk staff were personable and more than accommodating (free room upgrade). Room were clean and tastefully decorated with modern furnishings. The double shower in the studio room was HUGE! Fresh daily cookies, a complimentary bottle of wine, bottled water, excellent location within a short walk to the subway and fabulous eateries. The bar across the street (Verlaine) has amazing daily Happy Hour specials with $6 Lychee Martinis. We would definitely stay here again!

title: excellent
text: It was a excellent hotel. I will recommend it to all our clients. The staff, the waiters, the sales department and general manager were wonderful .  Overall it was wonderful.  The location of  the hotel is excellent it felt very safe to walk day or in the evening.  The staff could not have been more helpful and always asking doing you need anything.  .

title: Great Hotel on the LES
text: Great location on the LES. Everyone was friendly and very helpful. Hip Cool environment! Walking distance to great restaurants. Next time I'm in New York I would stay at the Hotel on Rivington. Highly recommend.

title: Hotel Rivington - Unique Suite
text: Tastefully decorated suite, great views, and friendly staff with a plethora of restaurants and bars just steps from the hotel. Beds are second to none. The top floor views made up for any shortcomings we experienced.

title: Perfect room to view Macy's Fireworks!!
text: The staff here is so friendly and the room we requested was perfect for viewing the Macy's fireworks! We live in Manhattan and stayed at the hotel because of the location and view and it did not disappoint! Highly recommend!

title: Excellent location and views
text: We spent 5 days at the Hotel Rivington and it was an excellent location to explore the LES. Room is large for NYC with incredible views. Comfortable bed, really nice shower with good pressure and clean. I could spend hours gazing out the windows at the city.  Didn't use the balcony as much as we thought because it was loud.

title: Location
text: Fabulous little hotel, quiet rooms and nice amenities .   Food and beverage options limited during my stay but plenty of options in area.  Would recommend for couples or solo.  Staff was helpful.  Location cannot be beat.

title: Gorgeous views through floor to ceiling windows!
text: Wow! My husband and I just returned from a trip to NYC and had such a great experience at the Hotel on Rivington. The staff were genuinely friendly and helpful and the general manager Danny couldn't have been more gracious. Not only did he personally greet us at check in, he alway asked if we were enjoying ourselves and stopped to chat. Our corner king with balcony was beautiful, clean and spacious (and that's saying a lot for a NYC hotel room!) I did read reviews that mentioned how shocked some people were that the bathrooms also had floor to ceiling windows as they felt there was a lack of privacy (no one could see in unless they had a telescope and if that's the case well....what are you going to do!) but the hotel offers privacy screens for those who feel they need it. Personally I've never had a better view during a shower and absolutely loved it! I've already recommended the Hotel on Rivington to friends who frequent NYC.

title: A little disappointing
text: We've visited Manhattan many times but this was our first stay in the LES.  We enjoyed our stay in the area.  We are in our 60s and this hotel as well as the Ludlow is mainly younger, more hipster.  The hotel itself was ok with some problems and in my estimation not worth the money we paid.   We chose to pay for a higher floor room and stayed on the 12th floor.  The room was nice enough: quiet, clean, comfortable bed and pillows with a good view and sitting area.  What we didn't like was the all black bathroom with horrible lighting.  I found the all black color scheme depressing and hard to judge it's cleanliness.  The one small light over the sink cast horrible  shadows on the face and made  applying make up a real challenge.  But perhaps the worse thing was when the cover for the air conditioner filter in the bathroom opened up accidentally and exposed a filter with a couple of inches of accumulated dust, which appeared not to have been changed in years.  Yuck!  We complained and they replaced it later in the day, but does make you wonder about their maintenance standards.  We'll stay in a different area and different hotel next time.

title: Chic and modern!
text:
Prior to booking with Hotel on Rivington, I called and worked with a manager to make sure I did everything I was supposed to do. My boyfriend and I visited for our three year, and I was able to book through an upgrade special they were running online. Alex, the manager, was very helpful on the phone.

When we arrived, the front desk staff informed us that they were able to make the upgrade we had requested, and we were moved up to a high floor king with soaking tub and balcony. Despite mentioning the special occasion in the comment section on my booking and at the front desk upon check-in, there wasn't any special thought or surprise but into the experience. The only reason I had expected this was due to other TripAdvisor reviews of the property and experiences at other hotels of this caliber/price range. This and the length of time it took (over 30min) to get an iron were the only slight disappointments we experienced the entire trip.

The room was definitely spacious with a very comfortable king bed, ample closet space, sitting room, desk area, and large bathroom. Both the room and bathroom had great views of the city through the floor to ceiling windows which brought lots of light into the modern, mostly white rooms. The shower and soaking tub were huge and very comfortably fit my 6'5" boyfriend.

Although we didn't eat at Cafe Medi downstairs, it was always busy and must attract customers outside of the hotel guests. There is also a Juice Press conveniently located right next door for great, quick morning or afternoon snacks! The area in and of itself also has a tremendous amount of food options, especially late night snacks.

Check out was a breeze and all done online!

title: Great boutique hotel with amazing location
text: Stayed here for a conference in Williamsburg. Many restaurants nearby, and one is attached to the hotel. Easy subway access a few minutes walk away, and very easy to cross back and forth across the Williamsburg bridge. I was in a Studio Suite, the biggest hotel room i've experienced in NYC, with a separate sitting area and a very comfortable king size bed. Amazing floor to ceiling windows.  Shower was enormous with two separate heads, would be nice for couples. Cool artwork in the rooms and hallways.

title: We love the Hotel on Rivington
text:
We love the Hotel on Rivington! Having stayed here many times over several years. The staff is excellent: kind, professional and genuinely caring about the quality of our stay.   Its like coming home and we are grateful!

From Lester and the door staff welcoming us warmly while handling our bags, musical instruments and valuables with proficient precision… to the front desk staff tending to our needs with speed and sweetness..  the Hotel on Rivington is a gem!  

The area has all kinds of wonderful food, shopping and easy access to public transportation (subways and taxis).  Its a great vibe!  Simply stroll around and choose from countless options for entertainment, nourishment and fun. The LES / East Village is unique in that both low key and opulent options abound. Its a great neighborhood: safe, inviting and full of character + charm. 

Room +++s 
The beds are super comfortable! Fantastic mattress.
The bathtub is the deepest delight I have ever experienced!
The water pressure is strong with endless hot water :)

Views A+
Our room has a stunning view of the Freedom Tower
Other rooms I’ve stayed in showcased the Williamsburg Bridge and the East Village.  Its nice to get a higher floor to see the sights.
Walls of windows provide so much sunlight, even being stuck in the room working becomes a joy. 

Balconies give a little outdoor space and fresh air 
When you close the balcony door you appreciate how quiet the rooms are with great sound blocking glass.

In room temp controls work like a charm. 

I’ve had the occasional issue with things like a broken door handle in the bathroom ~ however the staff quickly repaired problem and compensated us for the inconvenience. Life has wear and tear so this I don’t mind because of how thoughtfully and fast they addressed the issue.

Food
They leave you a different cookie treat every night as they turn down the beds. 
Its a delicious touch that warms the heart and tickles the belly.

The restaurant at the hotel has changed over from our last visit and is now called Cafe Medi. Its got a bright inviting atmosphere with a tastier menu. We had lunch with a fabulous burger and golden beet salad. The avocado toast breakfast is also great. 

Every visit here has been fantastic and we are so happy to be back at our beloved Hotel on Rivington! 

We totally recommend staying here!

title: Not in love with it
text: We wanted to explore a new part of New York, so we decided to try the Lower East Side. It wasn't for us as a neighborhood, so that had some effect on our opinion. The hotel itself is in a good location, but if you don't love the area, it's not that much of a plus. The entire place is a little worn around the edges. There are dings in the cupboard doors and plaster/floor boards. The lobby is situated on the second floor, and has a dark, red lit atmosphere, which I never like in hotels. I prefer things bright, open and to be able to see where I'm going. The room we got overlooked the water, and is a nice view. Except the room which has windows on three sides gets so incredibly hot when the sun gets on it, it's like being baked in a hot box. So you close the drapes -- which kind of defeats the point. The bathroom -- some people like the clear glass window that means you can be naked and showering in front of all NYC. Us -- not so much. They will give you something to cover it, of you ask. The staff were ok. Not exceptional. Overall rating -- meh.

title: Not bad
text: Let me start with the things I liked about Hotel on Rivington, as there were quite a few: excellent location, in a lively, fun area with nice bars and restaurants around. Comfortable, clean rooms, ours was very quiet too (we stayed in 75). Special shout out to the reception staff, who were super friendly and professional on every encounter. Bathroom was fine too, although it would have been nice to have a window. Wifi excellent. Not so great was our non-existent view, which was disappointing when the pictures on the website get you all excited about looking out over Manhattan. Breakfast was very limited and, while included, still entailed a service charge at every visit. Overall a pretty nice hotel, but at these prices, I would have expected a little bit more.

title: hotel but beware of billing procedures!
text:
First, let me say this hotel was decent. But 2 things (1) As other visitors stated, there are rooms with a floor to ceiling window in the shower! I don't understand why this "design" was done in such a ridiculous way. For one-half side (see pictures), the lower piece of glass, basically from your waist down, was frosted enough so you couldn't see through it. However, taking a shower at night with the light on, someone could see that there was a naked body in there. The upper piece was a working swing out window with no frosting whatsoever -- your entire upper half of your body is visible to anyone hanging out on the rooftops (and there were many people out), or rooftop parking lot a few buildings over. The other half of the window, from top to bottom,is lightly frosted but you can still see right through it. I asked for a more private room, and they said they would come up with a "privacy screen".. Well, "privacy screen" = white contact paper on the clear window only! They should just provide a shower curtain with a tension rod!

The 2nd issue, is a HUGE BEWARE... They take a photo copy of your credit card and license, send it to accounting department for billing, and then they said accounting will 'destroy the information" -- I'm sorry that is not good enough. As your desk clerk explained this to me, he opened a draw with all of the papers, pulled one out and held it up for me to see. With today's available technology, there are other more-secure ways to handle this. You are putting every customer at unnecessary risk. I do not recommend anyone staying here until this is resolved. I will be telling the travel site, that we use for work, to exclude this hotel.

Otherwise, you have a decent hotel, in a decent area. Your staff is very friendly and helpful (although one made a mistake during the explanation on payment), and your rooms are nice and clean - excluding the contact paper.

title: Great location
text:
location is great - we have always previously stayed in midtown but will always opt for lower east side now. Great vibe in area.

Hotel room was good - clean, modern and spacious corner king with comfy bed. Air conditioned ( although a bit noisy) very welcome as we were there during the heatwave . We asked for an iron and ironing board and were provided with these for the duration of our stay. Wifi provided. 

Bathroom was 'interesting' - modern facilities but shower had one pane of normal glass and two panes of obscured glass and was on the external wall - you could see right outside onto a car park and a building site in the near distance and if looking people could see you! The other issue was that when in the shower you could see the balcony on the floor above ... and people sat out there ! This delayed me having a shower on one occasion as wasn't keen on the idea of the neighbours looking in !! This may not bother some people but this shower was not a 'feature' I saw as an attraction to the room. i don't think the hotel make it clear enough on the room details that the showers have non obscured glass in - just say ' exterior facing showers overlooking manhattan'. 
We were out and about the majority of the time we were there and as we were only there for 4 nights decided not to raise the issue of the showers - have since read that privacy screens may have been available but also noted for one customer that involved a piece of cardboard ! 

We would consider staying at hotel again as good hotel and location great but would double check the room features before booking as understand internal showers options are available.

title: A Lower East Side Experience
text: Let me start this off by saying I have never been to NY before and honestly didn't know what to expect. Here for a conference and this was the recommended hotel, so we got a group rate which I thought was pretty pricey but now knowing what nicer hotels cost I see it's fairly reasonably priced but definitely not what I expected for the price. The nicest part was the bathroom. Never before in any of my travels have I had a shower with such great water pressure and size. It was amazing. The rest of it is ah ok in my opinion. They charge an outrages amount for food at the restaurant which is very subpar from anything else I've had, today I actually choose McDonalds over the restaurant. Had a burger tonight though and was disappointed again. The couches in the room are uncomfortable but the bed was nice well would have been without the odd stain on the sheets. Some holes in the wall in the bathroom and tile was a bit grimy. Overall I guess it was a Manhattan experience and I'd come back to NY but may try a new hotel.

title: Stylish, classy and cool
text:
Just returned to the UK after a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel.
This was my first visit to New York and was part of celebrations for a *special* birthday. 
From arrival we got a good vibe, although our room wasn't ready (they are very generous on allowing a 2pm checkout, so I totally understand that) we were very well looked after while we waited.
The room was on the 19th floor, hip, stylish art work on the wall.
The bathroom had a super power shower, huge soaking bath and beautiful toiletries.
Bath robes were sumptuous.
The bed was HUGE and cocooned us like a baby with crisp, white, Egyptian cotton sheets.
The balcony had jaw dropping views of manhattan, with stand outs being, The Chrysler building.
The staff were super friendly, interesting and intelligent.
The hotel is located in Lower East Side which is a very up and coming, vibrant area. It can be quite noisy at night, but, hey!!!!! You're in New York, it's the city that doesn't sleep, so embrace it and enjoy it. 
I can't think of a  better place we could have stayed in.
If you're visiting New York and you want a fabulous location, great service and THE best views, you won't get anywhere better
If you don't enjoy it, you have no soul xxx

title: So disappointing...
text:
We were so looking forward to staying at Hotel on Rivington but sadly it just didn't hit the spot.  

The location is good - the Lower East Side is a vibrant interesting area with lots of bars and restaurants.  We stayed on the 14th floor in a corner room with floor to ceiling windows.  The room concept is great but somehow it just doesn't quite come off.  The room is light and airy and the view is fabulous but the room is a little shabby and rough around the edges.  The bathroom really let the room down - the floor tiles were cracked with one coming away on my foot when walking into the bathroom, it was also dusty. The toilet did not flush easily or fully.  The sink layout is not practical, there is very limited space to put anything.

Breakfast at Cafe Medi was included in our rate.  The restaurant was not busy but the server was insistent the guests all sat in the same row of tables.  We suspect this was to make it easier for the staff as they did seem a little short handed.  It took a while to be provided with menus and to be asked if we wanted a drink.  We were only provided with the set menu included in our room rate, no other options were offered up.  The choices were limited - four items were shown from which you could choose two.  I chose the bagel, offered with cream cheese - why no smoked salmon?  The bagel was so stodgy it was inedible.  My husband's croissant was not much better.  We asked for cappuccinos and were advised that these were extra - fair enough but $26 for two cappuccinos - outrageous especially since they were luke warm and weak.  There is no issue with offering a limited selection of food but what is offered should be fresh and of a high quality.  For the price we paid for the room we expected more.  

We did complain and we were offered breakfast in our room the next day which was appreciated.  However, since the food  would have come from the same kitchen as the rock hard bagel we decided to decline.

We did follow the walking tours on the hotel's website which were really enjoyable, especially the walk over the Brooklyn Bridge with its fabulous views.  

Overall, Hotel on Rivington was a let down and especially given the price we paid.  We left with the feeling that we had been ripped off.

title: Probably the best hotel experience ever
text:
So, my previous benchmark for New York City was pretty low - a $100/night hostel. I obviously thought Hotel on Rivington would be better - but it exceeded all expectations.

The location is excellent. The rooms are huge by NYC standards. The beds are insanely comfortable. Free wifi. Gym with free weights. Best minibar I've ever seen. And the customer service is outstanding. Alyxx in particular was an excellent host. And they bring you a free plate of cookies every day!!

All these things combined made my visit to Hotel on Rivington my best ever hotel experience anywhere in the world - and I've paid much more elsewhere. Just book it - I will be back.

title: Good hotel in a great area
text: Just stayed here for 5 nights. It's a well appointed, stylish hotel that belies it's size and has quite a boutique feel. We stayed in a room with 2 sides floor to ceiling windows on the 16th floor. The views were breathtaking, not only back to the city but across all the Lower East Side. It has a good subway link up to midtown close by, so it's easy enough to get to all the sites, but is a great base as the Lower East Side is such a vibrant place to be in it's own right. All the staff were extremely helpful, and the doormen/bell boys know everything you'll need to know. The only downside is that the roof top bar is only available for private hire currently....those helpful staff I mentioned sneaked us up there and the views are brilliant.

title: Enjoyed Our Stay
text: Good location in LES.  Great boutique hotel.  We'd definitely stay here again. Very pleasant and polite service.  They even went out of their way to make sure that the rollaway bed we requested was in our room when we checked in.  The room was spacious for NYC, clean, and modern.  The lighting in the bathroom was too dim, but not a big deal for the one night we were there. Also was on a lower floor so we heard some street noise, I'd recommend a high floor.  Really appreciated the vouchers for a free glass of wine and a free coffee in the am.  Reasonable municipal parking around the corner is convenient as well.

title: Complete lack of privacy
text: Stayed here this week on a business trip.  My room was spacious and had a comfortable bed.  The mini bar was well stocked.  There was popcorn and water and cookies waiting for me.  All of these nice amenities were cancelled out by the fact that my shower had a massive window in it which looked directly out onto a parking garage and neighboring buildings.  The glass was not frosted.  It was not mirrored so strangers could not see in.  I called down the next morning to say how uncomfortable I was.  They offered a privacy screen.  I asked that it be installed while they serviced the room.  I did not get back to my room until midnight that night and there was no privacy screen in place.  I called down to the desk again and they said they would send someone right up.  A man arrived several minutes later holding a cardboard box and a roll of masking tape.  THIS was the "privacy screen" they intended to hang.  I told him I would rather deal with the window than have cardboard falling on me during my shower.  They said they had run out of the screens and would have one installed the following day.  Once again nothing was installed.  I complained at check out about the situation and was told that they have rooms with interior showers and that for my next stay they would put me in one of those.  I don't understand why this couldn't have happened the first time I called the front desk.  I would have gladly moved rooms.  To cap off a bad stay I asked for my minibar charges to be charged to my personal debit card (leaving my room night charges on my corporate card).  Instead the woman at the front desk moved ALL charges to my debit card which will now take days to credit.  Needless to say I will NOT be returning to this property.

title: Ottima posizione e vista spettacolare su Manhattan
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per una settimana. La zona è molto interessante, Lower East Side, ed è una delle mie preferite. Ci hanno assegnato una camera al 15 piano, con una magnifica vista su Manhattan. Le camere sono ben strutturate, con bagni grandi e docce spaziose. Nel quartiere ci sono molti locali per colazione, cena e dopocena, raggiungibili comodamente a piedi. Unico inconveniente: siamo rimasti 24h senza acqua calda a causa di un guasto che ha interessato metà edificio. Comunque consiglio l'hotel, per la vista, la posizione e il quartiere.

title: Amazing boutique hotel!
text:
I honestly have no complaints, only high praises. 
 Those cookies they left every evening for me were a highlight! it's the little things :) 
Location is just perfect. Rooms were clean, modern and spacious. Slept very well. 
There's a juice bar right next door, a convenient store on the corner and great restaurants  all walking distance. 
The staff were above and beyond!!! Have to especially mention Kristin Murphy who really took such good care to make sure my stay was memorable. She's exceptional!

title: Just so so
text: This hotel can be extremely nice with a few changes. There's no mirror outside of the bathroom and there's no long mirror at all in the hotel room. The ventilation systems are nonexistent in the bathroom. The design of the toilets does not work well for flushing. Service in the restaurant is extremely slow.  Pretty expensive

title: Great room, but noisy & poor internet
text: Most everything about the room itself was fantastic, from comfy beds to a nice shower. Staff was great. Problems were the noise, both from the hallway and the street, when I was there for work. Thus, I was unable to get the rest needed. The Internet was also mostly useless, which made it near impossible to get any work done, and the TV connectivity occasionally disappeared.

title: Inspiration trip
text: Good rooms, modern and fresh. Close to everything. Amazing view and really service minded. The only thing I was missing was some better light in the bathroom and an iron. Don't forget to bring your own converter.

title: Average
text: Rooms good size .  Bed comfortable.  Shower good   Location good  but everything else below average   On booking .com they advertised coffee wine and fruit available  during day.  Well it's not !!  The breakfasts are terrible ...stale bagels terrible coffee    Most of the reception staff unfriendly apart from one lady  We booked standard King and our view was a dirty alley way. Disappointed with the hotel and wouldn't stay here again

title: Hotel on Rivington
text: The hotel is in a great location. It wa very clean, and the corner king with balcony was very spacious. The balcony is small, but it was lovely to sit out there and enjoy the view. The hotel staff was accommodating and made sure we had everything we needed. My only gripe was the lack of room service the day we arrived. There was no explanation other than it wasn't available that day. But it's a great hotel, and I will stay again.

title: Great Stay!
text: I had such a great experience with this hotel.  Offered breakfast and the front desk staff was amazing! The rooms were pretty nice and there are so many restaurants within walking distance!  I would defiantly stay here again.

title: Great stay on the LES
text:
Lovely staff, nice contemporary rooms with great views.  Restaurant has really nice food - Greeted with smiles and very helpful front desk.  Doormen were very helpful and offered a reasonable car service to our bus out of town.
Unfortunately, the area is just plain noisy on the weekend!

title: Great Hotel
text: I absolutely love the Hotel on Rivington! The service is great and efficient, the rooms are really nice and the location is just perfect. I highly appreciate the detail to attention. The bathroom amenities are great and I LOVE the slightly larger size. The bathtub is out of this world! The beds are really excellent.

title: Fantastic
text: Phenomenal experience overall. Geo was amazing. Staff was great. Housekeeping was fantastic. I stayed for a week with my girlfriend and we had a great time. Definitely coming back. Thank you so much..

title: LES
text: Perfect location and great friendly hotel with super nice view if you are on a high floor. I love the lounge where you can enjoy a complementary drink in the afternoon. The restaurant is ok and breakfast is very nice.

title: A great LES gem !
text:
This is a great hotel, if you decide that LES is the area you want to stay in Manhattan. The area is full of cool bars and restaurants, live and young vibe. The Hotel is a 20 floor modern building surrounded by much lower buildings.. that mean that from most Hotel floors you will get a nice view. We had a corner room on the 16th floor, all the room had floor to ceiling windows which is a rare find in NYC hotels.. and the best part is the we had a full size terrace ! Room had everything you would need. Great shower and comfy bed.  We had breakfast several days, which was fine, with several good options to choose from. Housekeeping did a great good. Ashley at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly, during our stay and before we arrived. She helped us book all our restaurants in advance ! Great service. 

One point to improve - the gym is very small and under equipped....

Great Hotel. We will be back !

title: Great views. Mediocre staff.
text: Room was spacious with great views. Generally hotel setup and check in area is rather awkward. Uptake and genealogy cleanliness of hotel could be improved. So could be customer service and staff quality. Gym ammenities are very limited.

title: Great hotel but worst concierge experience ever.
text:
Just back from 4 nights at the Hotel on Rivington.  Loved the room and the location of the hotel but the concierge was the worst I have ever experienced.

I emailed two weeks before we arrived and asked for dinner recommendations for 1 night.   We received a list of 12 recommended restaurants and asked the concierge to make us a reservation at one of the recommended restaurants.

The day before we were supposed to go for dinner, I received an email from the concierge to say that the restaurant was fully booked but that she would pull some strings to get us a table.   She promised to update us that day.

And that was the last we ever heard.   I followed up to ask for an update but she never bothered to respond.   We ended up at a mediocre neighbourhood restaurant as it was too late to get a reservation at any of the recommended restaurants.

Because of this, I doubt we will be back to the Hotel on Rivington.

title: Charity Stay
text: We won this stay on a charity auction and was very pleased by the experience.  Staff was friendly and room was very clean and modern.  Request a high floor if you can to avoid outside noise but overall we had no complaints.  The breakfast was very good too.

title: Great Location, Good Vibes, Beds Comfy AF
text: Great location - for nightlife, dining, browsing, and getting around the city (Essex/Delancey station is great). Sleek, clean, comfortable rooms, with great views and solid mini bars (really, full bars). Helpful staff, a great restaurant, and overall wonderful experience.

title: Hotel on rivington
text:
5 day trip. Beds are very comfortable, this in the main reason for staying. Would definitely stay here again. Gbreat location. With in Walking distance to good
food and coffee shops. Friendly staff and doormen.

title: Great Hotel! excellent location and service
text:
This hotel is located at a walking distance from SoHo, Little Italy, and China Town, it is in a great area for both day and night activities.
The design is great, rooms are beautiful, as well as public areas, super modern with great attention to details.
Staff in this hotel are really doing their best effort to make you feel comfortable, they are dedicated, nice, smiley and always making sure you are enjoying your stay, I am definitely going back there soon.

title: Okay truthfully, it was an awesome hotel but the BEDS ruined it
text:
Awesome hotel, tight entrance but super discrete bc front desk is not on the street level so there's no risk of interrogation (there are cameras and door men and people that work there down stairs keeping eye), no room keys necessary for elevator, super clean, super cool look (a little on the tacky side with the fake fur rug thing they put on the sofa but you can just remove it).

BUUUUUUT

I don't know about you but the most important thing for me is staying somewhere
1. clean
2. with a comfy bed

These beds were the STIFFEST (I swear to the good lord above THE stiffest) beds I've ever slept on...and I have been to hotels all over the world. 

If you don't care about the beds and you get a good deal, take it. Otherwise, get proper sleep and stay somewhere else.

title: Last minute
text: Even though this was last minute we always wanted to check this hotel out.Check in was good ,good staff.room was good size and comfortable for a family of four.big bathroom , great Spanish restaurant next door food was awesome,are there for breakfast, economy candy store across the street every candy from your childhood to the present is there kids loved it. The hotel is a boutique style nice set up will return

title: Lo mejor de LES !!
text: Fuimos con mi familia de 6 personas y la verdad que nos sorprendio la amabilidad de la gente del hotel, empezando con Elvis, Jordan, Abraham, todos ellos se portaron de la mejor manera, haciendo de nuestra estadia , uno de las mejores !!! La habitacion era espaciosa, con dos camas Full con colchones orto pedic, muy comodos, y solicitamos una extra bed que era super buena !! El baño bien grande tambien !! En cuanto a la zona , es la primera vez ahi , y se encuentra a pasos de Little Italy, Soho, Chinatown, lejos del ruido de Times Square , con la estacion de subway de Delancey St , a una cuadra del Hotel !! Muchas gracias a la gente del hotel por hacer de nuestra estadia una de las mejores en largo tanto !!

title: Perfection!
text: I love this Hotel!  The location was great.  The service was amazing....Kristen at the front desk went above and beyond!  The view from our room was breath taking.  I have nothing but good things to say about Hotel on Rivington.  The room was spacious enough for us, the bathroom was incredible, so this hotel gets my highest rating!  We will be back!

title: Fine... if you like strangers watching you in the bathroom (and maybe even waving at you)
text: I stayed at this hotel in November 2016.  We had a corner room. The bathroom wall to the outside had very large windows as the shower wall with the left side slightly frosted but not on the right  When we looked out of the shower, we could see into other people's apartments and onto the rooftop of the apartment building next door.  One evening, as I was using the bathroom, I looked over and saw a group of people standing on the roof next door and staring right at me.  One of them started waving when they saw me see them. I waved back. I don't know why. Very violating experience. I used the bathroom in total darkness for the rest of the time. Otherwise, it was fine.

title: Great stay for work!
text: Really enjoyed my time at Hotel on Rivington. The rooms were very spacious, friendly staff, and great city views(not of a brick wall like most NYC hotels). Loved the neighborhood feel- this is the hot new area for hotels. Breakfast in the am was a touch slow , so just plan accordingly. Great renovation

title: Fun
text: Came back to the hotel after havibg stayed there 8 years ago ... same spirit, expect little service, maintance could be better ... BUT the views are still incredible ... so is the location ... much better than most boring midtown locations ... definitely would repeat ... room service is also great ...

title: Top notch service and stay
text: What a wonderful change of pace while visiting the city. We typically stay midtown and wanted to change it up a bit. I stumbled upon Hotel on Rivington while I was looking for somewhere that had good views and larger rooms. This seemed to fit the bill. We booked a high floor king suite and were just blown away. Upon arrival, we had a handwritten note from Kristen wishing my husband a happy of continuation of his birthday celebration (I had briefly mentioned to her in an email prior to arriving). Along with the note were cupcakes and a bottle of nice champagne. He was absolutely floored. Then, on our last night, we came in to a beautiful gift bag with a candle, ear plugs and nice note apologizing for any noise on the penthouse floor, as it had been rented out for a private party. The note also stated that breakfast was on them (the hotel) in the morning, should we choose to have any, downstairs. Again, floored. We could barely hear anything. But the fact that the hotel anticipated any issues and tried to counteract them with act of generosity and something useful, like earplugs, is just plain excellent customer service and something so many other businesses could take a lesson from. The room itself was just beautiful, crisp white linens, comfortable bed, wonderful views from the floor to ceiling windows and the bathroom tops it all. We can't thank you enough, Kristen and staff. You exceeded our every expectation and made my husband's turning 40 much more bearable! He forgot his age. Mission accomplished. We are already trying to figure out when we can come back.

title: Worst sleep of my life
text: I had high hopes for Hotel on Rivington, but was extremely disappointed with our stay. The room was gorgeous and large for Manhattan standards. However, we were on the 4th floor, corner room facing Rivington St. It was SO loud!! Neither my husband or I could get to sleep until 4am. Look, I get NYC is loud--I lived in Manhattan for over 8 years--but this was ridiculous. Sadly, it was a terrible experience for us.

title: Sweet Suites!
text: This is a great place to stay when in NYC, from it's contemporary design, great views of the city and best of all the staff treats you like royalty! Juliette was an absolute doll to me! It's the nice little touches that make your stay great - a complementary glass of wine, free wifi, even warm cookies brought up to your room. The units are VERY clean, and the soaking tub was so relaxing especially after a stressful business trip, the beds are firm but comfortable, you can go wrong with memory foam! I would definitely stay again! I highly recommend this hotel….and I am very picky!

title: Really cool boutique hotel!
text: The decor in this place is awesome! Don't let the vestibule fool you: it is tiny and nondescript on purpose. Very comfortable accommodations. Stayed with my friend who was out of town. We were very comfortable. The room was very art-deco inspired with lots of chrome and mirrored surfaces. Very neat!

title: Home away from home
text:
I love the Riv!  This hotel has been my go to hotel meaning my home away from home. For many many years. I love the location in the lower east side. It's go that neighborhood vibe which is great for a busy city. I also love the new restaurant and bar downstairs and the remodel
Of the lobby area. The rooms are larger than anyone else in this neighborhood. You can stay at the so called Trendy Ludlow hotel but the rooms their are so dinky that I bashed my knee against the bed trying to get to the bathroom and then their bathroom was another disaster as to sit in the toilet I had to close the bathroom door as the bathroom was so tiny and also to get in the shower was difficult. At the Rivington the rooms are big so you don't have that problem so when staying in the lower east side you must choose the Rivington hotel they also have the best views so make sure and request a room on a high floor so that you can soak up this beautiful city! Thank you hotel on Rivington staff for always going out of your way to ensure I have such a warm welcome you.

title: so nice
text: i love this hotel it is super romantic but also super fun the staff was nice also location is great for great food options store options bars clubs lounges etc the beds are tempur pedic & bathroom was nice balcony room was perfect and the views are bomb

title: 5 Stars across the board!!!
text: This is a GREAT hotel!!  Location, staff, decor... EVERYTHING was perfect from the moment of checkin to checkout.  I took my boyfriend to NY for his bday, this was the best location for walking the streets. We had a high floor corner king and it was SPECTACULAR!!! the view was incredible!  I wish we could have stayed longer.  Will definitely come back again!!  Thank you Rivington Staff you were awesome!!! Special props to the guy who checked us in, i think his name was Kenny, he was sooo nice and such a pleasure to deal with.

title: Excelentes Mejoras , Muy Buena Opcion
text: Estuve el año pasado hospedado para la misma epoca y estaban en remodelacion y quede sorprendido con las mejoras de la entrada el Cafe Medi y el bar para tomar unos buenos tragos, el servicio como siempre 1A la atencion y la ubicacion del Hotel son lo mejor , ahora con estas mejoras sin duda que seran numero 1 en la area del Lower East Side , como siempre es grato volver

title: Great birthday party!
text: We threw a birthday party here -- the staff were amazing.   Anna helped us pick the right room venue for the party and get set on all of the planning.    And then on party night - the entire staff was amazing.   Especially Q who made the night by his excellent service and great personality.   This review is way overdue in writing (the party was in August 2016) but it was amazing and I've been meaning to write for a long time.

title: Best customer service
text: Gio is the best manager, he goes above and beyond. This is our second time staying here and I can't say enough how great the customer service is! The rooms are beautiful with amazing top to bottom windows. The soaking tubs are so relaxing, and the beds/pillows are very soft!

title: Spacious for downtown NYC
text:
Some pluses: the concierge service here is top notch. The team is gracious and helpful with just about any request you might have, don't be afraid to reach out to them! I communicated directly with Adam and he kindly upgraded us to a room on a higher floor with a massive soaking tub. It was like a swimming pool! The rooms are also very spacious for downtown NYC. Comfortable couch, large bed, and cozy terry bathrobes!

On the downside, we were told there was complimentary breakfast when we booked but when we headed downstairs, this was nowhere to be found, and the hostess at Cafe Medi said they don't do that anymore. Not a huge deal, just be aware this is apparently no longer offered. Thankfully, there are tons of options around the corner from the hotel. If we were going to stay in LES again, we would not hesitate to come back to Hotel on Rivington. The bathroom amenities alone are worth it!

title: This place is a gem !
text: I really wanted to experience another side of NY and be in the LES. The Rivington is it ! The staff from the reservations to the lobby were awesome....."thanks Ken" for printing our boarding passes. My wife and I were a little older than many in the area but the Rivington treated us wonderful for our 30th anny. They hooked us up with a room on the 19th, great view, great bed.....cool bathroom. Ashely helped us with some tickets for Empire State Bldg. & the Met. The cleaning staff are wonderful and so friendly. If I have to critique for sake of "my comfort", I would recommend a menu change in the downstairs bar. The items are pricey and not a beer joint. Saying that, it is very nice area. Overall, I'm coming back.

title: Fantastic Hotel with some of the best views in Manhattan!
text: Love the Hotel on Rivington - have stayed several times, and we love the room sizes, the LES location, the balconies, and most of all the amazing views of the entire Manhattan skyline with floor to ceiling windows.  The staff is excellent, no complaints at all... would highly recommend it, and one day my goal is to spend at least a month staying at this hotel between Labor Day and New Years...

title: A really nice little hotel
text: A great little hotel based in the lower east side, this book toque place offers really cosy rooms, excellent service and also has a great little restaurant/bar alongside a cool themed nightclub that opens in the evening

title: Very average hotel, with some unpleasant staff
text: This hotel has had some work done in the Lobby and Reception but the rooms need a make over. The curtains were hanging off the rail and the furniture old and dated. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch, although more quantities of food is required. Most days they ran out of cups, bagels, hot water, yogurt and had to be asked for more. We had a very unpleasant experience with the doorman who I am very happy to name. When we got to the lobby to call for a taxi he was nowhere to be seen, so we asked another staff member who was passing by and he called the doorman. Well we received an outburst of frustration, as he said he shouldn't even be at work as he was sick and therefore could not help us get transport. We were less than happy with this response and in fact in Australia he would of been terminated on the spot!! He reluctantly called for an SUV which was not what we asked for but in the end accepted it out of sheer anger and frustration. To make our stay even more unpleasant there was an all night party in the room next door which kept our whole family of four up all night. When we complained during the night a staff member did tell them to quieten down but the room full of people continued to be very noisy, people slamming doors all night long. When we reported this to reception the staff could not really of cared less and made no attempt to compensate us for the very unpleasant night.

title: Solid
text: Its clean and comfortable. Maybe the breakfast included in the high price could be a little richer and warm. We also needed some slippers for the bathroom and an iron. Everything else was cozy and intimate, especially the seat in the shower hit the spot.

title: Loved it
text:
My partner and I stayed here in early January for 3 nights. I have to say this really is a wonderful hotel in lower east side.

We stayed in a high floor corner King with balcony. The bed is really super comfy, great linen, excellent pillows and a good nights sleep. The shower in the bathroom was excellent. The room had perhaps one of the best stocked mini bars I have ever seen in the US.

And a lovely touch of a complimentary bottle of champagne was waiting for us on ice in the room upon check in.

This is a great location to explore LES and soho and the surrounding area.

Staff are helpful and friendly. 

The complimentary continental breakfast is basic but good, although they have a good a la carte to supplement.

My only comment is that the room service menu is somewhat limited if you're feeling lazy...not that we used it anyway.

Will definitely be back here on our next visit to NYC!

title: UNDENIABLY EXCELLENT
text: I LOVED THIS PLACE! So elegant and updated and interesting!! Great location to walk to shopping and dining and to get to Williamsburg or One World Center area. Ate and drank several times at hotel..always pleasing. Cool crowd. And a few celebs were there at the bar. PLUS Aziz Ansari was filming his show in their club during the day. Go. Go. GO! I mean stay.

title: Buon hotel in una zona abitata da newyorkesi
text: Hotel non grande, con camere discrete, reception cordiale ed efficiente, prima colazione discreta. È in una zona di new york dove il turista può  rendersi veramente conto di come vivono gli abitanti della città. Siamo infatti lontani da quell'enorme centro commerciale e sarabanda che è times square e dintorni. Per una settimana a natale abbiamo speso circa euro 3mila in quattro adulti; di questi circa 2400 sono il costo dell'albergo, il resto sono tasse di soggiorno.

title: Comfortable Hotel
text: An overdue review however, it may help. Had a corner room on a high floor with a great view of the bridge. The room was large for NYC with a comfy king bed & a seating area. Bathroom was a great size but was uncomfortable with the window having no screen. It got pretty loud in the evenings with sirens & people partying. The area is great & very alive at night with a subway next door. Walking distance to Chelsea & Chinatown areas. Complimentary drinks in the late afternoon were great but had to ask staff to refill a few times & they didn't seem happy. Staff could have been friendlier at check in. When I went to ask for an Ironing Board at reception as I was passing it I kind of got yelled at ... Mam, it will be bought to your room! I guess its all part of the tipping. Great location. Get up to the Rooftop Bar if you can, great views!!

title: Agree with others, nice hotel, weak service
text: Hotel is almost on the verge of needing remodel but is still nice.  Had a corner room on the 17th floor with great views.  Check in time is 4:00. Even at 4:00 we had to wait for a room.  The first full day housekeeping didn't even show even after I called to remind them.  The second day housekeeping showed up at 4:20pm which was inconvenient so we just took what we needed.   Staff seemed to lack drive.   I liked being close to Chinatown. The only things bad I can say about the LES is that it was a lot dirtier than rest of Manhattan and the subway station at Delancey street was really dirty, it was the worst one we saw in our travels.

title: Wonderful hotel, great staff, fun location for nightlife
text:
My wife and I stayed in a luxury suite here on our wedding night in 2006 and again on our 10 year anniversary in 2016. The staff was unbelievably generous with room upgrades and a complimentary bottle of champagne and plate of chocolate covered strawberries.

The views from the high floor rooms are spectacular, the rooms are clean comfortable, and hip. The location is also a lot of fun for seeing a less touristy side of the city. There are tons of good restaurants and funky boutiques in the immediate vicinity, and the late night party scene is crazy with tons of bars and small nightclubs in the blocks surrounding the hotel.

I definitely recommend staying at The Hotel on Rivington if you're looking for a cool hotel in a fun neighborhood with amazing views.

title: Hotel with class
text:
Based on my experience, this is a great hotel in a really interesting and up and coming neigborhood.  We really enjoyed the location, kind of away from the tourist and lights of Time Square.  There were some really interesting shops and cool bars and restaurants.  Really can't wait to stay here again.

My only issue was the window in the shower that shined in the bedroom.  The curtains didn't cover that window, so if you wanted to sleep in  and have dark room you had to figure a way to pull the curtain to block the light.  Also, there is a a none frosted window in the shower, so women be aware of the men with binoculars below on roof tops taking smoke break.  I gave them a good laugh by pressing my man boobs against the glass.

Otherwise this is wonderful place to stay.  Nice free continental breakfast in the morning.  Easy access to the subway, comfortable beds and again in a very hip neighborhood.  The Essex Street Market is nearby and is a very interesting place with some good food and shopping.  There are also other great shops nearby for clothing, food and jewelry.  

Can't wait to stay here again.

title: Nice hotel let down by weak service
text:
The hotel has a great location if you want to be on the LES. Close to several subway lines, tons of restaurants and bars on the surrounding streets, plus great LES institutions like Katz's and Kossars a few minutes away. Rooms are nice and large. Great showers.  Some rooms definitely have a killer view.  Can be noisy on the weekend due to the neighborhood and noise from the hallway is very penetrating.

To their credit, they did send up a bottle of wine for a birthday.

However, in this price range, they are competing with the boutique brands of chain hotels like Indigo or Andaz, and there they drastically fall short.

During breakfast, every table was dirty and most things were not refilled, including yogurt, cream cheese, coffee, napkins, glasses, and fruit. (leaving just bagels with no cream cheese, juice with no glasses, toast, and dry cereal) When we asked the attendant about refilling the yogurt, he said curtly "Finished." We asked what that meant, since it doesn't seem unreasonable to expect them to refill the yogurt at a $400/night hotel. Plus, it was the only non-carb thing on the table. He began screaming (!) and gesturing at us - "Don't you understand? It's finished! There will not be any more today! Finished! Finished!" It was 9am, and breakfast goes until 1100. We felt bad for any one who comes at 1030.

I complained to the front desk, and the food situation was better the next day. However, I never received an apology or consideration from the hotel management for being yelled at, something I have never experienced in years of frequent travel.

Other service lapses:

- The initial check-in at the front desk was cold and abrupt.  When I asked about the complimentary coffee, tea, and wine that they advertised as available every day from 12-6 up until the day before we arrived, I was told that now they that changed it to ONE complimentary cup of coffee and ONE glass of wine during our stay.  This is a material change that should have been advertised or at least they could have offered those who already had reservations an unlimited number of coupons. Then when we went to the restaurant for our "free" coffee, we were directed to a self serve thermos with paper cups.  Not quite what we were expecting. 

- Cookies are supposed to be left at turndown. We got them the first day but not the next two. We asked a maid and she said they frequently run out. How do you run out when you know how many guests are in the hotel? Why promise something simple but not deliver? 

- Toiletries not refilled despite being almost empty.

- Used glasses were removed but not replaced. So the first day we had water glasses, then they disappeared, so we used the wine glasses, which also disappeared and were not replaced. Then we moved to the champagne glasses...

title: Very cool design hotel soho
text:
This is not a high rise but still one of the highest building in the area. Windows in the rooms snad suites are floor to ceiling . Corridors are black with room numbers lit.
The rooms have fantastic tempura madrasses . Also as you enter the reception it looks very spaced out and futuristic. Very good food in the restaurant as well

title: Хороший отель в Downtown
text: Отель расположен в даунтауне. Нью-Йорк город большой, и чтобы все посмотреть все равно придется пользоваться метро или такси. Поэтому по-большому счету где расположен отель неважно. Отель расположен рядом с китайским кварталом и маленькой Италией, а это значит, что рядом множество кафе и ресторанов, где можно вкусно и не дорого поесть (это немаловажный фактор в НЙ). Номера большие и чистые, завтрак в виде комплимента, можно отдельно заказать горячие блюда. Рядом станция метро, откуда удобно можно доехать до центрального парка. До всемирного торгового центра можно дойти пешком. Выбор не плохой.

title: great views
text:
great hotel in the LES. stayed here for the second time although last time was 5 years ago....and i must say the standard of the rooms has improved. we booked an unique room (room seemed only recently renovated) hoping to get the one with the terrasse as special feature but ended up with the one with a steam bath. a blessing in disguise as it was like we had our own little spa in the room where we could relax after walking the streets the whole day :-). located on one of the top floors the room had floor to ceiling windows offering stunning views from one world trade center to the chrysler building (including awesome sunsets on sunny days).

sending out a special thank you to Kristen and Eddie who took good care of us in the run up to our stay and during. hope you enjoyed the swiss choccolates :-)

will defo be back next fall and looking forward to staying in one of the unique rooms again.

title: bof !!!
text:
L'hotel n'est pas ( ou peut être plus ) au niveau qu'il prétends être.
L'usure gènèrale est ennuyeuse, un essai de rafraichissement n'y a rien fait, les peintres par exemple devaient être aveugles !!! Beaucoup de choses sont cassées dans les chambres ( commande electrique des immenses double rideaux qui entourent les coins des chambres, vitre de douche fendue, luminaires qui pendouillent poignées invisibles qui vous restent en main...) bref par à la hauteur des tarifs pratiqués.
Personnel sympathique sans plus. Literie de grande qualité ...

title: Great customer service
text: There was a problem with our room, and the staff and manager went above and beyond to fix it. Can't talk about the customer service enough, definitely stay here! The views, staff, and rooms are incredible.

title: Great visit at a funky hotel
text: Very large rooms with awesome bed. Most of staff was super. Great location in Lower East Side. You can find eats at any hour...a bodega on the corner. Great spot for a real taste of NYC. Be sure to visit penthouse/rooftop. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Horrible internet
text: We picked the hotel for it's location and in that aspect it was perfekt! Sadly the internet didn't work and we contacted the reception right away and they promised they would look into it. Later that night the internet worked off an on depending on your location in the room, we ended up sitting in the hallway or on the toilet when we needed to use the internet. The room itself is very nice and we would stay here again if the internet issue is solved.

title: En baisse, mais pas le prix, helas helas...
text:
J'ai fréquenté cet hotel à plusieurs reprises il y à 4 ou 5 ans, et son avantage était  le coté "branché" dans un quartier encore en devenir, bonne ambiance, en particulier au bar du rez de chaussée. Le coté décalé avec l'entrée en tunnel et la déco d'India Mahdavi. Si on y rajoute la vue extra depuis les chambres corner, le prix pouvait se justifier. 
Aujourd'hui, il n'en reste plus grand chose: le petit dejeuner, déjà frugal, est devenu un quasi scandale: confiture en rupture de stock, de même que les quelques fruits miteux, et même le philadelphia, équivalent de notre vache qui rit n'était pas réapprovisionné. 
Le quartier, devenu un des centres des beuveries new yorkaises est tellement bruyant qu'on est réveillé plusieurs fois par nuit. 
Pour 3 nuits à 450 usd la nuit + taxes, je pense n'en n'avoir pas eu pour mon argent !

title: Best Hotel in the neighborhood
text: This area have a very special NY taste, the streets are narrow, you can find play places, is full of live all the time, the Hotel is really cool, they have cookies in your room everyday, they did an extreme make over, all the rooms ares new, the view from the higher floors are amazing, no mater which side you choose you're going to love it! It's the place to be.

title: AU SECOUUUURRRSSSS!!!!!
text:
Bonjours et attention!!!!

Je ne suis de ceux qui passent  leur temps a critiquer sur tripadvisor.. d ailleurs c est la premiere fois !!!
Mais la c est pas possible cet hotel est un cauchemard, je ne sais pas comment ils font pour cacher les mauvaises critiques sur ce site mais c est tout simplement une arnaque vu le prix que nous avons payé 400$ la nuit!

Cet hotel n a meme pas le niveau d un 2 etoile au magreb.....!!!!!!!!!!

- dans les chambres l'isolation sonore est zero ,prevoir bouchon anti bruits ou casque bose car quartier très animé (tout les jours nous entendions des plaintes sur ce sujet)
- porte d entree avec 3cm d espace donc en fait vous avez l ipression de vivre dans le couloir pret de l ascenseur et de servir de groom.
- petit déjeuner mediocre non pardon NUL...... ( pas de croissants etc le dimanche ni d expresso car pas de livraison ce jour la!!) ne comptez pas sur un petit dej americain ou intercontinental car ils ne savent pas que cela existe, pas de yogourts!
au bouts du 3 eme jours nous avons décidé d aller nous plaindre a l accueil...... Surprise nous n etions pas les seuls.................
- pas de kit netoyage 
- les wc bruyant
- quand le voisin du dessous ouvre sa fenetre vous avez l ipression qu il ouvre votre fenetre.....
- etc.........
Si vous passez devant cete hotel ne vous arretez pas dessus .. vous etes prevenu!!

title: More like a nightclub
text:
Stayed for 3 nights at this nightclub.. sorry i mean hotel in August 2016. I have to be honest, it was rather disappointing. Firstly i think this hotel has a major identity crisis in so far as i believe they would rather be a party venue or nightclub than a hotel. One look at the mini bar confirms this, which whilest i can admit is pretty comprehensive, I also got the distinct impression that most of their effort, time and budget went into the mini bar stock.  Every other hotel we stayed at during our trip in California and New York gave at the very least complimentry bottles of Water and Coffee machines in the rooms yet for whatever reason, and on top of the hefty room rates Hotel on Rivington didn't offer this. $4 for a bottle of Water is pretty disgraceful and complimentary tepid coffee in the lobby was the best you could wish for.
The bathroom felt like I was getting ready in a cave. It was seriously dark. When we complained about this we were met with a total blank expression and asked "have you turned the light up" I gave up at that point. There was no clothes iron in the rooms so that involved another trip down to reception. There is very little room in the rooms for luggage and the hotel was slightly "rough around the edges" so to speak. Still, at least i could get stuck into the over priced mini bar...

title: Cool Rooms, not nice rooms
text:
Room was not ready upon arrival, then when i complained they rushed me into a room that clearly had some issues.  Needed to flush the toilet multiple times, thermostat did not work so we stayed with the balcony door open the entire night, the water temp in the shower was impossible to control.  The room was cool and had a great view but it did not feel very relaxing or clean.  Overall it was very dissapointing for the amount of money charged to stay in a corner king with balcony.

Since I don't want you to think im a salty person with only bad reviews there were two great things.  They gave us a champagne bottle on the house because it was my anniversary - that was awesome.  Also, the neighborhood is awesome - great location.

Overall, I wanted to like this hotel bc its awesome location - but i wouldnt advise anyone to stay here.

title: Spitzen-Lage, Super Zimmer
text:
Das hat echt Spaß gemacht!
Ein Hotel in NYC mit vernünftig großen Zimmern, einem ausreichenden Frühstück und dazu noch alles stylisch.
Obendrein sehr nettes Personal.
Wir kommen wieder, insbesondere da sich die Gegend rund ums Hotel weiter entwickelt!

title: Phänomenaler Blick über Manhattan
text: Im Januar bei Eis und Schnee, Sonne satt und dann diesen traumhaften Blick aus dem Hotelzimmer - phänomenal. Zwar alles etwas düster gestaltet (liegt wohl eher am Lichtdesigner) aber trotzdem gefällig, etwas anonym.

title: The service let it down
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I was greeted at check in by a very nice front desk person. I had to wait about mins for my room but after that was underway. 

The room I had booked was a high floor king. On entering the room I noticed how compact the room is. There is a sense of space toward the windows and the seating area, however the bathroom is small and has little ventilation. Based on the map behind the door this is one of the smaller rooms on the floor. The key issues I found with the room were the noise that could be heard outside the door anything going on in the hallway is 100% audible in the room. Also the front door is very high compared to the floor letting in a lot of light, combined with the fact the bed faces the door almost directly it became an issue.  

The other problem is the level of service, on the first night I returned to the hotel and asked the porter if he could take a photo of my wife and I. We were the only people at the front of the hotel and this gentlemen was leaning against a door doing nothing. He said verbatim "it will have to be fast as I'm busy working" in a very odd tone, then did not take the camera and just stared at us. It was very strange, I could understand if he was trying to be funny or he was just rude never the less no photo was taken and we were made to feel quite awkward. This gentlemen only seemed to work at night all the other porters that worked the day shift were beyond courteous and friendly. Moving forward the noise in the room was insane one morning from the room above somebody walking in heels for over an hour at 6am, I tried to call the hotel 5 times from my room and could not get anyone at the front desk to answer.
