I even tried to call the hotel from my cell phone and no luck. this happened twice more during the stay when I tried to reach the front desk. It seemed that the hotel was full and the hotel was really understaffed. 

I think because we were paying $500 a night we were expecting a lot more. At a lower rate I could except the flaws in service but not at the price.

title: O dear
text:
This is an example of a "boutique" hotel at its very worst. Superficially, everything looks very sharp, clean and modern. Unfortunately none of it is designed with guests in mind. The lighting in the rooms was so dim and unfocused that one could hardly see, the much touted balcony was a perilous looking sort of fire escape affair,
and a black toilet that barely flushes... I needn't go on. For the price, I felt tremendously taken advantage of. The only good thing I would like to report is the staff, who were all very nice and accommodating though one did not seem to know what the other was doing. Sorry guys.

title: Great staff, amazing views
text:
Firstly, I would recommend booking directly with the hotel rather than through Booking.com or any other third party. When I arrived there was some confusion over the room I had booked as the descriptions on booking.com were different to the actual room types offered by the hotel. However, Alex on the front desk was extremely accommodating and sorted the situation quickly and in a friendly way. 

The view from the room is the selling point - it is one of the best in Manhattan. Just make sure you get a high room and ideally a corner room to get all aspects. Also the beds are pure heaven! 

I have visited this hotel before and I had noticed that the fixtures and fittings in the rooms were a bit tired and the carpets in some of the hallways weren't always clean, but the views make up for all of that. 

It's also a bit strange that the hotel doesn't have a proper bar which makes the lobby feel a little soulless. But all in all this is a great hotel and Alex makes sure you have a great time. He should be promoted!!

title: Superbe
text:
Tres bon hotel situé dans un quartier un peu plus décalé mais très jeune.
Le personnel est serviable, n'hesitez pas a leurs demander une chambre en hauteur, ils feront le max pr vous satisfaire.
L'avis sur les chambres sont pour moi un peu mitige, j'ai l'impression qu'au niveau des fenetres elles auraient besoin d'une petite mise a jour, par contre deco tres sobre, propre, et bien-sur superbe vue (nous etions au 19e) 
Le petit dej est tres bon.vous pouvez aussi vous le faire monter pour profiter de la vue 😍
L'hotel offre des verres de vin, cafe, jus jusqu'a 16h.
Station de metro a quelques pas de l'hotel.

title: Hotel with a view
text: We booked a corner top floor room of this hotel with the intention of having a view of the Manhattan skyline. And indeed we had a breath taking view.  The room was spacious and comfortable. Cherry on the cake.  The staff was very helpful and to our surprise despite not having a breakfast included in our rate we were offered a complimentary basic breakfast. Very much appreciated.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location.
text: Me, my Girlfriend, my Sister and her Husband had a room each at the Hotel on Rivington for 2 nights and had a great time. The location is the best we've seen as we've visited NYC quite a few times. The views we had were literally incredible of the renowned New York skyline and there are lots of great bars and restaurants nearby. The hotels restaurant, Café Midi, was amazing and we tried lots of different dishes which I wouldn't normally go for, definitely try the Lamb Tartare. Also, check out Economy Candy over the road.

title: A good egg with just the right level of quirk and comfort.
text: Very friendly and attentive staff. Decor is lovely and unique. Nice city views from floor to ceiling windows. Really really comfortable mattress. Huuuuuuuge soaker tub. The first time I've ever actually wanted to use hotel-provided toiletries (Davines)!! Complementary continental breakfast was great.

title: Cool room for a guys trip
text: Great location, decent deal for a room with two full beds plus a small living room, with a great room. Cool place to hang out before heading out on the lower east side. Would definitely stay there next time.

title: Convenient, great for family reunion
text: We had a family reunion for a wedding here and it was great. Our room wasn't ready for 4 pm checkin, so we were upgraded which was fantastic. There is a bit of street noise but not too bad. We had a good continental breakfast included and there is a restaurant underneath for quick meals. It is close to a market and the subway station. The staff were always very helpful,from the desk staff printing papers for us to the doormen getting us cabs.

title: overpriced
text: paid 600 USD for a double room with double beds. it´s impossible to squeeze 4 people into this room as advertised. the bathroom is small and dark and the room was not really  clean. hotel is in a good location (if you like the lower east side) and has a nice looking restaurant and breakfast is complimentary but still this doesn´t justify the astronomical price. I had expected more amenities, a fresher look and friendlier personnel

title: Weekend fun
text: My stay this past weekend was fantastic.Eddie who helped with my booking and NYC site recommendation. Kei at Cafe Med to staff Gary, Adamo, Syed the food was just mouth watering; shrimp to steak,chocolate mousse to cheesecake. The Continental breakfast with Jordan and Frankie hit the spot, An if you want something extra the veg egg omelet was on the money. The located by a subway station, lots of little restaurants clubs nearby, room view was just breathtaking of lower Manhattan light at night.

title: Cool and classy
text:
The hotel is in a great location in a really interesting neighbourhood.  Staff are friendly and helpful, especially the doormen who were always very welcoming.  The complimentary breakfast was plentiful and much better quality than most.  The plate of cookies left by the beds every evening was a lovely touch and much appreciated. 

Our room was quite large by New York standards and very comfortable, but it could do with a bit of a refresh as it looked a bit tired in parts.  That's the only reason it doesn't get a 5 star review as we had a fantastic time and would go back in a heartbeat.

Lots of great places to eat nearby and don't miss Economy Candy across the street where it's worryingly easy to buy your own body weight in sweets.

title: Sexy hotel, but not quite 5 🌟
text:
Stayed in the corner king with tub and overall had a wonderful weekend! A few reasons they didn't get five stars though. The fixtures (doorknobs, light switches) were about to fall off or didn't work consistently. Also asked for housekeeping to come back in an hour one of the days, but they didn't. Lastly, when I booked the hotel it booked it for a rate about $75 cheaper (before taxes, per night) than I ended up being charged for pre-tax, per night (comparing apples to apples here). I'm sure it was just a glitch, but it was a little off-putting. I didn't take a screen shot otherwise I would have mentioned it to the staff.

The room / bathroom were very romantic. Despite the aforementioned small hiccups, we had a great stay and I think we would probably come back!

title: Confortevole ed accogliente
text: Hotel situato in nella East lower Manhattan in un quartiere molto vivace soprattutto la sera. Camere spaziose ed accoglienti ed una buona colazione hanno reso il soggiorno perfetto. Curata la stanza nei minimi dettagli ed anche il bagno era spazioso con l'enorme doccia. Unico neo un usciere molto maleducato.

title: Superb Downtown Hotel
text: This hotel is hip but the staff does not have an attitude.  The rooms are large with nice bathrooms and amenities.  The free breakfast is good.  It is located near many bars and restaurants.  It is a good choice when staying downtown.  The large windows provide excellent views.

title: Chilled out hotel
text: This place is fantastic. Rooms very modern and relaxing with great views. There is Free wine in the afternoon in the dinning area. Great roof top bar. Plenty of things to do around the area and a busy night life. Plenty transport to get all the sites .

title: Schon gut
text:
Wir waren für zwei Wochen hier ein quartiert und im großen und ganzen war es sehr gut.
Die Ankunft ist etwas bedrückend, vor allem, wenn man am Abend ankommt. Man fährt in dem funky roten Aufzug in die Rezeption im ersten Stock.
Der Aufenthaltsraum ist in Ordnung, eher was für junge Leute, dennoch kostenloses Wasser, Tee und Kaffee.
Das erste Zimmer hatte eine schöne Aussicht, war jedoch wegen einer Baustelle, die es gefühlt millionenfach in NY gibt, wahnsinnig laut und unglaublich heiß. Wir wechselten und wurden kostenlos upgegraded - Reklamationen haben generell sehr gut funktioniert, aber nur, wenn sie direkt an den Manager gingen.
Das größere Zimmer - so wie whrsl. die meisten in New York - war schön, aber sehr laut (kein Schallschutz an den Fenstern) - am Wochende ist bis drei in der früh Party, wir kamen um Ohropax nicht herum! Das Zimmer und das Bad wirkten schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen, dennoch fühlen wir uns sehr wohl.
Das Frühstück war inkludiert - also drei der 10 sehr deftigen Gerichte. Geschmacklich zum Teil sehr, sehr lecker, zum Teil in Ordnung - alles in allem nach 14 Tagen etwas zu wenig Abwechslung.
Die Umgebung ist gut, direkt gegenüber ein sehr cooler Candyladen (unbedingt besuchen!), die U-Bahn ist nah und zu Fuß gut erreichbar, die Delis sind nett...
Es gab zu frühen Geburtstagskuchen und am Ende noch Champagner aufs Haus, was uns beides gefreut hat. Die Minibar bietet vieles von Getränken über Snacks bis hin zu Sexzubehör - also nicht erschrecken lassen :)
Alles in allem für kurz oder lang empfehlenswert!

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: My daughter and I just spent 5 nights here and loved this hotel. Beautiful views, great staff, incredibly comfortable beds and a wonderful atmosphere. Thanks to Geo for helping me book this trip. The LES is a great place to be and I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

title: Romantic City Break
text:
Fab Hotel,  comfortable modern spacious rooms, floor to ceiling glass with great views - v.  cool.  Cracking location.  Good subway connections and walking distance to many locations.  Bars, shops, clubs and restaurants closeby.
Loved it !

title: Great Hotel and Location.
text: Just finished up a five-day stay at the Hotel on Rivington. It couldn't of been better. Incredible hotel, incredible location and the staff is the best. I loved everything about it. We had room 44 which has 2 walls of glass windows (with blackout curtains), a soak tub and steam shower. King size bed, sofa, etc.. Quiet and private. Right out of the lobby are an array of restaurants for either dining out or delivery. Hana Japenese is right next door. Über was always in front or 1 -2 minutes away. Again, thank you so much for a vacation I'll always remember. Special shout out to Victor at the front desk for checking us in taking care of us so well and Luis in the café who was always helpful.

title: Wonderful hotel, perfect location!
text: So happy we stayed at this hotel. Perfect location in the Lower East Side, easy to walk to many restaurants and bars near by. The room and bathroom were a good size, with a comfortable bed and cozy spa robes. Our room faced the courtyard and was very quiet. My husband loved the nightly bedside cookies!

title: I stay at the Hotel on Rivington EVERY TIME I come to NYC for work, which is about once a month, and I love it.
text: HOR is brilliant. I love the staff, I love the location (super convenient and walking distance to financial district, SoHo, Nolita, Chinatown and Little Italy), love the decor (clean, bright, modern), and the amazing little treats they leave you in your room every day (cookies, chocolates, Rice Krispie treats!). They have recently re-done the restaurant and bar area and it's awesome. the food is spectacular and the ambiance is lovely. My favourite thing is the watermelon basil martini. Make sure to try it out! I have to come to NYC for work a lot, and HOR makes me feel at home. But also, if I was a tourist, I know it would be great too - I have overheard the concierge on many occasions telling guests different places to go to eat, shop, etc. that are unique and great from a local's perspective. So it's definitely a great hotel for either business or pleasure.

title: LES Gem!
text: Was so surprised about everything in this amazing boutique hotel. Huge corner room with floor to ceiling windows, a balcony (in NYC!), great bed and linens, modern everything, large bathroom with window in the shower and lovely products! Great lobby with coffee and wine !  Great staff too

title: Amazing place!
text:
Credit to the management team who have turned this hotel into one of the best places to stay and hangout out in in the LES. The rooms are stylish and spacious, with super comfy beds and top AC.

Cafe Medi on the ground floor has a lively bar with a top food offering in the restaurant at the back which is definitely worth a go.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Exceptional service, great food, luxurious, spacious rooms, fantastic location, brilliant food, great bar. Quiet and peaceful and in my opinion, the only place to stay in NYC. Furthermore, the best dressing gowns in the city. Thank you for having me.

title: Love this place!!
text: The new decor of the hotel is refreshing and inviting.  The rooms are modern, clean and crisp.  The bed is so very comfortable and the shower is to die for!  The bathtubs are deep and relaxing after a day around the city or after some night life.  The service was personal and spot on.  Every staff member we encountered was warm and friendly.  Always willing to help in any way.  The area is safe and there are many different bars and restaurants within the immediate area well as shopping.  The subways are no more than a block away.  We have stayed here before and I will continue to in the future.

title: Poor customer service
text: I stayed at this hotel with a group of 25 colleagues from work for a 2 day workshop.  The facility is nice and the PH has some great views.  However, my experience was impacted negatively by their approach (or lack thereof to customer service).  I checked out yesterday and checked my bags with the bellman before I left for the second day of the workshop.  At lunch I realized I left my iphone charger in the room and called the room to inquire if it was recovered by the housekeeping staff.  The front desk manager said he would check and let me know when I arrived for my bags.  Upon arrival he told me that nothing was found in the room and that it had been checked by the HK managers as well.  When I asked if I could check the room myself he said no.  I then asked if a new guest had checked into the room, he said no and that there was no way I could have access to the room.  At this point it wasn't about the missing charger - it was about the customer service.  The head of security overheard our conversation and even inquired if he could accompany me to the room to check and the manager said no.  I am not sure if he did not want to be proved wrong or if he didn't want to admit that the HK staff took it or threw it out, but I will not stay here ever again nor do I recommend it based on this experience.  There are plenty of other hotels in this area that offer the views and amenities that HoR does, but with an understanding of what customer service is all about.

title: Modern hotel with sound challenges
text: This hotel is located near great shopping and dining options on the Lower East Side and Broadway.  It’s on the same block as the Delancey Street subway station (F train).  The rooms are modern, attractive, and larger than most hotel rooms in Manhattan.  However, the design carries sound very well.

title: Trendy but Friendly
text:
First the room: big and gorgeous!! Grey wood floor tiles meet cool wall colors, contemporary furnishings/shag rugs and walls of glass. The mattress is so comfortable I'm buying one for my home. The cramped, red carpet hallways are not very appealing, but don't let them discourage you. The rooms are truly fabulous. From the 7th floor and up, the views are amazing. Ours looked downtown to One WTC. We even had a small balcony and the best stocked mini bar I've ever seen. And for the price, the whole stay was amazing. 
The staff: so friendly and accommodating! Gio is the day manager and he will take care of anything you need-- as will just about everyone. From the doormen to the cleaning staff, we couldn't have been happier. The only critique I will give here is that some of the staff could be better informed about the area and its amenities, restaurants, bars, etc. But otherwise, the staff could hardly have been better.

title: Lower East Side Gem!
text:
Just returned from the Hotel on Rivington and had a great stay!

The hotel is located in the trendy LES neighborhood that gives you many options for dining and clubbing within walking distance. 

We chose a high floor king corner room with balcony which was worth the additional $. I've attached pics of the view and the room which was quite spacious for NYC. The minibar and toiletries were premium and really made the experience great. The hotel has a small gym, restaurant that serves a continental breakfast/afternoon complimentary wine and a rooftop bar (that we didn't get to enjoy because it was rented out for private events). 

What made it really special were the little touches like the bottle of wine given to us by the front desk since it took awhile for our room to be ready or the nightly snacks that are delivered to your room.

I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or personal travel.

title: I am IN LOVE!!!!!
text:
Our son went to college and now lives in NYC so we visit the city quite often. The hubby prefers to stay around Central Park and I finally convinced him to explore a new area and new hotel. SO THANKFUL HE DID!!! We're sold. Staff was excellent, place was incredibly fun and very clean. The neighborhood is high energy and very hip. We expected the noise so that was not upsetting but just be prepared if you are used to staying in a more low key area of the city. Only MINOR complaint was the elevators. They could use a few more.....again, minor complaint. Have experienced that in many places!!! Take your significant other and ENJOY! Just make time to enjoy the room!!! 
We hope to stay again next month when we take our 17yr old and friends. I'll have to post again on thoughts for family stays (with OLDER children)

title: Zentrale Lage in lebhaftem Viertel und guter Atmosphäre
text: Die Lage ist super. Ob zu Fuß oder mit der U-Bahn von hier kann man alles in Manhattan problemlos erreichen. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und das Zimmer modern, sauber und für NY sehr großzügig. Leider war der Frühstücksraum im 20. Stock nur an 2 Tagen geöffnet. Der Blick von hier zum Frühstück ist super.

title: Hotel on Rivington, NYC
text:
Location:  Lower East Side Manhattan,  Many restaurants and bars all within walking distance. very convenient

Hotel Property: Small Boutique hotel, Hipster trendy.  Your uber driver may miss it as not so good outside signage.

Layout: very nice, small, buts its manhattan, roof top bar and lounge very cool, You can walk outside, grab a smoke if that your thing and see the wonderful view of Freedom tower.  awesome views

Staff: very friendly and helpful

Rooms: Modern, some of my friends had rooms with transparent window in the showers, cool is a Risky/ naughty kind of way.  comfortable beds and windows that open so you can hear and get fresh air instead of air conditioning ( which i enjoy).  No ironing boards or iron in room - bummer and a cheap fix by management.

Restaurant on premises: it was just being finished up in construction, but I image it will be very nice.

breakfast: included continental server up roof top level, very nice

title: What a nice hotel!
text:
I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. 

Myself and my partner stayed for 6 nights. The hotel was in a really cool neighbourhood (Lower East Side), and was a great location for food and bars. 

I was initially really concerned that I had read reviews about noise. However we were at the back of the hotel on the 3rd floor and didn't hear anything from outside. The corridor was a little noisy, but it wasn't anything that putting on the aircon to mask the sound couldn't solve. 

The staff were friendly and attentive. The room was very big for NYC standards - the bed was a king (UK super king size), and we had two small sofas and a coffee table. 

I really enjoyed my stay and would consider staying there again.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel. Excellent Location.
text: Great staff from the doorman who were always available and always helpful to the front desk staff who were fast and efficient. Breakfast on the penthouse roof top deck was incredible. Wish it was open all the time for breakfast and drinks. Free continental breakfast was limited but very fresh with fruit, breads and great coffee. The room was a corner suite on the 15nth floor. Huge for NYC standards. The rooms were starting to show wear but they were very clean. The toiletries in the room were exceptional and were in larger bottles then the normal sample size. Plenty of public parking next door for $50/night although they may do valet parking as well. Convenient walking distance to China town and Little Italy or St Marks. Walkable to financial district, Battery Park or High Line if you like walking. Very nice hotel for the price.

title: Très bien situé
text:
Nous y sommes restés 10 nuits. L'hôtel est vraiment idéalement situé! L'arrêt de métro est au coin de la rue, et permet de prendre deux lignes différentes très utiles! Le pass de métro 7 jours illimité est très rentable et permet de faire le séjour sans taxi donc sans frais supplémentaires. L'accueil est courtois. 
Les chambres sont grandes et propres, avec peut être une petite obsession pour la clim mais elle se règle!
Quelques petits détails ont vieillis... 
Nous avions eu une offre sur le site de l'hôtel, donc très bonne qualité prix... A voir a l'avance...!
Pour l'étage, nous étions au 4ème donc sans la vue... Un peu dommage car c'est un des intérêts de cet hotel, mais nous avions payé en conséquence. 
Très bien insonorisé! Très tranquille.
Le quartier est génial pour dîner le soir!

title: Fabolous
text:
Nice hotell, nice staff, good rooms, good breakfast, in à very good neighbourhood. The view from the roof is magnifisant.  Helt klart ett superhotell!! 
Lugnt område så det går att sova gott o minibaren är inte mini. Gratis vin ibland som kan tas på taket där utsikten är fantastisk. Gym finns o alla rum har ångdusch o självklart airkondition

title: Excellent
text: stayed in this hotel recently with my partner.By far the best experience I have ever had in any hotel in nyc.The doorman Elvis was very helpful and polite as well as the woman in the front desk.Thank you for the excellent customer service and I will continue to stay at your hotel when I am in nyc!

title: Romantic hotel
text: Spent Valentine's Day at Hotel on Rivington in 2015. Beautiful rooms and beautiful stay. Staff was nice. Bathrooms and showers are huge and super sexy. Best Italian toiletries provided. Beds are amazing, clean and the most comfy. Wonderful views of the city. Perfect place for a romantic night!

title: Top floor views are out of this world
text: The room was lovely, with floor to ceiling windows it was almost hard to go out. The bathroom was also super cool. An experience in itself and right in the middle of the Lower East Side. Much more fun than some generic, more expensive spot.

title: Quality was worth a fraction of what we paid
text:
Booked a Unique Room here for our anniversary.  The view from the room was really great.  

Unfortunately, there were a few downsides.  The air conditioning in the room didn't work.  When we walked in, it had to be at least 90 degrees and was incredibly stuffy.  I saw a review from last week that said the same thing and hoped the problem was fixed, but it wasn't.  

I also requested a wheelchair for my partner.  The one they gave me was filthy, covered in dust and dirt.  When I spoke to the man at the front desk about both the air conditioner and wheelchair, he didn't even apologize.  He implied that most people don't request wheelchairs and made it sound like they did us a favor for supplying us with one.

Lastly, there was a room of loud guys directly below us yelling on their porch all night.  We asked the front desk to speak to them, but it never quieted down and we barely slept.

There was one woman at the front desk who was really nice and did her best to accommodate us.  She even sent us a free bottle of wine and ultimately, the wheelchair was cleaned off.

That withstanding, it was a disappointing experience given the price point (over $600.)  Standard rooms may be better here and again, you can't beat the views.  But I would not recommend this for anyone looking for a first rate experience.  It was anything but that.

title: Faux 4 étoiles !
text:
Très déçue par le service de cette hôtel !! À croire que le personnel n'a jamais fait d'école d'hôtellerie !! Certaines hôtesses mâchent du chewing-gum...

Il leur a fallu 2 jours et 3 réclamations de ma part avant qu'il accepte de nous changer la chambre (passant d'une vue à peu près potable au 15eme où on devinait le pont de Brooklyn au 10eme où on voyait très bien le parking en bas..) alors que :
- la fenêtre de la sdb était cassée et ouverte (bruit et froid entraient..) il fallait une ventouse pour la fermer que seul l'homme à tout faire avait... Imaginez rentrer à 22h épuisé d'une journée de marche et découvrir que vous devez attendre que l'homme monte avant de pouvoir utiliser la salle de bain
- l'accès au balcon était condamné (alors que les autres clients avec accès au leur)
- la chasse d'eau fuyait
- la porte du coffret électrique ne fermait pas et empêchait l'ouverture du placard où se trouvait le coffre et le bar
- des énormes tâches côté intérieur sur la baie vitrée..
Un vrai 4 étoiles aurait libéré la chambre dite de "secours" immédiatement. Il a presque fallu que je pleure pour qu'on nous change de chambre le soir du 2eme jour !!

Concernant le petit déjeuner, très très peu de choix. Attention pour ceux ayant des enfants pas de chocolat chaud et le lait est en supplément.
Au choix : céréales ou granola, croissants, mauvais pain ou bagel hyper dur ; petit fromage blanc avec fruits. Miel ou confiture  à la fraise. Thé, jus d'orange et café. Voila !
Dès 7 jours passés là-bas nous avons pu profiter qu'une fois de la salle de restauration située au 20 ème étage avec la super vue sinon c'était au 2 ème au lounge (au fait pas de billard comme sur la photo, que des tables et 2 canapés)
Le gars chargé de renflouer le petit déjeuner n'est jamais là et il faut parfois attendre 10mn avant qu'il revienne...

A savoir : la salle au 20 ème est parfois loué à des jeunes ou groupes pour des soirées privés. Ces même jeunes peuvent se retrouver à votre étage (pourquoi ? Je ne sais pas) et vous réveiller en pleine nuit..

L'entrée de l'hôtel n'est pas comme sur la photo avec du rouge et une jolie arche blanche mais toute noire ce qui n'est pas accueillant d'autant que l'accueil en lui même se fait au 2 ème étage (bon à savoir car personne ne vous le dit et ce n'est indiqué nul part)

Les points positif sont:
- le portier qui fait bien son boulot quand il est là,
- les femmes de chambres qui sont gentilles,
- la salle de bain qui est jolie même si on vous voit la nuit de dehors si vous prenez une douche (ombre),
- la proximité du métro (< 50m) (station Essex et Delancey)
- les 2 petits gâteaux (plus ou moins bons) que l'on vous dépose dans votre chambre chaque jour vers 18h
- l'hôtesse qui s'est proposée de poster notre courrier et nous a gentiment fait une réservation au restaurant.

Pour ma part ça reste une très grosse déception et je ne conseillerai pas cet hôtel qui ne vaut pas 4 étoiles mais plutôt 2 par son service et qui au final n'est pas si bien placé pour faire tout NY bien que facile d'accès depuis JFK (comptez quand même 1h30-2h de trajet en métro par la ligne J de l'hôtel au terminaux)

title: My new favorite hotel!
text:
I truly enjoyed my stay here between 19-20 of May! The hotel is quite anonymous from the outside, and the lobby is small and on the second floor. Service has been great all the stay through, and upon arrival I was greeted nicely with an upgrade to the 18th floor, to the most amazing view, and best room ever!

The room is huge! Quiet and gave me a great nights sleep! The bathroom was amazing, with a beautiful bathtub and great quality products (love going to hotels when you don't have to bring toiletries)
Breakfast was located on 20th floor, and was everything I wanted: yogurt with berries and granola, coffee and juice, bagel/toast with either jam or cream cheese.

Location is great!

In my room they had prepared cookies, water and popcorn, nice gesture! 

I come to NYC in business at least three times per year, and will happily stay here again, no other hotel can compare to this!

title: LOVE this hotel.
text:
Just finished a long weekend at the Hotel Rivington.  The hotel is in a great area - especially if you want to be in a walkable area close to lots of food and drink options.  The beds are so comfortable and the showers are incredible.  We stayed in a studio suite on the 11th floor and the views are quintessential New York.  

The hotel staff was so friendly and accommodating.  To top everything off, free light breakfast every morning and a wine hour that starts at 12pm!  

My advice is to try to get a room on the highest floor.  Also, this hotel is in a very busy nightlife part of the city.  If you are looking for quiet, I would go somewhere else.  But for a fun weekend in the city, I can't imagine a better spot.

Also, the hotel is doing a lot of work at the moment, so I really look forward to the new features that will make it even better.   Will be back soon!

title: Tired and Overpriced
text: Arrived at the hotel to be told our very expensive "unique" room would be ready in 30 mins to check into.  4 hours later we were still waiting with no explanation from the front desk.  A change of shift made little difference and the lack of interest in a $800 a night room was staggering.  When we did eventually get to the room, it was untidy, with yellow stained dirty curtains and a broken air conditioner.   This room and the hotel in general needs a major refurb, it looks and feels tired and dirty and it will be the last time I stay here.  Much better value close by like the Ludlow.

title: Could be better
text:
This hotel has everything to be perfect but it still needs a few improvements.
Iti is well located, at the bottom of Williamsburg bridge and in the heart of lower east side with many public transportation. The staff is friendly.
The rooms are nice, good bed and the wahrooms are ok, but what a weird idea to have the shower next to an outside normal window so at night it's a little visible.
We paid for a room in the upper levels and were deceived to be on the 9th floor.
Worse, the wifi was horrible, hard to be connected in the room and even next to the lobby.
There are only 2 elevators for 20 floors and they are used by the guests and the service so you wait long minutes everytime you want to use it, which is often because the lobby is on the 2nd level.
There is a beautiful penthouse room where you are suppose to have breakfast but it's often used for private parties so you can't access it and you are turned round pretty vigourosly.
I think when you pay over 400U$ a night, even in NY, it could be better.

title: No Sleep in LES! Terrible construction
text:
I stayed here for business and pleasure. I went against my usual of staying at Starwood properties as I wanted to try something new. What a terrible mistake....

Location:
It is an excellent location to party downtown and have action 24/7. If you need to go anywhere uptown by taxi, add about 20 mins to your travel. Just getting out of LES due to the construction is terrible. 

Property:
The lobby is under construction so you're walking into basically a dark and barebones lobby. Check in is on the 2nd floor and was shocked at how small it was. Nothing really more to tell about the building. 

Room:
We had a High Floor King w/ soaking tub on the 15th floor. Let me begin...The construction is subpar and none of the interior doors would shut properly unless you slammed. The TERRACE door would NOT close. I finally got it to shut. When I left my room for the day, I came back and their was maintenance in my room. Why? Because the terrace door came off the hinges and almost fell off the terrace. He proceeded to tell me that I should always keep the terrace door closed. Really? Or should housekeeping shut it if they see it open. 
The noise from the outside kept me up and there was a howling when it was windy outside. 

Conclusion:
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. This may have been a one of negative experience here but its about 1st impressions. Management did nothing to resolve the situation nor did they offer any concessions. Even an employee who I will not name or described told me what they did was wrong and I should leave a review on TripAdvisor. 

I will continue to spend my money at Starwood and Marriott properties.

title: vibrant area and comfortable and convenient hotel
text:
we generally stay uptown but wanted to explore downtown....At first glance, the hotel was not what I expected, but as we began to explore area, we liked it much better....the location is ideal to explore LES and easy to walk to Bowery (not what it use to be), West Village, Battery Park and Twin Tower area.  The area is vibrant and alive.  our room, on the 14th floor with balcony was comfortable and concise..Bed was very comfortable and shower was great. View was tremendous. One wall is all windows... Free  self-serve breakfast on penthouse floor was good and view was terrific...
Late night on weekends can be a bit noisy but ends when bars close down.

title: excellent
text: bellissimo hotel, riservato e discreto: arredi originali, fornitissimo e ottimo bar in camera, stanze confortevolissime e con ottima vista, bagni molto rilassanti e curati. un po' caro ma è bilanciato al servizio e all'ambiente curato.

title: Surprisingly great stay.
text:
We just thought this might be another one of these hotels, nope it was not. Staff were great, room was comfortable and the hotel had great views.

Small problem was sorted out with no fuss and the gave us a bottle of wine, what more i as you, what more?

Top service, top hotel, highly recommended and wine for all guests, free in the afternoon.

Lovely!

title: cool designhotel
text:
Gillar du stora fönster och duschväggar helt i glas (vissa mot gatan) är detta stället. 
Ligger riktigt bra om du är i staden för att äta gott, nattliv samt strosa omkring lower east och soho på dagarna. 
Frukost brukar ingå som är helt ok. Se till att få ett rum högt upp och få en riktigt bra utsikt över staden.

title: great views of downtown
text: what i love about this hotel is that the rooms are big. even the standards have a small couch and seating area.   the bathroom is huge by hotel standards. very quiet.  location is amazing close to subway on essex street and near all the cool restaurants and bars of the LES.   they are renovating the lobby so i hope that its fab when they are done.   they offer breakfast too which is nice.

title: Grossartige Aussicht und geniale Lage
text:
Das Hotel ist eines der wenigen hohen Häuser in der näheren Umgebung (20 Stockwerke), so dass man v.a. in den höheren Etagen eine grossartige Aussicht hat. Wir sahen von unserem Eckzimmer im 16. Stockwerk (mit Balkon!) alle drei südwestlichen Brücken - und 1'000 andere Sachen. :-) Die riesigen Fenster durchfluten das Eckzimmer mit Tageslicht. Das Hotel wurde im Eingangsbereich gerade renoviert, was aber kaum störte. Der Zustand des Gebäudes lässt generell etwas zu wünschen übrig, dafür ist alles mit Stil eingerichtet - und die Betten sind äusserst komfortabel!
Die Umgebung (Lower East Side / East Village) ist grossartig - vor allem, wenn man nicht zum ersten Mal in NYC ist und daher nicht nur die typischen Touristen-Attraktionen besichtigen möchte. Es gibt eine Unmenge wunderbarer Bars und Restaurants. Die Gegend lebt, aber auf eine entspanntere Art als andere Teile der Stadt.

title: Room with a view
text:
Our Tablet plus status got us an easy upgrade to a junior corner suite on the 15th Fl. The floor to ceiling Windows offer wide angle breathtaking views and yet total privacy (no high rises within 'critical' distance (though we all know there's telescope junkies around... But, hey, it's NY).
A challenge for this type of rooms is the night time blackout level at times, but the 'surround' curtains do a very decent job, we thought (and I'm notably fussy about external light piercing through).
The only minus in our room was the pm sun exposure in the bedroom part where the a/c seems to lack cooling power. But the room cooled off comfortably over the evening hours.
The renovation of ground level spaces was not disturbing in the least and their progress goes at the speed of light.
Comp continental breakfast, allday coffee and pm wines are a pleasant surprise. In fact we weren't even charged for our breakfast specials.
Highly recommended !

title: Great Birthday Stay
text: The room was sunny and had a great view.  Loved the bathroom and the soak in tub. I was sad that we could not utilize the balcony because it was very windy. The staff was very friendly and I loved the wine and desserts delivered to the room.  How awesome!

title: Construction was a "non issue"
text: Minimalist rooms with incredible views!  I was concerned to hear that construction was going on during our stay, but was pleased to find that was a non issue.  The hotel is primarily working on the outside street side facade/entrance.  Looks like they were adding or remodeling a restaurant on the ground floor.  Should be a great addition once complete.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The 20th floor has a simple breakfast in the am and wine in the afternoons (afternoon starting at 12, hell yes!🍷).  Each are complimentary.  I am not sure what the 20th floor penthouse use to be used for, but it's very open and the views are sick.

title: Fab Hotel in great location
text: Minimalist room, clean, modern, ceiling to floor glass.  Good views from balcony and ideally located in LES, near Metro and in walking distance of Little Italy, China town, Financial District,  Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsburg bridges.  Close to Bowery and Soho.  Lots of food and drink places nearby.

title: The City that never sleeps?  Neither will you!  Beautiful views though....
text:
Unfortunately the main thing that sticks in my mind was the noise.  That didn't stop.
we stayed on the 9th Floor and the views from the floor to ceiling glass windows were lovely, however I think they may of neglected the sound proofing as the noise from the road below was staggering.  Taxis tooting and police sirens going all day and night (I lie, it did get quieter between around 2-5 am- but then the garbage trucks roar down the street.  Sadly we paid a small fortune for this hotel and I didn't sleep for 4 days.  Having said this, NYC is busy and noisy and perhaps it would be the same in any hotel in Manhattan?  The hotel was being refurbished when we visited and the foyer was a bit of a mess, but the breakfast on the 20th floor had wonderful views across the city.  The breakfast itself  was really very basic and we had a better offering in the boutique B&B we later stayed in.  The rooms were clean, and we had an adjoining area with sofas and a TV which was useful.
The bed gets 5 stars from me, I'm not sure if it was a Tempur but it felt like memory foam and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever laid on.  
Cookies left in the room each afternoon was a nice touch.

title: Two days of business
text: hotel is a right place for relaxation after a hard day, staff friendly, smiling, always ready to help, the food in the restaurant is excellent, service is quick, friendly waiters, comfortable room with a large bed, thank you.

title: NYC
text: Room size was fabulous and was lovely and quiet. Bed was way too firm for our liking. Unfortunately entry foyer was being renovated which was inconvenient during our stay. For the price of the room breakfast could be included.

title: Otimo
text: Hotel com uma decoração  super moderna, atendimento maravilhoso, quarto grande, aconchegante, limpo e cheiroso. A rede Wifi  era muito boa  e pegava super bem no quarto. adorei o ambiente calmo e espero voltar novamente.

title: Most memorable New York stay with stellar service & views
text:
We booked the Corner King Suite for over a week and was blown away upon arrival. Not only by the floor to ceiling Windows and views of the Williamsburg, Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge but also because it was my mothers birthday trip and Eddie Griffin who greeted us upon arrival from day one made the entire trip a memorable one. We were greeted with champagne and a cake and throughout our
 stay there were cookies placed at our bedside. My mother casually mentioned that she loved the Rice Krispy treats the most and from that day they were at her bedside every evening. We also found out they were made fresh in house daily too. 

Location wise you have the best of eats in lower Manhattan. A simple stroll will bring you to The infamous Katz Deli, Russ and daughters deli & also their cafe on Orchard, Freemans Alley and even Chinatown for hot pot in the winter which is lifesaver is round the corner too. 

Overall stunning views with a modern decor, incredible tempur pedic beds, floor to ceiling views of Manhattan even from the shower (you can request for the glass windows to be covered from the bathroom if you so desire) 

Service wise, we have yet to stay in a hotel so dedicated to your comfort esp when Eddie is around. Richard at the door was also one of my favourites of the staff. Absolute stars of the Rivington. 

We look forward to staying with you all again in the future.

title: 10/10 in every way
text:
This hotel is the hidden gem in LES. Close to all of the best restaurants such as Dirty French, Beauty and Essex and many more.
The hotel itself is 10/10 for what you pay;
Amazing service.
Good sized rooms.
Great roof top bar.
Location was also great - a short cab ride to anywhere or a subway ride, which was literally a hop, skip and jump from the hotel.

The staff were fantastic and any problems would instantly be fixed.

We came to New York for 7 nights and had booked Hotel Rivington as it was recommended to us.
We then came back a few days later after visiting DC with plans of staying in the Upper East Side but re-booked Rivington as the area is simply too good.
On second time back the staff were even better and we sort of felt like family.
Such a great feel and a memorable holiday.
A special thanks to Daniel, the General Manager, who welcomed us back with open arms and couldn't have been any more hospitable!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
Stayed here for a 3 night break and could not fault it.  There was construction on the ground floor so finding the hotel was a little difficult.  The lobby is on the second floor and check in was easy and quick.

Our room was on the 5th floor with no view to speak of other than an internal yard.  This was no big deal for us though as we spent most of the time out of the hotel.  The view from the 20th floor is spectacular though.  A complimentary breakfast is also available on the 20th floor.  This consists of coffee, bagels, toast, pastries, breakfast cereals and hot oatmeal.  The entire offering is decent for a free breakfast.

The room was a good size by NY standards and was spotlessly clean.  The bathroom was also clean, well designed and well stocked with good quality bath products.  You shower in full view of the outside world but if this a problem just let the shower run for a minute and the window steams up.  The Tempura mattress was super comfy and we slept extremely well.

The location is great with numerous restaurants, cool bars and shops within walking distance.  The subway is a 2 minute walk away with an easy connection to and from JFK on the J train.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Nice surprise on the LES
text: My daughter and I had a room with 2 double beds on the 7th floor. By NYC standards it was a nice sized room.  Loved the Tempurpedic mattress and Frette linens.  There were 3 large closets for us to share.  Complementary coffee and a wheat-y breakfast is served in the 20th floor penthouse each morning.  Fantastic views.  They also served fruit, yogurt and hot oatmeal.  We also frequently made it back for the wine reception from 5-6pm also served in the penthouse.  Nice touch.  Other nice touches were turn down service with cookies each night.  Individual heating and cooling thermostat ensured we were always comfortable.  We would definitely stay there again.  However.... I would make sure that I booked a room on a higher floor.  For one, for the view.  For another, the weekend party noise.  It wasn't so much the revelers we heard but until about 3:30 AM there was constant car honking.  Constant.  Throw in an occasional siren and I imagined everyone on the street was having mostly - a good time.  Of course, I would remember to pack ear plugs. Entry to the hotel late at night is secured by room key. The staff was friendly and helpful.  The neighborhood was exceptionally fun to explore.  I tried sheep's milk yogurt from a stand at Essex Market and now will remain on a search until I can find that scrumptious stuff again.  Juice Press has an amazing selection of cold pressed juice.They are remodeling the common areas of the hotel but there was minimal disruption caused by this.

title: Always an amazing stay at the Riv !
text: I have visited this hotel on multiple  occasions and I'm alway blow away by the service and the atmosphere . From the phone call to book speaking with Ashley who is so knowledgable to the city and so helpful and cheerful everything we call . Then there's checking in . The valet and door guys are always awesome ! Alex at the from desk is a nice guy and also very helpful always . Then there's Geo at the bar who could not like him ! The bathtubs are so relaxing . The views are like no other ! The area and gourmet food in the close area are wonderful ! I suggest Stanton social or beauty and Essex ! Whatever you do if you have to go to the LES stay a the the hotel on rivington you can't go wrong here !

title: Higher-Lower East Side
text:
Stayed here with my two brothers for a 50th birthday event. They'd never experienced NYC before and i knew LES was the place that would suit us most for having some fun.
The hotel worked a treat. From the booking phase which Kristen at the hotel really helped us with to the actual stay. She sold us HoR over SixtyLES, where the guy couldn't really care if we stayed or not, so i knew we'd made the right choice with this one!
Had a King Suite (Think thats what its called) and we shared a massive (and supremely comfortable) King for two of us with the 3rd bor on a roll-away in teh 'lounge' area of the suite. We were on the 14th floor and thought the views were great, until we went onto the roof of the Penthouse for a gander; which is incredible. Thats also where you have breakfast (which was perfect self-service, bagels, cereal, juice, coffee etc). The view from the shower is great too!
All the staff were great; reflected the LES vibe well and whilst we didn't really need them, we're always friendly and welcoming. We even got a bucket of beers on check-in; how cool is that!! (Can't guarantee, everyone will get that though!).
The bars in this area are brilliant if you're unpretentious and just want to have fun, whether thats midday or midnight. Felt really safe walking around too, even at 2am.

title: Superbe vue, mais service mediocre...
text:
Dates de séjour : 10/03/2016 - 15/03/2016
  DECEPTION
En effet, malgré un emplacement tout à fait remarquable, et une vue très appréciée, tout le reste était très en deçà de nos attentes. Il n'est pas acceptable de séjourner dans un tel hotel sans faire mention des travaux de refonte dont il fait l'objet. Le personnel est très loin des standards rencontrés dans d'autres hotels moins renommés et peu enclin à un service digne de ce nom.
*L'acces à l'hotel depuis la rue s'effectue sous les echaffaudage à travers une réception bachée et pleine de poussière. Les marteau piqueurs sont à l'action tout au long de la nuit (chaque soir un petit courrier se trouvait dans notre chambre).
*Le petit déjeuné se déroulait dans un cadre bricolé et en déménagement, sur des banquettes sales et au raz du sol dans une salle sans vue sur l'extérieur, de plus la qualité et la variété des produits mis à disposition était inacceptable. il fallait se battre pour un reste de bagel chaque matin....
*Aucun accès au rooftop n'était possible et surtout le lobby de l'hotel était en réfection complete, ce qui nous obligeait à monter à pieds par un escalier de service avant de pouvoir prendre l'ascenceur durant 3 jours et subir les poussières les ouvriers en transit avec des matériaux dans l'ascenceur et marteau piqueurs jusque tard dans la nuit... C'est tout simplement inacceptable.
*Enfin, les photos disponible de la chambre sur divers sites datent un peu, car aujourd'hui, l'ensemble est bien vétuste, l'état de propreté tout juste acceptable (en particulier le mobilier et la SDB qui ont besoin d'un coup de frais) en tout cas sans rapport avec le service qu'on est en droit d'attendre en venant dans ce genre d'établissement. petit bonus, les sextoy et lubrifiant de mauvais gout disponibles dans le minibar font un peu "hotel de passe des années 70:)

Enfin, le personnel qui n'a jamais du fréquenter les bancs de l'école hotelière... géré comme une boite de nuit par des barman à peine polis...

Vacanciers en quête d’hôtel de standing passez votre chemin... à part pour la vue...

title: Hipsterish hotel in one of my favorite NYC neighborhoods
text: I stay at this hotel for about half my visits to NYC. It's becoming a bit run-down (nothing serious), but I enjoy the rooms, the view from the rooms (especially the higher floors that have north-facing windows), and the Lower East Side neighborhood is one of the liveliest in the city. I hear they're renovating some spaces, so maybe the "run-down" issue is being addressed?

title: Spur of the moment stay
text: Used Hotel Tonight app to book a spur of the moment stay.Check in was a breeze and Staff was very nice.Clean room and bathroom.4th floor,room 47 facing street.Very noisy due to club across street but for me,not an issue.Bed was so comfy!Pillows way too soft.Slept fantastic though.Room is spacious and pretty.They leave two candles for you to light!Really dig this place.Will come again. PS...Bed is great!! (:

title: Third stay summer 2015!
text: We've stayed at this hotel three times and it is consistently good. Rooms are funky, clean, well taken care of. Tons of natural light. Service at the desk efficient and friendly. Great Manhattan location.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying here and the team members were awesome. The rooms was large clean and had floor to ceiling windows. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was modern with a great view out of the shower. The balcony was a surprise but provided a great chance to great views. The outlets are under construction and will be very warm and reflective of the hotel in general. I hope to return and eience the hotel again.

title: A tucked away gem.
text: We chose Hotel on Rivington for its location, but were overwhelmed by the amenities, the features and the size of the rooms.  The hotel is located on the lower east side, a neighborhood with a rich historic past, currently in the boom of gentrification  and growth.  Surrounding the hotel are fantastic restaurants, shops and a rich night life.  At first glance we were put off by the scaffolding surrounding the hotel.  However, all was forgiven when we reached the glass enclosed 20th floor with beautiful views of NYC to check in.  We then learned that the hotel is in the completing stages of the renovations.  Our three rooms were glorious with sunken tubs, terrace, new and clean amenities. From the welcoming popcorn pack with Fiji water to the incredible memory foam mattress, we were thrilled to discover this gem.

title: Worst hotel experience ever
text: If you want to be burglarized and then treated with suspicion by the hotel staff, definitely stay here! They have no security cameras in the hotel and faulty door locks, so someone can enter your room while you're asleep, take your stuff, and just roll out. Then, the hotel will demand that you to prove that things were stolen. Then when you provide proof they won't respond to you. Horrible attitude all around when dealing with us on this issue. I've had to stop payment on my credit card and file disputes with the city of new york and the BBB because the management at this hotel is completely indifferent to their guests being victimized.

title: Great Deal Downtown
text: We have stayed at the Hotel on Rivington twice in the past few months and the location can't be beat for concerts, restaurants and drinks.  The layout of the hotel is a little strange - you have to go up one level to reach the lobby, but the rooms are very nice.  Our king room had floor to ceiling windows and a huge soaking tub.  We were able to find deals both times and felt like it was a very good value.

title: My stay at Rivington
text: Loved the hotel! Definitely recommend it. I booked a high king room and was told I would be on the 15 floor but I wanted a tub (no biggie) & ended up on the 12th floor. Was still a beautiful room with a japanese tub & the staff were really nice. Will definitely be returning.

title: My favorite!
text:
By far the funniest and trendy hotel I've ever stayed in. I've stayed a couple times and loved every visit. The location for me is perfect. Tons of restaurants, bars and shopping near by.  Rooms are really done well and bed is comfy, with great linens!

Staff is so accommodating!

title: Nice Trendy Hotel and Excellent Service
text: I travel to New York for business often and normally stay at the Jumeirah Essex House where, for the price, you should absolutely expect consistently clean, beautiful rooms and great service. On my last trip to NY, I decided to stay somewhere a bit more economical, so I opted for Hotel on Rivington, per a friend's recommendation. I was a little skeptical, as I am accustomed to the comfort and grandeur of Central Park S., but I can assure you that any and all of my previous doubts are now gone. This hotel was spotless, the room was a comfortable size and layout (standard room), and the wait staff, especially during breakfast, were truly amazing. They were casual, but totally professional and always anticipated my needs - they remembered my breakfast preference and had a cab ready for me by the time I was finished. Even though all of my appointments are much closer to the Essex House, I will definitely be staying here again. Highly recommended.

title: Breathtaking views in an edgy neighbourhood
text:
OK my title was a bit of a fib. The lower east side used to be edgy, but like most edgy parts of any city, the hipsters, then crowds move in and gentrification is everywhere. I first stayed at the Hotel on Rivington in 2007 and then the area was not where you'd expect this gleaming steel and glass structure. The views are spectacular. The decor chic. The rooms huge for NYC. If you book a room with a Japanese bath, I think it may well be possible to fit several sumo wrestlers in with ease. The bath also enjoys the views as do the showers. Foaming up rubbing on moisturising natural orange body wash with a view of downtown Manhattan is a treat for sure. 
The bars serving $1 beers are long gone, but the vibrancy and energy of the area is amazing. One Saturday at 4pm, every venue I walked past was bursting at the seems. 
Ditch Times Square, Mid Town, Broadway, et al. This shows NYC has so much better than that.

title: Back again and pleased again
text: i'm sitting in the lobby with a (free) glass or red as i write this. i spent three nights at the rivington and was again very pleased with my stay. my first review of this hotel provides further detail, but to summarise two nice things about my current trip, (1) there is unfortunately some renovation going on in the co-op bar on the ground floor, but fortunately free breakfast and a discount offered to guests at a really good juice bar two doors down; and (2) the hotel staff really went out of their way to assist me with everything i needed, not least allowing me to check in two hours late today. i would never hesitate to stay here and do recommend for anyone who knows what they want from a hotel (and isn't precious about that hotel conforming to a cookie cutter experience). i may be back again in two days!

title: Pleasure
text:
Stay away. 

Dirty.  Creepy. Very small rooms. 
Very disappointed. 

Nice neighborhood but place needs organization.  Needed towels and hangers on room upon checkin. Would not come back.  
Front desk is creepy. Employees not very helpful. Young kids.

title: Cool
text: I always love staying at Rivington. It's always like walking into an exclusive night club.  For my last stay I was upgraded to the penthouse was was a nice gesture since I stay so often.  My only issue is the lobby furniture seems to be getting a bit old but I am sure they will change that out soon.  If you stay make sure you jump over to Brooklyn.

title: Execelente Hotel
text: Muy grata estadía,  hotel bien ubicado en East midtown cerca a la estación del metro,  cerca a Buenos restaurantes y al puente de brooklyn,  habitaciones cómodas con todo lo necesario,  buena conexión de WiFi y sobre todo el mejor personal atentos muy agradables y pendientes de las necesidades,  desayuno bueno,  excelente Estadia

title: Hotel on Rivington @ LES
text: Nice and modern hotel with a great location in Lower East Side. Nice staff who is providing good service. Big bright and clean rooms with AC that works. Very good and tasteful breakfast, but with slow service. Great neighborhood with plenty of good, hip restaurants & bars. Subway is walking distance from the hotel. 10 min walk to SoHo.

title: Upbeat Like its Neighborhood
text:
Friendly doormen open the way into a womb-like entrance hall. The reception with its equally friendly personnel is a floor higher via a dark hallway, next to a casual common room which serves light beverages and snacks.

As suggested by previous reviewers, we splurged on an upper floor (I think the 17th) corner room with a balcony. The room, although certainly not palatial in size, was suitable for the four nights we were there, and we enjoyed the grand view towards the south. It should be noted that the balcony really isn’t suitable for more than a quick look as the grating could cause some to feel squeamish, and it’s too small to drag a chair out to sit on.

It was fun to shower while watching over the city – no problems with privacy for us - but then, we’re Europeans. There was little room to store toiletries in the bathroom, and also luggage and closet space was limited, so we simply left our suitcases open out on the floor.

The amazing minibar leaves literally nothing to be desired (those who have stayed here will know what I mean)! That, and the tremendous fresh cookies brought to the room each night were extra special treats.

The hotel is a fun place to stay and caters to a young and hip crowd. The neighbourhood is very interesting, somewhat away from the usual tourist destinations, so plan on walking a lot or taking public transportation to get to many places. But we chose it on purpose in order to get a different flavor of New York City.

title: Very sheik in the middle of the lower east side
text:
So I stayed here for a few hours prior to an event ... The hotel is situated on a street probably more busy than Times Square itself! I was on the 14th floor and the views were awesome. The bathroom is to die for! We stayed in the studio suite which was shaped rather awkwardly but very nice. The floor to ceiling windows gave a very modern flair to the room. 

There was a rooftop even taking place in the penthouse so as busy as I and my team were we almost blended right in with the up and down. The kitchen closes at 1030 so order early or prepared to venture out. But trust me there are enough pubs bars restaurants pizza shops delis all around you will not go hungry ... The neighborhood in a four block radius is a non stop party to if you're coming here for sleep and relaxation this may not be the best bet BUT for the hip partying crowd ... It's a winner 

Will definitely stay again

title: Great NYC overnight
text:
Wonderful hotel with friendly staff, lovely room, amazing views and excellent menu. Our first time staying, Hotel Rivington was recommended to us by a friend. We had a beautiful corner room suite with plenty of space and a double shower. 

Complimentary coffee, water and wine in the lounge until 6:00 pm was a nice surprise. Even better was the hotel's room service menu. We're vegetarian and about half the menu items were very smart and interesting veg options. The meat options also looked fantastic. We ordered in both dinner and breakfast and the food was perfect. 

We did not venture up to the top floor Penthouse club/bar as we had evening plans, but I went to a party there a few years back and it is an awesome space with amazing 360 degree views of Manhattan.

title: Comfortable stay
text: Spent two nights at THOR to celebrate my daughter's 1st birthday in NYC. All expectations were met: comfortable bed, pleasant view (high floor king #104 on the 10th floor, facing south/west), courteous service. The dulce de leche french toast was really yummy! There was mild street noise (from crowds, traffic) over the weekend but not so much that it disturbed the baby who is a light sleeper. The hotel was fully booked on our first night but it didn't present a crowd problem with the elevators or breakfast. Internet speed was fine. Minor hiccups: water temperature varied in the shower and sink, no slippers, limited room service offerings during the weekend, and it would really be awesome if a coffee maker was available en suite. All in all though, my little family had a good stay!

title: Still tons of fun
text: I visited the Hotel on Rivington three or four years ago and it is still a great place to set up for a fun time downtown or in Brooklyn.  Located in Manhattan's Lower East Side neighborhood, it's walking distance to Soho, Village, Bowery, Chinatown, Little Italy and even Williamsburg, Brooklyn (pedestrian overpass on the bridge).  The lower east side itself is a fun little neighborhood with lots of bars, restaurants and even some remnants of its immigrant history (the tenement museum).  The hotel is located in a modern glass building among all of the old tenements.  The hotel is small and a little quirky with a second floor lobby.  Service can be a little slow or spotty but everyone is super nice.  Get a room above the 4th floor to see the sky, otherwise you will be facing brick buildings.  Our room this time was on the 7th and we had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows facing lower manhattan.  Fixtures are all standard fare for a boutique hotel.  Overall for such a tiny hotel, the rooms are quite large.  But the best part of the hotel is its location - you can walk to many of the best neighborhoods in manhattan, and you are far away from the cheesy tourists staying near times square or uptown.

title: Convenient
text: If you are looking for a boutique - cool, understated, and very comfortable - downtown, this is a good choice.  Perfect location for great bars, great restaurants, clubs and dancing and late night choices.   If you plan to be uptown a lot (theater, museums, the Park), the location is not terribly convenient.  For a place to crash that's a little out of the ordinary and if you want to stay in one of the city's coolest neighborhoods, stay here.  Plus Economy Candy is across the street - another bonus.  The rates this time of year are really good too. Also, the rate included a decent breakfast in their lounge.

title: So disappointed and I'll never go back
text:
I had been to this hotel 8 years ago and I remember it being a very cool boutique hotel in a great area. My boyfriend and I checked in this weekend for a romantic overnight in the city and were immediately disappointed. The hotel had a run-down feel and after waiting 15 minutes to check in we were told the CO-OP lounge/restaurant was closed for renovation. That would have been useful information when we booked. Then we were told the 12th floor room we were guaranteed was not going to be ready until 6:00 (it was 4:30 and check-in time is 4:00).  I was already frustrated but we ended up with a decent room.  The service continued to go downhill from there. The hotel is run by a bunch of inexperienced kids who could not give less of a crap about the comfort or needs of their guests. And the fact that there is no bar or restaurant, and the fact that you can't order room service at any hour of the night in NYC is beyond ridiculous. I then waited 15 minutes the next day to check out and even longer for the valet to get my car. Again, no one seemed to care or have any desire to take care of their guests. I will never stay here again and would never recommend it to anyone. 
-Mere N.

title: Great location and decent hotel but needs maintenance
text: It's a really interesting neighbourhood, great restaurants, bars, and activities, the hotel was probably really amazing but currently needs some maintenance and love on the common areas as well as the rooms.  My room was on the high floor, and had a great view but the light didn't work in enfoyer, the curtains quite grungy .

title: relaxing time
text: big and spatial rooms, nice modern bathroom with the coolest bathtub I have ever use, delicious breakfast menu - try avocado toasts!! good location (close to subway) very safe area, nearby you will find cool bars and restaurants, if you are from europe make sure you took your adapter with you - hotel crew don`t have any spare adapters for guests.

title: very disappointed
text:
Was met at by a doorman dressed like teenage skateboarder. The doorman was also inconsistent and often absent. When around the doorman was not polite. No please/thank you's not what I expected. We arrived at 22.00hrs very tired from the UK hungry and thirsty. There was no bar (there was an extortionately priced mini bar in the room but I never use them) and we were told room service had finished! Seriously in the CITY THAT NEVER SLEEPS. I had to go out to the a convenience store around the corner at 23.00hrs to get a couple of cans of coke. We were also not  told before booking that the restaurant was closed for refurbishment. Which in itself caused breakfast to be served in a dirty/disorganised conference room. On arrival the tables were not laid or clean and we waited 45 minutes for breakfast to be served which delayed our check out. When the breakfast arrived due to the distance and logistics of getting a hot breakfast from the kitchen and lobby it was dry and only luke warm. We had no apologise, no warning of any of this and the lack of room service to compensate means this hotel should be rated 2-3 star. No one apologised once for the inconveniences. New York City in 2016..no room service in a hotel that claims to be luxury boutique. Not a chance, I could have stayed at the Marriot on the East side for less money.
All of this could have been cleared up we were made aware on booking but it wasn't which is why I am so disappointed. Of course hotels need to be refurbished from time to time, but when they do, the staff need to make up for this in extra special service. The service here was non-existent. Gone are the days a smiling check in lady cuts it..not at 4 star. Very poor.

title: One of the very original and sleek hotel in LES New York
text: The hotel is located in the heart of the most vibrant area of NYC, LES (lower east side) on Rivington between Ludlow & Essex.  There are SO MANY amazing restaurants, bars, lounges, cafes, art galleries, in the area.  The check in process is very friendly and smooth, staff is low-key and very friendly, the room is clean and very chic, the view from the room or lobby lounge or the rooftop is ONE OF THE KIND!  They serve free breakfast, free coffee/tea all day, In room dining is 24H, and yes, there is wifi throughout the building, accessibility is great; near subway station (1.5 blocks), you can hail cabs with no time from the hotel, a few blocks to Chinatown & Little Italy, a couple of stations away from SOHO.  There are always 'chill' crowd at this hotel but not so intimidating.  I heard that they were re-building new cool restaurant at the hotel, can't wait to go back there when the restaurant is open!

title: great sized room, but not quite "deluxe"
text:
First, we got a free upgrade to a higher floor, so that was nice.

Room was very generously sized for a New York hotel room - the king with soaking tub (higher floor) had plenty of room for a desk, couch, and coffee table.  Also came with a private balcony.  Well put together, great amenities - and that tub was HUGE and so great after walking all day.  Tempurpedic bed was great, though a bit firm for my tastes. We also had a great view looking towards the Williamsburg Bridge and the new World Trade Center.

Neighborhood - Lower East Side - is great for some new bars / restaurants as well as great history (Tenement Museum, Jewish - American history).  Easy to get to multiple subways (6 train at Spring Street goes to the East Village as well as to Grand Central, from which you get access just about any place in the city).  BONUS - within walking distance of Katz's Deli, Grilled Cheese, Pickle Guys, and Sammy's Roumanian Steakhouse!

All doormen were wonderful, pleasant, cheerful but respectful, and very helpful!

However, some things to note.  I was disappointed in a few things about the room that made me think the management was not quite to the level they advertised - some missing tiles on the black tile floor, a broken seal in the (glass) shower door, holes in two towels, and a window (in said shower) that did not close / latch.  Cleaning staff put our toothbrush in a glass to neaten up, which only left us with one drinking glass.  Also, the hotel advertised that their lounge had beverages at certain times (including wine), but when a private event was in that space they did not post / notify guests that there was an alternate location (if there was).

They are VERY strict about their 4 p.m. check in time, and there were many people waiting in the lounge (free wine) to check in.  I have no argument with this - it's their policy - but we had one woman who was very rude when we tried to check in early, telling us we should have booked the night before to guarantee the room. (Whereas another woman was very kind, pointed out the lounge, and told us we could stow our luggage and call back and see if a room was ready early).

My only real complaint, which isn't really their fault, was that when we were there it was VERY windy and we heard the wind whistling through something all night - kept us up both nights.  Not sure if it was the bathroom window that didn't close, the balcony door that didn't lock, or just the balcony (wired railing) itself. 

I would stay again, though I'd check the room more thoroughly before I unpacked.

title: Amazing Rooms Gracious Hosts
text: Besides a great location, the rooms are fantastic.  If you are into a view or a great sauna bathroom the hotel is a great place to return to at the end of a day of site seeing.  The staff is super sweet and gracious.  I give this place my highest recommendation.

title: Fantastic base in the Lower East Side
text:
This is a great hotel in a wonderful location on the Lower East Side. OK, the lobby is a bit tricky to find if the doorman is otherwise occupied, but the rooms are great and the staff even better. The rooms are relatively spacious, the beds to die for and the floor to ceiling windows let in massive amounts of light - so much that you may want to draw your curtains during summer to keep your room cool while you are out. The bathrooms are funky and you can even imagine you are scaring the neighbours while you are in the shower.
I will be back.

title: Wow....Service & those beds!!!!
text: After a very very long search for a hotel to celebrate my 50th I choose Hotel on Rivington & it was great!! The staff are a credit to the hotel and the rooms are beautiful. The beds are soooo wonderful its hard to get out of them!! I even got an upgrade with a bottle of champagne & birthday cake!! The area is also great, lots of bars, shops & resturants and so easy to get everywhere, it was perfect!! Thank you so much Hotel on Rivington!! XX

title: Une vue magnifique
text:
Vue magnifique au 10 étage avec chambre d'angle. Vue sur la one d'un côté et sur l'Empire de l'autre. 
La chambre était grande, la salle de bain super.
Par contre rue bruyante.
Literie très confortable.
Petit déjeuner sympa malgré une salle un peu triste.
Concierge attentionné, qui se donne pour organiser des réservations et des visites.

title: 恋人と過ごすなら。
text: 連れの誕生日祝いに利用。極寒の1月だったので、ゆったり浸かれるバスタブのあるホテルを探した結果、ここに決定。予約時にバスタブ付きの部屋が指定できるのが嬉しいポイント。もともとバスタブ付きキングルームを予約していましたが、チェックイン時にアップグレードしていただき、17階の角部屋に。眺めも抜群で、夜も朝も感動でした！誕生日祝いと知ったスタッフの方が、お部屋にケーキとシャンパンを用意してくれたり、本当に至りつくせりで、ぜひまたなにかの機会に利用したいと思っています。

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
Amazing hotel just in the heart of Manhattan. The rooms are absolutely stunning with views over the whole city and very stylish with great extras such as balcony or steam shower.
Rooms are quiet and clean; perfect for a nice rest in the middle of everything. 
The Hotel includes a nice bar and a club next door at ground floor. The service was excellent; here is complementary water, fruits, coffee, tea and wine at the very relaxed and social lobby room. Staff was amazing and super friendly. I can highly recommend the hotel.

title: Clean and Comfortable with Good Beds
text: If you are looking for a decent hotel for the money, this may be what you want. It's clean, comfortable, has great beds and is in an awesome location. They also have a nice lounge where you can hang out rather than be in your room. I did have trouble checking in since it was in my husband's name and he wasn't with us (first time I've encountered that in 20 years of marriage) so make sure you have both names on the reservation. My only complaint other than that hassle is that breakfast. They should be embarrassed to be associated with it. Skip the free meal and eat at one of the local spots.

title: Great hotel on the Lower East Side
text:
I really liked this hotel.  The location is perfect if you want to hit the numerous restaurants and bars on the Lower East Side of Manhattan.  That’s what my wife and I did, along with a couple who were staying a block and a half away at the newer Hotel Indigo, which has a great rooftop bar and pool.  At our hotel on Rivington, the service was fine.  The gentleman who checked us in was very nice and funny.  He offered us a good map of Manhattan (unusual in my experience) and even wrote on it a few restaurants and bars.  When I told him we had reservations at La Contenta nearby, he wasn’t familiar with it but asked me to report back if I liked it so he could recommend it to others.  

The room was really nice and surprisingly big for Manhattan.  The black tile bathroom was huge with a really big shower that may have had some steam feature (which I didn’t try).  Down a long hallway was a series of built in closets and a mini bar.  A small bottle (375 ml) of Maker’s Mark or Belvedere was only $40.  The room itself had a small desk and a love seat with large coffee table.  Really nice, and our room was on a corner so we looked out not only over Rivington Street but also towards the cross street, Essex.  The bed seemed a bit hard when I first tried it, but after a night of drinking it was perfect.  This hotel is just a block from Schapiro’s and Nitecap.  I would highly recommend this place, and we got a good price ($225 for the Saturday after Christmas) via the hotels tonight app.  My friends also liked the Indigo, and we loved all the distressed wood in the lobby of that hotel less than two blocks away.   Their room was also spacious.  I might try that one the next time.

title: My go to hotele in New York
text:
I remember my first trip to NY back in 2009 and I stayed in mid-town and did all the tourist things. Then in 2012 I was travelling by myself for business and had one night in NY so I asked some friends where to spend 24 hours and they suggested the Lower East Side.

So I discovered Hotel on Rivington and have now stayed there 3 years in a row!!!

It's conveniently located and other than my wife wanting to go shopping at Macy's we never headed further north than 12th Street. Everything you want is within walking distance of this hotel of a couple of stations on the subway if you don't want to walk.

The subway station is conveniently located around the corner on Essex.

I always take the high corner rooms.  If you go to NY, you may as well see the skyline.

The staff are always helpful and the rooms are clean.

I'm looking forward to coming back as its the best located hotel in the neighbourhood.

title: Awesome Service and comfy beds!
text:
This was an unexpected visit as an Airbnb apartment was not good.  In a panic I called this hotel and a very helpful woman by the name of Kristin helped me in booking a room for that day.  What was a horrible day due to the Airbnb experience was made fantastic in checking into the Hotel on Rivington.

We got an upgrade in our room which was spectacular.  The room was fantastic with an awesome double shower and a wonderful comfy bed!  Breakfast was quite yummy and included in our rate.  Everyone was very helpful and gave great service from the desk team, restaurant staff and front door team.

It was a "mistake" that we booked here but will definetly stay in our next visit to our old home city of NYC.

title: Glamour in the East Village
text: I had a corner King room on the 16th floor with such amazing views that even New Yorkers were taking photos! The bed was fantastic, and I loved having the large walk in closet. But the best thing about this hotel is the great service from the very professional staff, who were also relaxed and laid back, and nothing was a problem. And whenever we wanted to know where to go or what to do, we just asked the concierge or called reception, and every time they gave us the best advice.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: We stayed at the Hotel on Rivington for one night for a 50th birthday party which was at the hotel penthouse bar.    We had a lovely room with an incredible view of the Freedom Tower.
