The rooms were stylish, spacious and clean.  The party venue and staff were terrific.  It was an amazing weekend.  But what really stood out about this hotel was the customer service.  During our stay, my car was damaged by the valet.  The hotel night manager and day manager were extremely apologetic and professional about the situation and took care of the problem quickly.  I didn't have to worry about anything and I was kept informed of the progress every day or two.   My car was fixed in no time.  The management and staff turned a potentially painful situation into a pleasant one.  We will definitely be back!!!  Thank you Daniel and Geo!

title: Bad service
text:
Bad service.A few days before my arrival i recived an e-mail regarding if i had any questions, and if so i was to e-mail the concierge.
I did so, because i wanted to book a pick-up service car when i arrived at the airport.
I did not recive any answer.
I had booked 2 nights through booking.com and 4 more nights were booked through my work. When i told them that i had two bookings they said that i could leave my luggage and my things in my first room in the morning (which i stayed in for the first two nights), and their staff would move everything to my new room and have everything ready by 4 pm (which i would stay in the following four nights). I prepared my two pcs of luggage together with 3 bottles of liquids (my herbal medicine/supplements), a kettle which i was borrowing from the hotel and wrote a note where it said: " Please put these items in the fridge of my new room, since these needs to stay chilled". I also put some tip together with the note. 
When i got back to the hotel appr around 7.pm, the luggage was not in my new room. I asked for the staff to bring them up to my room and they did so. But my bottles of herbal medicine/supplements were not there. I called down to the reception and asked where my bottles were, and the answer i got was that i could not assume that the staff could not read english, so they probably had thrown away my medicine. 
First of all, i had spoken to some of the cleaning staff and they did speak english. Second of all, if i was told that the staff would move my things, i assumed they would do so avvording to my preferences. Why would i leave a note and tip otherwise? If i wanted it to be thrown away i would have done it myself. They did not make an effort to make it right or say that they were sorry or offered any compensation at all.

title: Gran hotel, en todos los sentidos
text: Hotel situado en la zona más cool de Nueva York a dos pasos del Soho y de Little Italy, nuevo moderno, por la noche se pone bueno de ambiente y los desayunos son de capitán general. Las bañeras son espectaculares así como sus vistas desde todas las ventanas de la habitación.

title: Outstanding stay at every level!
text: Traveling with my wife for her first trip to NYC, myself had not been in over 15 years. Hotel had been recommended by a few good friends who live in the city. We are in our forties and past our 'hipster' days so I was hoping it wouldn't be a bit too 'cool' for us. Ashley, a concierge, had kept me reassured over the phone about our car service that met us promptly at Newark and drove us to the city happily pointing out areas of interest. We were escorted to our King room on the 15th floor and were taken aback by its beauty and incredible view of the city. A complimentary bottle of wine was waiting for us. After our long flight from LA, we tried, and quickly fell in love with the enormous Japanese soaking tub that we indulged in nightly after long days of trekking through the city. The staff, Ashley, doormen, desk people where all super helpful in guiding us to some great local dinning. It's location was fabulous, the LES, is such a vibrant area. I've read some who were put off by the neighborhood and noise which we had no problems with. A special 'thank you' to one of the best housekeeping services I have ever encountered. They were invisible but available within minutes for any extra towels, etc. I believe they even folded clothes I had left astray every morning!! This trip was a close second to our Honeymoon and we most definitely will return to catch the few attractions we missed this time around. Really the best hotel we've ever stayed at!!!

title: Très belle vue sur la ville
text:
Cet hôtel est véritablement une très bonne expérience. Tout d'abord, la chambre (corner en étage) : très bien agencée et spacieuse, elle dispose d'un lit avec un matelas rarement aussi confortable, avec des oreillers qui ne vous cassent pas le cou comme c'est malheureusement souvent le cas dans les hôtels. La salle de bain est parfaite, élégante et fonctionnelle. Le tout encadré de baies vitrées qui font du lever et du coucher du soleil (côté sud est) des moments magiques avec vues sur la ville et les ponts. La luminosité dans la pièce est unique au lever du soleil. L'hôtel accueille une clientèle plutôt jeune et branchée. Il est situé dans le quartier du Lower east side ; un quartier sympa mi populaire mi bobo, intéressant pour l'architecture. Le metro est juste en bas de l'hôtel et dessert bien Manhattan et Brooklyn ; idéal pour se déplacer. 
Quelques bémols : le bruit d'une soufflerie côté sud si vous n'êtes pas assez élevé en étage (pensez aux boules quies pour dormir) ; 1 ou 2 membres du personnel  en charge du petit-déjeuner qui ne sont pas spécialement accueillants (il ne suffit pas d'être beau gosse et tatoué pour être un véritable serveur).
Globalement, cet hôtel est parfait pour un séjour à New York de quelques jours.

title: Still elegant, better breakfast
text: The last time we stayed at THOR some years ago we were celebrating a big birthday and had a sweet with amazing views and electrically opened and closed curtains that one could activate from the bed. This time we had a regular room with a dreadful view (tair-conidtioner laden rooftop), but the stay was still enjoyable. The room has elegant decoration, particularly the all-black bathroom  (see photos) with very garbs amenities  and the fur or faux black throw on the couch, and of course the black and red hallways. Great bed! The complimentary breakfast this time around was large and generous and very tasty. Oh yes, it's one of those hotels that makes coffee and fruit available part of the day and wine the rest.

title: Excellent stay
text:
We have just returned to the UK after a four night stay in this fabulous hotel.
Our double- double room was lovely (15th floor),and was easily big enough for us (3 adults), and all our shopping, with a nice view which included Freedom Tower. The beds were incredibly comfortable with a turn-down service and cookies waiting for us after our numerous hectic days shopping. It was spotlessly clean, and a welcome treat had been arranged for my daughter's birthday - what a lovely surprise ! Everything we needed was supplied which included an in room safe and free wi-fi. The only down side was that the lighting in the bathroom was very low.
The staff were all very helpful and friendly from reception, bar and door staff. Devell, on reception, and Richard and Elvis on the door helped us out by recommending restaurants and the best shopping areas, as well as being friendly and professional.
A special mention goes to Adam who emailed me on numerous occasions  answering my many questions, arranging transport to and from the airport, and taking collection of our pre-ordered shopping until we arrived, What a star !
I have to say the  Lower East Side was not an area of New York I was familiar with but it exceeded all expectations and I only wish we had had more time to explore it further. I would not hesitate to recommend Hotel on Rivington and would love to return in the future.

title: Great location & views
text: I had a lovely weekend at Hotel on Rivington. The room and the bathroom are spacious and nicely decorated. The best thing about this hotel are the views you get from high floor rooms and the location. It is couple of blocks away from M/F lines and walking distance to Soho/Nolita. Staff was very nice and friendly. The only minor complaint I have is that the bathroom is very dark so the mirror cannot be used at night. Apart from that, everything else was great and I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Best location to 'do' New York
text:
Have just come back from a short first stay in New York and I would strongly recommend Hotel on Rivington. It is  located in the residential area of South East Side close to Little Italy and China town, yet a short subway ride to the sights of Times Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and the 9/11 memorial. In fact you can see the 1 World Trade Tower from the bathroom. 
Our room on the 10th floor had a most comfortable bed, and a modern bathroom with a large bath and a very efficient shower. 
The restaurant served the most appetising breakfast with a very generous portion of fruit for those choosing the healthier options! 
Service was efficient and friendly, and the biscuits delivered to your room in the evenings completed the very pleasant experience of our stay in New York.

title: Great stay, terrible aftertaste
text:
First of all let me say my time at the Hotel on Rivington was truly excellent. The rooms are lovely, the views spectacular, and the staff friendly.

However, after arriving home after 21 hours of flights, I discovered a rather high charge on my credit card. Thinking this was odd, I emailed the hotel immediately. They informed me that the charge was for mini bar items, specifically 2 bottles of high end champagne. Since I do not drink wine I was perplexed. I responded as such, and also suggested that had I used minibar items, I would have informed staff upon checkout. After several emails back and forth, the hotel still claims that the items were consumed during my stay and refuses to provide a refund. To have my honesty questioned like this seems the height of rudeness. The experience has soured what was a very pleasant experience until that point.

I can only suggest that people check the minibar when they arrive and leave, as the Hotel on Rivington seems to ascribe any discrepancies to its customers, not themselves. Massively disappointing.

title: Still Top-notch
text:
Have stayed here many times and it's still great. Was in town for a wedding and a little business. LES location a block from the train was pefect. Within a couple of blocks to a solid selection of bars and eats. Easy stroll to Soho and Broadway
The service was really solid. Everyone from front desk to the door crew treated us wonderfully. 
They hooked us up with a great room. Thanks you Daniel T!!. No soaking tub this time as we were rushing around a lot but the new steam showers are MAGNIFICENT and a great pick-me-up when you need to clean-up AND revive.
Very cool as always Rivington...thanks for all and hope to be back soon

title: LESからの素晴らしい眺望
text:
19Fのバルコニーがある角部屋にステイしました。
眺めはとてもよく、部屋も清潔です。ただ、バルコニーはとても狭く柵状のものなので落下のキケンがあります。酒に酔った出るのはやめたほうがよいでしょう。館内もモダンな雰囲気でオシャレです。クラシカルなものではないので好き嫌いがあるかもしれません。
付近にはお洒落なレストランが多いです。

title: Doesn't seem THAT good from the outside, but once you're in...
text:
This is one of my fave hotels in New York. The view is breathtaking from the 17th floor , the colours of the sunset is just astonishing. They have balconies which are always a big bonus. The lower rooms' bathrooms are a bit awkward as the window is see through and you always got the feeling someone is watching you while you poop. Besides the rooms are great, equipped with large windows. The higher your floor the more light you have. Bear this in mind...
Paul's Boutique (the place the Beastie Boys album was named after) is literally on the corner, the surrounding area is vibrant and busy. Did I mention Katz Deli is just a block away?

title: The most comfortable beds in the world!
text:
Love this hotel. We were on 15th floor in a corner suite. Would recommend a high room. We had a massive bed and a double shower!
Lounge area was spacious. Second time we have stayed. Staff so helpful and bar does great drinks and amazing truffle popcorn. 
Would definitely go back

title: Great views of Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower
text:
I stayed here for two nights for work in early November  Its not much to look at when you drive up but the staff and the rooms were great.  The bedroom I had faced towards the Brooklyn Bridge so you had a wonderful vista. Each room comes with a very tiny balcony which I imagine would be nice in the warmer, drier months.  The bathroom had a great shower and very deep bath tub which was modern but I imagine a bit hard to get in and out of.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens luxurious.  They leave treats at night for the turn down service.  One night was home made rice crispy treats, the next night oatmeal cookies. They also left bottled water and fresh popped popcorn. Those little touches mean a lot when you have to spend as much as you have to spend in the city.
We dined around the corner both nights. One night at Beauty and Essex which was fantastic and the next at a local sushi place which was good but someone limited in its menu.  Its not necessarily easy to get a cab first thing but there are Uber drivers nearby.  Good location if you have to be way downtown for work or pleasure.  They also have a complimentary happy hour serving wine in their lounge each weekday afternoon.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Cool comfort in the Lower East Side
text: Just came back from one of those hectic work trips to NYC and tried out Hotel on Rivington and I have now found my NYC work trip home.  Plain and simple the area is great for food and bars, the hotel is cool with out NYC pretention.  More importantly management and staff where super friendly and full of advice.  Home baked cookies in your room every night is a perfect example of one of the touches that allow you to feel a little bit more grounded in this crazy city  Also has to be the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.  I could not recommend the Hotel on Rivington more...

title: Best hotel in lower manhattan
text:
This place blew me away. My wife and I were supposed to be in an Airbnb a few blocks away, but that fell through at 6pm on a Sunday night - and we had to be at dinner in Williamsburg by 7. We found this hotel on HotelTonight - booked it and walked over. They greeted us with a surprise upgrade to a suite, and got us checked in. We still made it to dinner on time :)

I've stayed at 5 other similar nearby hotels - but since my first stay here, this is now choice #1.

This is also the only hotel I've ever stayed at (in the whole world) with truly amazing beds - which to me is priority #1. Seriously - I could actually live in this place. I also always come back to find fresh cookies on the bedside table every night: awesome.

I've stayed twice, and just booked a third.

title: If I could give more than 5 stars I would
text:
We had previously stayed at the Hotel on Rivington and, whilst we loved it, thought we would try out somewhere else this time. We booked at the Ludlow a couple of blocks away for what was my 40th birthday trip. From the moment we arrived at the Ludlow we regretted it, it was cramped, the aircon was ridiculously loud and the bed was broken so that every time we moved in our sleep it creaked so badly it woke us both up. 

The next day we called the Hotel On Rivington and, despite the Ludlow making a fairly half baked attempt at fixing the bed, we moved to Rivington for the remaining three nights. Ashleigh at reception was amazing. She booked us into a really high room and told us to come back for 4pm. The room wasn't quite ready so we sat in the lobby for about 20 mins drinking the free wine on offer. The concierge was v apologetic for the small wait and gave us vouchers for free drinks. 

When we got to the room, it was amazing. 18th floor with a balcony (although I was too much of a wimp to spend much time on it!) and the biggest, comfiest bed I have ever slept on. A bath big enough to do laps in and a shower with a glass wall. Hopefully there were no neighbours with binoculars opposite!  :-) Although the nearest block was really far away so if there wasn't much chance of that! There was a complementary bottle of wine waiting and some popcorn. 

I suppose if I had to find any negatives, the elevators and the entrance are looking a wee bit shabby. But how much time does one spend in a lift anyway?! 

Definitely try to get a high floor - I've stayed in a lower one before which was lovely, but it's nice to have no one overlooking (which for showers with no frosted windows is quite useful!).

Thank you Hotel on Rivington for helping salvage the trip and making it a brilliant holiday!

title: Great place in the lower east side.
text: the lower east side is really hopping. the Rivington is a very hip hotel. it has great views and great service and hospitality. The surrounding are is alive and well. they are redeveloping the area and it is really up and coming.

title: Downtown Gem
text:
I've stayed at the Rivington a couple of times. Here are a few things that are special about it:
Even a standard room is fairly large by NYC standards. 
It's got a high quality interior. The style is minimalistic yet welcoming with elements of velvet and (fake) fur. I really like the memory foam mattresses - very comfortable!
Service staff does a great job in keeping the Rivington clean. They also give you little treats like daily cookies. Also a rarity, candles in the bath room! 
Finally there's nothing mini about the mini bar. Full-size bottles of Veuve that don't break the bank should the need arise.
If you like the Lower East Side, the Rivington is highly recommended!

title: Very Interesting Hotel
text: We stayed here because it was booked for our wedding party. It is not a place I would normally stay at. It was very modern (too much for us). This is a different and young and hip crowd that stays here. The hotel was very clean but in a horrible part of New York, very grungy and dirty. We stayed here two nights and moved on to a Hilton after this. I would not return here but I will say the service staff here was awesome, other hotels could learn from them in that aspect.Hotel was very loud too, alot of partying going on.

title: Excellent Hotel & Service in the Heart of NYC
text:
My husband and I travelled with our baby to Hotel on Rivington for a 6 night stay in October. 
The Hotel could not have been more helpful and every single staff member that we encountered was extremely helpful and went out of their way to welcome you to NYC. 

We had a deluxe King with tub and it had great views of the One World Tower and the Williamsburg Bridge.

Large rooms (especially by NYC standards) and very comfortable beds. The best stocked mini bar I have seen also!
Loved the nightly treats that were left by the bed too! 

A 10 minute walk to SoHo, Little Italy and lots of famous restaurants around the Lower East Side and close to shopping. 

Would recommend and we would definitely stay there again.

title: Super City Views!
text:
Had a great view of the city from my corner room and the local area is really vibrant. The hotel puts on free social drinks during late afternoon, which is a nice touch and the food in the restaurant is good.

We had to wait until 5pm to check in but the complimentary bottle of champagne and efforts of the staff were appreciated.

I'd go back.
